Name: temperature_resolved_pyrolysis_field_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: temperature-resolved pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is pyrolysed then ionised by interaction with a high electric field. The ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios as a function of temperature during pyrolysis.

Name: chirped_pulse
Label: chirped pulse
Definition: An adiabatic shaped pulse. The resonance frequency is swept through a defined rf range during application of the pulse. Allows excitation of a broader range of frequencies than the size of the rf field. For the pulse see J. Magn. Reson. Ser. A 1993 102 pg 293.

Name: cloud_point_extraction
Label: cloud-point extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a non-ionic surfactant from one liquid phase to another by heating. As the temperature of the solution rises the surfactant molecules form micelles if the temperature increases above the cloud point CPT the micelles become dehydrated and aggregate. This leads to macroscopic phase separation of the solution into a surfactant-rich phase and a solvent phase.

Name: resonant_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: resonant Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The wavelength of the incident photons is scanned over an absorption edge in the sample and the Auger electrons emitted are detected as a function of energy.

Name: inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: multiple_ion_monitoring
Label: multiple-ion monitoring
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the intensities of multiple specific ion beams are recorded rather than the entire mass spectrum.

Name: osteryoung_square_wave_voltammetry
Label: Osteryoung square-wave voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied as a square wave and there is one square wave cycle per staircase step.

Name: supercritical_antisolvent_technique
Label: supercritical antisolvent technique
Definition: A solid sample is dissolved in a common organic or inorganic solvent then injected into a supercritical fluid held under pressure resulting in a large decrease in solution density. This effect leads to the reduction in solubility of the solid and precipitation.

Name: forward_geometry_double_focusing_mass_spectrometer
Label: forward-geometry double-focusing mass spectrometer
Definition: A double-focusing mass spectrometer where the electric sector precedes the magnetic sector.

Name: nanoparticle
Label: nanoparticle
Definition: A nanosized spherical or capsule-shaped structure.

Name: small_angle_light_scattering
Label: small-angle light scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of visible light scattered at a small angle 0.110 to the incident light.

Name: carrier_extraction_by_linearly_increasing_voltage_method
Label: carrier extraction by linearly increasing voltage method
Definition: A method for measuring charge carrier mobilities and conductivities by applying two sequentional triangular-shaped voltage pulses and measuring the resulting current.

Name: impedance_spectroscopy
Label: impedance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the change in impedance the resistance of alternating current of a sample during excitation is measured as a function of frequency.

Name: particle_induced_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: particle-induced X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the X-rays are generated by bombarding the sample with a focused beam of high-energy particles.

Name: sound_induced_gelation
Label: sound-induced gelation
Definition: The formation of a gel from a solution by the application of ultrasound sound waves >20 kHz frequency.

Name: dual_inlet_isotope_ratio_mass_spectrometry
Label: dual-inlet isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where purified gas obtained from a sample is alternated rapidly with a standard gas of known isotopic composition by means of a system of valves so that a number of comparative measurements are made of both gases. The relative abundance of isotopes in a sample is then determined.

Name: photodeposition
Label: photodeposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a monomer is irradiated with UV light causing cross-linking and the deposition of a polymer film on a substrate.

Name: multiphoton_fluorescence_microscopy
Label: multiphoton fluorescence microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where fluorophores in the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by absorption of two or more photons.

Name: laser_ionisation_spectroscopy
Label: laser ionisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a sample is illuminated with a laser and photoexcitation is used to promote an atom or molecule above its ionisation potential to create an ion.

Name: confocal_infrared_microscopy
Label: confocal infrared microscopy
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved infrared spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. An aperture is used to discriminate between infrared signal coming from the laser spot and that coming from the out-of-focus region of the sample.

Name: gas_source_molecular_beam_epitaxy
Label: gas-source molecular beam epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from a molecular beam of reactive gases on a monocrystalline substrate under high vacuum <10{-8} Pa.

Name: elastic_incoherent_neutron_scattering
Label: elastic incoherent neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample phase is not conserved and the neutrons retain all of their kinetic energy during collisions.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_imaging_mass_spectrometry
Label: matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation imaging mass spectrometry
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved mass spectra of a sample during microscopy where a pulse laser is used to produce both ionisation and vapourisation and the sample is held in a matrix such as dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. The spectra are used to visualise the spatial distribution of typically biomolecules by their molecular masses.

Name: cathodic_arc_deposition
Label: cathodic arc deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where an electric arc is used to vaporize material from a cathode target. The vaporized material then condenses on a substrate forming a thin film.

Name: gamma_ray_scattering_spectroscopy
Label: gamma-ray scattering spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where gamma-rays are absorbed by a sample resulting in the ejection of an electron and the emission of light which is detected.

Name: specimen_role
Label: specimen role
Definition: A role borne by a material entity that is obtained during a specimen collection process and that can be realized by performing measurements or observations on the specimen."en

Name: assay
Label: assay
Definition: A planned process that has the objective to produce information about a material entity the evaluant by examining it."en

Name: isopycnic_centrifugation
Label: isopycnic centrifugation
Definition: A method where the components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a density gradient of e.g. CsCl in a centrifuge according to buoyant density. The species in the sample move through the gradient until they reach a point where their density and that of the gradient are identical.

Name: thermal_conductivity_detection
Label: thermal conductivity detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to inorganic gases. A hot 450 C filament is used to heat a carrier gas containing the sample and the difference in thermal conductivity caused by the presence of the sample is measured.

Name: gas_phase_infiltration
Label: gas-phase infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with or deposition from a gas.

Name: differential_pulse_voltammetry
Label: differential pulse voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied using pulses of increasing amplitude and the current is sampled before and after each voltage pulse.

Name: proton_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: proton nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity and possibly other parameters for hydrogen-1 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: planar_array_infrared_emission_spectroscopy
Label: planar array infrared emission spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated and the infrared radiation 0.781000 m emitted during cooling is detected with a two-dimensional focal plane array infrared camera.

Name: obsolete_separation_method_measurement_method
Label: obsolete: separation method-measurement method
Definition: A method in which a separation method is coupled to a measurement method in order to perform measurements upon different components of a sample.

Name: nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy_with_paramagnetic_signals_enhancement
Label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy with paramagnetic signals enhancement
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule leq 6 AA apart. Spectra recorded with suppression of the diamagnetic window by the PASE pulse sequence.

Name: projection_reduction_exposure_with_variable_axis_immersion_lense
Label: projection reduction exposure with variable axis immersion lense
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses electrons to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a beam of electrons 100 keV is scanned across a patterned mask. The electrons induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'. The lens system used to focus the electron beam has a 4-times magnification and a 250 m2 exposure field and was developed by IBM and Nikon.

Name: two_photon_fluorescence_image
Label: two-photon fluorescence image
Definition: A fluorescence image obtained through a two-photon excitation process.

Name: clustered_data_visualization
Label: clustered data visualization
Definition: A data visualization which has input of a clustered data set and produces an output of a report graph which is capable of rendering data of this type."en

Name: catalytic_steam_reforming_of_methanol
Label: catalytic steam reforming of methanol
Definition: The reaction of methanol with steam at high temperature 7001000 C in the presence of a nickel catalyst in order to produce hydrogen.

Name: 3he_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 3He nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 3He nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: template_generated_ontology_module
Label: template generated ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that is automatically generated from a template specification and fillers for slots in that template."en

Name: high_frequency_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: high-frequency electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to short ns pulses of high-frequency microwave radiation mm wavelength in a high magnetic field is measured.

Name: differential_isothermal_capacitance_transient_spectroscopy
Label: differential isothermal capacitance transient spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities grain boundaries interfaces etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the differential of the capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at constant different temperatures spectra are generated that exhibit peaks the height of which are proportional to the height of which are proportional to time constant for the emission rate.

Name: high_resolution_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-resolution mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the 'exact' mass of the molecular ions in the sample is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass the number of protons and neutrons.

Name: surface_enhanced_laser_desorption_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: surface-enhanced laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is mixed with a matrix compound such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid and deposited on a surface with some chemical functionality to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Name: size_exclusion_chromatogram
Label: size-exclusion chromatogram
Definition: A plot of detector signal e.g. ion count or  absorbance vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment where the separation is caused by exclusion effects within the stationary phase and where the stationary phase is a swollen gel.

Name: kelvin_probe_force_micrograph
Label: Kelvin probe force micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by using a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the difference in work function between the tip and sample as a function of position.

Name: photo_etching
Label: photo etching
Definition: The process of generating a pattern in a photosensitive sample by irradiating it with UV light. After exposure the plate is 'developed' by washing away the unexposed resist.

Name: potential_sputter_etching
Label: potential sputter etching
Definition: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by bombarding it with high-energy or highly charged heavy ions. When the multiply charged ions recombine on the sample surface their potential energy is liberated accelerating the process.

Name: 39k_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 39K nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 39K nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: bomb_digestion
Label: bomb digestion
Definition: The decomposition of a sample in strong acids such as nitric sulfuric or perchloric acid in a sealed vessel lined with PTFE under high pressure and high temperature in order to obtain the sample in liquid form.

Name: 13c13c_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: 13C–13C correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 13C nuclei that are J-coupled usually <3 bonds apart.

Name: nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrometer
Label: nuclear magnetic resonance spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus used to conduct NMR experiments consisting of a magnet housing a sample space surrounded by two coils which act to transmit radio frequency radiation to the sample and to detect the response of the sample.

Name: time_of_flight_secondary_ion_mass_spectrometry
Label: time-of-flight secondary ion mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a stream of primary mass-selected particles and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected by accelerating them to the same known kinetic energy and measuring the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: incoherent_neutron_scattering
Label: incoherent neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample and phase is not conserved.

Name: micro_raman_spectrum
Label: micro-Raman spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. Raman shift cm-1 obtained by measuring the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a micrometre-sized area of a sample located using an optical microscope.

Name: liquid_atomic_force_microscopy
Label: liquid atomic force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen that is immersed in a liquid cell. The tip oscillates intermittently touching or tapping the surface. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: spark_source_mass_spectrometry
Label: spark source mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a vacuum spark discharge which is generated by a pulsed high 25100 kV potential difference between two electrodes.

Name: data_about_an_ontology_part
Label: data about an ontology part
Definition: Data about an ontology part is a data item about a part of an ontology for example a term"en

Name: scanning_vibrating_electrode_technique
Label: scanning vibrating electrode technique
Definition: A technique that operates by mechanically vibrating a probe at a fixed amplitude frequency and height over an electrochemically active sample in solution measuring and mapping the electric field generated by the sample. This technique is used to probe the nature of corrosion processes.

Name: emulsion_polymerisation
Label: emulsion polymerisation
Definition: A polymer preparation technique in which monomer usually acrylic droplets are dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase and are kept colloidally stable through the use of a surfactant.

Name: nitrogen_sorption_desorption_measurements
Label: nitrogen sorption-desorption measurements
Definition: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an N2 which adsorbs onto the surface of interest the 'sorbate' and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature. Regression analysis is then applied to the data resulting in an isotherm.

Name: ultraviolet_resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: ultraviolet resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from an ultraviolet laser by a sample is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition within the sample.

Name: 121sb_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 121Sb Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 121Sb nuclei is detected.

Name: ultra_high_vacuum_tip_enhanced_raman_spectroscopy
Label: ultra-high vacuum tip-enhanced Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of visible laser light by metal surfaces where scattering is enhanced by the optical near field of a scanning tunnelling tip under ultra-high vacuum is detected.

Name: manufacturing
Label: manufacturing
Definition: A planned process with the objective to produce a processed material which will have a function for future use."en

Name: 1h1h_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: 1H–1H nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between protons that are spatially proximate within a molecule 6 AA apart.

Name: weak_cation_exchange_column
Label: weak cation-exchange column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a weak cation exchanger.

Name: constant_potential_amperometry
Label: constant potential amperometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured whilst the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is held at a constant value sufficient to oxidize or reduce the sample.

Name: laser_microprobe_inductively_coupled_plasma_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: laser microprobe inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: Inductively coupled atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is vaporised by laser ablation with a finely focused <10 m diameter laser.

Name: force_spectroscopy_mapping
Label: force spectroscopy mapping
Definition: The measurement of spatially resolved forcedistance curves using an atomic force microscope to produce a chemical profile image.

Name: proton_decoupled_phosphorus_31_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: proton-decoupled phosphorus-31 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are phosphorus-31 nuclei and J/scalar coupling patterns between protons and phosphorus-31 nuclei have been removed.

Name: vanadium_51
Label: vanadium-51
Definition: The stable isotope of vanadium with relative atomic mass 50.943964 99.8 atom percent natural abundance and nuclear spin 7/2.

Name: chromatography
Label: chromatography
Definition: A separation method where the components are distributed between two phases one of which is stationary while the other moves in a definite direction.

Name: stber_process
Label: Stöber process
Definition: A material processing process that produces monodisperse particles of silica by adding tetraethyl silicate to an excess of water containing a low-molar-mass alcohol and stirring.

Name: precipitation_with_compressed_antisolvent
Label: precipitation with compressed antisolvent
Definition: A technique where a solid sample is dissolved in a common organic or inorganic solvent then sprayed into a vessel pressurised with a dense gas e.g. supercritical CO2 This results in a large decrease in solution density and precipitation.

Name: catalytic_steam_reforming
Label: catalytic steam reforming
Definition: The reaction of hydrocarbons with steam at high temperature 7001000 C in the presence of a nickel catalyst in order to produce hydrogen.

Name: weak_beam_dark_field_transmission_electron_micrograph
Label: weak-beam dark-field transmission electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons. A diffracted beam harmonic a 'weak beam' is used rather than the diffracted beam itself allowing ch higher resolution to be obtained.

Name: ultraviolet_visible_spectrophotometry
Label: ultraviolet-visible spectrophotometry
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the range ultraviolet to visible 190-800 nm resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Name: inelastic_electron_tunnelling_spectroscopy
Label: inelastic electron tunnelling spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a metal-molecule-metal sandwich is formed and electrons tunnel from metal to metal through the molecules. Any additional molecules adsorbed onto the inner layer of the sandwhich can affect the tunneling via the excitation of vibrational states.

Name: analytical_pyrolysis
Label: analytical pyrolysis
Definition: The characterisation in an inert atmosphere of a material or a chemical process by a chemical degradation reaction induced by thermal energy.

Name: magnesium_k_alpha_source
Label: magnesium K-alpha source
Definition: An X-ray source where magnesium atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Name: electroporation
Label: electroporation
Definition: a process in which a significant increase in the electrical conductivity and permeability of the cell plasma membrane caused by an externally applied electrical field. It is usually used in molecular biology as a way of introducing some substance into a cell such as loading it with a molecular probe a drug that can change the cell's function or a piece of coding DNA"en

Name: 1h15n_heteronuclear_multiple_bond_coherence_spectrum
Label: 1H–15N heteronuclear multiple bond coherence spectrum
Definition: A heteronuclear NMR spectrum where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 1H and 15N nuclei which are 23 bonds removed.

Name: capillary_electrophoresis_mass_spectrometry
Label: capillary electrophoresis-mass spectrometry
Definition: Any method where the sample is first separated by capillary electrophoresis before being analysed by mass spectrometry.

Name: inelastic_incoherent_neutron_scattering
Label: inelastic incoherent neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample phase is not conserved and the neutrons suffer a loss of kinetic energy during collisions.

Name: value_specification
Label: value specification
Definition: An information content entity that specifies a value within a classification scheme or on a quantitative scale."en

Name: 127i_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 127I Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 127I nuclei is detected.

Name: divided_electrochemical_cell
Label: divided electrochemical cell
Definition: An electrochemical cell where the anode and cathode are placed in different vessels requiring the use of a salt bridge frit or membrane to complete the circuit.

Name: ultraviolet_spectrometer
Label: ultraviolet spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source a holder for the sample a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light a detector and is used to measure spectra in the ultraviolet range 190400 nm.

Name: liquid_chromatography_evaporative_light_scattering_detection
Label: liquid chromatography-evaporative light scattering detection
Definition: A liquid chromatography method where the mobile phase is atomised in a gas forming small droplets which are allowed to evaporate leaving the sample as fine particles. The suspended particles pass through a light beam and the scattered light transmitted by the particles is sensed by a photomultiplier. The response is proportional to the mass of the molecules in the sample.

Name: fast_atom_bombardment_mass_spectrometry
Label: fast-atom bombardment mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample which is held in a liquid matrix is bombarded with a stream of primary noble gas atoms and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected.

Name: laser_oximetry
Label: laser oximetry
Definition: A technique used to determine the amount of oxygen in sample based on the absorption of laser radiation.

Name: separation_capillary
Label: separation capillary
Definition: A piece of apparatus that has the form of a tube with an internal diameter of 20100 micrometres and hosts the separation medium in capillary electrophoresis.

Name: proton_induced_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: proton-induced Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with protons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons which are detected as a function of incident proton energy.

Name: argon_pulse_discharge_photoionisation_detection
Label: argon pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Definition: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through argon gas generating high-energy 13.517.5 eV photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Name: pumprepumpprobe_spectroscopy
Label: pump–repump–probe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse the 'pump' followed by a second pump laser pulse and finally a third laser pulse the 'probe' after a short delay. The two pump pulses create excitations in the sample which are sensed by the probe pulse.

Name: surface_enhanced_chiral_raman_spectroscopy
Label: surface-enhanced chiral Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where vibrational optical activity from a sample absorbed onto a metal Au Ag or Cu surface is measured by means of a small difference in the intensity of Raman scattering from chiral molecules of right- and left-circularly polarised incident light.

Name: normal_pulse_voltammetry
Label: normal pulse voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied using pulses of increasing amplitude and the current is sampled after each voltage pulse.

Name: boundary_between_portions_of_material
Label: boundary between portions of material
Definition: A two-dimensional surface that separates two portions of material of different compositions.

Name: inelastic_tunnelling_spectrum
Label: inelastic tunnelling spectrum
Definition: A plot of current or a first or higher derivative of current with respect to voltage vs. voltage obtained by measuring the tunnelling current through a metal-oxide-metal sandwich. Molecules are adsorbed onto the oxide and these molecules can affect the tunnelling via the excitation of vibrational states.

Name: gas_chromatograph
Label: gas chromatograph
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a gas supply system an injection or sampling system a column detector and a data acquisition/ processing system that is used to carry out chromatographic separations.

Name: magnetophoresis
Label: magnetophoresis
Definition: A separation method where magnetic particles move at different speeds according to their magnetic susceptibilities in a separation medium across which a magnetic field is applied.

Name: atomic_mass_spectrometry
Label: atomic mass spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the sample is atomised and converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: electronic_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: electronic circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised visible or near-ultraviolet radiation 200400 nm. The optical activity of the sample is monitored using electronic transitions.

Name: negative_staining_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: negative-staining transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen that has been stained with heavy metals salts e.g. uranyl acetate is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Name: temperature_programmed_absorption
Label: temperature-programmed absorption
Definition: A sample preparation method where a sample is heated slowly in a gas.

Name: shaped_radio_frequency_pulse
Label: shaped radio frequency pulse
Definition: A selective or shaped pulse which is designed to excite only a specific region of a spectrum.

Name: trimethylsilyl_derivatisation
Label: trimethylsilyl derivatisation
Definition: Derivatisation of a metabolite by addition of a trimethylsilyl reagent to protect functional groups such as hydroxy carboxylic acid thio and amine groups.

Name: supercritical_fluid_method
Label: supercritical fluid method
Definition: Any material processing method that uses a supercritical fluid.

Name: fractional_sublimation
Label: fractional sublimation
Definition: A method for purifying samples by heating the sample under reduced pressure and allowing the fractions to sublime order of increasing sublimation temperature a function of vapor pressure.

Name: gas_chromatography_thermal_energy_analysis
Label: gas chromatography-thermal energy analysis
Definition: A gas chromatography method that is sensitive to compounds containing NO and NO2 groups. The eluent is pyrolysed at 275 deg C producing radicals which react with ozone under low pressure to produce chemiluminescence.

Name: solution_nebulisation_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: solution nebulisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture a solution in dilute HNO3 is passed through a nebuliser to form a mist of finely dispersed droplets before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: specular_x_ray_reflectometry
Label: specular X-ray reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at an extremely flat surface at angle theta to the surface and measuring the intensity of the X-rays which undergo specular reflection and are emitted at angle theta from the surface.

Name: tris_hcl_buffer
Label: Tris-HCl buffer
Definition: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by Tris trishydroxymethylaminomethane and HCl solution.

Name: two_dimensional_chromatography
Label: two-dimensional chromatography
Definition: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both chromatography. initial separation proceeds in a primary column and 'cuts' of the eluent from this column are directed into one or more secondary columns.

Name: in_situ_x_ray_diffraction
Label: in situ X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by detecting the positions and intensities of X-rays that have been generated within a structural domain as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Name: normal_pulse_polarography
Label: normal pulse polarography
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The working electrode is a dropping mercury or other liquid conductor electrode and unstirred solutions are used. The potential is varied using pulses of linearly increasing amplitude one pulse during each drop lifetime and the current is sampled after each voltage pulse.

Name: solid_state_quadrupolar_carr_purcell_meiboom_gill_spectrum
Label: solid-state quadrupolar Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill spectrum
Definition: A plot of the nuclear magnetic resonance frequency vs. intensity composed of a series of peaks separated by the reciprocal of a user-defined time delay in a QCPMG pulse sequence which describe the envelope of the full static spectrum.

Name: scanning_mobility_particle_sizer
Label: scanning mobility particle sizer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that measures the size distribution of particles in an aerosol by neutralising the particles passing them through a differential mobility analyser in order to control the size of the particles and then counting the particles of that size with a condensation particle counter.

Name: gas_chromatography
Label: gas chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas.

Name: cross_polarisation_magic_angle_spinning
Label: cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
Definition: Magic angle spinning spectroscopy where cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.

Name: two_dimensional_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: two-dimensional infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m over two frequency axes. Cross peaks in the spectrum encode the couplings and orientation between vibrations.

Name: chemodosimetry
Label: chemodosimetry
Definition: Measurement of the dose of ions or small molecules taken up by an object.

Name: electrostatic_force_microscopy_image
Label: electrostatic force microscopy image
Definition: An image obtained by using a conducting sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the drop in amplitude of the oscillating cantilever caused by the electrostatic force it experiences while the tip is biased with a voltage of a few volts as a function of position.

Name: positive_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: positive electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised to positive ions by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: photoelectron_microspectroscopy
Label: photoelectron microspectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a finely focused <10 m photon beam causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Raman spectroscopy where the energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition in the sample.

Name: laser_desorption_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: high performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: helium_pulse_discharge_photoionisation_detection
Label: helium pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Definition: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through helium gas generating high-energy 13.517.5 eV photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Name: nanoelectrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrum
Label: nanoelectrospray ionisation mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment  where the ions are obtained by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small capillary at a flow rate of nL min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: pressure_monitored_pyrolysis
Label: pressure-monitored pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy during which the pressure of the volatile pyrolysates is recorded.

Name: strong_cation_exchange_chromatography
Label: strong-cation-exchange chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where cations are retained by functional groups that are permanently negatively charged in aqueous conditions for example aliphatic sulfonic acid groups in the stationary phase.

Name: argon_plasma_sintering
Label: argon plasma sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample with an Ar plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons until the particles adhere to each other.

Name: hydrophilic_interaction_chromatography
Label: hydrophilic interaction chromatography
Definition: Liquid chromatography where the stationary phase is hydrophilic the mobile phase is organic and separation is achieved based on polarity.

Name: gas_chromatography_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: gas chromatography time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography then sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: calorimeter
Label: calorimeter
Definition: A piece of apparatus that is used to measure the heat of chemical reactions or physical changes.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_time_of_flight_quadrupole_detection
Label: electrospray ionisation time-of-flight quadrupole detection
Definition: A mass detection method where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution of the sample through a small heated capillary into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets or by collision with solvent ions produced by the same process. The ions are then held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes a 'quadrupole' and accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: atom_scattering
Label: atom scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered atoms.

Name: microscope_projection_photolithography
Label: microscope projection photolithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. A reduced image of the desired pattern is then projected on the photoresist using a microscope and the substrate is exposed to intense typically UV light. A post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: mechanosynthesis
Label: mechanosynthesis
Definition: A synthesis method in which the reaction outcome is determined by the use of mechanical constraints to direct reactive molecules to specific molecular sites.

Name: transmission_x_ray_microscopy
Label: transmission X-ray microscopy
Definition: An imaging technique where a finely focused beam of X-rays is directed at the specimen and the energies and intensities of the transmitted X-rays are measured as a function of position.

Name: particle_induced_gamma_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: particle-induced gamma-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of gamma-ray emission spectroscopy where the gamma-rays are produced by bombarding the sample with a focused beam of ions.

Name: cold_vapour_atomic_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: cold vapour atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where no vaporisation step is required because the sample is a volatile heavy metal such as mercury which is a vapour at room temperature.

Name: size_exclusion_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: size-exclusion chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by size-exclusion chromatography before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: 13c15n_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 13C–15N rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 13C and 15N nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: reversed_phase_chromatography
Label: reversed-phase chromatography
Definition: A separation method where the components are distributed between two phases one of which is stationary and non-polar while the other is polar and moves in a definite direction.

Name: diffuse_reflectance_spectrum
Label: diffuse reflectance spectrum
Definition: A plot of reflectance  vs. wavenumber obtained by measuring the amount of radiation reflected from an uneven surface at a number of angles by the sample.

Name: 25mg_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 25Mg nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 25Mg  nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: solidliquid_extraction
Label: solid–liquid extraction
Definition: The process of transferring the soluble components of a solid to the liquid phase using a solvent.

Name: laser_micro_emission_spectroscopy
Label: laser micro emission spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a thermally-excited vapour sample is illuminated with a finely focused <10 m diameter ultraviolet or visible laser and the photon emission spectrum of the sample is observed.

Name: dot_plot
Label: dot plot
Definition: A dot plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where each data point is represented by a single dot placed on coordinates corresponding to data point values in particular dimensions."en

Name: oxidationreduction_titration
Label: oxidation–reduction titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by monitoring a redox process until the endpoint at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached.

Name: silicon_29_cross_polarisation_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: silicon-29 cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which the nuclei of interest are silicon-29 nuclei line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field and cross polarisation has been used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.

Name: ultraviolet_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with ultraviolet 10400 nm photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: x_ray_photoemission_electron_microscopy
Label: X-ray photoemission electron microscopy
Definition: A type of electron microscopy where the distribution of electrons emitted by a specimen sample following excitation with an X-ray source is used to produce an image.

Name: partial_sample_digestion
Label: partial sample digestion
Definition: The decomposition of only part of a sample by the addition of liquid reagents to solubilise it.

Name: elemental_analysis
Label: elemental analysis
Definition: A process where a sample is analyzed for its elemental and sometimes isotopic composition the elements present and sometimes their weight percentage.

Name: heteronuclear_multiple_bond_coherence
Label: heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and nuclei which are 23 bonds removed.

Name: isothermal_capactiance_transient_spectroscopy
Label: isothermal capactiance transient spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities grain boundaries interfaces etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at constant different temperatures spectra are generated that exhibit peaks the height of which are proportional to the height of which are proportional to time constant for the emission rate.

Name: diffuse_reflectance_ultravioletvisible_spectrum
Label: diffuse reflectance ultraviolet–visible spectrum
Definition: A plot of reflectance  vs. wavenumber obtained by measuring the amount of ultraviolet to visible 190800 nm radiation reflected from an uneven surface at a number of angles by the sample.

Name: reversed_phase_liquid_chromatography_electrospray_ionisation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: reversed-phase liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by reverse-phase liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of it through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 uL min1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance by two mass spectrometers in series.

Name: ambient_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: ambient ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Any mass spectrometry technique where the sample is ionised at low or ambient temperature.

Name: fluorescence_cross_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: fluorescence cross-correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured at two distinct wavelengths and correlated within a very small detection volume. Ultra-violet light is used to stimulate fluorescence.

Name: spin_echo_small_angle_neutron_scattering
Label: spin-echo small angle neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the velocity of neutrons in known magnetic fields before and after scattering at small angles by the sample. The neutrons are scattered by the interaction of neutron spin with spins in the sample 'spin echo'.

Name: adsorption_chromatography
Label: adsorption chromatography
Definition: Chromatography in which separation is based mainly on differences between the adsorption affinities of the sample components for the surface of an active solid.

Name: molecular_mass_spectrometry
Label: molecular mass spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the sample is converted into gaseous molecular ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: scanning_electron_micrograph
Label: scanning electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by scanning a finely-focused <10 nm diameter electron beam across the specimen under vacuum.

Name: steam_reforming
Label: steam reforming
Definition: The reaction of hydrocarbons with steam at high temperature 7001000 C in order to produce hydrogen.

Name: 19f_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 19F nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 19F nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: liquid_chromatography
Label: liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid.

Name: excitation_emission_spectrum
Label: excitation-emission spectrum
Definition: A three-dimensional spectrum generated by scanning the emission spectrum at incremental steps of excitation wavelength.

Name: laboratory_uncontrolled_explosion
Label: laboratory uncontrolled explosion
Definition: An explosion that takes place in a laboratory and is not controlled by the experimenter.

Name: static_light_scattering
Label: static light scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the total or time-averaged scattering intensity of scattered visible light as a function of angle.

Name: 1h113cd_heteronuclear_multiple_quantum_coherence
Label: 1H–113Cd heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 113Cd nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Name: angular_dependent_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: angular dependent Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: oscillographic_potentiometry
Label: oscillographic potentiometry
Definition: An obsolete electrochemical technique where the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured using an oscillograph under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: pulse_radiolysis
Label: pulse radiolysis
Definition: The cleavage of one or more bonds resulting from exposure to a beam of highly accelerated 10 MeV electrons. Pulse radiolysis is a method of initiating reactions which occur on a timescale faster than 100 s.

Name: infrared_evanescent_wave_spectroscopy
Label: infrared evanescent wave spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy using radiation in the infrared region 0.781000 m where an evanescent wave is generated using an optical fibre.

Name: low_energy_electron_beam_lithography
Label: low-energy electron-beam lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses electrons to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist' and a beam of electrons 1 keV is scanned across it in a patterned fashion. The electrons induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'. The electron beam can be focused using either electric or magnetic fields.

Name: total_current_spectroscopy
Label: total current spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is determined by measuring the total electron current incident on the sample target.

Name: decomposition
Label: decomposition
Definition: The breakdown of a single phase into two or more phases by heating or treatment with acid alkali or enzymes.

Name: fluorescence_titration
Label: fluorescence titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the intensity/wavelength of fluorescence emitted by the sample.

Name: rotational_spectrum
Label: rotational spectrum
Definition: A spectrum that reflects the rotational degrees of freedom of a molecule.

Name: infrared_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: infrared dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption or reflection of polarised infrared light by a sample.

Name: reprecipitation
Label: reprecipitation
Definition: The planned repetition of a precipitation to remove impurities from a precipitate or improve its stoichiometry.

Name: solid_source_molecular_beam_epitaxy
Label: solid-source molecular beam epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from a beam of evapourated metal particles on a monocrystalline substrate under high vacuum <10{-8} Pa.

Name: flow_injection_thermospray_flame_furnace_absorption_spectrometry
Label: flow injection thermospray flame furnace absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where the sample is carried to the spectrometer by flow injection and forced through a heated metal capillary tip before atomisation in a flame furnace.

Name: nano_filtration
Label: nano-filtration
Definition: A pressure-driven membrane-based separation process in which particles and dissolved macromolecules larger 200 Da are rejected.

Name: physical_quality
Label: physical quality
Definition: A quality of a physical entity that exists through action of continuants at the physical level of organisation in relation to other entities.

Name: bridgeman_technique
Label: Bridgeman technique
Definition: A method of growing a single crystal 'ingot' or 'boule'. The polycrystalline sample is heated in a container above its melting point and slowly cooled from one end where a seed crystal is located. Single crystal material is then progressively formed along the length of the container.

Name: electrohydrodynamic_droplet_dispensing
Label: electrohydrodynamic droplet dispensing
Definition: The dispensing of droplets between two electrodes by applying an electric field.

Name: neutron_diffraction
Label: neutron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of cold or thermal neutrons at a sample and recording the resulting diffraction pattern.

Name: near_infrared_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: near-infrared absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the near infrared region 0.82 m.

Name: chromatograph
Label: chromatograph
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a mobile phase supply system an injection or sampling system a column detector and a data acquisition/ processing system that is used to carry out chromatographic separations.

Name: scanning_electron_microscopy
Label: scanning electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV is scanned across the specimen under vacuum and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen is determined.

Name: gel_spinning
Label: gel spinning
Definition: A process used to create polymer fibers. Polymer in a gel state is forced through a spinneret a multi-pored device similar to a shower head. The fibres are then air dried and cooled in a liquid bath.

Name: square_wave_voltammetry
Label: square-wave voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied as a square wave and the current is measured at the end of each half-wave just prior to potential change.

Name: polymer_precipitation
Label: polymer precipitation
Definition: A technique used to isolate and purify polymers. The polymer sample is dissolved in a 'good' organic solvent and this solution is then poured into a 'poor' solvent . Introduction of the polymer to the poor solvent causes the polymer chains to collapse aggregate and come out of solution.

Name: graphite_electrode
Label: graphite electrode
Definition: A carbon electrode that has been fired at a temperature around 2800 K resulting in a largely graphitic composition.

Name: conductometric_titration
Label: conductometric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is monitored by measuring the conductance of the solution.

Name: contact_profilometry
Label: contact profilometry
Definition: A method where the profile of a surface is determined by moving a diamond stylus laterally across it at a specified contact force and measuring its vertical displacement.

Name: phosphorescence_spectroscopy
Label: phosphorescence spectroscopy
Definition: The detection of luminescence emitted over a long timescale from a sample as a result of irradiation with light as a function of wavelength or time.

Name: metalorganic_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: metal–organic chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to volatile precursors one of which is an organometallic compound which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: flame_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: flame atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where the sample is  aspirated aerosolised and mixed with combustible gases such as acetylene and air or acetylene and nitrous oxide. The mixture is then ignited and atomised in a flame whose temperature ranges from 21002800 degC. During combustion atoms of the element of interest in the sample absorb light at characteristic wavelengths.

Name: surface_atomic_force_infrared_microscopy
Label: surface atomic force infrared microscopy
Definition: The simultaneous collection of AFM topography data and spatially-resolved infrared spectra by measuring the infrared absorption via transient deformation of the AFM cantilever induced by an infrared pulsed laser tuned to a wavelength that corresponds to a vibrational absorbing wavelength in the specimen as a function of AFM tip position. Mid-IR radiation generated using a periodically poled LiNbO3 crystal emitting tuneable laser is focussed directly on the specimen surface.

Name: transmission_electron_microscopy_energy_dispersive_x_ray_spectroscopy
Label: transmission electron microscopy energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV under vacuum. The interaction of electrons with the specimen produces X-rays with energies characteristic of atomic number which are detected as a function of wavelength.

Name: continuous_flow_liquid_phase_micro_extraction
Label: continuous-flow liquid-phase micro-extraction
Definition: A process for transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase or vice versa by injecting one phase into a glass chamber using a conventional microsyringe and holding the microlitre droplet at the outlet tip of a PTFE connecting tube. The other phase then flows continuously over the droplet allowing mass transfer to occur.

Name: optical_interference_microscopy
Label: optical interference microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with visible light split into two beams which then interfere to produce fringes whose spacing is proportional to the height of the specimen.

Name: interferometric_rayleigh_scattering_spectroscopy
Label: interferometric Rayleigh scattering spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of Rayleigh scattered visible light which has been passed through an inferometer.

Name: 93nb_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 93Nb solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states 93Nb nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: glass_like_carbon_electrode
Label: glass-like carbon electrode
Definition: An electrode consisting of agranular non-graphitizable carbon with high isotropy and low permeability for liquids and gases.

Name: material_separation_objective
Label: material separation objective
Definition: is an objective to transform a material entity into spatially separated components."en

Name: quantitative_determination_method
Label: quantitative determination method
Definition: A measurement method which obtains the concentration or quantity of a specified substance in an analyte.

Name: intensity_modulated_photocurrent_spectroscopy
Label: intensity-modulated photocurrent spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where light energy from a fluctuating light source absorbed by the sample results in the production of a current the 'photocurrent' which is measured at different spectral intervals as a function of the modulation frequency of the light source.

Name: carbon_hydrogen_and_nitrogen_elemental_analysis
Label: carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen elemental analysis
Definition: A type of elemental analysis accomplished by combustion of the sample at 1200 C in a stream of unreactive gas and excess oxygen and collection of the products CO2 H2O and NOx. The masses of these combustion products can be used to calculate the composition of the unknown sample.

Name: reversed_phase_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: thermography
Label: thermography
Definition: An imaging method that uses infrared 900-14 000 nm radiation and allows variation in temperature to be observed typically brighter areas in the image represent higher temperatures.

Name: high_resolution_transmission_electron_microscope
Label: high-resolution transmission electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of an electron transparent specimen using several finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beams with an acceleration voltage of 50150 kV under vacuum. The amplitude of the interference of the transmitted electron waves is then measured and the phase contrast is used to produce an image.

Name: magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the solid sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: chrono_potentiometry
Label: chrono-potentiometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the time-dependence of the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: role
Label: role
Definition: A realizable entity  the manifestation of which brings about some result or end that is not essential to a continuant  in virtue of the kind of thing that it is but that can be served or participated in by that kind of continuant  in some kinds of natural social or institutional contexts."en

Name: pyrolysis_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: pyrolysis Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is first chemically degraded by heating then its absorption of radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m is measured and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: carbon_nanotube_synthesis_method
Label: carbon nanotube synthesis method
Definition: Any method used to synthesise carbon nanotubes.

Name: pseudo_polarography
Label: pseudo polarography
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is first electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped' by applying an oxidising potential. During removal the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. A plot of stripping peak current versus deposition potential resembles a polarogram.

Name: liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: liquid_chromatography_mass_spectrometry_assay
Label: liquid chromatography mass spectrometry assay
Definition: A mass spectrometry assay where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being converted into ions which are characterized by using mass spectrometry based on their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance."en

Name: liquid_chromatography_electrochemical_detection
Label: liquid chromatography-electrochemical detection
Definition: A liquid chromatography method that is sensitive to compounds which can be either reduced or oxidised. The mobile phase passes directly over the working electrode which is set to the specific potential required for oxidation or reduction. The current produced is then measured.

Name: coherent_neutron_scattering
Label: coherent neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample and phase is conserved.

Name: deionisation_method
Label: deionisation method
Definition: The removal of ions from a solution using an ion-exchange method.

Name: emulsion_method
Label: emulsion method
Definition: A method for dispersing two or more immiscible liquids by shaking stirring or homogenising the mixture.

Name: magic_angle_spinning_decoupling_pulse_sequence
Label: magic angle spinning decoupling pulse sequence
Definition: An NMR pulse sequence used in magic angle spinning that decouples nuclei i.e. removes the effects of usually J-coupling line splitting from the spectrum.

Name: laser_induced_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: laser induced fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser causing molecules in the sample to be electronically excited. The photons emitted as a result of the decay of the molecules back down to the ground state are measured.

Name: fixed_angle_reflectometry
Label: fixed angle reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating an extremely flat surface with visible light and measuring the intensity of the light reflected at the Brewster angle.

Name: high_vacuum_sublimation
Label: high-vacuum sublimation
Definition: A technique for purifying solid samples by heating the sample under high vacuum <0.1 Pa. The sample sublimes and the vapours condense as a purified compound on a cooled surface leaving the non-volatile residue impurities behind.

Name: liquidliquid_extraction
Label: liquid–liquid extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a dissolved substance from one liquid phase to another immiscible or partially miscible liquid phase in contact with it.

Name: ultra_small_angle_x_ray_scattering
Label: ultra-small angle X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample at ultra-low angles corresponding to Q  0.000050.005 inverse.

Name: generically_dependent_continuant
Label: generically dependent continuant
Definition: b is a generically dependent continuant  Def. b is a continuant that g-depends_on one or more other entities. axiom label in BFO2 Reference: 074-001"en

Name: voltammetry
Label: voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes.

Name: total_internal_reflection_microscopy
Label: total internal reflection microscopy
Definition: A type of optical microscopy which is used to monitor Brownian fluctuations in the separation between a single microscopic sphere and a flat plate in aqueous media. The sphere is levitated above the plate by colloidal forces such as double-layer or steric repulsion. Changes in elevation as small as 1 nm can be detected by measuring the light scattered by a single sphere when illuminated by an evanescent wave.

Name: detector
Label: detector
Definition: Any piece of apparatus used to detect an analyte.

Name: gradient_selected_heteronuclear_multiple_bond_coherence
Label: gradient-selected heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where pulsed-field gradients are used and a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and nuclei which are 23 bonds removed.

Name: gas_jet_deposition
Label: gas jet deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where a flow of carrier gas containing vaporised precursors is projected onto a surface resulting in a deposit.

Name: flow_field_flow_fractionation
Label: flow field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying a carrier liquid flow perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is then passed through the channel and the particles elute in order of decreasing diffusion coefficient.

Name: electron_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: electron magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of magnetic resonance spectroscopy involving unpaired electrons.

Name: material_supplier
Label: material supplier
Definition: A person or organization that provides material supplies to other people or organizations."en

Name: ph_measurement
Label: pH measurement
Definition: The measurement of pH the negative logarithm to base ten of the hydrogen ion activity in a solution. Operationally the pH of a solution X pHX is measured relative to that of a standard reference solution pHS and defined as pHX  pHS - EX - ES/RT/Fln 10 where EX and ES are the electromotive forces measured in cells containing the solution X and the reference solution respectively.

Name: two_step_uv_assisted_capillary_force_lithography
Label: two-step UV-assisted capillary force lithography
Definition: A process for shaping pliable thermoplastic polymers. An elastomeric polyurethane acrylate mould is placed on a UV-curable polymer that has been spin- or drop-coated onto a substrate and partially cured using UV light 200400 nm. Capillary force allows the polymer melt to fill up the void space between the polymer and the mould generating a negative replica of the mould pattern. The process is repeated with a second mould and exposure to UV light. Two-step UV-assisted capillary force lithography is used to generate micro/nanoscale combined hierarchical structures.

Name: dialysis
Label: dialysis
Definition: The separation of molecules in solution by the difference in their rates of diffusion through a semipermeable membrane.

Name: acetate_buffer
Label: acetate buffer
Definition: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by an acetic acid-acetate equilibrium.

Name: evaluant_role
Label: evaluant role
Definition: a role that inheres in a material entity that is realized in an assay in which data is generated about the bearer of the evaluant role"en

Name: fourier_profilometry
Label: Fourier profilometry
Definition: A method where the profile of a surface is determined by illuminating the sample with a beam of light which has been split into two paths one of which is directed at the sample and the other at a reference mirror. When the reflections are recombined a Fourier transform is applied to the phase of the interference pattern which contains information about the contours of the surface.

Name: double_focusing_mass_spectrometer
Label: double-focusing mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer that applies an electric field in order to select ions that have the same kinetic energy from an ion beam and uses a wedge-shaped magnetic field to separate the total ion beam into discrete ion beams according to the mass-to-charge ratio of the ions.

Name: karlfischer_titration
Label: Karl–Fischer titration
Definition: The process of determining trace amounts of water in a sample by the titration of sulphur dioxide in water using iodine.

Name: cathodic_stripping_potentiometry
Label: cathodic stripping potentiometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped' by re-reduction. During removal the time-dependence of the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: spin_tagging_velocimetry
Label: spin tagging velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of a fluid by tagging presaturating the magnetisation in a particular group of spins and tracking them in a fluid flow using NMR spectroscopy.

Name: optical_heterodyne_detection
Label: optical heterodyne detection
Definition: The measurement of the intensity of the light resulting from the interference of two lasers of different wavelength at the beat frequency.

Name: ionisation_spectroscopy
Label: ionisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the loss in energy of electrons produced by ionisation is measured.

Name: hollow_fibre_liquid_phase_micro_extraction
Label: hollow fibre liquid-phase micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase immobilised within the pores of the wall of a porous hollow fibre <10 m diameter.

Name: detection_method
Label: detection method
Definition: A method used to indicate the presence of a substance within a sample.

Name: coextraction
Label: coextraction
Definition: The transfer of two solutes from a liquid phase to a low-polarity organic liquid phase in contact with it. The solutes form mixed-species aggregates in the organic phase.

Name: chiral_raman_spectroscopy
Label: chiral Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where vibrational optical activity is measured by means of a small difference in the intensity of Raman scattering from chiral molecules of right- and left-circularly polarised incident light.

Name: thermospray_flame_furnace_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: thermospray flame furnace atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where sample is forced through a heated metal capillary tip before atomisation in a flame.

Name: single_crystal_x_ray_diffraction
Label: single crystal X-ray diffraction
