Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at a single crystal sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. Single crystal X-ray diffraction is used for protein crystallography.

Name: capillary_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: capillary liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by capillary liquid chromatography before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: differential_mobility_spectroscopy
Label: differential mobility spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the velocity of gas phase ions in an electric field is measured. A radio frequency voltage forces the ions to oscillate between two electrodes causing some ions to be transmitted while others collide with the walls of the electrodes.

Name: microwave_assisted_extraction
Label: microwave-assisted extraction
Definition: The process of transferring the organic components of a solid to an organic liquid phase. The process is accelerated by directing radiation in the microwave region 11000 mm at the sample.

Name: assembly
Label: assembly
Definition: The process of individual components of a sample associating to form a new pattern or structure.

Name: solvent_role
Label: solvent role
Definition: solvent role is a role which inheres in a molecular entity capable of ensuring the dissolution of another chemical entity and realized by the process of solvation"en

Name: atomic_force_microscopy
Label: atomic force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: autothermal_reforming
Label: autothermal reforming
Definition: The reaction of hydrocarbons with oxygen and carbon dioxide at 9501100 C to form syngas.

Name: platinum_sputter_deposition
Label: platinum sputter deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a Pt metal target is bombarded with energetic ions e.g. Ar causing atoms to be ejected 'sputtering'. The ejected atoms then deposit as a thin film of Pt on a substrate.

Name: material_acquisition
Label: material acquisition
Definition: A planned process in which materials for an experiment are acquired from an external supplier.

Name: pickering_emulsion_method
Label: Pickering emulsion method
Definition: A method for dispersing two or more immiscible liquid by shaking stirring or homogenising the mixture. The emulsion is stablised by adding finely divided insoluble solid particles e.g. latex or silica.

Name: laser
Label: laser
Definition: A laser acronym for light amplification by the stimulated emission of radiation is a light source that emits photons of the same characteristics in a coherent beam. A laser uses a solid liquid or gaseous lasing medium that contains molecules of which some atoms have electrons that emit photons of the same frequency when falling back to their normal orbital after excitation pumping by external means A laser is the most common way to irradiate a cell in a flow cytometer."en

Name: isotachophoresis
Label: isotachophoresis
Definition: An electrophoresis method in a discontinuous buffer system where the analytes migrate according to their electrophoretic mobilities forming a chain of adjacent zones moving with equal velocity between two solutions the leading and terminating electrolytes bracketing the mobility range of the analytes.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry where the sample ions are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: ctab_assisted_hydrothermal_synthesis
Label: CTAB-assisted hydrothermal synthesis
Definition: Hydrothermal synthesis that uses cetyltrimethylammonium bromide to guide the morphology of the product.

Name: foam_fractionation
Label: foam fractionation
Definition: A method of separation in which a component of the bulk liquid is preferentially adsorbed at the liquidvapour interface and is removed by foaming.

Name: ph_glass_electrode
Label: pH glass electrode
Definition: A hydrogen-ion-responsive electrode consisting of a piece usually a bulb of special glass attached to a stem of high-resistance glass complete with internal reference electrode and internal filling solution system.

Name: matrix_solid_phase_dispersion
Label: matrix solid-phase dispersion
Definition: A technique for the preparation and extraction of solid and viscous samples. The sample is blended with a bonded-phase solid support such as silica using a glass pestle to obtain a semi-dry material. The blended sample is then packed into a cartridge and eluted.

Name: chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: photoacoustic_raman_spectroscopy
Label: photoacoustic Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. Two lasers 'pump' and 'probe' are mixed and focused on the sample cell. When the frequency difference between the lasers corresponds to a Raman transition an acoustic signal a sound wave produced by an increase in pressure is generated and detected by a sensitive microphone.

Name: secondary_electron_emission_mass_spectrometry
Label: secondary electron emission mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a surface is bombarded with sample ions and the secondary electrons emitted are detected.

Name: potential_barrier_field_flow_fractionation
Label: potential barrier field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel such that the Earth's gravitational field is perpendicular to the channel and varying the ionic strength of the solution or Hamaker constant/surface potential of the particles.

Name: deuterium_decoupled_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: deuterium-decoupled nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where J/scalar couplings to 2H nuclei are cancelled by applying radio frequency radiation to saturate or otherwise manipulate the 2H spins such that no evolution of the coupling occurs.

Name: mixing
Label: mixing
Definition: The combining of components particles or layers into a more homogeneous state. The mixing may be achieved manually or mechanically by shifting the material with stirrers or pumps or by revolving or shaking the container. The process st not permit segregation of particles of different size or properties. Homogeneity may be considered to have been achieved in a practical sense when the sampling error of the processed portion is negligible compared to the total error of the measurement system.

Name: imaging_mass_spectrometry
Label: imaging mass spectrometry
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved mass spectra of a sample during microscopy which are used to visualise the spatial distribution of compounds by their molecular masses.

Name: thermally_induced_phase_separation
Label: thermally induced phase separation
Definition: A method for preparing a polymer membrane by mixing the polymer with a substance that acts as a solvent a high temperature and casting the solution into a film. When the solution is cooled solidification occurs.

Name: purified_material
Label: purified material
Definition: A material entity that is generated by a purification process in which an input material is separated to obtain a fraction with a higher concentration of a desired component"en

Name: time_resolved_resonance_rayleigh_scattering
Label: time-resolved resonance Rayleigh scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of Rayleigh scattered visible light as a function of time where the wavelength of the incident light corresponds to an absorption band in the scattering molecules.

Name: 1h_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 1H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: direct_current_dielectrophoresis
Label: direct-current dielectrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their dielectrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium across which a direct electric field is applied.

Name: optical_density_measurement
Label: optical density measurement
Definition: The measurement of the light transmitted through a sample for a given wavelength.

Name: blank_value
Label: blank value
Definition: An experimental method output originating from the matrix reagents and any residual bias in the measurement device or process which contributes to the value obtained for the quantity in the analytical procedure.

Name: homonuclear_three_dimensional_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: homonuclear three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which three independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals. Each signal is described by three frequencies all arising from the same type of nucleus thus effecting the distribution of signals within a cube.

Name: rate_zonal_centrifugation
Label: rate-zonal centrifugation
Definition: A method where the components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a density gradient of e.g. CsCl in a centrifuge according to mass. The species in the sample move through the gradient until they reach a point where their density and that of the gradient are identical.

Name: supercritical_fluid_chromatography
Label: supercritical-fluid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a fluid above and relatively close to its critical temperature and pressure.

Name: clear_native_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: clear native polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where protein molecules move at different speeds in non-denaturing conditions according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied. This method does not use a dye to transfer charge to the protein molecules and is used to separate acidic water-soluble and membrane proteins.

Name: disappearance_potential_spectroscopy
Label: disappearance potential spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the sudden disappearance of electrons from the beam.

Name: vapour_phase_epitaxy
Label: vapour-phase epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from vapour-phase precursors on a monocrystalline substrate.

Name: one_dimensional_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: one-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them and the spectrum is obtained by plotting chemical shift vs. frequency.

Name: chemical_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction electron or proton transfer with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at low pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation.

Name: ultrahigh_vacuum_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: ultrahigh vacuum chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors under ultrahigh vacuum <10{-6} Pa which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: diffuse_x_ray_reflectometry
Label: diffuse X-ray reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at an extremely flat surface at angle theta minus omega to the surface and measuring the intensity of the X-rays which undergo diffuse reflection and are emitted at angle theta plus omega from the surface.

Name: globally_optimized_alternating_phase_rectangular_pulse
Label: globally optimized alternating phase rectangular pulse
Definition: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. 1985 64 pg 547.

Name: infrared_spectrum
Label: infrared spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained by measuring the absorption or emission of infrared radiation by a sample.

Name: magnetometer
Label: magnetometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus used to measure the strength and/or direction of a magnetic field.

Name: ultrasonication
Label: ultrasonication
Definition: The irradiation of a liquid sample with ultrasonic >20 kHz waves resulting in agitation. Sound waves propagate into the liquid media result in alternating high-pressure compression and low-pressure rarefaction cycles. During rarefaction high-intensity sonic waves create small vacuum bubbles or voids in the liquid which then collapse violently cavitation during compression creating very high local temperatures.

Name: diffuse_reflectance_infrared_fourier_transform_spectroscopy
Label: diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the diffuse reflection of a single pulse of infrared radiation by a sample is measured and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: accordion_spectroscopy
Label: accordion spectroscopy
Definition: A dimensionality reduction technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments. A nD NMR experiment is represented in n-1 dimensions by concerted simultaneous interrogation of two spectral dimensions.

Name: transmission_raman_spectroscopy
Label: transmission Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light usually from a laser by a sample is detected. The light is collected from the non-illuminated side of the sample.

Name: ultrasonic_speckle_velocimetry
Label: ultrasonic speckle velocimetry
Definition: A method for measuring the velocity of a sample by detecting and analysing successive ultrasonic speckle signals that result from the interference of backscattered echoes of successive incident pulses of ultrasonic radiation 36 MHz.

Name: negative_ion_chemical_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: negative ion chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with reagent gaseous anions at low pressure.

Name: three_dimensional_diffusion_ordered_spectroscopy
Label: three-dimensional diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Definition: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D NMR experiment are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Name: micrograph
Label: micrograph
Definition: A magnified image obtained using a microscope to view a small object or specimen.

Name: gas_phase_plasma_hydrocarbonation
Label: gas-phase plasma hydrocarbonation
Definition: A synthesis method for semiconducting single-walled carbon nanotubes where as-grown single-walled carbon nanotubes are treated with a methane plasma at 400600 C in a vacuum and the metallic single-walled carbon nanotubes are selectively etched.

Name: scanning_electron_microscopy_energy_dispersive_x_ray_spectroscopy
Label: scanning electron microscopy energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV is scanned across the specimen under vacuum. The interaction of electrons with the specimen produces X-rays with energies characteristic of atomic number which are detected as a function of wavelength.

Name: excitation_laser_function
Label: excitation laser function
Definition: Function of a laser realized by it exciting some internal state of a sample.

Name: short_column_chromatography
Label: short-column chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the stationary bed is within a tube of less than the standard length of 25 cm. The particles of the solid stationary phase or support coated with a liquid stationary phase may fill the whole inside volume of the tube packed column or be concentrated on or along the inside tube wall leaving an open unrestricted path for the mobile phase in the middle part of the tube open-tubular column.

Name: citratephosphate_buffer
Label: citrate–phosphate buffer
Definition: A phosphate buffer containing citric acid and sodium phosphate where the pH is maintained by citratecitric acid and phosphatehydrogen phosphate equilibria.

Name: high_temperature_ultrasonic_velocimetry
Label: high-temperature ultrasonic velocimetry
Definition: A method for detemining the velocity of metallic or semiconductor melts at 1000 C by measuring the Doppler shift experienced by ultrasound radiation.

Name: two_dimensional_small_angle_x_ray_scattering
Label: two-dimensional small-angle X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of two separate beams of X-rays scattered by a sample at low angles 010.

Name: interference_lithography
Label: interference lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. The photoresist is then exposed to a pattern of intense UV light generated by the interference of two or more coherent light sources. A post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: nuclear_magnetic_resonance_method
Label: nuclear magnetic resonance method
Definition: A technique or procedure applied in nuclear magnetic resonance experiments.

Name: two_dimensional_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectrum
Label: two-dimensional nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectrum
Definition: A two-dimensional spectrum which plots the resonance frequency of homonuclear nuclei approximately 6 AA apart which are correlated by the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect. The resonance frequencies are plotted with intensities proportional to the populations of nuclei.

Name: adaptive_immune_receptor
Label: adaptive immune receptor
Definition: is a receptor produced by cells of the adaptive immune system with the purpose of binding epitopes."en

Name: resonant_infrared_multiphoton_dissociation_spectroscopy
Label: resonant infrared multiphoton dissociation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs resonant radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m with sufficient energy to cause photodissociation by the absorption of two or more photons.

Name: differential_centrifugation
Label: differential centrifugation
Definition: A separation method where the components of a cell are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. The sample is centrifuged in a number of separate sequential steps each time the pellet is removed and the speed increased.

Name: continuous_distillation
Label: continuous distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser. The distillation is ongoing with sample mixture being continuously added.

Name: 29si_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 29Si magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 29Si nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: faraday_efficiency
Label: Faraday efficiency
Definition: A measure of the efficiency by which charge is transferred in a chemical reaction.

Name: low_temperature_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: low-temperature plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons generated by an alternating current.

Name: atmospheric_pressure_photoionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: atmospheric pressure photoionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with an ultraviolet laser at atmospheric pressure. The sample absorbs one or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Name: derived_data_from_statistical_analysis
Label: derived data from statistical analysis
Definition: A data item that is derived from a statistical data analysis.

Name: spectrofluorimeter
Label: spectrofluorimeter
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a laser a monochromator for selecting a specific excitation wavelength and a detector which is used to measure fluorescence spectra.

Name: inverse_gas_chromatography
Label: inverse gas chromatography
Definition: A surface characterisation technique in which a pulse or constant concentration of a known gas or vapour probe molecule is injected into a column packed with the solid sample at a fixed carrier gas flow rate. The retention time of the probe molecule is then measured using a  traditional gas chromatography detector.

Name: degenerate_four_wave_mixing_spectroscopy
Label: degenerate four-wave mixing spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where one laser beam is split into three beams.

Name: transmission_high_energy_electron_diffraction_data
Label: transmission high-energy electron diffraction data
Definition: Data which is obtained from a transmission high-energy electron diffraction experiment.

Name: figure
Label: figure
Definition: An information content entity consisting of a two dimensional arrangement of information content entities such that the arrangement itself is about something."en

Name: cool_function
Label: cool function
Definition: A cool function is a function to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material below the initial kinetic energy of that type of material."en

Name: single_molecule_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: single-molecule fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the fluorescence of a single molecule excited by ultraviolet light is detected as a function of wavelength.

Name: low_energy_electron_microscopy
Label: low-energy electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter low energy 1-100 eV electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV under vacuum. The interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected.

Name: magnetometry
Label: magnetometry
Definition: The measurement of the strength and/or direction of magnetic fields or the magnetic susceptibility of a sample.

Name: flow_compensated_phase_contrast_velocimetry
Label: flow-compensated phase-contrast velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by using magnetic field gradients to encode velocity information into the phase of the NMR signal. All other contributions to the magnetic gradient phase are set to zero the only velocity contribution to the phase is due to the flow of the sample 'flow compensation'.

Name: micromoulding
Label: micromoulding
Definition: A process for shaping pliable polymer material using a microsized rigid frame or model called a 'mould'. The polymer material in liquid form is injected into a mould using a small diameter piston and then allowed to harden or set inside the mould adopting its shape.

Name: specimen
Label: specimen
Definition: A material entity that is collected for potential use as an input upon which measurements or observations are performed."en

Name: wall_coated_open_tubular_column
Label: wall-coated open-tubular column
Definition: An open-tubular column in which the liquid stationary phase is coated on the unmodified smooth inner wall of the tube.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_quadrupole_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrospray-ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Time-of-flight mass spectrometry where there is an initial electrospray ionisation stage.

Name: hydrazine_treatment
Label: hydrazine treatment
Definition: Treatment of a sample with hydrazine. This can be used to prepare samples for glycomics.

Name: anisotropic_nucleus_nucleus_interaction_line_broadening_minimization_objective
Label: anisotropic nucleus-nucleus interaction line broadening minimization objective
Definition: An objective to minimize line broadening in solid state NMR that is caused by anisotropic interactions between nuclei.

Name: electronic_sputter_etching
Label: electronic sputter etching
Definition: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by bombarding it with high-energy or highly charged heavy ions.

Name: dynamic_force_spectroscopy
Label: dynamic force spectroscopy
Definition: The use of an atomic force microscope to measure rupture or fusion force as a function of loading rate.

Name: electrochemiluminescence_detection
Label: electrochemiluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence emitted by electrochemically-generated intermediates during an electrochemical reaction.

Name: spin_polarised_low_energy_electron_microscopy
Label: spin-polarised low energy electron microscopy
Definition: Low-energy electron microscopy where a magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the sample surface.

Name: solution_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: solution-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of nuclei with non-zero spin in a sample dissolved in a deuterated solvent to a perturbing magnetic field is detected. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: supported_liquid_membrane_extraction
Label: supported liquid membrane extraction
Definition: The transfer of a solute from one phase the 'donor' or 'feed' phase to another the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase across a non-porous liquid membrane.

Name: action_spectrum
Label: action spectrum
Definition: A plot of a relative biological or chemical photoresponse per number of incident photons against wavelength or energy of radiation under the same radiant power of light.

Name: metalorganic_vapour_phase_epitaxy
Label: metal–organic vapour-phase epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from organometallic vapour-phase precursors on a monocrystalline substrate.

Name: gamma_ray_spectroscopy
Label: gamma-ray spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energies of gamma-rays emitted or absorbed by a sample is measured.

Name: flow_cytometer
Label: flow cytometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a flow cell a laser and a detector which detects the fluorescence and light scattering of individual particles e.g. cells.

Name: particle_beam_lithography
Label: particle-beam lithography
Definition: A type of lithography where electrons or ions are used to generate pattern which is transferred to a resist.

Name: wide_angle_powder_x_ray_diffraction
Label: wide-angle powder X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the powdered sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. The incident X-ray beam strikes the sample at a wide angle >10.

Name: quartz_crystal_microbalance
Label: quartz crystal microbalance
Definition: A piece of apparatus used to measure the mass per unit area 1 g per cm2 by measuring the change in frequency of a quartz crystal resonator a quartz crystal sandwiched between a pair of electrodes as a function of mass change.

Name: dielectric_barrier_discharge_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: dielectric barrier discharge ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by passing an alternating-voltage electrical discharge between a Cu sheet electrode and a discharge electrode separated by a glass slide. The glass slide acts as dielectric barrier and sample molecules on the surface of the glass slide are desorbed and ionised by the plasma.

Name: rheometry
Label: rheometry
Definition: The study of the flow of fluids which cannot be defined by a single value of viscosity. Rheometry is the measurement of the relationship between deformation and stress for these liquids.

Name: electron_beam_projection_lithography
Label: electron-beam projection lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses electrons to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a beam of electrons 100 keV is scanned across a patterned mask. The electrons induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'. The electron beam can be focused using either electric or magnetic fields.

Name: soft_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: soft X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with low energy X-rays and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to valence-to-core transitions are detected.

Name: convergent_beam_low_energy_electron_diffraction
Label: convergent beam low energy electron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a highly convergent beam nm diameter of low energy <500 eV electrons at the sample and recording the resulting diffraction pattern.

Name: 19f_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 19F solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states 19F nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: spinning
Label: spinning
Definition: A process used to create polymer fibers using a spinneret a multi-pored device similar to a shower head to form multiple continuous filaments.

Name: exclusion_chromatography
Label: exclusion chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the separation is caused by exclusion effects such as differences in molecular size shape or charge.

Name: supercritical_fluid_extraction_supercritical_fluid_chromatography
Label: supercritical-fluid extraction-supercritical-fluid chromatography
Definition: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid then subjected to column chromatography where the supercritical fluid acts as the mobile phase.

Name: homogenisation
Label: homogenisation
Definition: The intensive mixing of tually insoluble phases sometimes with addition of surfactants to obtain a soluble suspension or emulsion.

Name: hnco
Label: HNCO
Definition: A triple resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a isotopically enriched protein. The chemical shift of the backbone amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the carbonyl carbon of the preceding residue. The name of the method describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Name: physical_store
Label: physical store
Definition: A container with an environmental control function."en

Name: x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient around the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron are measured as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Name: deuterated_lanthanum_triglycine_sulfate_detector
Label: deuterated lanthanum triglycine sulfate detector
Definition: A very sensitive temperature-controlled detector for mid-infrared range measurement that employs temperature-sensitive ferroelectric crystals of either deuterated lanthanum triglycine sulfate or deuterated L-alanine doped triglycine sulfate. As the temperature and hence polarisability of the crystals changes due to the absorption of infrared radiation a charge is generated which is detected by two parallel electrodes. The deuterated forms of the crystals are used because they have a higher Curie point.

Name: solvent_casting_and_particulate_leaching
Label: solvent casting and particulate leaching
Definition: A process for forming thermoplastic polymer samples by dipping a mould into a solution of the polymer and particles of known dimension and drawing off the solvent to leave a composite polymer-particle film adhering to the mould.

Name: gradient_selected_heteronuclear_multiple_quantum_coherence
Label: gradient-selected heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the nuclei to which they are covalently bound. A spatially inhomogeneous magnetic field is applied with a defined gradient and used to either select a particular signal or to render unwanted signals undetectable.

Name: minicolumn
Label: minicolumn
Definition: A chromatography column that is small enough to use in a 96-plate microarray.

Name: small_angle_neutron_scattering
Label: small-angle neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons at small angles corresponding to a scattering vector Q  4/sinpi/2  0.0050.2 inverse degrees.

Name: synchrotron_radiation_excited_x_ray_spectroscopy
Label: synchrotron radiation excited X-ray spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with radiation is generated in a synchrotron and the energies and intensities of the emitted X-rays are detected.

Name: elemental_analysis_isotope_ratio_mass_spectrometry
Label: elemental analysis isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is first subject to elemental analysis dropped onto a heated reactor which contains an oxidant-such as copper and chromium oxide-and combusted at 900 C to produce N2 NOx H2O and CO2 which are reduced in a stream of helium before the relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is determined.

Name: profilometer
Label: profilometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that measures surface profiles by dragging a diamond stylus across the sample surface. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the stylus and surface during scanning.

Name: proton_decoupled_13c_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: proton-decoupled 13C nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where J/scalar couplings between 13C and 1H nuclei are cancelled by applying radio frequency radiation to saturate or otherwise manipulate the 1H spins such that no evolution of the coupling occurs.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the sample is ionised by electrospray ionization. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: rotating_disk_voltammetry
Label: rotating-disk voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The indicator electrode e.g. a Pt disc of 1.0 mm diameter sealed in a Teflon carrier  spins at high speed during the experiment and the rotational motion sets up a well-defined flow of analyte towards its surface.

Name: reflectionabsorption_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: reflection–absorption Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the absorption and reflection of low-incident-angle infrared light by the surface molecules of a highly reflective or polished sample is measured. The  sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: selective_laser_sintering
Label: selective laser sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample below its melting point using a high-energy laser until its particles adhere to each other.

Name: jump_and_return_pulse_sequence
Label: jump and return pulse sequence
Definition: A pulse cluster used for solvent suppression consisting of two rf pulses separated by a delay with conditions set such that the solvent signal alone is rendered unobservable by the second pulse. For the pulse sequence see J. Am. Chem. Soc. 1982 104 pg 7310.

Name: bright_field_transmission_electron_micrograph
Label: bright-field transmission electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the directly transmitted electrons.

Name: hncoca
Label: HNCOCA
Definition: A triple resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a isotopically enriched protein. The chemical shift of the backbone amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the alpha-carbon of the preceding residue. The name of the method describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Name: atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionisation
Label: atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample is ionised by interaction electron or proton transfer with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure.

Name: agarose_gel_electrophoresis
Label: agarose gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium consisting of agarose gel across which an electric field is applied.

Name: crystallisation
Label: crystallisation
Definition: The formation of a crystalline solid from a solution melt vapour or a different solid phase generally by lowering the temperature or by evaporation of a solvent.

Name: ultra_small_angle_neutron_scattering
Label: ultra small angle neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons at ultra-small angles corresponding to Q  0.0000030.01 inverse degrees.

Name: two_photon_fluorescence_microscopy
Label: two photon fluorescence microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where fluorophores in the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by the near-simultaneous absorption of two photons.

Name: square_wave_anodic_stripping_voltammetry
Label: square-wave anodic stripping voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is first electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped' by applying an oxidising potential. During removal the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied as a square wave superimposed on a linear sweep.

Name: photoelectrochemical_deposition
Label: photoelectrochemical deposition
Definition: A synthesis method in which a film of solid metal is deposited from a solution of ions onto an electrically conducting surface an electrode. Three electrodes are required working counter and reference and when sufficient current is passed through the solution accompanied by irradiation with UV light metal ions are reduced at the working electrode.

Name: phase_profilometry
Label: phase profilometry
Definition: A method where the profile of a surface is determined by illuminating the sample with a beam of light which has been split into two paths one of which is directed at the sample and the other at a reference mirror. When the reflections are recombined any distortions of periodic shadows due to interference contain information about the contours of the surface.

Name: pulsed_field_gradient
Label: pulsed field gradient
Definition: A tool employed in NMR experiments spatially inhomogeneous magnetic fields applied with a defined gradient. Used to either select a particular signal or to render unwanted signals undetectable.

Name: fluorescence_lifetime_imaging_microscopy
Label: fluorescence lifetime imaging microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by illuminating it with light of specific wavelengths and the spatial distribution of mean fluorescence lifetimes usually on the ns scale is mapped within the microscopic images.

Name: graphite
Label: graphite
Definition: An allotropic form of the element carbon consisting of layers of hexagonally arranged carbon atoms in a planar condensed ring system graphene layers. The layers are stacked parallel to each other in a three-dimensional crystalline long-range order. There are two allotropic forms with different stacking arrangements hexagonal and rhombohedral. The chemical bonds within the layers are covalent with sp2 hybridization and with a C--C distance of 141.7 pm. The weak bonds between the layers are metallic with a strength comparable to van der Waals bonding only.

Name: manufacturer_role
Label: manufacturer role
Definition: Manufacturer role is a role which inheres in a person or organization and which is realized by a manufacturing process."en

Name: column_chromatography
Label: column chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the stationary bed is within a tube of standard length 25 cm. The particles of the solid stationary phase or support coated with a liquid stationary phase may fill the whole inside volume of the tube packed column or be concentrated on or along the inside tube wall leaving an open unrestricted path for the mobile phase in the middle part of the tube open-tubular column.

Name: pyrolysis_mass_spectrometry
Label: pyrolysis mass spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the sample is chemically degraded by thermal energy then converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of nuclei with non-zero spin in a solid sample to a perturbing magnetic field is detected. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: x_ray_appearance_potential_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray appearance potential spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the sudden appearance of soft X-ray fluorescence.

Name: femtosecond_pumpprobe_spectroscopy
Label: femtosecond pump–probe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse the 'pump' followed by a second laser pulse the 'probe' after a fs delay. The pump pulse creates excitations in the sample which are sensed by the probe pulse.

Name: plasma_etching
Label: plasma etching
Definition: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface using short pulses of a plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals.

Name: electron_energy_loss_spectroscopy
Label: electron energy loss spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known narrow range of kinetic energies 50200 eV interacts with a surface and the energy loss 0.005100 eV the electrons suffer as a result of the interaction is measured.

Name: electrode
Label: electrode
Definition: An electrically-conducting piece of apparatus that exchanges electrons with an electrolyte as part of an electrical circuit.

Name: dimethyl_sulfoxide
Label: dimethyl sulfoxide
Definition: A 2-carbon sulfoxide in which the sulfur atom has two methyl substituents.

Name: chemical_force_microscopy
Label: chemical force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a chemically functionalised sharp spike e.g. with thiols mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the chemical interactions between the tip and surface e.g. gold as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: sample_preparation_for_assay
Label: sample preparation for assay
Definition: A sample_preparation_for_assay is a protocol_application including material_enrollments and biomaterial_transformations. definition_source: OBI."en

Name: moulding
Label: moulding
Definition: Any process for shaping pliable polymer materials using a rigid frame or model called a 'mould'. The polymer material in liquid form hardens or sets inside the mould adopting its shape.

Name: 67zn_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 67Zn nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 67Zn nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: transmitting_polarising_microscope
Label: transmitting polarising microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an eyepiece an objective lens object turret stage orthogonal polarising filters and light source which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range. The specimen is illuminated with visible light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective.

Name: diastereomeric_ratio
Label: diastereomeric ratio
Definition: The ratio of the percentage of one diastereomer in a mixture to that of the other.

Name: roller_nanoimprint_lithography
Label: roller nanoimprint lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses mechanical deformation to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of resist a thermoplastic polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. A stamp containing the desired nanosized pattern on its surface is placed on the substrate. A roller heated to the glass transition temperature of the resist is then used to press the stamp into the resist. The resist is cooled and any residual resist in the cast area is removed by an anisotropic etching process such as reactive ion etching.

Name: soft_x_ray_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: soft X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with 'soft' <300 eV X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: secondary_ion_mass_spectrometry
Label: secondary ion mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a stream of primary mass-selected particles and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected.

Name: electron_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: electron coincidence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where two or more particles electrons photons or ions originating from a single event such as an ionisation are detected as a function of energy.

Name: angle_resolved_electron_electron_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved electron-electron coincidence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: liquid_phase_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: liquid-phase nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy in the liquid phase where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.

Name: time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: extraction
Label: extraction
Definition: The transfer of a solute from a liquid phase to another immiscible or partially-miscible liquid phase in contact with it.

Name: ion_detector
Label: ion detector
Definition: A piece of apparatus that produces an output that depends on the number of ions that it encounters.

Name: high_resolution_fourier_transform_ion_cyclotron_resonance_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-resolution Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field. The 'exact' mass of the sample ions is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass the number of protons and neutrons.

Name: far_infrared_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: far-infrared magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy levels of paramagnetic species such as HCN are tuned into resonance with a far-infrared laser source in order to investigate rotational transitions.

Name: surface_plasmon_resonance_imaging
Label: surface plasmon resonance imaging
Definition: Spectroscopy where the resonant excitation of surface plasmons usually on a Au or Ag surface by ultraviolet or visible light is measured during which the reflectivity of the sample is measured at a fixed angle or wavelength.

Name: krypton_pulse_discharge_photoionisation_detection
Label: krypton pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Definition: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through krypton gas generating high-energy 13.517.5 eV photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Name: square_wave_polarography
Label: square-wave polarography
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the ac component of the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the ac potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The working electrode is a dropping mercury or other liquid conductor electrode and unstirred solutions are used. The cell current is sampled only once per drop lifetime on alternate half cycles and the potential is applied as a large amplitude square wave superimposed on a linear sweep.

Name: knudsen_cell
Label: Knudsen cell
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a crucible made of pyrolytic boron nitride quartz tungsten or graphite heating filaments a water cooling system which is used to measure very low vapor pressures by measuring the mass of vapor which escapes when the vessel contains a liquid in equilibrium with its vapor. It is also used as a source evaporator during crystal growth e.g. during molecular-beam epitaxy.

Name: electron_spin_resonance_imaging
Label: electron spin resonance imaging
Definition: An imaging method which uses the detection of unpaired spins in a magnetic field gradient so that the resonance condition is sensitive to the position of the spins in the sample.

Name: supercritical_fluid_extraction_supercritical_fluid_chromatography_liquid_chromatography
Label: supercritical-fluid extraction-supercritical-fluid chromatography-liquid chromatography
Definition: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid then subjected to column chromatography where the supercritical fluid acts as the mobile phase and finally depressurised collected and subjected to liquid  chromatography.

Name: angle_resolved_bremsstrahlung_isochromat_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved bremsstrahlung isochromat spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation which is detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: pressurised_fluid_extraction
Label: pressurised-fluid extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a dissolved substance from one liquid phase to another immiscible or partially miscible liquid phase in contact with it using solvents at elevated temperature 50200 C and pressure 720 MPa.

Name: wide_angle_neutron_scattering
Label: wide angle neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons at wide angles corresponding to Q > 1 inverse degrees.

Name: supercritical_mobile_phase
Label: supercritical mobile phase
Definition: A supercritical fluid that percolates through the stationary bed in chromatography.

Name: vector_piezoresponse_force_microscopy
Label: vector piezoresponse force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electric field is applied to a sharp spike known as a 'tip' which is mounted on the end of a cantilever. The tip scans the surface of a piezoelectric specimen and the distortion of the electric field by the specimen is measured as components from three directions one vertical and two lateral. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: double_patterning_lithography
Label: double patterning lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. The photoresist is then exposed to two different patterns of intense typically UV light using two different masks. A post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: 1h15n_heteronuclear_multiple_bond_coherence
Label: 1H–15N heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 15N nuclei which are 2 to 3 bonds removed.

Name: thermogravimetry
Label: thermogravimetry
Definition: The measurement of the mass of a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: angle_resolved_resonant_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved resonant Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The wavelength of the incident photons is scanned over an absorption edge in the sample and the Auger electrons emitted are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: sputter_deposition
Label: sputter deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a solid target is bombarded with electrons or energetic ions e.g. Ar causing atoms to be ejected 'sputtering'. The ejected atoms then deposit as a thin-film on a substrate.

Name: negative_ion_laser_desorption_mass_spectrometry
Label: negative ion laser desorption mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry using negative ionisation where a high-energy pulsed laser is used for sample vaporisation.

Name: steady_state_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: steady-state fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of the fluorescence emitted by molecules excited by constant illumination of ultraviolet light is detected as a function of wavelength.

Name: mobile_phase
Label: mobile phase
Definition: A fluid that percolates through or along the stationary bed in chromatography.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_nanoelectrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography-nanoelectrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of nL min1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: analysis_subset_ontology_module
Label: analysis subset ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that is intended for usage in analysis or discovery applications."en

Name: multi_angle_light_scattering
Label: multi-angle light scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered visible light at a number of different angles none of which are close to the angle of incidence of the light.

Name: temperature_programmed_reduction
Label: temperature-programmed reduction
Definition: Thermal analysis of a system where the consumption of reducing agent in moles per second per gram of material is measured against temperature.

Name: thermal_energy_analyser_detection
Label: thermal energy analyser detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to molecules containing NO and NO2 groups. The sample is pyrolysed at 275 C producing radicals which react with ozone under low pressure to produce chemiluminescence.

Name: 93nb_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 93Nb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 93Rb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: near_resonance_rayleigh_scattering_spectroscopy
Label: near-resonance Rayleigh scattering spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of Rayleigh scattered visible light where the wavelength of the incident light corresponds to an energy which is near to an absorption band in the scattering molecules.

Name: circular_dichroism_titration
Label: circular dichroism titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by the sample.

Name: 127i_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 127I nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 127I nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: portion_of_material
Label: portion of material
Definition: An independent material continuant that is self-connected and retains its identity over time.

Name: measure_function
Label: measure function
Definition: Measure function is a function that is borne by a processed material  and realized in a process in which information about some entity is expressed relative to some reference."en

Name: charge_coupled_device
Label: charge-coupled device
Definition: A piece of apparatus based on a semiconductor chip which converts the intensity of light falling onto its surface at different points into a charge. When a photon is absorbed by the chip a single electron is released. Electrodes covering the chip surface hold these electrons in place in an array of wells or pixels so that during exposure of the chip to light a pattern of charge builds up that corresponds to the pattern of light.

Name: x_band_electron_spin_resonance_spectrum
Label: X-band electron spin resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to spin-state transitions of unpaired electrons against a perturbing magnetic field in the presence of fixed-frequency microwave radiation of approximate frequency 9 GHz known as the 'X-band'.

Name: thermogravimetry_mass_spectrometry
Label: thermogravimetry-mass spectrometry
Definition: The MS analysis of volatile compounds released during the measurement of the mass of a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: step_and_flash_imprint_lithography
Label: step-and-flash imprint lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses mechanical deformation and cross-linking to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photosensitive organosilicon resist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. A transparent stamp e.g. quartz containing the desired nanosized pattern on its surface is then pressed into the resist which is exposed to UV light. Any unexposed areas of polymer are removed by reactive ion etching.

Name: reactive_spray_deposition
Label: reactive spray deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a metal-containing precursor dissolved in a solvent is atomised and ignited. During combustion the flame is directed at the substrate resulting in the deposition of a thin layer of metal.

Name: reference_material
Label: reference material
Definition: A substance or mixture of substances the composition of which is known within specified limits and one or more of the properties of which is sufficiently well established to be used for the calibration of an apparatus the assessment of a measuring method or for assigning values to materials.

Name: carr_purcell_meiboom_gill_pulse_sequence
Label: Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill pulse sequence
Definition: A pulse sequence which is applied during nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy to measure spinspin T2 relaxation times. For the pulse sequence see Rev. Sci. Inst. 1958 29 pg 688.

Name: fluorescence_microscope
Label: fluorescence microscope
Definition: A microscope that uses an excitation source to produce light which is passed through an excitation filter reflects off the surface of a dichroic mirror onto the specimen which fluoresces producing light that passes through an emission filter to select only the required wavelengths onto the collector lens.

Name: descriptive_statistical_calculation_objective
Label: descriptive statistical calculation objective
Definition: A descriptive statistical calculation objective is a data transformation objective which concerns any calculation intended to describe a feature of a data set for example its center or its variability."en

Name: adverse_laboratory_event
Label: adverse laboratory event
Definition: An event that takes place in a laboratory that may unintentionally harm an organism or piece of apparatus.

Name: plasma_sputter_deposition
Label: plasma sputter deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a solid target is bombarded with energetic ions e.g. Ar causing atoms to be ejected 'sputtering'. The ejected atoms then deposit as a thin-film on a substrate. Ionisation of the neutral gas atoms requires a plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons source to be generated by passing an electrical discharge through the chamber with the target acting as the cathode.

Name: heteronuclear_single_quantum_coherence_total_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: heteronuclear single quantum coherence total correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of heteronuclear three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the proton signals of a 2D TOCSY spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to the chemical shift of their covalently bound heteronuclei.

Name: isoelectric_focusing
Label: isoelectric focusing
Definition: An electrophoresis method for the separation of amphoteric analytes according to their isoelectric points by the application of an electric field along a pH gradient.

Name: dual_phase_extraction
Label: dual-phase extraction
Definition: An extraction method for soil samples that uses a high-vacuum system to remove liquid and gas from low-permeability or heterogeneous soil. By removing water from the sample liquid-phase extraction the water table is lowered exposing the solid sample to vapor-phase extraction.

Name: capillary_voltage
Label: capillary voltage
Definition: A setting datum that specifies the potential difference across the tip of the capillary in electrospray ionisation.

Name: synchrotron_small_angle_x_ray_scattering
Label: synchrotron small angle X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays generated in a synchrotron scattered by a sample at low angles 010.

Name: excitationemission_matrix_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: excitation–emission matrix fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: A type of fluorescence spectroscopy where a two-dimensional total fluorescence spectrum is recorded at various excitation wavelengths.

Name: chiral_stationary_phase_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: chiral stationary phase high-performance liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small chiral particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high.

Name: solvent_suppression_pulse_sequence
Label: solvent suppression pulse sequence
Definition: An NMR pulse sequence that is used to suppress or remove the solvent signal.

Name: photodetachment_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: photodetachment photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a fixed-energy light source resulting in the detachment of electrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: proton_detected_separated_local_field_spectroscopy
Label: proton detected separated local field spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment for the measurement of heteronuclear dipolar couplings. 1H1H interactions are decoupled and proton magnetisation is passed through 13C nuclei present at natural abundance to simplify a dipolarly coupled spectrum.

Name: x_ray_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: only_para_hydrogen_spectroscopy
Label: only para-hydrogen spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment where pulsed field gradients are used to filter thermal signals from NMR spectra whilst leaving those derived from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Name: atmospheric_pressure_glow_discharge_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: atmospheric pressure glow discharge tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised under atmospheric pressure in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes. multiple mass-selection steps are used with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage.

Name: liquid_phase_infiltration
Label: liquid-phase infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with or deposition from a liquid.

Name: excitationemission_fluorescence_spectrum
Label: excitation–emission fluorescence spectrum
Definition: A 3D plot of excitation wavelength vs. emission wavelength vs. intensity obtained from a fluorescence spectroscopy experiment.

Name: pipes_buffer
Label: PIPES buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by a 22'-piperazine-14-diylbisethanesulfonic acid22'-piperazine-14-diylbisethanesulfonate equilibrium.

Name: hydrodynamic_voltammetry
Label: hydrodynamic voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current flowing during convective mass transfer the movement of material by the action of a fluid is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied linearly and inverts at the end point resulting in a cycle.

Name: extractive_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: extractive electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a neutral sample in the form of a gas or aerosol flow is ionised by directing it into a plume of charged droplets generated by forcing a solution of pure solvent through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 1-10 microlitres per minute into an electric field.

Name: two_dimensional_gel_electrophoresis_mass_spectrometry
Label: two-dimensional gel electrophoresis-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by two-dimensional gel electrophoresis before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: ultraviolet_spectrophotometry
Label: ultraviolet spectrophotometry
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the ultraviolet region 190400 nm resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Name: electron_microscopy
Label: electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV under vacuum. The interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected.

Name: small_angle_powder_x_ray_diffraction_data
Label: small-angle powder X-ray diffraction data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an X-ray diffraction experiment where the specimen is a powder and the X-rays are incident on the sample at small angles 0-10 degrees.

Name: plasma_assisted_desorptionionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: plasma-assisted desorption–ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons is directed onto the surface of interest causing desorption of sample molecules from the surface and subsequent ionisation.

Name: cold_spray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: cold-spray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small cold 10-80 C capillary at a flow rate of 1-10 L min1.

Name: 51v_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 51V magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes vanadium-51 nuclei.

Name: gas_liquid_chromatography
Label: gas-liquid chromatography
Definition: Gas chromatography where the stationary phase is a liquid.

Name: laser_cooling
Label: laser cooling
Definition: A technique for cooling atoms by directing two laser beams with energy just below an electronic transition at the sample from opposite directions. Scattering of the laser photons by the atoms in the sample reduces their kinetic energy.

Name: laser_mass_spectrometry
Label: laser mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is illuminated with a laser.

Name: diffuse_reflectance_ultravioletvisible_spectrophotometry
Label: diffuse reflectance ultraviolet–visible spectrophotometry
Definition: Spectroscopy where the diffuse reflection of radiation in the range ultraviolet to visible 190800 nm by a sample is measured.

Name: oven_drying
Label: oven drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample by heating in an oven.

Name: fourier_transform_infrared_microscopy
Label: Fourier transform infrared microscopy
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved infrared spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. The infrared spectra are obtained by single pulse of infrared radiation and are subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: flow_curve
Label: flow curve
Definition: A plot of stress vs. flow rate obtained from rheological measurements.

Name: absolute_activation_analysis
Label: absolute activation analysis
Definition: A kind of activation analysis in which the elemental concentrations in the material are calculated from known nuclear constants irradiation and measurement parameters rather than by comparing with known standards.

Name: sputtered_neutral_atom_mass_spectrometry
Label: sputtered neutral atom mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a continuous focused beam of primary mass-selected ions which remove material from the surface of the sample by sputtering. The neutral atoms ejected from the sample are ionised and detected.

Name: resonance_ionisation_spectroscopy
Label: resonance ionisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a sample is illuminated with resonant laser light using a laser which is tuned to match an electronic transition within the sample and photoexcitation is used to promote an atom or molecule above its ionisation potential to create an ion.

Name: pyrolysis_gas_chromatography_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: pyrolysis gas chromatography-infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Any method where a sample mixture is first chemically degraded by heating then separated by column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas then the absorption of radiation from the infrared region by the sample is measured.

Name: modulus_addition_using_spatially_separated_echo_spectroscopy
Label: modulus addition using spatially separated echo spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment used to measure self-diffusion coefficients via signal attenuation which occurs due to diffusion during the application of pulsed field gradients. This experiment also corrects for the effects of imperfect pulsed field gradients.

Name: gel_electrophoresis
Label: gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium consisting of gel across which an electric field is applied.

Name: gas_chromatography_microwave_induced_plasma_atomic_emission_detection
Label: gas chromatography-microwave-induced plasma atomic emission detection
Definition: A gas chromatography method that is sensitive to individual elements. The eluent is both atomised and excited by a microwave-induced plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals. The characteristic radiation emitted by the atoms in the sample is then detected using a photodiode array.

Name: electrochemical_passivation
Label: electrochemical passivation
Definition: Any eletrochemical process that makes one sample unreactive to another prior to using the samples together.

Name: grazing_incidence_small_angle_neutron_scattering
Label: grazing incidence small-angle neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of neutrons scattered at low angles. The incident neutron beam strikes the sample under a small angle close to the critical angle of total external neutron reflection.

Name: x_ray_excited_electron_appearance_potential_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray excited electron appearance potential spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the sudden appearance of peaks in the photoelectron spectrum.

Name: objective_specification
Label: objective specification
Definition: A directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved."en

Name: photoluminescence_spectrum
Label: photoluminescence spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the intensity of radiation emitted by a sample through photoluminescence emission of light as a result of stimulation with light against the frequency/wavelength of the incident radiation.

Name: analytical_solution_calorimetry
Label: analytical solution calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of the enthalpy change during chemical reaction in order to determine quantitative values of a reactant or catalyst. In general at least one reactant is a liquid or solution.

Name: fluorescence_scanning_near_field_optical_microscopy
Label: fluorescence scanning near-field optical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe consisting of a laser of a specific wavelength transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to <10 nm from the surface of the specimen. The tip is coated with metal to prevent light from escaping from the sides and near-field or evanescent field light is emitted through a small opening or 'aperture' 50100 nm in diameter at the apex of the probe.
