An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the fluorescence intensity from fluorophores on the surface of the specimen as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: magnetic_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: magnetic circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised photon radiation in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: carbon_nanotube
Label: carbon nanotube
Definition: A molecule consisting of a graphene cylinder or two or more concentric graphene cylinders.

Name: potentiostatic_coulometry
Label: potentiostatic coulometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the total Coulombs of electricity required to complete fully oxidise or fully reduce the sample in an electrochemical reaction is measured whilst the potential of the working electrode is held at a constant value.

Name: magnetic_sector
Label: magnetic sector
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a magnet which is used to separate an ion beam into discrete ion beams according to the mass-to-charge ratio of the ions.

Name: gas_phase_electrophoretic_mobility_molecular_analysis
Label: gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis
Definition: A separation method where singly-charged complexes move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in air under the influence of an electric field.

Name: raster_image_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: raster image correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume which is moving with respect to the sample. The temporal and spatial correlation between adjacent pixels lines and frames is calculated allowing for the mapping of local translational diffusion coefficients.

Name: ion_spectroscopy
Label: ion spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the absorption of emission of ions is detected.

Name: fluorescence
Label: fluorescence
Definition: A luminous flux quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's emitting longer wavelength light following the absorption of shorter wavelength radiation fluorescence is common with aromatic compounds with several rings joined together.

Name: ion_source_pyrolysis
Label: ion-source pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy in which the reactor is located within the ion source of a mass spectrometer.

Name: absorbance_titration_curve
Label: absorbance titration curve
Definition: A plot of volume of titrant vs. absorbance obtained from an absorbance titration experiment.

Name: plasma_ionisation
Label: plasma ionisation
Definition: Any ionisation method when the sample is ionised in a plasma-a partially ionised gas such as Ar containing free electrons.

Name: stripping_voltammetry
Label: stripping voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is first deposited usually by electroplating onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped'. During removal the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes.

Name: desorption_chemical_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: desorption chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is dissolved in a volatile solvent and dropped onto a heated filament before being ionised by interaction electron or proton transfer with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at low pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation.

Name: breath_figure_templating
Label: breath-figure templating
Definition: The method of using hexagonally-packed water microspheres as templates for the fabrication of microporous polymer films.

Name: material_separation_function
Label: material separation function
Definition: A material separation function is a function that increases the resolution between two or more material entities. The  to distinction between the entities is usually based on some associated physical quality."en

Name: categorical_value_specification
Label: categorical value specification
Definition: A value specification that is specifies one category out of a fixed number of nominal categories"en

Name: liquid_chromatography_capillary_electrophoresis
Label: liquid chromatography-capillary electrophoresis
Definition: A two-dimensional separation method where the sample is first subjected to liquid chromatography followed by capillary electrophoresis.

Name: photochemical_curing
Label: photochemical curing
Definition: A chemical process in which a prepolymer is converted into a polymer and then into a network upon irradiation with light.

Name: laser_micro_dissection
Label: laser micro-dissection
Definition: A type of dissection where a laser is coupled to a microscope and focused onto a biological sample e.g. tissue on the slide.

Name: mercury_cadmium_tellurium_detector
Label: mercury cadmium tellurium detector
Definition: A detector for infrared measurements that employs a thin layer of the semiconductor HgCdTe. Incident photons with energy greater than the semiconductor band-gap energy excite electrons into the conduction band creating an increase in the conductivity of the layer which is detected by two electrodes.

Name: external_import_ontology_module
Label: external import ontology module
Definition: An imported ontology module that is derived from an external ontology. Derivation methods include the OWLAPI SLME approach."en

Name: furnace_atomic_nonthermal_excitation_spectrometry
Label: furnace atomic nonthermal excitation spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is atomised by placing it in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it then excited using a glow discharge a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas.

Name: freeze_drying
Label: freeze drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample without passing through the liquidgas boundary. The sample is frozen at liquid nitrogen temperature -80 C then the surrounding pressure is reduced to allow the water in the sample to sublime.

Name: chelatometric_titration
Label: chelatometric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample metal cation by adding measured increments of a titrant a chelating agent until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached.

Name: sputter_etching
Label: sputter etching
Definition: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by bombarding it with energetic ions.

Name: isotopic_labelling
Label: isotopic labelling
Definition: The substitution of an atom or an ion present in the form of its stable isotope by an isotope of the same element.

Name: synchrotron_x_ray_powder_diffraction
Label: synchrotron X-ray powder diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at a powder sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. The X-rays are generated by the acceleration of charged particles through magnetic fields.

Name: pulsed_field_gradient_nuclear_magnetic_spectroscopy
Label: pulsed-field gradient nuclear magnetic spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where a spatially inhomogeneous magnetic field with a defined gradient is used either to select a particular signal or to render unwanted signals undetectable.

Name: diffusion_ordered_spectroscopy_total_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: diffusion-ordered spectroscopy-total correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D TOCSY spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Name: femtosecond_laser_flash_photolysis
Label: femtosecond laser flash photolysis
Definition: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong femtosecond pulse the 'pump' pulse of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Name: differential_pulse_voltammogram
Label: differential pulse voltammogram
Definition: A plot of cell current vs. the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes obtained from a differential-pulse voltammetry experiment i.e. where the potential is varied using pulses of increasing amplitude and the current is sampled before and after each voltage pulse.

Name: site_specific_infrared_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: site-specific infrared dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of polarised infrared light by a set of isotopically labelled sites in a sample. The introduction of a labelled atom e.g. 13C16O results in a shift of the corresponding absorption frequency.

Name: ultravioletvisible_spectrum
Label: ultraviolet–visible spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation absorbed by a sample as a function of the wavelength of incident radiation in the ultraviolet to visible 190800 nm range.

Name: atomic_force_infrared_microscopy
Label: atomic force infrared microscopy
Definition: The simultaneous collection of AFM topography data and spatially-resolved IR spectra by measuring the IR absorption via transient deformation of the AFM cantilever induced by an infrared pulsed laser tuned to a wavelength that corresponds to a vibrational absorbing wavelength in the specimen as a function of AFM tip position.

Name: catalytic_pyrolysis
Label: catalytic pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy in the presence of a catalyst.

Name: obsolete_sample_preparation_method_measurement_method
Label: obsolete: sample preparation method-measurement method
Definition: A method in which a sample preparation method is coupled to a measurement method.

Name: ion_cyclotron_resonance_mass_spectrometry
Label: ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field.

Name: liquid_chromatography_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance using two mass spectrometers in series.

Name: thermoptometry
Label: thermoptometry
Definition: The measurement of an optical characteristic of a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: vacuum_ultraviolet_spectrophotometry
Label: vacuum ultraviolet spectrophotometry
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the vacuum ultraviolet region 0.1-200 nm resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Name: spectroscopic_ellipsometry
Label: spectroscopic ellipsometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating a sample with a continuous-wavelength light source and measuring the intensity and change in polarisation of the reflected light as a function of wavelength.

Name: occurrent
Label: occurrent
Definition: An entity that has temporal parts and that happens unfolds or develops through time."en

Name: visible_spectrum
Label: visible spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation absorbed by a sample as a function of the wavelength of incident radiation from the visible region 380800 nm range.

Name: base_peak_intensity_chromatogram
Label: base peak intensity chromatogram
Definition: A plot of ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection. The base peak intensity chromatogram represents the intensity of the most intense peak at any one time.

Name: karl_fischer_coulometric_titration
Label: Karl-Fischer coulometric titration
Definition: The process of determining trace amounts of water in a sample by the titration of sulphur dioxide in water using iodine. In this method the I2 is generated electrochemically from I- and titrated with sulphur dioxide.

Name: 57fe_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 57Fe Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 57Fe nuclei is detected.

Name: nanoflow_liquid_chromatography_chip_enabled_ion_trap_mass_spectrometry
Label: nanoflow liquid chromatography chip enabled ion trap mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography flow rate nL min-1 before being passed though a 'chip' a microfluidic device to the mass spectrometer where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric or magnetic field.

Name: constant_capacitance_deep_level_transient_spectroscopy
Label: constant-capacitance deep-level transient spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities grain boundaries interfaces etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By holding the capacitance constant and monitoring the carrier emission produced when applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures spectra are generated which exhibit a peak for each 'deep level' each energy level near the center of the band gap. The height of the peak is proportional to the defect density and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.

Name: porous_layer_open_tubular_column
Label: porous-layer open-tubular column
Definition: An open-tubular column in which a porous layer achieved by either etching a non-porous layer or by deposition of porous particles from a suspension coats the inner wall and may serve as a support for a liquid stationary phase or as the stationary phase itself.

Name: 13c_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 13C nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 13C nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: electron_multiplier
Label: electron multiplier
Definition: A piece of apparatus that on contact with a charged particle of sufficient energy emits a greater number electrons.

Name: 1h_1h_only_para_hydrogen_spectroscopy_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: 1H-1H only para-hydrogen spectroscopy correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled usually < 3 bonds apart. Thermal signals in the resulting 1H spectra are then removed whilst keeping the signals from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Name: five_quantum_excitation_in_combination_with_magic_angle_spinning
Label: five-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment used for 5/2-spin quadrupolar nuclei involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Name: laser_desorption_ionisation
Label: laser desorption ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser.

Name: thin_film_x_ray_diffraction
Label: thin-film X-ray diffraction
Definition: A range of techniques used to determine the structure of thin films by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. Techniques include glancing-incidence X-ray reflectivity and pole figure measurements.

Name: beta_particle_spectroscopy
Label: beta-particle spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the beta-particles spontaneously emitted from radioisotopes are detected.

Name: coherence_probe_microscopy
Label: coherence probe microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the surface of the specimen is illuminated with short-coherence length visible light split into two beams which then interfere to produce fringes whose spacing is proportional to the profile of the specimen.

Name: pyrolysis_field_desorption_mass_spectrometry
Label: pyrolysis field desorption mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is pyrolysed then deposited on a solid surface known as an 'emitter' and ionised by interaction with a high electric field.

Name: positive_mode_atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionization_mass_spectrometry
Label: positive mode atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry
Definition: Atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry where the sample is ionized by interaction with positive ions.

Name: variable_temperature_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: variable-temperature nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of a nucleus with non-zero spin to a perturbing magnetic field is detected at temperatures above or below the ambient probe temperature. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: temperature_programmed_reduction_profile
Label: temperature-programmed reduction profile
Definition: A plot of the consumption of a reducing agent in moles per second per gram of material against temperature obtained from a temperature-programmed reduction experiment.

Name: concentrating
Label: concentrating
Definition: A preparative step where the concentration of one component is increased.

Name: photoacoustic_spectroscopy
Label: photoacoustic spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sound emitted when a gaseous sample is exposed to an intense laser beam which is rapidly interrupted by a rotating slotted disk is measured.

Name: matrix_role
Label: matrix role
Definition: The role inhering in that portion of a sample which is not measured by an experiment.

Name: reflectance_spectrum
Label: reflectance spectrum
Definition: A plot of reflectance  vs. wavenumber obtained by measuring the amount of radiation reflected by a sample.

Name: magnetic_force_microscopy
Label: magnetic force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp magnetic spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of a magnetic specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the tip in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the magnetic force experienced by it as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: fourier_transform_microwave_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform microwave spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is irradiated with a single pulse of radiation in the microwave region 11000 mm and the spectrum is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: nanolithography
Label: nanolithography
Definition: Any synthesis technique involving the transfer of a nanosized pattern to a material.

Name: neutron_time_of_flight_scattering
Label: neutron time-of-flight scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons and the time since the indicent pulse 'time-of-flight' for each neutron. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample and suffer a loss of kinetic energy during collisions.

Name: microextraction
Label: microextraction
Definition: The transfer of a microlitre amount of solute from a liquid phase to another immiscible or partially-miscible liquid phase in contact with it.

Name: correlation_spectroscopy
Label: correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled usually <3 bonds apart.

Name: spectrophotometer
Label: spectrophotometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus used to measure a spectrum by illumination with visible light.

Name: thermal_curing
Label: thermal curing
Definition: A chemical process in which a prepolymer is converted into a polymer and then into a network upon application of heat.

Name: thermoluminescence_spectroscopy
Label: thermoluminescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where thermoluminescence visible light emitted by certain crystalline materials when previously absorbed energy from electromagnetic radiation or other ionizing radiation is re-emitted as light upon heating of the material is detected as a function of wavelength.

Name: solvent_vapour_annealing
Label: solvent vapour annealing
Definition: A method applied to polymer films to increase polymer chain mobility. The film is exposed to a solvent atmosphere at room-temperature causing it to swell.

Name: microscopy_assay
Label: microscopy assay
Definition: An imaging assay that utilizes a microscope to magnify features of the visualized material of interest that are not visible to naked eye."en

Name: microspectrum
Label: microspectrum
Definition: A spectrum obtained from a very small portion of a sample for example by means of a microscope.

Name: smith_degradation
Label: Smith degradation
Definition: Selective degradation of polysaccharides by periodate oxidation.

Name: liquid_chromatography
Label: liquid chromatography
Definition: A preparative chromatography in which material components are separated in a liquid solution."en

Name: attenuated_total_reflectance_fourier_transform_infrared_spectrum
Label: attenuated total reflectance Fourier transform infrared spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained through a Fourier transform of the times series of the absorption or emission of a sample that has been excited by an infrared-frequency pulse. The infrared light is introduced into a prism at an angle exceeding the critical angle for internal reflection. This produces an evanescent wave at the reflecting surface a surface which is transparent to infrared such as thallium bromide on which the sample is supported. The distortion of the evanescent wave by the sample is measured.

Name: two_dimensional_liquid_chromatography
Label: two-dimensional liquid chromatography
Definition: A type of chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid an initial separation proceeds in a primary column commonly ion-exchange and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column commonly reverse phase.

Name: statistical_total_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: statistical total correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy which reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system. This technique exploits the correlations seen between the intensities of spectral features of multiple spectra so as to obtain a statistically derived spectrum. This technique is of particular value for metabolic profiling.

Name: photoelectron_spectroscopy_of_adsorbed_xenon
Label: photoelectron spectroscopy of adsorbed xenon
Definition: Spectroscopy where Xe atoms adsorbed on the surface of a sample are illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected. The binding energy of the core or valence levels of Xe weakly bound to the surface relative to the Fermi level of the substrate depends on the local work function of its adsorption site.

Name: precipitation
Label: precipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid material a 'precipitate' from a liquid solution in which the material is present in amounts greater than its solubility in the liquid.

Name: dry_wet_phase_inversion_technique
Label: dry-wet phase inversion technique
Definition: A technique for preparing a polymer membrane by mixing polymer and solvent then casting this solution onto a surface and allowing the solvent to partially evaporate. The film is them immersed in a nonsolvent causing solidification.

Name: stagnation_point_adsorption_reflectometry
Label: stagnation point adsorption reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating an extremely flat surface with visible light and monitoring the intensity of light reflected at the Brewster angle during the adsorption of particles on the surface.

Name: optically_induced_electrokinetic_patterning
Label: optically induced electrokinetic patterning
Definition: Any technique that utlilises the movement of particles under the influence of an electric field e.g. electroosmosis or electrophoresis in conjunction with illumination of a photosensitive substrate to form a pattern.

Name: k_resolved_inverse_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: k-resolved inverse photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation which is detected as a function of the vector k where k is the difference between the wave vectors of the incident and scattered radiation.

Name: photoionisation_detection
Label: photoionisation detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to volatile organic compounds. A carrier gas e.g. methane containing the sample is bombarded with high-energy UV photons resulting in ionisation. The current generated by these gaseous ions is then measured.

Name: deep_ultra_violet_resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: deep ultra-violet resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a deep ultraviolet <300 nm laser by a sample is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition within the sample.

Name: high_voltage_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: high-voltage transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 7003000 kV under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Name: 1h_pulsed_field_gradient_spin_echo_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 1H pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 1H nuclei resonances. Additionally attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Name: visible_spectrophotometry
Label: visible spectrophotometry
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the visible region 380800 nm resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Name: flame_ionisation_detection
Label: flame ionisation detection
Definition: A detection method which is sensitive to compounds containing CH bonds. A flow of carrier gas containing the sample is mixed with H2 and air and ignited. Any positively-charged radicals resulting from this process are collected at a cathode allowing the current to be measured.

Name: electron_beam_curing
Label: electron beam curing
Definition: A chemical process in which a prepolymer is converted into a polymer and then into a network upon irradiation with an electron beam.

Name: earles_balanced_salt_solution
Label: Earle's balanced salt solution
Definition: A solution containing CaCl2 MgSO4 KCl NaHCO3 NaCl NaH2PO4 and phenol red that resists changes to its pH.

Name: tunable_diode_laser_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: tunable diode laser absorption spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where a diode laser is tuned to a specific absorption line of interest in the sample and the intensity of the transmitted radiation is measured.

Name: gravitational_field_flow_fractionation
Label: gravitational field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating small particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel such that the Earth's gravitational field is perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is then passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of particle size.

Name: photoinduced_current_transient_spectroscopy
Label: photoinduced current transient spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities grain boundaries interfaces etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the current produced by applying an optical pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures spectra are generated which exhibit peaks the height of which are proportional to the defect density and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.

Name: atomic_layer_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: atomic layer chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors which react or decompose on the surface to produce a monolayer deposit. The surface reaction is self-limiting resulting in a nanometre thickness of film.

Name: 129i_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 129I Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 129I nuclei is detected.

Name: document
Label: document
Definition: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole"en

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_mass_spectrometer
Label: matrix assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer that uses a plate to hold the sample in a matrix such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid whilst it is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser.

Name: hepes_buffer
Label: HEPES buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 2-4-2-hydroxyethylpiperazin-1-ylethanesulfonic acid.

Name: normal_phase_liquid_chromatography
Label: normal-phase liquid chromatography
Definition: Liquid chromatography where the stationary phase is more polar than the mobile phase. This is the default for liquid chromatography.

Name: tes_buffer
Label: TES buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by a N-trishydroxymethylmethyl-2-aminoethanesulfonic acidN-trishydroxymethylmethyl-2-ammonioethanesulfonate equilibrium.

Name: field_emission_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: field-emission transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam produced by thermionic emission heating field emission and with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Name: spinodal_decomposition
Label: spinodal decomposition
Definition: A clustering reaction in a homogeneous supersaturated solution solid or liquid which is unstable against infinitesimal fluctuations in density or composition. The solution therefore separates spontaneously into two phases starting with small fluctuations and proceeding with a decrease in the Gibbs energy without a nucleation barrier.

Name: microphotoluminescence_spectroscopy
Label: microphotoluminescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the luminesence the emission of visible light from a small area <10 microns diameter of a sample which has been illuminated with light is detected.

Name: combined_rotation_and_multiple_pulse_spectroscopy
Label: combined rotation and multiple pulse spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.The combination of multiple-pulse NMR experiments and magic angle spinning. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_quadrupole_time_of_flight_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrospray-ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Tandem time-of-flight mass spectrometry where there is an initial electrospray ionisation stage.

Name: x_ray_diffraction_data
Label: X-ray diffraction data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an X-ray diffraction experiment.

Name: regulatory_role
Label: regulatory role
Definition: a role which inheres in material entities and is realized in the processes of making enforcing or being defined by legislation or orders issued by a governmental body."en

Name: laser_capture_micro_dissection
Label: laser capture micro-dissection
Definition: A method for isolating specific cells of interest from microscopic regions of tissue using a microscope coupled to a UV laser.

Name: low_energy_e_beam_proximity_lithography
Label: low-energy e-beam proximity lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses electrons to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a beam of moderately low energy electrons 2 keV is scanned across a patterned mask held up to 50 m from the substrate surface. The electrons induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'.

Name: electron_capture_detection
Label: electron capture detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to electronegative compounds e.g. halogenated compounds. A beta-particle emitter e.g. 63Ni is used to produce an electron beam which is passed between two electrodes. As the sample is passed through the e-beam organic functional groups interact with the electrons interrupting the current.

Name: absorption_titration
Label: absorption titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the absorbance of radiation by the sample.

Name: tast_polarography
Label: tast polarography
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The working electrode is a dropping mercury or other liquid conductor electrode and unstirred solutions are used. The current is sampled only during a specific time interval of the life of each drop of the droppping mercury electrode.

Name: analyte
Label: analyte
Definition: The component of a system to be analysed.

Name: circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by a sample.

Name: drift_tube_ion_mobility_spectroscopy
Label: drift tube ion mobility spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the velocity of gas phase ions in an electric field is measured. The ions are gated into a region of constant electric field strength and the ions with highest mobility arrive at the detector first.

Name: neutron_reflectometry
Label: neutron reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of neutrons onto an extremely flat surface and measuring the intensity of the reflected neutrons as a function of angle and neutron wavelength.

Name: drop_coating_deposition_raman_spectroscopy
Label: drop coating deposition Raman spectroscopy
Definition: A type of Raman spectroscopy where the spectral signal is enhanced by pre-concentration of the sample. Drops of the sample in solution are deposited onto a surface and dry in a 'coffee-ring' pattern. Spectra are then obtained from this ring of excess of material after evaporation has completed.

Name: infrared_spectrometer
Label: infrared spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an infrared laser a beam splitter and a detector a CCD which is used to measure spectra in the infrared range.

Name: azeotropic_distillation
Label: azeotropic distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. An azeotrope a mixture of two or more liquids which produces vapor with the same ratio of constituents as the original mixture cannot be separated by normal distillation therefore an additional third component known as an 'entrainer' is added to the mixture. This has the effect of changing the volatility of one of liquids in the azeotrope to a greater extent than the other allowing separation to occur.

Name: phosphate_buffer
Label: phosphate buffer
Definition: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by phosphoric acid-phosphate anion or phosphate-hydrogen phosphate equilibria.

Name: photoion_photoelectron_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: photoion-photoelectron coincidence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of a photoelectron and its corresponding ion which are detected as a function of energy.

Name: continuous_wave_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: continuous-wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Spectra are obtained by scanning a range of radio frequencies.

Name: laboratory_atmosphere
Label: laboratory atmosphere
Definition: A gaseous environment in which an experiment takes place. This may be unreactive in order to prevent unintended reactions or reactive for example gaseous hydrogen to promote reactions.

Name: ion_beam_spectroscopy
Label: ion-beam spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a focused beam of ions is directed at a sample and the secondary ions emitted are detected.

Name: laser_desorptionionisation_mass_spectrum
Label: laser desorption–ionisation mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the ions are obtained by vaporisation and ionisation using a high-energy pulsed laser.

Name: low_energy_electron_diffraction
Label: low energy electron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of low energy <500 eV electrons at the sample and recording the resulting diffraction pattern.

Name: hot_extrusion
Label: hot extrusion
Definition: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die at elevated temperatures up to 2000 C.

Name: glow_discharge_ionisation
Label: glow discharge ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method when the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by passing an electrical discharge under reduced pressure between two electrodes.

Name: intracavity_laser_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: intracavity laser absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside the laser cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected.

Name: 125te_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 125Te nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 125Te nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: percentage_enantiomer_excess
Label: percentage enantiomer excess
Definition: The absolute value of the mole fraction for one enantiomer in a mixture minus the mole fraction for the other enantiomer multiplied by 100.

Name: 19f_spin_diffusion_experiment
Label: 19F spin diffusion experiment
Definition: An NMR experiment which exploits the increased efficiency of energy magnetisation transfer between 19F nuclei via dipolar coupling in rigid or semi-rigid samples. The rate at which polarisation is transferred between spins is measured giving information on the proximity and orientation of the interacting spins within the sample.

Name: 151eu_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 151Eu Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 151Eu nuclei is detected.

Name: pulsed_discharge_helium_ionisation_detection
Label: pulsed discharge helium ionisation detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to small gas molecules e.g. O2 N2 CO2. A low-power pulsed DC discharge is used to ionise the sample which is held in He carrier gas. The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Name: saturated_calomel_electrode
Label: saturated calomel electrode
Definition: A reference electrode where the electrochemical reaction is between mercury metal and mercuryI chloride.

Name: colloidal_crystal_templating
Label: colloidal crystal templating
Definition: A synthesis method in which polymer spheres are assembled into a colloidal crystal on a substrate by evaporation induced self-assembly. The free spaces between the spheres are subsequently infiltrated with a metal by electrodeposition and the colloidal particles are selectively removed by dissolution in a solvent e.g. toluene leaving behind a periodic arrangement of spherical voids embedded in a solid macroporous matrix.

Name: laser_raman_spectroscopy
Label: laser Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a laser in the visible near infrared or near ultraviolet range by a sample is detected.

Name: high_speed_ball_milling
Label: high-speed ball milling
Definition: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by grinding with one or more inert balls ceramic flint or stainless steel 28 mm diameter rotating at high speed around a horizontal axis. A high-speed agitator is used to increase the speed of the balls.

Name: two_pulse_electron_spin_echo_envelope_modulation
Label: two-pulse electron spin-echo envelope modulation
Definition: A type of pulsed EPR spectroscopy which is used to observe the electron spin echo in a paramagnetic system as a function of the time that separates the two pulses causing the echo. This technique is a powerful probe of the radial distribution of magnetic nuclear spins in the environment of the electron spins producing the echo.

Name: far_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: far-infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the far infrared region 151000 m.

Name: limit_of_detection
Label: limit of detection
Definition: The smallest measure that can be detected with reasonable certainty for a given analytical procedure.

Name: ultraviolet_photolysis_digestion
Label: ultraviolet photolysis digestion
Definition: The decomposition of a sample by placing it in an organic matrix and irradiating the matrix with radiation in the range 200-435 nm indirectly using a mirror. OH radicals generated from the matrix react with the sample degrading it.

Name: transmitted_polarising_light_microscopy
Label: transmitted polarising light microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen placed between two orthogonal polarising filters and illuminated with visible light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective.

Name: statestime_proportional_phase_incrementation
Label: States–time proportional phase incrementation
Definition: A technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments to achieve frequency discrimination of the signals in the additional dimensions. It combines the States and TPPI methods.

Name: weak_anion_exchange_chromatography
Label: weak-anion-exchange chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where anions are retained by positively charged functional groups that have a positive charge only at high pH such as amine groups in the stationary phase.

Name: high_temperature_x_ray_diffraction
Label: high-temperature X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample which is heated from 252000 C and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Name: crystallographic_data
Label: crystallographic data
Definition: Data which is obtained from a diffraction experiment.

Name: optical_reflectometry
Label: optical reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating an extremely flat surface with visible light and measuring the intensity of the reflected light as a function of angle. The reflected light has two polarised components s perpendicular and p parallel. The reflectivity of s-polarised light depends on the angle of incidence but the reflectivity of p-polarised light vanishes at the Brewster angle.

Name: process
Label: process
Definition: An occurrent that has temporal proper parts and for some time t p s-depends_on some material entity at t."en

Name: freeze_fracture_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: freeze-fracture transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Transmission electron microscopy where the electron-transparent specimen normally a fresh tissue or cell suspension is prepared by rapid freezing using liquid nitrogen then fractured and the cold fractured surface is coated with Pt or Au by evaporation.

Name: positive_electrospray_ionisation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: positive electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage. Sample ionisation is achieved by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 uL min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of positively charged droplets.

Name: two_dimensional_liquid_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: two-dimensional liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method in which a two-dimensional chromatography method  where the mobile phase is a liquid is coupled to mass spectrometry

Name: evaporation
Label: evaporation
Definition: The physical process by which a liquid substance is converted to a gas or vapour. This may occur at or below the normal boiling point of the liquid the temperature at which a liquid boils at 1 atmosphere pressure and the process is endothermic.

Name: dissection
Label: dissection
Definition: The disassembly of an object to determine its internal structure.

Name: enzyme_linked_immunosorbent_assay
Label: enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay
Definition: An analyte assay where binding of an enzyme linked antibody to a material entity that is immobilized on solid support is detected utilizing a chemiluminescent reaction. Depending on the setup the enzyme-linked antibody could be binding directly to the analyte or it serves as a secondary antibody detecting binding of the primary antibody to the analyte."en

Name: proton_decoupled_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: proton-decoupled nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where J/scalar couplings to 1H nuclei are cancelled by applying radio frequency radiation to saturate or otherwise manipulate the 1H spins such that no evolution of the coupling occurs.

Name: thermogravimetry_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: thermogravimetry-Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: The FTIR analysis of volatile compounds released during the measurement of the mass of a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: desorption_atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: desorption atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where ionisation is achieved using a corona discharge which directs a liquid spray composed of an inert high velocity gas and solvent ions onto the sample surface.

Name: autoradiolysis
Label: autoradiolysis
Definition: The cleavage of one or more bonds in a radioactive material resulting directly or indirectly from its own radioactive decay.

Name: quasi_reference_electrode
Label: quasi-reference electrode
Definition: An electrode based on a ferrocene or cobaltocene redox couple internal standard through which no appreciable current is allowed to flow and is used to observe or control the potential at a working electrode.

Name: frequency_switched_lee_goldberg_cross_polarization
Label: frequency-switched Lee-Goldberg cross polarization
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR dipolar recoupling technique used to determine dipolar couplings between 1H and 13C nuclei. A FSLG sequence is used to remove homonuclear couplings by spin-locking the 1H nuclei and polarization transfer from the protons to the 13C via dipolar coupling manifests as a splitting of the detected 13C signal.

Name: acoustic_droplet_dispensing
Label: acoustic droplet dispensing
Definition: The dropwise release of a liquid using a focused acoustic beam to eject a controlled droplet from an open pool of liquid. When the acoustic beam strikes the liquid surface the pressure causes the fluid to rise up and a droplet breaks off.

Name: heatmap
Label: heatmap
Definition: A heatmap is a report graph which is a graphical representation of datawhere the values taken by a variables are shown as colors in atwo-dimensional map."en

Name: trituration
Label: trituration
Definition: Purification of crude chemical compounds containing solid impurities where a solvent is chosen in which the desired product is insoluble and the undesired by-products are very soluble or vice versa. The crude material is washed with the solvent and filtered away leaving the purified product in solid form and any impurities in solution.

Name: flash_photolysis
Label: flash photolysis
Definition: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong pulse the 'pump' pulse of light from a laser or flash lamp. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Name: micro_laser_induced_breakdown_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: micro laser-induced breakdown atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a finely focused <10 m diameter high energy laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source.

Name: magnetron
Label: magnetron
Definition: A device that uses electrical and magnetic fields to generate heat.

Name: field_effect_transistor_method
Label: field-effect transistor method
Definition: A method for determining charge transport by incorporating the sample as a thin film into an FET. An electric field is applied to the sample by means of the gate electrode and the change in conductance between the source and drain electrodes is measured.

Name: electron_spin_resonance_spectrometer
Label: electron spin resonance spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a microwave radiation source a resonator a cavity a magnet and a detector that is used to measure electron spin resonance spectra.

Name: negative_electrospray_ionisation
Label: negative electrospray ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample is either forced through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of negatively charged droplets or solvent droplets subjected to the same process are directed at the sample.

Name: ceramisation
Label: ceramisation
Definition: A process in which a ceramic precursor is converted into a ceramic.

Name: transmission_quadrupole_mass_to_charge_analyser
Label: transmission quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser
Definition: A mass-to-charge analyser that consists of a set of four linear electrodes and allows only ions of a given mass-to-charge ratio set according to the direct current and radio frequency potentials to reach a detector.

Name: high_angular_annular_dark_field_scanning_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: high-angular annular dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted at high angles before reaching the specimen and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample. An annular aperture is used to select electrons that have passed through given symmetric zones within the objective lens of the microscope.

Name: surface_extended_x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: surface extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient and the Auger emission of the sample are measured 5001000 eV below the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Name: 31p15n_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 31P–15N rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P and 15N nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: chemical_ionisation
Label: chemical ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample is ionised by interaction electron or proton transfer with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at low pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation.

Name: nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule 6  apart.

Name: polarimetry
Label: polarimetry
Definition: The measurement of the extent to which a sample interacts with polarized electromagnetic radiation by transmission reflection refraction or diffraction.

Name: scanning_angle_reflectometry
Label: scanning angle reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating an extremely flat surface with visible light and measuring the intensity of light reflected at different angles around the Brewster angle.

Name: principal_components_analysis_dimensionality_reduction
Label: principal components analysis dimensionality reduction
Definition: A principal components analysis dimensionality reduction is a dimensionality reduction achieved by applying principal components analysis and by keeping low-order principal components and excluding higher-order ones."en

Name: two_dimensional_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: two-dimensional high-performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method in which a two-dimensional chromatography method  where the mobile phase is a liquid and the inlet pressure is relatively high is coupled to mass spectrometry

Name: continuous_scan_cyclic_voltammetry
Label: continuous-scan cyclic voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied as a continuous sine wave and inverts at the end point resulting in a cycle.

Name: tris_borate_edta_buffer
Label: Tris-borate-EDTA buffer
Definition: A borate buffer solution prepared from Tris boric acid and EDTA.

Name: sequential_pyrolysis
Label: sequential pyrolysis
Definition: The repeated chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy under the same conditions of time temperature etc.

Name: reagent_role
Label: reagent role
Definition: A role inhering in a biological or chemical entity that is intended to be applied in a scientific technique to participate or have molecular components that participate in a chemical reaction that facilitates the generation of data about some entity distinct from the bearer or the generation of some specified material output distinct from the bearer."en

Name: autosampler
Label: autosampler
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a rotating circular tray containing a number of sealed vials that is used for the automatic injection of samples during a mass spectrometry experiment.

Name: protective_equipment
Label: protective equipment
Definition: Equipment that is used in a laboratory context to prevent or mitigate adverse laboratory events.

Name: multi_dimensional_electrophoresis
Label: multi-dimensional electrophoresis
Definition: A multi-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are all electrophoresis.

Name: microwave_digestion
Label: microwave digestion
Definition: The assisted solubilisation of a sample by the application of radiation in the 1-1000 mm region.

Name: resonance_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: resonance ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with a resonant laser a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample. The sample absorbs two or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Name: reflectometry
Label: reflectometry
Definition: Any method for determining structure by directing a beam of particles or X-rays onto an extremely flat surface and measuring the intensity of the reflected radiation as a function of angle.

Name: reflection_method
Label: reflection method
Definition: Any method for determining structure where the change in direction or intensity of reflected radiation or particles is detected.

Name: wet_spinning
Label: wet spinning
Definition: A process used to create polymer fibers. Polymer dissolved in a solvent is forced through a spinneret a multi-pored device similar to a shower head into a chemical bath which causes the polymer to precipitate as it emerges.

Name: assay_output
Label: assay output
Definition: An information content entity that is output by an assay.

Name: two_dimensional_1h1h_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: two-dimensional 1H–1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A two-dimensional plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for hydrogen-1 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field. Signals are defined in terms of two frequencies by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and in the other by the chemical shift of a correlated nucleus.

Name: atmospheric_pressure_glow_discharge_mass_spectrometry
Label: atmospheric pressure glow discharge mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised under atmospheric pressure in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes.

Name: x_ray_diffractometer
Label: X-ray diffractometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus which illuminates a sample with X-rays and measures the diffraction pattern produced. It typically will contain at least one monochromator to ensure the incident radiation is of a specific energy a goniometer which allows the geometry of the sample and detector to be precisely specified and a detector.

Name: dielectrometric_titration
Label: dielectrometric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the relative permittivity of the solution as a function of the solution volume.

Name: fluorescence_microscopy_assay
Label: fluorescence microscopy assay
Definition: Any type of microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by illuminating it with light of specific wavelengths. These specimens are called fluorophores.

Name: dielectric_barrier_discharge_ionisation
Label: dielectric barrier discharge ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method when the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by passing an alternating voltage across a dielectric layer between two electrodes.

Name: polarised_raman_spectroscopy
Label: polarised Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the polarisation of light which has been subjected to Raman scattering by a sample is determined.

Name: porosimetry
Label: porosimetry
Definition: The measurement of the pore diameter pore-size distribution and total pore volume of a sample.

Name: total_internal_reflection_fluorescence_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: total internal reflection fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where ultraviolet light is used to stimulate fluorescence in a sample and the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume. To generate total internal reflection the UV light is either passed through a prism to generate high enough incident angles or the UV light is focused through the periphery of a high numerical aperture objective which is directly coupled to the sample surface.

Name: anodic_stripping_potentiometry
Label: anodic stripping potentiometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped' by re-oxidation using either oxidants in the sample or by applying a small constant current or a combination of both. During removal the time-dependence of the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: solubility
Label: solubility
Definition: The concentration of a solute in a saturated solution.

Name: electron_beam_lithography
Label: electron-beam lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses electrons to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a beam of electrons 1020 keV is scanned across it in a patterned fashion. The electrons induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'. The electron beam can be focused using either electric or magnetic fields.

Name: measurement_datum
Label: measurement datum
Definition: A measurement datum is an information content entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device."en

Name: phosphorus_31_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: phosphorus-31 magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are phosphorus-31 nuclei and in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: high_resolution_magic_angle_spinning
Label: high-resolution magic angle spinning
Definition: Magic angle spinning spectroscopy using a high resolution magnetic susceptibility matching probe.

Name: non_contact_mode_atomic_force_microscopy
Label: non-contact mode atomic force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The tip oscillates in the 'attractive' force region i.e. avoiding sample contact. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: filter_cake
Label: filter cake
Definition: The material left behind in the filter as a result of filtration.

Name: skimmer_voltage
Label: skimmer voltage
Definition: A setting datum that specifies the potential difference across a skimmer.

Name: absorption_of_radiation
Label: absorption of radiation
Definition: A phenomenon in which radiation transfers to matter which it traverses some or all of its energy.

Name: selenium_77_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: selenium-77 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for selenium-77 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: piece_of_heating_apparatus
Label: piece of heating apparatus
Definition: A piece of apparatus that is used to raise the temperature of a sample.

Name: tip_enhanced_raman_spectroscopy
Label: tip-enhanced Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a visible laser 500650 nm by metal surfaces where scattering is enhanced by the optical near-field of a metal-coated scanning probe microscopy tip is detected.

Name: dynamic_force_micrograph
Label: dynamic force micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by using a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. The tip oscillates intermittently touching or tapping the surface.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage. Sample ionisation is achieved by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 uL min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: hyper_rayleigh_scattering_spectroscopy
Label: hyper Rayleigh scattering spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the structure of a liquid sample by measuring the change in direction or energy of hyper-Rayleigh scattered visible light scattering where photons from the incident laser-with frequency -are scattered into photons of the second harmonic-photons with frequency 2.

Name: cation_exchange_chromatography
Label: cation-exchange chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where cations are retained by negatively charged functional groups in the stationary phase.

Name: dynamic_force_spectrum
Label: dynamic force spectrum
Definition: A plot of adhesion or rupture force vs. loading rate obtained from an atomic force microscopy experiment.

Name: infrared_reflectance_spectroscopy
Label: infrared reflectance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the reflection or scattering of infrared radiation 0.781000 m by a sample is detected.

Name: orthogonal_acceleration_ion_source
Label: orthogonal-acceleration ion source
Definition: An ion source that works by sampling an ion beam travelling in a direction orthogonal to the axis of the flight path in the mass-to-charge analyser.

Name: membrane_extraction
Label: membrane extraction
Definition: The transfer of a solute from one phase the 'donor' or 'feed' phase to another the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase across a nonporous membrane.

Name: argon_ionisation_detection
Label: argon ionisation detection
Definition: A detection method where metastable Ar atoms are used to ionise the sample which is held in a carrier gas. The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Name: high_resolution_diffusion_ordered_spectroscopy
Label: high-resolution diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy using pulsed-field gradients where the rate of decay of NMR signals in each component of a sample mixture is measured across a series of experiments. The rate of signal decay is proportional to the diffusion coefficient for each component. The diffusion coefficient for each peak is measured and this information is used to construct a 2D spectrum.

Name: vacuum_ultraviolet_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: vacuum ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with vacuum ultraviolet 1020 nm photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: spin_echo_neutron_scattering
Label: spin-echo neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the velocity of neutrons in known magnetic fields before and after scattering by the sample. The neutrons are scattered by the interaction of neutron spin with spins in the sample 'spin echo'.

Name: scanning_probe_acoustic_microscopy
Label: scanning probe acoustic microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe vibrating at its resonant frequency is scanned over the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the resonant frequency or the amplitude of vibration of the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy-correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear three-dimensional NMR experiment in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule leq 6 AA apart. These signals are then correlated with those protons to which they are J-coupled usually leq 3 bonds apart.

Name: reflectron
Label: reflectron
Definition: A piece of apparatus which produces an electric field that accelerates ions in a mass-to-charge analyser in a direction opposite to their direction of travel acting as an ion mirror to separate ions of the same mass-to-charge ratio that have different kinetic energy.

Name: paramagnetic_relaxation_enhancement
Label: paramagnetic relaxation enhancement
Definition: An NMR technique whereby paramagnetic ions are introduced to a sample which cause enhanced relaxation of the spins in proximity of the paramagnetic spin label giving long-range up to 24  structural information. Also used in binding studies allowing identification of the atoms involved in binding.

Name: saturation_transfer_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: saturation-transfer electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy used to measure very slow rotational motions where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to short ns pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured. The microwave energy absorbed by the spins is such that there is an equal population of upper and lower spin states described as 'saturated'.

Name: saturation_transfer_double_difference_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: saturation transfer double difference nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where radio frequency pulses are used to induce an equal population of upper and lower spin states in 'saturate' certain selected protons removing their signal from the NMR spectrum. The signal from two different samples is obtained simultaneously and common signals are cancelled automatically. Saturation-transfer double-difference NMR is used to detect the transient binding of small molecule ligands to macromolecular receptors.

Name: partial_yield_spectroscopy
Label: partial-yield spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation X-rayultraviolet generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. All of the photoelectrons emitted within a certain energy interval are detected.

Name: data_visualization
Label: data visualization
Definition: A planned process with the objective to graphically represent some data by inputing the data and outputting images diagrams or animations."en

Name: resonance_enhanced_multiphoton_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: resonance-enhanced multiphoton ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with a resonant laser a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample. The sample absorbs one or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Name: high_resolution_soft_x_ray_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: high-resolution soft X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with monochromatic 'soft' <300 eV X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: plasma_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma is used as the excitation source.

Name: ion_exchange_chromatography
Label: ion-exchange chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the separation is caused by differences in ion-exchange affinity.

Name: tensiometry
Label: tensiometry
Definition: The measurement of the surface tension of a liquid.

Name: electroless_metal_deposition
Label: electroless metal deposition
Definition: A synthesis method in which a film of solid metal is deposited from a solution of ions onto an electrically conducting surface. No external power source is required but a reductant is added to the solution to initiate the reduction of the metal ions.

Name: kerr_effect_spectroscopy
Label: Kerr effect spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the refractive index change of the sample induced by two polarized laser beams pump and probe under the influence of an electric field the 'optical Kerr effect' is measured.

Name: backscattering_near_field_optical_microscopy
Label: backscattering near-field optical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a laser is focused to a diffraction-limited spot size onto an oscillating AFM tip close to the surface of the specimen. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the backscattered light from the tip as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: spark_atomic_emission_spectrometry
Label: spark atomic emission spectrometry
Definition: Atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is excited by an arc or spark between two electrodes.

Name: preparative_chromatography
Label: preparative chromatography
Definition: the use of a biomaterial's preferential affinity for either the mobile phase or the stationary phase to separate it from other materials of differing affinity"en

Name: reversed_phase_liquid_chromatography
Label: reversed-phase liquid chromatography
Definition: Liquid chromatography where the mobile phase is significantly more polar than the stationary phase for example a microporous silica-based material with chemically bonded alkyl chains.

Name: wire_electrical_explosion_method
Label: wire electrical explosion method
Definition: A synthesis method for metal nanopowders that consists of passing a pulse of a high-density current 104 to 106 A/mm2 through a wire causing the explosive disintegration of the metal accompanied by a bright flash of light a shock wave the dispersion of the metal and the fast expansion of a mixture of boiling metal droplets and vapour to the surrounding medium and the production of metal  particles with characteristic sizes of tens of  m to a few nm.

Name: dropping_mercury_electrode
Label: dropping mercury electrode
Definition: An electrode formed by a sequence of mercury drops falling from a small aperture.

Name: pumpdumpprobe_spectroscopy
Label: pump–dump–probe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse the 'pump' which causes excitations within the sample. This is followed by a second laser pulse which is tuned to the correct frequency to excite transitions resonantly back down to the lower electronic state the 'dump'. After a short delay a third laser pulse the 'probe' is used to sense changes in the sample.

Name: x_ray_scattering
Label: X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample.

Name: continuous_wave_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: continuous-wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of the absorption of radio frequency radiation vs. frequency for spin-active nuclei.

Name: image_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: image correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured at several different points in parallel and correlated within very small detection volumes. Ultra-violet light is used to stimulate fluorescence.

Name: grinding
Label: grinding
Definition: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by attribution friction impact or cutting.

Name: quadrupole_mass_spectrometer
Label: quadrupole mass spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source a mass-to-charge analyser a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The detector is a quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser which holds the ions in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Name: auger_photoelectron_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: Auger-photoelectron coincidence spectroscopy
