Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays resulting in the emission of photoelectrons and 'Auger' electrons which are detected as a function of energy.

Name: malcolm_levitt_pulse_sequence
Label: Malcolm Levitt pulse sequence
Definition: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. Also used to allow transfer of magnetisation between nuclei by making the spins precess with at the same chemical shift and thus enjoy strong coupling-isotropic mixing. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. 1981 43 pg 502.

Name: electron_microscope
Label: electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of a specimen using a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50150 kV under vacuum and measuring the interaction of the electrons with the specimen.

Name: blast_screen
Label: blast screen
Definition: A screen that blocks debris from an explosion.

Name: single_layer_subset_ontology_module
Label: single layer subset ontology module
Definition: A subset ontology that is largely comprised of a single layer or strata in an ontology class hierarchy. The purpose is typically for rolling up for visualization. The classes in the layer need not be disjoint."en

Name: templated_self_assembly
Label: templated self-assembly
Definition: A synthesis method in which the components of the sample spontaneously and reversibly associate by non-covalent interactions forming a organised structure or pattern on a physical template. Individual building blocks associate into more complex higher-order structures during self-assembly.

Name: polarography
Label: polarography
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The working electrode is a dropping mercury or other liquid conductor electrode and unstirred solutions are used.

Name: 207pb_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 207Pb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 207Pb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: reversed_phase_solid_phase_extraction
Label: reversed-phase solid-phase extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the non-polar liquid sample through a polar stationary phase.

Name: heteronuclear_two_dimensional_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: heteronuclear two-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed.

Name: ion_excited_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: ion-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where ion bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons which are detected as a function of incident ion energy.

Name: photocurrent_spectroscopy
Label: photocurrent spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where light energy absorbed by the sample results in the production of a current the 'photocurrent' which is measured at different spectral intervals.

Name: scanning_transmission_x_ray_microscopy
Label: scanning transmission X-ray microscopy
Definition: An imaging technique where a finely focused 2050 nm beam of X-rays is scanned over the surface of the specimen and the energies and intensities of the transmitted X-rays are measured as a function of position.

Name: 1h_correlation_spectroscopy_spectrum
Label: 1H correlation spectroscopy spectrum
Definition: A two-dimensional spectrum in which the position of a peak in one dimension corresponds to the chemical shift of a particular hydrogen nucleus and in the other dimension to the chemical shift of a hydrogen nucleus which is J-coupled to the first.

Name: two_photon_laser_scanning_microscopy
Label: two-photon laser scanning microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by scanning a solid-state Ti sapphire laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface to produce multi-photon fluorescence i.e. the fluorophore simultaneously absorbs two photons each one half of the energy required for single-photon excitation.

Name: laser_flash_photolysis
Label: laser flash photolysis
Definition: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong pulse the 'pump' pulse of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Name: obsolete_sample_transformation_method_measurement_method
Label: obsolete: sample transformation method-measurement method
Definition: A method consisting of a sample transformation method coupled to a measurement method.

Name: microwave_spectroscopy
Label: microwave spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with radiation in the microwave region 11000 mm.

Name: te_buffer
Label: TE buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by Tris trishydroxymethylaminomethane and EDTA ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid. TE buffer is used to protect DNA or RNA from degradation.

Name: laboratory_safety_function
Label: laboratory safety function
Definition: The function ascribed to laboratory equipment to prevent or mitigate adverse laboratory events.

Name: self_assembly
Label: self-assembly
Definition: A process where the components of a sample spontaneously and reversibly associate by non-covalent interactions forming an organised structure or pattern. Individual building blocks associate into more complex higher-order structures during self-assembly.

Name: template_directed_synthesis
Label: template-directed synthesis
Definition: A synthesis method which relies on the use of reversible noncovalent bonding interactions between molecular building blocks in order to preorganise them into a certain relative geometry as a prelude to covalent bond formation.

Name: 6li1h_heteronuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: 6Li–1H heteronuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between 6Li and 1H nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule <6 AA apart.

Name: sample_digestion
Label: sample digestion
Definition: The decomposition of a sample into liquid form by treatment with enzymes or strong acids or alkalis.

Name: scanning_near_field_thermal_microscopy
Label: scanning near-field thermal microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a thermocouple probe is positioned very close to the surface of the specimen in the near-field. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the thermocouple probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the surfaceprobe heat transfer as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: electrochemical_surface_enhanced_raman_spectroscopy
Label: electrochemical surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a visible laser at a metal Au Ag or Cu electrochemcial interface is detected.

Name: mid_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: mid-infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the mid infrared region 38 m.

Name: liquid_junction
Label: liquid junction
Definition: A boundary between two electrolyte solutions of different composition across which arises a potential difference called the liquid junction potential. In an operational pH cell the junction is between the test solution and the filling solution or bridge solution of the reference electrode.

Name: microspectrofluorometry
Label: microspectrofluorometry
Definition: A type of chemical imaging where an optical microscope is used to image the sample and locate a small area for fluorescence spectroscopy.

Name: wide_angle_x_ray_diffraction
Label: wide-angle X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. The incident X-ray beam strikes the sample at a wide angle >10.

Name: nanostructure
Label: nanostructure
Definition: A nanometre sized object.

Name: high_resolution_field_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: high resolution field ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with a high electric field. When the ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios the 'exact' mass is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass the number of protons and neutrons.

Name: excitation_spectrum
Label: excitation spectrum
Definition: A plot of the spectral radiant exitance or of the spectral photon exitance against the frequency or wavenumber or wavelength of excitation.

Name: transient_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: transient infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where transient species such as radicals ions or reactive intermediates are studied using pulses from an infrared laser. The infrared absorbance of the sample before and after an excitation laser pulse is measured.

Name: ion_mobility_spectrometry_mass_spectrometry
Label: ion mobility spectrometry-mass spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the ionic species associated with the peaks in an ion mobility spectrum are identified by a mass spectrometer.

Name: class_discovery_data_transformation
Label: class discovery data transformation
Definition: A class discovery data transformation sometimes called unsupervised classification is a data transformation that has objective class discovery."en

Name: infrared_scanning_near_field_optical_microscopy
Label: infrared scanning near-field optical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe consisting of an infrared laser transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to <10 nm from the surface of the specimen. The tip is coated with metal to prevent light from escaping from the sides and near-field or evanescent field infrared radiation is emitted through a small opening or 'aperture' 50100 nm in diameter at the apex of the probe. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the disturbance of the infrared near-field as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: direct_analysis_in_real_time
Label: direct analysis in real time
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample is ionised by a corona discharge within a He atmosphere.

Name: hydrogen_gas_electrode
Label: hydrogen gas electrode
Definition: A reference electrode based on the equilibrium between aqueous protons and electrons on one side and hydrogen gas on the other in solutions saturated with hydrogen gas. Typically it is made of a thin foil of platinum electrolytically coated with a finely divided deposit of platinum or palladium metal.

Name: washing
Label: washing
Definition: washing is a process by which a material entity acting as  contaminant e.g. excess staining reagent is removed by application of one or more cycles of solution in flow."en

Name: silicon_29_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: silicon-29 magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are silicon-29 nuclei and in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: polarization_modulation_infrared_reflectionadsorption_spectroscopy
Label: polarization modulation infrared reflection–adsorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the differential absorption and reflection of low incident angle p- and s-polarized infrared light by the surface molecules of a highly reflective or polished sample is measured. The ultra-thin layers on metal surfaces interact with the p-polarized component of light but not with the s-polarized component.

Name: two_dimensional_capillary_electrophoresis
Label: two-dimensional capillary electrophoresis
Definition: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both capillary electrophoresis.

Name: fluorescence_detected_circular_dichrosim_spectrum
Label: fluorescence-detected circular dichrosim spectrum
Definition: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised luminescence.

Name: aerosol_method
Label: aerosol method
Definition: A method for the synthesis of solid particles from an aerosol. The desired solid particles are suspended in a liquid which is heated to 275330 C under pressure and passed through an orifice so that an aerosol forms. The particles in the aerosol are polymerised by partial evaporation of the solvent.

Name: sequentional_extraction
Label: sequentional extraction
Definition: An analytical process that sequentially chemically leaches metals from soils sludges or sediments.

Name: multi_photon_laser_scanning_microscopy
Label: multi-photon laser scanning microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by scanning a solid-state Ti sapphire laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface to produce multi-photon fluorescence i.e. the fluorophore simultaneously absorbs multiple photons of typically one half to one third of the energy required for single-photon excitation.

Name: sonochemiluminescence_detection
Label: sonochemiluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of chemiluminescence caused the emission of light by tiny bubbles in a liquid excited by sound.

Name: electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to a perturbing magnetic field is measured.

Name: near_edge_x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured within 40 eV of the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Name: flame_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: flame atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is excited using an N2/oxideacetylene flame.

Name: phosphorescence_spectrum
Label: phosphorescence spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation emitted by a sample through phosphorescence against the wavelength of the incident radiation.

Name: hyperfine_sublevel_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: hyperfine sublevel correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of two-dimensional EPR spectroscopy based on the electron spin-echo envelope modulation ESEEM effect where a sequence of four microwave pulses is applied to the sample and the stimulated spin-echo produced is measured.

Name: autoradiography
Label: autoradiography
Definition: The recording of the image of an object through the effect of ionising radiation on a film or emulsion.

Name: scanning_photocurrent_microscopy
Label: scanning photocurrent microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a laser is scanned over the surface of the specimen and the photocurrent is recorded as a function of position.

Name: laser_assisted_direct_imprint_lithography
Label: laser-assisted direct imprint lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses mechanical deformation to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photosensitive resist a polymer is deposited on a silicon substrate by spin coating. A transparent stamp e.g. quartz containing the desired nanosized pattern on its surface is then pressed into the resist and a single laser pulse XeCl excimer laser is applied to melt the top layer of silicon. The molten silicon flows into the pattern then rapidly solidifies.

Name: sum_frequency_generation_spectroscopy
Label: sum-frequency generation spectroscopy
Definition: A method for generating surface-specific vibrational spectra by mixing two light beams at a surface and detecting the output beam which has frequency equal to the sum of the two input frequencies.

Name: alkalimetric_titration
Label: alkalimetric titration
Definition: Acid-base titration where the sample is an acid and the titrant is a base.

Name: experimental_sample
Label: experimental sample
Definition: A portion of material that is the subject of an experiment.

Name: grazing_incidence_x_ray_scattering
Label: grazing-incidence X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample. The incident X-ray beam strikes the sample under a small angle close to the critical angle of total external X-ray reflection.

Name: magnetic_stirring
Label: magnetic stirring
Definition: Stirring achieved by rotating a magnetic stir bar in a solution.

Name: cell_specimen
Label: cell specimen
Definition: A specimen primarily composed of a cell or cells collected from a multicellular organism or a cell culture."en

Name: atomic_force_microscopy_infrared_image
Label: atomic force microscopy infrared image
Definition: A data set derived from AFMIR consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents the infrared wavelength.

Name: high_speed_chrono_amperometry
Label: high-speed chrono-amperometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the time dependence of the cell current is measured whilst the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is controlled. Measurements are taken every 1 to 5 s.

Name: raman_spectroscopy
Label: Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light usually from a laser in the visible near infrared or near ultraviolet range by a sample is detected.

Name: conductometry
Label: conductometry
Definition: The measurement of the conductance of a solution as a function of concentration. Measurements are made indirectly across the resistance of the solution with alternating current.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_isotope_dilution_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography-isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised by a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and the relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is determined using an isotope dilution standard the sample labelled with a rare isotope.

Name: waterchloroform_21_extraction
Label: water:chloroform 2:1 extraction
Definition: Extraction of plant metabolites using a 2:1 v/v mixture of water and chloroform.

Name: fluorescence_spectrum
Label: fluorescence spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity against wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation emitted by a sample through fluorescence against the frequency of the incident radiation.

Name: exclusion_subset_ontology_module
Label: exclusion subset ontology module
Definition: A subset of an ontology that is intended to be excluded for some purpose. For example a blacklist of classes."en

Name: cold_extrusion
Label: cold extrusion
Definition: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die at room temperature.

Name: polarising_microscope
Label: polarising microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an eyepiece an objective lens object turret stage orthogonal polarising filters and light source which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before the energy states of spin-active nuclei in the sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.

Name: vacuum_distillation
Label: vacuum distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a high-boiling-point sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat at low pressure and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser.

Name: hccconnh
Label: HCC(CO)NNH
Definition: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a isotopically enriched protein. The chemical shift of the backbone amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and with both the alpha- and beta-carbons and protons of the preceding residue. The experiment name describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Name: fluorescence_detected_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: fluorescence detected circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised luminescence.

Name: rotating_frame_overhauser_effect_spectroscopy
Label: rotating frame Overhauser effect spectroscopy
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement NOE effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule 6  apart. Spin-locking is employed to ensure that correlation between spins which are close in space but have zero NOE are seen. This technique is used for molecules whose tumbling regime lies at the border of positive and negative NOE responses.

Name: strong_cation_exchange_column
Label: strong cation-exchange column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a strong cation exchanger.

Name: temperature_programmed_oxidation_profile
Label: temperature-programmed oxidation profile
Definition: A plot of the consumption of dioxygen in moles per second per gram of material against temperature obtained from a temperature-programmed oxidation experiment.

Name: high_performance_anion_exchange_chromatography
Label: high-performance anion-exchange chromatography
Definition: A high-performance liquid chromatography method where the components are distributed between two phases one of which is stationary and retains anions by positively charged functional groups.

Name: scanning_near_field_ellipsometric_microscopy
Label: scanning near-field ellipsometric microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a metal-coated AFM tip is positioned very close to the surface of the specimen in the near-field and an image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the tip in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the change in the polarisation of incident light when it is reflected from a surface as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry

Name: pulsed_laser_deposition
Label: pulsed laser deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a high-power pulsed laser beam is focused inside a vacuum chamber onto a target of the desired composition. Material is then vaporized from the target 'ablation' and deposited as a thin film on a substrate facing the target.

Name: thermal_desorption_spectrum
Label: thermal desorption spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity or rate vs. temperature obtained by heating the sample slowly in a vacuum and measuring the change in pressure as molecules desorb from the surface of the sample.

Name: 63cu_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 63Cu nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 63Cu nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: protein
Label: protein
Definition: An amino acid chain that is produced de novo by ribosome-mediated translation of a genetically-encoded mRNA and any derivatives thereof.

Name: desorption_measurements
Label: desorption measurements
Definition: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an inert gasesous or liquid substance the 'sorbent' usually H2 or N2 which desorbs from the surface of interest the 'sorbate'. Regression analysis is then applied to the data resulting in an isotherm.

Name: solvent_evaporation
Label: solvent evaporation
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample usually by the application of heat.

Name: undivided_electrochemical_cell
Label: undivided electrochemical cell
Definition: An electrochemical cell where the anode and cathode are placed in the same vessel.

Name: analytical_centrifugation
Label: analytical centrifugation
Definition: A separation method where components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. During centrifugation the sample can be monitored in real time through an optical detection system or using ultraviolet light absorption.

Name: magnetic_spin_echo_small_angle_neutron_scattering
Label: magnetic spin-echo small angle neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the velocity of neutrons in known magnetic fields before and after scattering at small angles by a magnetic sample. The neutrons are scattered by the interaction of neutron spin with spins in the sample 'spin echo'.

Name: pressure_controlled_scanning_calorimetry
Label: pressure-controlled scanning calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction by the known variation step-wise or linear of the pressure whilst the temperature is kept constant.

Name: abberration_corrected_high_angular_annular_dark_field_scanning_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: abberration-corrected high-angular annular dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted at high angles before reaching the specimen and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample. An annular aperture is used to select electrons that have passed through given symmetric zones within the objective lens of the microscope. The electron beam is focused using a set of magnetic lenses which removes spherical aberration an effect where the electron beam is deflected too strongly resulting in a blurred image.

Name: colloidal_probe_atomic_force_microscopy
Label: colloidal probe atomic force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a microparticle usually made of silica mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of a colloidal specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the force between the two colloidal surfaces as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: photoluminescence_detection
Label: photoluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence emitted from a sample as a result of irradiation with light. Photoluminescence includes both fluorescence and phosphorescence.

Name: fluorescence_decay_curve
Label: fluorescence decay curve
Definition: A plot of fluorescence intensity vs. time.

Name: isomorphous_replacement
Label: isomorphous replacement
Definition: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by introducing heavy atoms into isomorphous crystals.

Name: thermoacoustimetry
Label: thermoacoustimetry
Definition: Thermal analysis where the characteristics of imposed acoustic wave passing through the sample are measured.

Name: electronic_spectrum
Label: electronic spectrum
Definition: A spectrum that reflects the electronic degrees of freedom of an atom or molecule.

Name: flash_pyrolysis
Label: flash pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample caused by a fast rate of temperature increase 10000 K/s.

Name: solgel_method
Label: sol–gel method
Definition: The process of the settling of nm sized particles from a colloidal suspension onto a pre-existing surface resulting in ceramic materials. The desired solid particles e.g. metal alkoxides are suspended in a liquid forming the 'sol' which is deposited on a substrate by spinning dipping or coating or transferred to a mould. The particles in the sol are polymerised by partial evaporation of the solvent or addition of an initiator forming the 'gel' which is then heated at high temperature to give the final solid product.

Name: strong_anion_exchange_column
Label: strong anion-exchange column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a strong anion exchanger.

Name: organism
Label: organism
Definition: A material entity that is an individual living system such as animal plant bacteria or virus that is capable of replicating or reproducing growth and maintenance in the right environment. An organism may be unicellular or made up like humans of many billions of cells divided into specialized tissues and organs."en

Name: dark_field_microscope
Label: dark-field microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an eyepiece an objective lens a condenser lens stage and light source which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range. An opaque disc is placed underneath the condenser lens so that only light that is scattered by objects on the slide can reach the eye.

Name: scanning_probe_lithography
Label: scanning probe lithography
Definition: Any synthesis technique where a scanning probe microscope is used to pattern surfaces either constructively by depositing a substance or destructively by etching a pattern in a surface.

Name: flame_ionisation_detector
Label: flame ionisation detector
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of an oven and apparatus to mix carrier gas containing the sample with hydrogen and air then ignite it and collect the resulting positively-charged radicals at a cathode.

Name: material_transformation_objective
Label: material transformation objective
Definition: an objective specifiction that creates an specific output object from input materials."en

Name: planned_process
Label: planned process
Definition: A process that realizes a plan which is the concretization of a plan specification."en

Name: field_desorption_mass_spectrometry
Label: field desorption mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is deposited on a solid surface known as an 'emitter' and ionised by interaction with a high electric field.

Name: 31p_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 31P nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 31P nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: spin_polarised_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: spin-polarised Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of incident photon energy and a magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the emitting surface.

Name: cross_polarisation_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field and cross polarisation has been used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.

Name: anomalous_wide_angle_x_ray_scattering
Label: anomalous wide-angle X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample at wide angles >10. The wavelength of the X-rays used is scanned over an absorption edge which changes the scattering in a known way the 'anomalous dispersion effect'.

Name: pngase_f_digestion
Label: PNGase F digestion
Definition: An enzymatic removal of N-linked glycans from a peptide or protein using the enzyme PNGase F N-glycosidase F.

Name: infiltration
Label: infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with or deposition from a liquid or vapor.

Name: inverse_satellite_transition_magic_angle_spinning
Label: inverse satellite transition magic angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment where the selective excitation of central and satellite transitions during magic angle spinning is used for recording high-resolution NMR spectra of quadrupolar nuclei in solids. Satellite transitions are detected first followed by central transitions.

Name: fume_hood
Label: fume hood
Definition: A hood in which to conduct experiments that give off poisonous fumes that vents them to a non-enclosed environment.

Name: resonance_enhanced_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: resonance-enhanced photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation X-rayultraviolet generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. The energy of the incoming photons is adjusted such that it coincides with an electronic transition of the molecule.

Name: thermoluminescence_detection
Label: thermoluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence exhibited by certain crystalline materials such as some minerals when previously absorbed energy from electromagnetic radiation or other ionizing radiation is re-emitted as light upon heating of the material.

Name: gas_chromatography_pulsed_discharge_helium_ionisation_detection
Label: gas chromatography-pulsed discharge helium ionisation detection
Definition: A gas chromatography method that is sensitive to small gas molecules e.g. O2 N2 CO2. A low-power pulsed DC discharge is used to ionise the eluent which is held in He carrier gas. The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Name: two_dimensional_1h_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: two-dimensional 1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment in which a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between interacting 1H nuclei.

Name: scanning_capacitance_microscopy
Label: scanning capacitance microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a small electrode to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the electrostatic capacitance of the surface as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the electrode and surface during scanning.

Name: saturation_transfer_difference_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: saturation transfer difference nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where radio frequency pulses are used to induce an equal population of upper and lower spin states in 'saturate' certain selected protons removing their signal from the NMR spectrum. The resulting spectrum is then subtracted from a reference spectrum obtained without saturation. Saturation-transfer NMR is used to detect the transient binding of small molecule ligands to macromolecular receptors.

Name: chemical_ionisation_source
Label: chemical ionisation source
Definition: An ion source that consists of a high-pressure ionisation chamber containing a reagent gas for example N2 O2 or H2O which is ionised by high-energy electrons from a heated strip of metal and goes on to react with the analyte to ionise it.

Name: photoemission_electron_microscopy
Label: photoemission electron microscopy
Definition: A type of electron microscopy where the distribution of electrons emitted by a specimen sample following excitation by UV light synchrotron radiation or X-ray sources is used to produce an image.

Name: continuous_x_ray_induced_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: continuous X-ray-induced Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with a continuous X-ray source X-rays generated when electrons or other high energy charged particles such as protons or alpha-particles lose energy whilst passing through the Coulomb field of a nucleus results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons which are detected.

Name: synchrotron_fourier_transform_infrared_microscopy
Label: synchrotron Fourier transform infrared microscopy
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved infrared spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. The infrared spectra are obtained by single pulse of infrared radiation produced in a synchrotron and are subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: preparative_centrifugation
Label: preparative centrifugation
Definition: A method where a sample is purified by removing impurities on the basis of their density in a centrifuge.

Name: sorption_desorption_measurement
Label: sorption-desorption measurement
Definition: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an inert gaseous or liquid substance the 'sorbent' usually H2 or N2 which adsorbs onto the surface of interest the 'sorbate' and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature. Regression analysis is then applied to the data resulting in an isotherm.

Name: three_dimensional_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which three independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals by employing two magnetisation transfer steps. Each signal is described by three frequencies thus effecting the distribution of signals within a cube.

Name: pngase_a_digestion
Label: PNGase A digestion
Definition: An enzymatic removal of N-linked glycans from a peptide or protein using the enzyme PNGase A N-glycosidase A including those with core 1-3 fucosylation.

Name: particle_image_velocimetry
Label: particle-image velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by pulsing a planar laser light sheet twice and recording images of fine particles lying in the light sheet using a video camera or a photograph.

Name: fluorescence_activated_cell_sorting
Label: fluorescence-activated cell sorting
Definition: A method for separating microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid. The particles are forced individually through a vibrating nozzle then exposed to a laser beam and the resulting fluorescence and scattered light is detected. Finally the cells are sorted by applying an electrical charge to droplets of the fluid and deflecting it to the left or right using charged electrodes.

Name: support_coated_open_tubular_column
Label: support-coated open-tubular column
Definition: An open-tubular column in which a layer of porous particles deposited from a suspension coats the inner wall and serves as a support for a liquid stationary phase.

Name: 89y_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 89Y nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 89Y nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: split_flow_thin_fractionation
Label: split flow thin fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating magnetic and nonmagentic particles by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying a magnetic field. Magnetic particles are dragged away from their stream into a separate buffer stream leaving the nonmagnetic particles behind.

Name: curation_subset_ontology_module
Label: curation subset ontology module
Definition: A subset ontology that is intended as a whitelist for curators using the ontology. Such a subset will exclude classes that curators should not use for curation."en

Name: partition_chromatography
Label: partition chromatography
Definition: Chromatography in which separation is based mainly on differences between the solubility of the sample components in the stationary phase gas chromatography or on differences between the solubilities of the components in the mobile and stationary phases liquid chromatography

Name: apertureless_near_field_scanning_optical_microscopy
Label: apertureless near-field scanning optical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a laser spot is focused on a solid sharp metallic probe producing a confined light field very close to <10 nm from the surface of the specimen. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the scattering of the incident light by the probe as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: fourier_transform_far_infrared_spectrum
Label: Fourier transform far-infrared spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained through a Fourier transform of the times series of the absorption of a sample that has been excited by an far-infrared-frequency pulse.

Name: phase_atomic_force_micrograph
Label: phase atomic force micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by using a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the drop in amplitude of the oscillating cantilever as a function of position.

Name: confocal_microscopy
Label: confocal microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where visible light coming from the specimen is collected and guided through a pinhole before it is detected. The pinhole allows only light from the focal point to pass to the detector reducing background interference.

Name: calorimetric_titration
Label: calorimetric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration performed in a calorimeter which produces a plot of heat change vs. volume of titrant.

Name: cation_exchange_column
Label: cation-exchange column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a cation exchanger.

Name: ion_detector
Label: ion detector
Definition: An ion detector is a device that measures and records the charge induced or current produced when an ion passes by or hits a surface.  Example: In a scanning instrument the signal produced in the detector during the course of the scan versus where the instrument is in the scan at what m/Q will produce a mass spectrum a record of ions as a function of m/Q."en

Name: kugelrohr_condenser
Label: Kugelrohr condenser
Definition: A short-path vacuum distillation apparatus consisting of an electric heater and two or more glass bulbs. The compound to be distilled is placed in the last bulb.

Name: differential_interference_contrast_microscopy
Label: differential interference contrast microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with polarised visible light split into two beams which then interfere to produce fringes whose spacing is proportional to the height of the specimen.

Name: information_content_entity
Label: information content entity
Definition: A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing."en

Name: charge_transport_measurement_method
Label: charge transport measurement method
Definition: Any technique for measuring charge transport.

Name: categorical_label
Label: categorical label
Definition: A label that is part of a categorical datum and that indicates the value of the data item on the categorical scale."en

Name: luminescence_spectrum
Label: luminescence spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity against wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation emitted by a sample through luminescence against the frequency of the incident radiation.

Name: fluorine_19_atom
Label: fluorine-19 atom
Definition: The stable isotope of fluorine with relative atomic mass 18.998403 and nuclear spin 1/2.

Name: density_gradient_ultracentrifugation
Label: density-gradient ultracentrifugation
Definition: A method where the components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a dense medium or density gradient in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. Samples are spun at speeds of up to 150000 rpm.

Name: two_pulse_phase_modulation_pulse_sequence
Label: two pulse phase modulation pulse sequence
Definition: A continuous sequence of pulses used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effects of heteronuclear dipolar coupling. For the pulse sequence see J. Chem. Phys. 1996 103 pg 6951.

Name: static_headspace_extraction
Label: static headspace extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a solid or liquid matrix to the vapour phase by heating. Once the concentration of the analyte in the headspace is in equilibrium with the concentration in the sample matrix the headspace is removed.

Name: high_resolution_scanning_electron_microscopy
Label: high resolution scanning electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused electron beam is scanned across the specimen under vacuum and the secondary and backscattered electrons produced are detected.

Name: microlithography
Label: microlithography
Definition: Any synthesis technique involving the transfer of a microsized pattern to a material a 'resist' by selective exposure to a radiation source e.g. light or X-rays or to a beam of charged particles. Upon irradiation the material experiences a change in its physical properties which changes its response to a developer solution making it either soluble or insoluble. The desired pattern is then obtained by removing any excess resist with the developer.

Name: oximetry_spectrum
Label: oximetry spectrum
Definition: A plot of  oxygen vs. time measured during a process where oxygen is consumed or evolved.

Name: delays_alternating_with_nutation_for_tailored_excitation
Label: delays alternating with nutation for tailored excitation
Definition: A pulse sequence used to selectively excite a frequency range by applying a series of very short pulses to manipulate or nutate the magnetisation vectors of the desired spins interspersed with delays which cause the off-resonance magnetisation to receive a different phase. For the pulse see J. Magn. Reson. 1978 29 pg 433.

Name: normal_phase_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: normal-phase high-performance liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid  the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. In normal-phase HPLC the stationary phase is more polar than the mobile phase.

Name: molecular_nonthermal_excitation_spectroscopy
Label: molecular nonthermal excitation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of molecular spectroscopy where the sample is placed in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it then excited using a glow discharge a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas.

Name: rotary_evaporator
Label: rotary evaporator
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a motor unit that rotates the evaporation flask a vacuum system a heated water bath and a condenser which is used to remove solvents from samples under reduced pressure.

Name: localised_surface_plasmon_resonance_spectrum
Label: localised surface plasmon resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of reflectance vs. incident frequency or angle obtained by measuring the resonant excitation of surface plasmons usually on a Au or Ag nanosized surface by ultraviolet or visible light.

Name: elastic_recoil_detection_analysis
Label: elastic recoil detection analysis
Definition: A technique for measuring elemental concentration depth profiles in thin films by directing an ion beam at the sample and detecting recoiled atoms.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_electrospray_ionisation
Label: matrix-assisted laser desorption electrospray ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where neutral molecules are desorbed from the sample usually biological and held in an organic acid matrix using a nitrogen laser and then ionised by collision with charged solvent droplets which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field.

Name: extraction_electrospray_ionisation
Label: extraction electrospray ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where a neutral sample in the form of a gas or aerosol flow is ionised by directing it into a plume of charged droplets generated by forcing a solution of pure solvent through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field.

Name: collinear_laser_spectroscopy
Label: collinear laser spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of an accelerated beam of particles atoms or ions which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample and light absorption is measured.

Name: beta_particle_spectrum
Label: beta-particle spectrum
Definition: A plot of beta-particle count vs. energy obtained by measuring the number and energy of beta-particles emitted by a sample.

Name: 31p_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 31P rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: time_resolved_optical_kerr_effect_spectroscopy
Label: time-resolved optical Kerr effect spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where time response of a transient birefringence induced in the sample by two polarized laser beams pump and probe under the influence of an electric field the 'optical Kerr effect' is measured.

Name: elastic_neutron_scattering
Label: elastic neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample and retain all of their kinetic energy during collisions.

Name: near_infrared_reflectance_spectroscopy
Label: near-infrared reflectance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the reflection or scattering of near infrared radiation 0.8-2 micrometres by a sample is detected.

Name: multi_dimensional_separation_method
Label: multi-dimensional separation method
Definition: A method that results in the separation of two or more components along two physical axes.

Name: multiphoton_dissociation_spectroscopy
Label: multiphoton dissociation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser and molecules in the sample dissociate following the absorption of two or more high-energy photons.

Name: flow_cytometry
Label: flow cytometry
Definition: A method for analysing microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid. The particles are individually passed through a laser beam and the resulting fluorescence and scattered light is detected.

Name: angle_resolved_electron_electron_ion_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved electron-electron ion coincidence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of an ion and a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: collection_of_specimens
Label: collection of specimens
Definition: A material entity that has two or more specimens as its parts."en

Name: obsolete_sample_transformation_method_detection_method
Label: obsolete: sample transformation method-detection method
Definition: A method consisting of a sample transformation method coupled to a detection method.

Name: germanium_73_magic_angle_spinning_quadrupolar_carr_purcell_meiboom_gill_spectrum
Label: germanium-73 magic-angle spinning quadrupolar Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill spectrum
Definition: A plot of the nuclear magnetic resonance frequency for 73Ge nuclei vs. intensity composed of a series of peaks separated by the reciprocal of a user-defined time delay in a QCPMG pulse sequence which describe the envelope of the full static spectrum. Line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the solid sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: liquid_chromatography_matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography-matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance. The sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is held in a matrix such as dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Name: tungsten_183
Label: tungsten-183
Definition: The stable isotope of niobium with relative atomic mass 182.950225 14.3 atom percent natural abundance and nuclear spin 1/2.

Name: 197au_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 197Au Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 197Au nuclei is detected.

Name: synchrotron_circular_dichroism_spectrum
Label: synchrotron circular dichroism spectrum
Definition: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised synchrotron radiation as a function of wavelength.

Name: spin_polarized_metastable_de_excitation_spectroscopy
Label: spin-polarized metastable de-excitation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where energy transfer from a metastable atom in close proximity to 5  the sample gives rise to a characteristic ejected electron energy spectrum. A magnet is used to align all the electron spins parallel to the surface.

Name: 183w_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 183W nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 183W nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: synchrotron_fourier_transform_infrared_spectrum
Label: synchrotron Fourier transform infrared spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained through a Fourier transform of the times series of the absorption or emission of a sample that has been excited by an infrared-frequency pulse generated in a synchrotron.

Name: data_matrix
Label: data matrix
Definition: A data item that is more specifically a rectangular array of numbers symbols or expressions arranged in rows and columns.

Name: thermal_reforming
Label: thermal reforming
Definition: Any process in which the molecular structure of a hydrocarbon is rearranged to alter its properties e.g. its combustion characteristics by exposing the hydrocarbons to high pressures and temperatures.

Name: material_maintenance_objective
Label: material maintenance objective
Definition: An objective specification maintains some or all of the qualities of a material over time."en

Name: impedance_spectrum
Label: impedance spectrum
Definition: A plot of impedance  vs. frequency that reflects the change in impedance of a sample during excitation.

Name: scattering_spectroscopy
Label: scattering spectroscopy
Definition: Any method that measures the amount of light that a substance scatters at certain wavelengths incident angles and polarization angles.

Name: container
Label: container
Definition: A device that can be used to restrict the location of material entities over time"en

Name: isotope_dilution_inductively_coupled_plasma_quadrupole_mass_spectrometry
Label: isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma quadrupole mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The mass-to-charge ratios of the ions in the sample are then measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes. The relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is determined by using an isotope dilution standard the sample labelled with a rare isotope.

Name: heat_flux_differential_scanning_calorimetry
Label: heat-flux differential scanning calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction of both a sample and a reference by the known variation step-wise or linear of one variable whilst a second is kept constant using a heat-flux differential scanning calorimeter.

Name: stimulated_raman_spectroscopy
Label: stimulated Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from two lasers 'pump' and 'probe' by a sample is detected.

Name: weak_beam_dark_field_electron_microscopy
Label: weak-beam dark-field electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum. The interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected. A diffracted beam harmonic  a 'weak beam' is used rather than the diffracted beam itself allowing ch higher resolution to be obtained.

Name: 119sn_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 119Sn nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 119Sn nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: chromatography_column_inner_diameter
Label: chromatography column inner diameter
Definition: The inner diameter specified for a chromatography column.

Name: heteronuclear_multiple_bond_coherence_spectrum
Label: heteronuclear multiple bond coherence spectrum
Definition: A heteronuclear NMR spectrum where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are 23 bonds removed.

Name: spiking
Label: spiking
Definition: A material processing step that involves taking a test material with an adequately low background level of the intended analyte and mixing it with a known amount of analyte.

Name: 19f29si_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 19F–29Si rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 19F and 29Si nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: surface_enhanced_resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: surface-enhanced resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a visible laser by a sample adsorbed onto a metal Au Ag or Cu surface is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition within the sample.

Name: 1h13c_heteronuclear_single_quantum_coherence
Label: 1H–13C heteronuclear single quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 13C nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Name: transmission_electron_microscope
Label: transmission electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of an electron transparent specimen using a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50150 kV under vacuum. The energies and intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Name: ionization_function
Label: ionization function
Definition: An ionization function is a function to physically convert an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions."en

Name: isothermal_titration_calorimetry_curve
Label: isothermal titration calorimetry curve
Definition: A plot of energy against time obtained from the measurement of the heat evolved during a chemical or biochemical reaction such as protein-receptor binding.

Name: cryogenic_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: cryogenic transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Transmission electron microscopy where the specimen is cooled in liquid ethane to 180 C.

Name: double_pulsed_field_gradient_spin_echo_pulse_sequence
Label: double pulsed field gradient spin echo pulse sequence
Definition: An NMR pulse sequence in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a doubled spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular resonances. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. A 1995 112 pg 275.

Name: nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectrum
Label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectrum
Definition: A spectrum that shows the response of spin-active nuclei to radio frequency radiation in an applied magnetic field. The resonance frequencies of nuclei approximately 6 AA apart which are correlated by the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect are plotted with intensities proportional to the populations of nuclei.

Name: weighing
Label: weighing
Definition: Determination of the mass of a sample.

Name: isoelectric_focusing_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: isoelectric focusing polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A two-dimensional separation method where one separation process is isoelectric focusing on a gel and the other separation process is polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis.

Name: microwave_polyol_method
Label: microwave-polyol method
Definition: The synthesis of metal-containing compounds in polyethylene glycols heated by microwave irradiation. The ethylene glycols act as both the solvent and reducing agent.

Name: pulsed_laser_polymerisation_size_exclusion_chromatography
Label: pulsed laser polymerisation-size exclusion chromatography
Definition: A technique for measuring the propagation rate coefficient during polymerisation reactions. The polymerisation is initiated by laser irradiation and the chain length distribution is subsequently determined by size-exclusion chromatography.

Name: capillary_electrophoresis_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: capillary electrophoresis-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture is first separated by capillary electrophoresis before being ionised in a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: enzyme_oximetry
Label: enzyme oximetry
Definition: Oximetry used to determine the extent of oxygenation of an enzyme based on the absorption of light by the oxygenated and deoxygenated forms.

Name: inverted_microscope
Label: inverted microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an eyepiece an objective lens object turret stage condenser and light source which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range. In an inverted microscope the light source and condenser are mounted above the stage while the objective lens and turret are mounted below the stage.

Name: liquid_chromatography_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing the solution usually in an organic solvent through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: infrared_multiphoton_dissociation_spectroscopy
Label: infrared multiphoton dissociation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m with sufficient energy to cause photodissociation by the absorption of two or more photons.

Name: central_transition_magic_angle_spinning
Label: central transition magic angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment where the selective excitation of central transitions during magic angle spinning is used for recording high-resolution NMR spectra of quadrupolar nuclei in solids.

Name: tungsten_183_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: tungsten-183 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for tungsten-183 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: indirect_laser_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: indirect laser absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of laser spectroscopy where an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected.

Name: evaporation_induced_self_assembly
Label: evaporation-induced self-assembly
Definition: A synthesis method in which a drop of solvent is placed on the components to be assembled and allowed to dry freely in air. The solvent evaporation causes the spontaneous association of individual components into an organised structure or pattern.

Name: constant_rate_dip_coating
Label: constant-rate dip coating
Definition: The application of a thin cover to sample by immersing it at constant velocity in a tank containing coating material allowing it to remain there for a certain 'dwell time' and removing the piece from the tank 'withdrawal' at a constant velocity.

Name: sodium_23_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: sodium-23 solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for sodium-23 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: magic_angle_spinning
Label: magic angle spinning
Definition: Spinning a sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 deg with respect to the direction of the magnetic field in order to average anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples to zero.

Name: raman_microscopy
Label: Raman microscopy
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved Raman spectra of a sample during optical microscopy.

Name: galvanostat
Label: galvanostat
Definition: A piece of apparatus that maintains the current through an electrochemical cell at a preset value.

Name: plasma_desorption_mass_spectrometry
Label: plasma desorption mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by bombarding the sample mounted on a thin foil with a highly energietic fission fragment from 252Cf.

Name: thermoluminescence
Label: thermoluminescence
Definition: The measurement of the luminescence of a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: ultrasound_assisted_polyol_method
Label: ultrasound-assisted polyol method
Definition: The synthesis of metal-containing compounds in polyethylene glycol which is irradiated with ultrasonic >20 kHz waves. The ethylene glycols act as both the solvent and reducing agent.

Name: infrared_microscope
Label: infrared microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an optical microscope coupled to a reflecting magnifying mirror system which is used to collect spatially resolved infrared spectra of the surface of a specimen.

Name: nanostructure_synthesis
Label: nanostructure synthesis
Definition: A material processing process that is intended to produce nanostructures.

Name: tandem_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometer
Label: tandem time-of-flight mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer which uses two time-of-flight mass-to-charge analysers in sequence to separate ions. The first time-of-flight analyser isolates precursor ions of choice using a velocity filter and the second time-of-flight analyser detects the fragment ions.

Name: near_infrared_raman_spectroscopy
Label: near-infrared Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of near-infrared radiation radiation in the range 0.82 m is detected.

Name: sodium_dodecyl_sulfate_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: sodium dodecyl sulfate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied and the electrophoretic mobility of the analytes usually proteins is altered by their binding to sodium dodecyl sulfate.

Name: scanning_electron_microscope
Label: scanning electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of a specimen by scanning a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50150 kV across the specimen under vacuum and measuring the interaction of the electrons with the specimen.

Name: sample_drying
Label: sample drying
Definition: The process of removing a solvent from a substance.

Name: dark_field_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: dark-field transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV. under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted before reaching the specimen and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample.

Name: microspectroscopy
Label: microspectroscopy
Definition: Any type of chemical imaging spectroscopy where an optical microscope is used to image the sample and locate a small area for spectral analysis.

Name: dynamic_liquid_phase_micro_extraction
Label: dynamic liquid-phase micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase or vice versa by the repeated movement of a microsyringe.

Name: j_spectrum
Label: J-spectrum
Definition: A two-dimensional NMR spectrum where signals are defined in terms of two frequencies by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and in the other by the J-multiplets of correlated nuclei.

Name: phase_contrast_microscopy
Label: phase contrast microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a transparent specimen is illuminated with visible light and small phase shifts in the light passing through the specimen are used to produce an image.

Name: atomic_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: atomic absorption spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with ultraviolet or visible light which is absorbed by the non-excited atoms at characteristic wavelengths.

Name: dimensionality_reduction
Label: dimensionality reduction
Definition: A dimensionality reduction is data partitioning which transforms each input m-dimensional vector x_1 x_2 ... x_m into an output n-dimensional vector y_1 y_2 ... y_n where n is smaller than m."en

Name: microemulsion_electrokinetic_chromatography
Label: microemulsion electrokinetic chromatography
Definition: Electrokinetic chromatography where the secondary phase is a microemulsion.

Name: gas_chromatography_pulse_discharge_photoionisation_detection
Label: gas chromatography-pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Definition: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through a carrier gas generating high-energy 13.517.5 eV photons which photoionise the elements a sample obtained by gas chromatography and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Name: elution_chromatography
Label: elution chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the stationary bed is within a tube and the mobile phase moves continuously through the column and the analyte is detected as it emerges from the column.

Name: carrier_gas_flow_rate
Label: carrier gas flow rate
Definition: The volume of carrier gas passing through a chromatography column in unit time.

Name: argentometric_titration
Label: argentometric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. The titration is followed by the observing the precipitation of silver compounds following the addition of silver nitrate.

Name: scanning_thermal_microscopy
Label: scanning thermal microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an Wollaston wire probe is scanned over the surface of the specimen and the height required by a feedback loop in order to maintain a constant temperature between the probe and the specimen is recorded as a function of position.

Name: optical_extinction_spectrum
Label: optical extinction spectrum
Definition: A plot of extinction or transmittance vs. wavelength or wavenumber obtained by measuring the amount of radiation transmitted through a sample as a function of the wavelength of the incident radiation. Optical extinction spectra can also be derived theoretically.

Name: single_wavelength_ellipsometry
Label: single-wavelength ellipsometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating a sample with a monochromatic light source and measuring the intensity and change in polarisation of the reflected light.

Name: corrected_emission_spectrum
Label: corrected emission spectrum
Definition: A plot of emission against wavelength  obtained by measuring the emitted spectral radiant power against a quantity related to photon energy such as frequency wavenumber or wavelength and corrected for wavelength-dependent instrumental and sample effects.

Name: amperostatic_coulometry
Label: amperostatic coulometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the total Coulombs of electricity required to complete fully oxidise or fully reduce the sample in an electrochemical reaction is measured whilst the current is held at a constant value.

Name: extreme_ultraviolet_photoelectron_microspectroscopy
Label: extreme ultraviolet photoelectron microspectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a finely focused <10 m extreme ultraviolet 10121 nm photon beam causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: heteronuclear_single_quantum_coherence_nuclear_overhauser_spectroscopy
Label: heteronuclear single quantum coherence-nuclear Overhauser spectroscopy
Definition: A 3D NMR experiment in which the chemical shifts of protons are correlated with the chemical shifts their covalently-bound heteronuclei and with the shifts of spatially proximate protons <6A.

Name: reversed_phase_nanoflow_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: reversed-phase nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid and is significantly more polar than the stationary phase which consists of very small particles the inlet pressure is relatively high and the flow rate is nL min-1.

Name: oscillo_polarography
Label: oscillo polarography
Definition: An obsolete electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes using an oscillograph. The working electrode is a dropping mercury or other liquid conductor electrode and unstirred solutions are used.

Name: inertial_droplet_dispensing
Label: inertial droplet dispensing
Definition: The dispensing of droplets by applying a pattern of piezoelectric acceleration and deceleration to the droplets such that inertial force can overcome adhesion force resulting in droplet detachment from the device.

Name: infraredvisible_sum_frequency_generation_spectroscopy
Label: infrared–visible sum-frequency generation spectroscopy
Definition: A method for generating surface-specific vibrational spectra by mixing two light beams visible and IR at a surface and detecting the output beam which has frequency equal to the sum of the two input frequencies.

Name: gas_phase_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: gas-phase nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy in the gas phase where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.

Name: extended_electron_energy_loss_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: extended electron energy loss fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known extended range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and the energy loss the electrons suffer upon reflection is measured. Measurements are taken from the absorption edge onset to several hundred eV above it.

Name: deep_reactive_ion_etching
Label: deep reactive-ion etching
