Definition: The process of creating deep holes and trenches in a sample surface using short pulses of a plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals alternating with the deposition of a chemically inert passivation layer.

Name: reversed_phase_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography
Definition: Liquid chromatography where the inlet pressure is relatively high and the mobile phase is significantly more polar than the stationary phase which consists of very small particles for example a microporous silica-based material with chemically bonded alkyl chains.

Name: native_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: native polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where protein molecules move at different speeds in non-denaturing conditions according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied.

Name: solvent_precipitation
Label: solvent precipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid material a 'precipitate' from a liquid solution caused by the addition of an additional different solvent.

Name: nuclear_overhauser_effect_difference_spectroscopy
Label: nuclear Overhauser effect difference spectroscopy
Definition: A 1D NMR experiment in which a 1D spectrum is subtracted from a spectrum acquired under steady-state NOE conditions.

Name: space_charge_limited_current_method
Label: space-charge-limited current method
Definition: A method for measuring density-of-state DOS distributions by injecting a nonequilibrium density of charges and measuring the resulting current.

Name: transmission_high_energy_electron_diffraction
Label: transmission high energy electron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of high energy 10200 keV electrons at the sample and recording the resulting diffraction pattern produced by any electrons transmitted through the sample.

Name: wideband_alternating_phase_low_power_technique_for_zero_residual_splitting
Label: wideband alternating-phase low-power technique for zero residual splitting
Definition: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. Also used to allow transfer of magnetisation between nuclei by making the spins precess with at the same chemical shift and thus enjoy strong coupling-isotropic mixing. J. Magn. Reson. 1983 52 pg 335.

Name: capillary_electrochromatography
Label: capillary electrochromatography
Definition: Electrokinetic chromatography where the movement of the mobile phase through a capillary is achieved by electroosmotic flow. The retention time is determined by a combination of electrophoretic migration and chromatographic retention.

Name: protein_precipitation
Label: protein precipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid protein a 'precipitate' from an aqueous solution caused by the addition of an organic solvent e.g. methanol a polyelectrolyte e.g. alginate or a salt e.g. ammonium sulfate in a process known as 'salting out'.

Name: graphite_furnace_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where the sample is atomised by placing it in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Name: dendrogram
Label: dendrogram
Definition: A dendrogram is a report graph which is a tree diagramfrequently used to illustrate the arrangement of the clusters produced by aclustering algorithm."en

Name: dry_electrolytic_conductivity_detection
Label: dry electrolytic conductivity detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds containing Br or Cl. A carrier gas flow containing the sample is heated in a ceramic chamber to 1000 C forming gaseous Cl and Br ions. The change in electrical conductivity of the gas-phase current is then measured.

Name: membrane_extraction_with_a_sorbent_interface
Label: membrane extraction with a sorbent interface
Definition: The transfer of a solute from one phase the 'donor' or 'feed' phase to another the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase across a non-porous non-polar polymer membrane. The membrane first extracts the analytes from their matrix and these are subsequently trapped on a polymeric trap with a porous sorbent using a carrier gas stream.

Name: activation
Label: activation
Definition: Any process that involves preparing or exciting a sample for a subsequent reaction.

Name: raman_spectrometer
Label: Raman spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of a laser a beam splitter an interferometer and a detector and is used to measure Raman spectra.

Name: data_set_of_features
Label: data set of features
Definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a descriptive statistical calculation data transformation and consists of producing a data set that represents one or more features of interest about the input data set."en

Name: light_scattering
Label: light scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered visible light. Light is scattered by the electrons surrounding the atomic nuclei in the sample.

Name: 89y_cross_polarisation_magic_angle_spinning
Label: 89Y cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field. Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 89Y nuclei.

Name: magic_angle_spinning_quadrupolar_carr_purcell_meiboom_gill_spectrum
Label: magic-angle spinning quadrupolar Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill spectrum
Definition: A plot of the nuclear magnetic resonance frequency vs. intensity composed of a series of peaks separated by the reciprocal of a user-defined time delay in a QCPMG pulse sequence which describe the envelope of the full static spectrum. Line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the solid sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: fourier_transform_flame_infrared_emission_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform flame infrared emission spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated in a flame and the infrared radiation  0.781000 m emitted during cooling is detected. The spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: thermal_diffusion_forced_rayleigh_scattering
Label: thermal diffusion forced Rayleigh scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure where a grating created by the interference of two laser beams is written into a sample which contains a small amount of dye. The intensity grating is converted into a temperature grating which in turn causes a concentration grating by thermal diffusion. A further laser beam is Rayleigh scattered by the grating and the change in direction or energy of the light and the temporal evolution of the scattered beam are measured.

Name: diffuse_reflectance_laser_flash_photolysis
Label: diffuse reflectance laser flash photolysis
Definition: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong pulse the 'pump' pulse of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The diffuse reflectance of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Name: assay_objective
Label: assay objective
Definition: an objective specification to determine a specified type of information about an evaluated entity the material entity bearing evaluant role"en

Name: time_of_flight_mass_to_charge_analyser
Label: time-of-flight mass-to-charge analyser
Definition: A piece of apparatus which accelerates a sample of ions so that they all have the same kinetic energy across a field-free drift region of length 12 m to a detector thus separating the ions by their velocity which is proportional to their mass-to-charge ratio.

Name: supercritical_fluid_extraction_supercritical_fluid_chromatography_gas_chromatography
Label: supercritical-fluid extraction-supercritical-fluid chromatography-gas chromatography
Definition: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid then subjected to column chromatography where the supercritical fluid acts as the mobile phase and finally depressurised collected and subjected to gas chromatography.

Name: x_ray_spectrometer
Label: X-ray spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus used to measure the absorption or emission of X-rays.

Name: flash_chromatography
Label: flash chromatography
Definition: A type of column chromatography where 0.1-10 g of sample mixture is separated in less than 15 min by using pressurised gas to drive the mobile phase through the column.

Name: atomic_spectroscopy
Label: atomic spectroscopy
Definition: Any spectroscopic technique which is based upon the ability of atoms to absorb or emit electromagnetic radiation. In atomic spectroscopy the sample is vaporised and then atomised.

Name: positive_electrospray_ionisation
Label: positive electrospray ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample is either forced through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of positively  charged droplets or solvent droplets subjected to the same process are directed at the sample.

Name: boron_11_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: boron-11 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for boron-11 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: gas_chromatogram
Label: gas chromatogram
Definition: A plot of detector signal e.g. ion count or  absorbance vs. retention time obtained from a column chromatography experiment where the mobile phase is a gas.

Name: chemodosimeter
Label: chemodosimeter
Definition: A sensor that is used to measure the dose of ions or small molecules taken by up an object.

Name: carbon_electrode
Label: carbon electrode
Definition: An electrode that consists of a sample of granular carbon material that has been bound with pitch and has been fired at high temperature.

Name: total_suppression_of_sidebands_pulse_sequence
Label: total suppression of sidebands pulse sequence
Definition: A pulse sequence used in magic angle spinning NMR experiments to remove additional signals resulting from spinning the sample too slowly to obtain a response composed solely of isotropic chemical shifts.

Name: shear_force_microscopy
Label: shear force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The tip oscillates parallel to the surface. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: single_photon_laser_scanning_microscopy
Label: single-photon laser scanning microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by scanning a solid-state Ti sapphire laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface to produce single-photon fluorescence.

Name: spark_plasma_sintering
Label: spark plasma sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample below its melting point using a direct current until its particles adhere to each other.

Name: imnoaffinity_chromatography
Label: imμnoaffinity chromatography
Definition: Affinity chromatography where the separation is caused by differing antibody-ligand interactions.

Name: rotary_evaporation
Label: rotary evaporation
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample by applying heat and lowering the pressure above the sample whilst rotating it at 10300 rpm.

Name: electrostatic_repulsion_hydrophilic_interaction_chromatography
Label: electrostatic repulsion hydrophilic interaction chromatography
Definition: Hydrophilic interaction chromatography where the chromatography column is an ion-exchange column and the mobile phase is predominantly organic.

Name: nanoflow_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_electrospray_ionisation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of it through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of nL min1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance by two mass spectrometers in series.

Name: spray_coating
Label: spray coating
Definition: The application of a thin cover to sample by converting the coating solution to an aerosol then allowing the droplets to settle on the sample surface under the influence of gravity or using an electrostatic field.

Name: pressure_pulsed_chemical_vapour_infiltration
Label: pressure-pulsed chemical vapour infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with or deposition from a vapour which is applied as a series of high pressure pulses. This results in a multilayer structure.

Name: 45sc_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 45Sc nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 45Sc nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: sandwich_sublimation
Label: sandwich sublimation
Definition: A technique for growing thick micrometre epitaxial layers of SiC by heating a source polycrystalline SiC or powder at high temperature 1800-2600 C and low pressure in an Ar atmosphere causing it to sublime. The vapours then condense on a single crystal of SiC the 'seed' placed a few mm away.

Name: cyclic_voltammogram
Label: cyclic voltammogram
Definition: A plot of cell current vs. the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes obtained from a cyclic voltammetry experiment.

Name: inelastic_x_ray_scattering
Label: inelastic X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the energy loss of X-rays scattered by a sample.

Name: spin_diffusion_experiment
Label: spin diffusion experiment
Definition: An NMR experiment which exploits the increased efficiency of energy magnetisation transfer between nuclei via dipolar coupling in rigid or semi-rigid samples. The rate at which polarisation is transferred between spins is measured giving information on the proximity and orientation of the interacting spins within the sample.

Name: melting_curve
Label: melting curve
Definition: A plot of signal vs. temperature for a sample that is heated to cause the solidliquid phase change.

Name: nanowire_electron_scattering
Label: nanowire electron scattering
Definition: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known extended range of kinetic energies is scattered by a sample supported on a nano-sized wire such as a carbon nanotube and the energy loss the electrons suffer upon scattering is measured.

Name: rapidfirer_mass_spectrometry
Label: RapidFire(R) mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry developed by BioTrove which uses microfluidics to aspirate an aliquot of sample directly from a quenched assay plate and performs a solid-phase extraction on the sample before ionisation.

Name: size_exclusion_chromatography
Label: size-exclusion chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the separation is caused by differences in molecular size.

Name: polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied.

Name: solid_phase_micro_extraction
Label: solid-phase micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a small fibre containing a stationary phase bonded to a silica needle <10 m diameter.

Name: time_resolved_microwave_conductivity
Label: time-resolved microwave conductivity
Definition: A technique allowing the quantitative and qualitative detection of radiation-induced charge separation by time-resolved measurement of the changes in microwave absorption resulting from the production and decay of charged and dipolar molecular entities. In a typical TRMC experiment separated charge carriers which are generated by a laser pulse lead to a perturbation of the initial microwave absorbance. The temporal decay of the conductivity signal i.e. microwave absorbance reflects the lifetime of the photogenerated carriers.

Name: contact_lithography
Label: contact lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. A mask 'photomask' with the desired pattern is then placed in contact with the substrate and both are exposed to intense UV light. A post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: laser_microprobe_spectroscopy
Label: laser microprobe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more finely focused <10 m diameter laser beams and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured.

Name: holographic_optical_tweezers
Label: holographic optical tweezers
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a laser a beam splitter an optical microscope a condenser and a CCD camera that is used to manipulate microscopic particles. The beam splitter is used to create multiple laser beams that interfere forming multiple optical traps.

Name: electrothermal_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: electrothermal atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where the sample is atomised using a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Name: hanging_mercury_drop_electrode
Label: hanging mercury drop electrode
Definition: An electrode formed of a partial mercury drop of controlled geometry and surface area at the end of a capillary.

Name: thermal_analysis
Label: thermal analysis
Definition: Any measurement technique in which a physical property of the sample is measured as a function of temperature.

Name: hot_wire_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: hot wire chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors which react or decompose catalysed by a hot filament on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: light_emission_device
Label: light emission device
Definition: A device which has a function to emit light."en

Name: isotope_dilution_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is then determined by using an isotope dilution standard the sample labelled with a rare isotope.

Name: ultraviolet_fluorescence_microscopy
Label: ultraviolet fluorescence microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by illuminating it with radiation in the ultra-violet region 4380 nm.

Name: surface_assisted_chemical_vapour_transport
Label: surface-assisted chemical vapour transport
Definition: A crystal growth method for metal dichalcogenides in which the starting materials high-purity metal and chalcogen powders are placed in one half of a quartz ampoule together with a transport agent e.g. iodine and heated in a furnace under a temperature gradient. The product crystals are grown on the surface of a sheet of high-purity metal in the other half of the ampoule.

Name: etching
Label: etching
Definition: The process of chemically removing a thin layer from a sample surface usually to leave behind a pattern.

Name: micro_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: micro infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from a finely focused beam <10 m diameter of infrared light  0.781000 m.

Name: vibrational_electron_energy_loss_spectroscopy
Label: vibrational electron energy loss spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known narrow range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and energy loss the electrons suffer corresponding to vibrational modes in the sample is measured.

Name: strong_cation_exchange_reversed_phase_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionisation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: strong-cation-exchange reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample is first subjected to two-dimensional high-performance liquid chromatography passed through two columns in sequence -a primary ion-exchange column where the particles show no loss or gain of charge with varying pH and a secondary column where the stationary phase is significantly less polar than the mobile phase. The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised by interaction electron or proton transfer with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure. The sample is analysed by two mass spectrometers in series.

Name: cavity_ring_down_spectroscopy
Label: cavity ring-down spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside a highly reflective laser cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected. The decay time for light exiting the cavity is determined as a function of pulsed laser wavelength.

Name: thermal_lens_spectroscopy
Label: thermal lens spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy generated by nonradiative thermal relaxation after laser light absorption is measured.

Name: heteronuclear_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: heteronuclear correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and heteronuclei.

Name: bridge_ontology_module
Label: bridge ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that consists entirely of axioms that connect or bridge two distinct ontology modules. For example the Uberon-to-ZFA bridge module."en

Name: hydroxy_acid_modified_metal_oxide_chromatography
Label: hydroxy acid-modified metal oxide chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the separation is caused by differing analyteligand interactions. Phosphorylated proteins and peptides are retained by hydroxy acid-modified metal oxide particles because of their affinity for the phosphate group.

Name: differential_thermal_analysis
Label: differential thermal analysis
Definition: The measurement of the temperature difference between the sample and a reference material.

Name: extended_x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured 5001000 eV below the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Name: fluorescence_quenching_method
Label: fluorescence quenching method
Definition: Any method that involves observing or measuring the time take for loss of fluorescence in a sample.

Name: ultraviolet_titration
Label: ultraviolet titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the absorbance of radiation in the ultraviolet range 190400 nm by the sample.

Name: graph
Label: graph
Definition: A diagram that presents one or more tuples of information by mapping those tuples in to a two dimensional space in a non arbitrary way."en

Name: colloidal_lithography
Label: colloidal lithography
Definition: Any synthesis technique involving the transfer of a pattern to a material a 'resist' by exposure to a radiation source e.g. light or X-rays or to a beam of charged particles through a mask composed of a close-packed colloidal array. Upon irradiation the material experiences a change in its physical properties. Excess material is then removed by a liquid 'developer' or an etching process.

Name: transverse_relaxation_optimised_spectroscopy
Label: transverse relaxation optimised spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR experiment employed for protein samples in which relaxation mechanisms are optimised in order to suppress transverse relaxation times T2 and deliver only the sharpest signal present in a multiplet.

Name: electrospray_ionization
Label: electrospray ionization
Definition: A process in which ionized species in the gas phase are produced from an analyte-containing solution via highly charged fine droplets by means of spraying the solution from a narrow-bore needle tip at atmospheric pressure in the presence of a high electric field. When a pressurized gas is used to aid in the formation of a stable spray the term pneumatically assisted electrospray ionization is used. The term ion spray is not recommended.

Name: angle_resolved_ion_excited_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved ion-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where ion bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: zero_kinetic_energy_electron_spectroscopy
Label: zero kinetic energy electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured. The energy of the incident photons matches the ionisation energy of the sample so emitted electrons have zero kinetic energy.

Name: polymerisation_propagation_rate_coefficient_determination
Label: polymerisation propagation rate coefficient determination
Definition: An assay to determine the propagation rate coefficient of a polymerisation process.

Name: seeded_sublimation
Label: seeded sublimation
Definition: A technique for growing crystals of SiC by heating a source polycrystalline SiC or powder at high temperature 1800-2600 C and low pressure in an Ar atmosphere causing it to sublime. The vapours then condense on a single crystal of SiC the 'seed'.

Name: transmission_electron_micrograph
Label: transmission electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons.

Name: angle_of_optical_rotation
Label: angle of optical rotation
Definition: An experimental method output that consists of the angle through which plane polarized light is rotated clockwise as seen when facing the light source in passing through an optically active medium.

Name: physical_object_quality
Label: physical object quality
Definition: A quality which inheres in a continuant.

Name: cobalt_k_alpha_source
Label: cobalt K-alpha source
Definition: An X-ray source where cobalt atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Name: gasification
Label: gasification
Definition: The conversion of carbonaceous materials e.g. such as coal petroleum biofuel or biomass into CO and H2 by heating with a controlled amount of oxygen and/or steam. The resulting gas mixture is called a 'syngas'.

Name: blue_native_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: blue native polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where protein molecules move at different speeds in non-denaturing conditions according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied. The dye Coomassie blue is used to transfer charge to the protein.

Name: cathodic_stripping_voltammetry
Label: cathodic stripping voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is first electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped' by applying a reducing potential. During removal the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes.

Name: differential_optical_absorption_spectrophotometry
Label: differential optical absorption spectrophotometry
Definition: Ultraviolet-visible spectroscopy where the difference between incident and transmitted radiation is measured for a gaseous sample.

Name: chemical_shift_anisotropy_experiment
Label: chemical shift anisotropy experiment
Definition: An NMR experiment in which differences in chemical shift are used to give information about the orientation of those spins with respect to the field and thus the orientation of the molecule.

Name: reagent
Label: reagent
Definition: A biological or chemical entity that bears a reagent role in virtue of it being intended for application in a scientific technique  to participate in or have molecular parts that participate in a chemical reaction that facilitates the generation of data about some distinct entity or the generation of some distinct material specified output."en

Name: 7li_pulsed_field_gradient_spin_echo_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 7Li pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 7Li nuclei resonances. Additionally attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Name: linear_quadrupole_mass_spectrometer
Label: linear quadrupole mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer that uses an orthogonal-acceleration ion source. The detector is a quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser which holds the ions in a stable orbit using an electric field generated by four linear parallel electrodes.

Name: liquid_chromatography_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before the energy states of spin-active nuclei in the sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. The sample is then converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: gradient_elution_chromatography
Label: gradient-elution chromatography
Definition: A separation method where the components are distributed between two phases one of which is stationary while the other moves in a definite direction the 'mobile' phase. In gradient-elution chromatography the elution solvent strength of the mobile phase is gradually increased during the separation.

Name: ion_trap_mass_spectrometer
Label: ion trap mass spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source a mass-to-charge analyser a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The detector is an ion trap mass-to-charge analyser which holds the ions in a stable orbit by an electric field.

Name: scanning_calorimetry
Label: scanning calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction by the known variation step-wise or linear of one variable whilst a second is kept constant.

Name: photodegradation
Label: photodegradation
Definition: The photochemical transformation of a molecule into lower molecular weight fragments usually in an oxidation process.

Name: refractive_index_detection
Label: refractive index detection
Definition: A detection method based on the change in refractive index of a solution. Light is passed through a hollow prism and focused on a photocell. When a liquid containing the sample is allowed to flow through the prism the light diverges from its original path and the change in intensity and angle of the transmitted light is measured.

Name: electron_backscatter_diffraction
Label: electron backscatter diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of electrons at the sample the energies of which are controlled by their acceleration voltage and recording the resulting diffraction pattern of any backscattered electrons.

Name: flash_vacuum_thermolysis
Label: flash vacuum thermolysis
Definition: The reaction of a molecule by exposing it to a short thermal shock at high temperature usually in the gas phase.

Name: silversilver_chloride_reference_electrode
Label: silver/silver chloride reference electrode
Definition: A reference electrode where the electrochemical reaction is between silver metal and silverI chloride.

Name: multi_layer_soft_lithography
Label: multi-layer soft lithography
Definition: Any synthesis technique which uses elastomeric stamps molds and conformable photomasks prepared from multiple liquid polymer precursors.

Name: coherent_stokes_raman_spectroscopy
Label: coherent Stokes Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. An anti-Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and a Stokes frequency beam is observed. multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Name: capillary_gel_electrophoresis
Label: capillary gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method that takes place in a capillary and where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium consisting of gel across which an electric field is applied.

Name: vacuum_drying
Label: vacuum drying
Definition: The removal of water from a sample by placing it under reduced pressure. This allows water to evaporate from heat-sensitive samples at a lower temperature.

Name: nano_electrospray_ionisation_gas_phase_electrophoretic_mobility_molecular_analysis
Label: nano electrospray ionisation gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis
Definition: A separation method where singly-charged complexes move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in air under the influence of an electric field. The sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of nL min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: sodium_acetate_buffer
Label: sodium acetate buffer
Definition: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by an acetic acidsodium acetate equilibrium.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets and where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: carbon_13_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: carbon-13 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for carbon-13 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: calorimetry
Label: calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction.

Name: 31p19f_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 31P–19F rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P and 19F nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: supercritical_fluid_extraction
Label: supercritical fluid extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to a liquid phase using a supercritical fluid.

Name: rotating_disk_electrode
Label: rotating-disk electrode
Definition: A type of working electrode which usually consists of a Pt disc diameter 1.0 mm sealed in a Teflon carrier which rotates a high speed during the experiment. Rotating-disk electrodes are used to investigate reaction mechanisms.

Name: evolution_of_poisonous_fumes
Label: evolution of poisonous fumes
Definition: An adverse laboratory event where a reacting species gives off a gas poisonous to the experimenter.

Name: continuous_wave_electron_nuclear_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: continuous-wave electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a sample is irradiated by a microwave frequency which matches an electron resonance transition whilst nuclei in the vicinty of the unpaired eletron are excited by a radio frequency sweep.

Name: fluorescence_anisotropy
Label: fluorescence anisotropy
Definition: A method for measuring the binding interaction between two labelled molecules. The sample is excited with vertically polarised light and the polarization of the fluorescence is measured.

Name: dielectrophoresis
Label: dielectrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their dielectrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium across which an electric field is applied.

Name: flame_photometric_detection
Label: flame photometric detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to sulfur- and phosphorus-containing compounds. A flow of carrier gas containing the sample is mixed with oxygen or air and ignited. Any chemiluminescence due to these compounds is then detected.

Name: multiple_modulation_multiple_echo_velocimetry
Label: multiple-modulation multiple-echo velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by encoding it into an NMR signal. The NMR signal is produced using multiple spin echoes from several radio frequency pulses in the presence of a constant magnetic field gradient.

Name: selective_insensitive_nuclei_enhancement_by_polarization_transfer
Label: selective insensitive nuclei enhancement by polarization transfer
Definition: A heteronuclear NMR experiment in which magnetisation arising from 1H nuclei is transferred to covalently bound heteronuclei thereby enhancing the NMR signal of the heteronuclei. Selective pulses that only excite or 'select' some of the signals in the spectrum are used in this experiment.

Name: paper_chromatography
Label: paper chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the stationary phase is or is impregnated in a sheet of paper.

Name: gas_chromatography_electron_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: gas chromatography electron ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography before being ionised by electrons energy 70 eV which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: electron_induced_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: electron-induced X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the X-rays are generated by bombarding the sample with a focused beam of high-energy electrons.

Name: reasoned_ontology_module
Label: reasoned ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that contains axioms generated by a reasoner. The generated axioms are typically direct SubClassOf axioms but other possibilities are available."en

Name: tandem_dual_column_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: tandem dual-column high-performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample is first subjected to column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. The sample passes through two columns anion and cation exchange in series. The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised in a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: capillary_isotachophoresis
Label: capillary isotachophoresis
Definition: An electrophoresis method in a capillary containing a discontinuous buffer system where the analytes migrate according to their electrophoretic mobilities forming a chain of adjacent zones moving with equal velocity between two solutions the leading and terminating electrolytes bracketing the mobility range of the analytes.

Name: alpha_particle_x_ray_spectroscopy
Label: alpha-particle X-ray spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the sample is irradiated with alpha-particles and the energies of the backscattered alpha-particles and X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions are measured.

Name: directive_information_entity
Label: directive information entity
Definition: An information content entity whose concretizations indicate to their bearer how to realize them in a process."en

Name: high_pressure_fluorescence_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: high-pressure fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume. Ultraviolet light is used to stimulate fluorescence and the sample is held inside a single fused silica microcapillary under high pressure up to 300 MPa.

Name: rapid_electrokinetic_patterning
Label: rapid electrokinetic patterning
Definition: A technique that utlilises the movement of particles under the influence of an electric field e.g. electroosmosis or electrophoresis in conjunction with illumination of a photosensitive substrate to form a pattern. Particles suspended in DI water are placed between two parallel ITO electrodes biased with an AC signal. Light of wavelength 1064 nm is used to heat the fluid sample and induce an electrohydrodynamic microvortex bringing the particles towards its centre forming a pattern.

Name: temperature_gradient_gel_electrophoresis
Label: temperature gradient gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles consisting of polynucleotides move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of a gel across which an electric field is applied and across which there is a gradient of temperatures that cause double-stranded DNA to unzip.

Name: time_correlated_single_photon_counting
Label: time-correlated single photon counting
Definition: A method that is used to measure the relaxation rate of molecules in fluorescent samples. A laser pulse excites the molecule and the time taken for it to emit a single photon is measured.

Name: ion_projection_lithography
Label: ion projection lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses ions to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a focused ion beam 75 keV He ions is scanned across a patterned mask inducing chemical reactions in the resist. The desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'.

Name: auxiliary_electrode
Label: auxiliary electrode
Definition: An electrode that serves merely to carry the current flowing through an electrochemical cell.

Name: hydrogen_atmosphere
Label: hydrogen atmosphere
Definition: A laboratory atmosphere consisting of gaseous diatomic hydrogen.

Name: t_cell_receptor_complex
Label: T cell receptor complex
Definition: A protein complex that contains a disulfide-linked heterodimer of T cell receptor TCR chains which are members of the immunoglobulin superfamily and mediates antigen recognition ultimately resulting in T cell activation. The TCR heterodimer is associated with the CD3 complex which consists of the nonpolymorphic polypeptides gamma delta epsilon zeta and in some cases eta an RNA splice variant of zeta or Fc epsilon chains.

Name: ostwald_ripening
Label: Ostwald ripening
Definition: The growth of larger crystals from those of smaller size which have a higher solubility than the larger ones.

Name: multiple_headspace_extraction
Label: multiple headspace extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a solid or liquid matrix to the vapour phase by heating. Once the concentration of the analyte in the headspace is in equilibrium with the concentration in the sample matrix the headspace is removed. The process is repeated multiple times allowing the new equilibrium to form at each stage.

Name: 29si_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 29Si solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 29Si nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: confidence_interval
Label: confidence interval
Definition: A quantitative confidence value that refers to an interval give values within which there is a high probability 95 percent by convention that the true population value can be found. The calculation of a confidence interval considers the standard deviation of the data and the number of observations. Thus a confidence interval narrows as the number of observations increases or its variance dispersion decreases.

Name: laser_induced_simultaneous_thermophoresis
Label: laser-induced simultaneous thermophoresis
Definition: A separation method where two or more particles e.g. proteins are separated according to their thermal conductivity in a separation medium across which a thermal gradient  produced by laser irradiation is applied.

Name: decoupling_using_mind_boggling_optimisation_pulse_sequence
Label: decoupling using mind-boggling optimisation pulse sequence
Definition: A sequence of pulses used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effect of homonuclear dipolar couplings. For the pulse sequence see Chem. Phys. Lett. 2004 398 pg 532.

Name: fourier_transform_ion_cyclotron_resonance_mass_spectrometry
Label: Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field and subjecting it to a Fourier transform.

Name: vacuum_sublimation
Label: vacuum sublimation
Definition: A technique for purifying solid samples by heating the sample under vacuum. The sample sublimes and the vapours condense as a purified compound on a cooled surface leaving the non-volatile residue impurities behind.

Name: cold_spray_ionisation_mass_spectrum
Label: cold-spray ionisation mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment  where the ions are obtained by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small cold 1080 C capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: extrusion
Label: extrusion
Definition: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die.

Name: sputter_coater
Label: sputter coater
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an anode the specimen a cathode the source of sputter atoms or 'target' and a magnet all held inside a vacuum chamber which is used to coat specimens with a thin layer of atoms e.g. Au prior to microscopy.

Name: absorption_spectrum
Label: absorption spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation absorbed by a sample as a function of the wavelength of incident radiation.

Name: ribonucleic_acid_immunoprecipitation
Label: ribonucleic acid immunoprecipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid material a 'precipitate' consisting of a proteinspecific antibody complex where the protein is part of a proteinRNA complex from solution. This method is used to determine the location of RNA binding sites for particular proteins of interest.

Name: elution
Label: elution
Definition: A process wherein one material is extracted from another by interaction with a solvent.

Name: nitrogen_adsorption_desorption_isotherm
Label: nitrogen adsorption-desorption isotherm
Definition: A plot of relative pressure vs. volume adsorbed obtained by measuring the amount of N2 gas that adsorbs onto the surface of interest the 'sorbate' and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature.

Name: high_angular_annular_dark_field_scanning_transmission_electron_micrograph
Label: high-angular annular dark-field scanning transmission electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by scanning the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted at high angles before reaching the specimen and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample. An annular aperture is used to select electrons that have passed through given symmetric zones within the objective lens of the microscope.

Name: inductively_coupled_plasma_field_sector_mass_spectrometry
Label: inductively coupled plasma field sector mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The beam of ions is then directed into magnetic field the orientation of which is perpendicular to the beam. The magnetic field forces the charged particles into different circular trajectories the radii of which depend on the strength of the magnetic field the accelerating voltage and the mass of the ion.

Name: j_spectroscopy
Label: J-spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear protonproton NMR spectroscopy where chemical shift and J-coupling information are separated onto different frequency axes.

Name: relative_x_ray_reflectometry
Label: relative X-ray reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at an extremely flat surface at a grazing angle and measuring the intensity of the reflected X-rays as a function of angle.

Name: glow_discharge_mass_spectrometry
Label: glow-discharge mass spectrometry
Definition: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes under reduced pressure. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: wet_etching
Label: wet etching
Definition: The process of using strong acids/alkalis to cut into the unprotected parts of a surface e.g. metal or silicon to create a pattern.

Name: vibrating_tube_densiometry
Label: vibrating-tube densiometry
Definition: The measurement of the density of a solution by determining the resonant frequency of a quartz U-tube which holds about 1 mL of sample.

Name: sonoluminescence_detection
Label: sonoluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of short bursts of light emitted from a liquid sample excited by sound.

Name: laurdan_generalised_polarisation_spectroscopy
Label: laurdan generalised polarisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the difference between the red and blue fluorescence emission of the fluorescent probe laurdan 6-dodecanoyl-2- dimethylaminonaphthalene which depends on the phase of lipid membranes is measured.

Name: muffle_furnace
Label: muffle furnace
Definition: A device for heating substances to high temperatures where the material is kept separate from the fuel.

Name: percentage_yield
Label: percentage yield
Definition: The mass of the product of a synthesis expressed as a percentage of the theoretical maxim mass given the masses of the reactants.

Name: free_flow_electrophoresis
Label: free-flow electrophoresis
Definition: An electrophoresis method where the sample is introduced continuously to the separation chamber and the electric field is applied perpendicular to the hydrodynamic flow resulting in two-dimensional separation of the analytes based on the flow rate and their electrophoretic mobilities.

Name: quality_of_a_substance
Label: quality of a substance
Definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of its constitution.

Name: azithal_photoelectron_diffraction
Label: aziμthal photoelectron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure during photoelectron spectroscopy. Photons are directed at a sample and diffraction patterns resulting from the emission of electrons are determined as a function of emission angle.

Name: multi_dimensional_chromatography
Label: multi-dimensional chromatography
Definition: A multi-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are all chromatography.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrum
Label: electrospray ionisation mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment  where the ions are obtained by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: surface_enhanced_infrared_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: surface enhanced infrared absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the rough metal surface of a sample absorbs radiation in the infrared region 0.781000 m.

Name: trapping_method
Label: trapping method
Definition: Any method used to trap a sample for further analysis.

Name: 15n_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 15N solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states 15N nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: nanoflow_liquid_chromatography_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: nanoflow liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography with a flow rate of nL min-1 before being ionised by forcing the solution usually in an organic solvent through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: environment_control_function
Label: environment control function
Definition: An environmental control function is a function that regulates a contained environment within specified parameter ranges. For example the control of light exposure humidity and temperature."en

Name: langmuirblodgett_assembly
Label: Langmuir–Blodgett assembly
Definition: A method of depositing crystalline films one molecular layer at a time by dipping the substrate into water containing a polymer that forms a single layer of molecular chains on the surface. This layer is then transferred from the water to the substrate.

Name: warm_extrusion
Label: warm extrusion
Definition: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die at a temperature that is above room temperature but below the recrystallisation temperature of the material 400900 C.

Name: elution
Label: elution
Definition: the process of extracting one material from another by washing with a solvent to remove adsorbed material from an adsorbent as in washing of loaded ion-exchange resins to remove captured ions"en

Name: independent_continuant
Label: independent continuant
Definition: A continuant that is a bearer of quality and realizable entity entities in which other entities inhere and which itself cannot inhere in anything."en

Name: near_edge_x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectrum
Label: near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. energy obtained by measuring the number and energy of X-rays absorbed by the sample within 40 eV of the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron.

Name: high_resolution_x_ray_diffraction
Label: high-resolution X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a parallel beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Name: electron_beam_induced_deposition
Label: electron-beam-induced deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where an electron beam is used to decompose gaseous molecules leading to deposition of a solid on a nearby substrate.

Name: 195pt_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 195Pt nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 195Pt nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: microscope
Label: microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to generate an image of the surface of a specimen whether by focusing reflected light onto where it can be collected or by scanning a given area of the surface.

Name: neutral_buoyancy_densiometry
Label: neutral buoyancy densiometry
Definition: The measurement of the density of a solution by determining the neutral buoyancy of an object the point at which it maintains a constant depth in the solution.

Name: 197au_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 197Au nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 197Au nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: photoelectron_spectrum
Label: photoelectron spectrum
Definition: A plot of photoelectron count vs. kinetic energy.

Name: ionisation_detected_stimulated_raman_spectroscopy
Label: ionisation-detected stimulated Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from two lasers 'pump' and 'probe' by a sample is detected. The molecules in the sample are ionised using an ultraviolet laser in order to improve the signal-to-noise ratio of the spectrum.

Name: microspectrophotometry
Label: microspectrophotometry
Definition: Spectroscopy where an optical microscope is used to image the sample and locate a small area for spectral analysis with radiation in the ultraviolet to near infrared range.

Name: x_ray_microprobe_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray microprobe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with a finely focused X-ray beam <10 m diameter and the X-ray absorption coefficient of the sample is measured.

Name: photon_scanning_tunnelling_microscopy
Label: photon scanning tunnelling microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with a near-field of photons. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving an optical fibre probe in a raster scan over the specimen line by line and detecting any photons which tunnel from the specimen to the probe as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the optical fibre probe and surface during scanning.

Name: kelvin_probe_method
Label: Kelvin probe method
Definition: A measurement method for determining the contact potential difference or difference in work functions between the sample and a reference electrode. In this method the probe which is made of a material with a known work function commonly tungsten or platinum is arranged close to the sample surface as a parallel-plate capacitor with a small spacing. The probe is vibrated causing a change in the capacitance between the electrodes resulting in a small ac current. The work function difference is measured by applying an opposing external bias voltage such that the ac current is zero.

Name: standard_atomic_force_infrared_microscopy
Label: standard atomic force infrared microscopy
Definition: The simultaneous collection of AFM topography data and spatially-resolved infrared spectra by measuring the infrared absorption via transient deformation of the AFM cantilever induced by an infrared pulsed laser tuned to a wavelength that corresponds to a vibrational absorbing wavelength in the specimen as a function of AFM tip position. The specimen is deposited on an ATR-compatible ZnSe prism and infrared light is introduced into the prism at an angle exceeding the critical angle for internal reflection. This produces an evanescent wave at the reflecting surface.

Name: transmission_electron_microscopy_selected_area_electron_diffraction
Label: transmission electron microscopy selected area electron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of high energy 10200 keV electrons at the sample within a transmission electron microscope and recording the resulting diffraction pattern produced by any electrons transmitted through the sample.

Name: gas_chromatography_thermal_conductivity_detection
Label: gas chromatography-thermal conductivity detection
Definition: Thermal conductivity detection where the sample is the eluent from a gas chromatography separation.

Name: gold_nanoparticle
Label: gold nanoparticle
Definition: A nanoparticle consisting of gold atoms.

Name: 111cd_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 111Cd nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 111Cd nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: single_drop_micro_extraction
Label: single-drop micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a dissolved substance from one liquid phase to another immiscible or partially miscible liquid phase in contact with it. A microdrop of organic solvent 8 L is suspended from the end of Teflon rod immersed in a stirred aqueous solution of the sample. The sample solution is stirred until equilibrium is reached after which the drop is retracted into the Teflon rod.

Name: thermocouple
Label: thermocouple
Definition: A piece of apparatus that generates electrical current when it experiences a thermal gradient.

Name: quick_extended_x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: quick extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured 5001000 eV below the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy. A monochromator is scanned continuously and rapidly around the absorption edge resulting in measurement times of seconds normal EXAFS measurements take minutes.

Name: vibrational_spectroscopy
Label: vibrational spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy which probes the vibrational degrees of freedom of a molecule.

Name: synchrotron_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: synchrotron Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m produced in a synchrotron and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: laser_ablation
Label: laser ablation
Definition: A sample preparation method where material is removed from a specimen by illuminating it with a laser beam.

Name: reproducibility_standard_deviation
Label: reproducibility standard deviation
Definition: The standard deviation of independent measurements obtained with the same method on identical test material under different conditions.

Name: two_dimensional_small_angle_x_ray_scattering_data
Label: two-dimensional small-angle X-ray scattering data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an X-ray scattering experiment where two separate beams of X-rays scattered by a sample at low angles 010 deg.

Name: fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before the energy states of spin-active nuclei in the sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. The sample is then converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: amperometry
Label: amperometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured whilst the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is controlled.

Name: quality
Label: quality
Definition: A dependent entity that inheres in a bearer by virtue of how the bearer is related to other entities

Name: two_photon_emission_spectrum
Label: two-photon emission spectrum
Definition: A photoluminescence spectrum where the excitation process involves two-photon absorption.

Name: catalytic_reforming
Label: catalytic reforming
Definition: Any process in which the molecular structure of a hydrocarbon is rearranged to alter its properties e.g. its combustion characteristics in the presence of a catalyst and under a high pressure of H2 gas.

Name: ultra_fast_laser_spectroscopy
Label: ultra-fast laser spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured in the following fsns timescale is measured.

Name: four_dimensional_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: four-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which four independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals by employing three magnetisation transfer steps. Each signal is described by four frequencies thus effecting the distribution of signals within an axis of cubes.

Name: plasma_activation
Label: plasma activation
Definition: A process that involves improving the adhesion properties of a sample using short pulses of a plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals.

Name: alternating_current_dielectrophoresis
Label: alternating-current dielectrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their dielectrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium across which an alternating electric field is applied.

Name: paired_emitterdetector_diode_detection
Label: paired emitter–detector diode detection
Definition: A detection method that is based on light emitting diodes LEDs. One LED functions as a light source and the other LED is reverse biased to function as a light detector. Light from the source LED is passed through the sample and the intensity received by the detector LED is measured.

Name: size_exclusion_chromatography_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: size-exclusion chromatography-high-performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by size-exclusion and high-performance liquid chromatographies before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: immobilised_ph_gradient_based_isoelectric_focusing
Label: immobilised pH gradient-based isoelectric focusing
Definition: An electrophoresis method for the separation of amphoteric analytes according to their isoelectric points by the application of an electric field along a pH gradient. The pH gradient is formed during casting of the gels therefore cannot be altered during the experiment.

Name: mass_spectrometry
Label: mass spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the sample is converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: angle_resolved_synchotron_radiation_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved synchotron radiation photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation X-rayultraviolet generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: 121sb_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 121Sb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 121Sb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: silicon_29_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: silicon-29 solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for silicon-29 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: thermophoresis
Label: thermophoresis
Definition: A separation method where particles move at different speeds according to their thermal conductivity in a separation medium across which a thermal gradient is applied.

Name: electron_electron_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: electron-electron coincidence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of energy.

Name: supercritical_antisolvent_precipitation_with_enhanced_mass_transfer
Label: supercritical antisolvent precipitation with enhanced mass transfer
Definition: A solid sample is dissolved in a common organic or inorganic solvent then sprayed into a supercritical fluid held under pressure resulting in a large decrease in solution density. This effect leads to the reduction in solubility of the solid and precipitation. A surface vibrating at an ultrasonic frequency is used to atomise the solution jet into microdroplets during spraying increasing turbulence and mixing resulting in higher mass transfer and smaller particles.

Name: ribonucleic_acid
Label: ribonucleic acid
Definition: High molecular weight linear polymers composed of nucleotides containing ribose and linked by phosphodiester bonds RNA is central to the synthesis of proteins.

Name: molecular_entity
Label: molecular entity
Definition: Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom molecule ion ion pair radical radical ion complex conformer etc. identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity.

Name: spin_echo_wide_angle_neutron_scattering
Label: spin-echo wide angle neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the velocity of neutrons in known magnetic fields before and after scattering at wide angles by the sample. The neutrons are scattered by the interaction of neutron spin with spins in the sample 'spin echo'.

Name: vapour_phase_extraction
Label: vapour-phase extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a vapour to a solid phase by passing the vapour sample through a stationary phase e.g. silica particles and then desorbing it using a desorbent or carrier gas.

Name: recrystallisation
Label: recrystallisation
Definition: A technique for purifying a crystalline sample where the impure sample is dissolved in a small volume of solvent forming a supersaturated solution. As the temperature of the solution drops pure crystals form the impurities remaining dissolved in the solvent.

Name: spin_polarised_secondary_electron_spectroscopy
Label: spin-polarised secondary electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where primary electrons interact with a sample and the electrons emitted as a result of the interaction secondary electrons are detected. A magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the surface of the sample.

Name: specificity
Label: specificity
Definition: A data item that refers to the proportion of negatives in a binary classification test which are correctly identified

Name: manufacturer
Label: manufacturer
Definition: A person or organization that has a manufacturer role."en

Name: scattering_with_angular_limitation_projection_electron_beam_lithography
Label: scattering with angular limitation projection electron-beam lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses electrons to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a beam of electrons 100 keV is scanned across an ultrathin <150 nm thickness low-atomic-number patterned mask. Many of the electrons are scattered by the mask so the image is formed only by those electrons that pass through the membrane without scattering. The electrons induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'.

Name: specimen_from_organism
Label: specimen from organism
Definition: A specimen that derives from an anatomical part or substance arising from an organism. Examples of tissue specimen include tissue organ physiological system blood or body location arm."en

Name: sample_heating
Label: sample heating
Definition: A sample preparation step involving the increase in temperature of a sample.

Name: lithium_7_atom
Label: lithium-7 atom
Definition: The stable isotope of lithium with relative atomic mass 7.016004 92.5 atom percent natural abundance and nuclear spin 3/2.

Name: electron_diffraction_data
Label: electron diffraction data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an electron diffraction experiment.

Name: anion_exchange_chromatography
Label: anion-exchange chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where anions are retained by positively charged functional groups in the stationary phase.

Name: 31p_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 31P magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 31P nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: capillary_viscometry
Label: capillary viscometry
Definition: The determination of the viscosity of a fluid by measuring the time a defined volume of fluid requires to flow through a capillary tube of a specific length and width.

Name: 1h_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 1H magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 1H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: enzyme_digestion
Label: enzyme digestion
Definition: The decomposition of sample by an enzyme to obtain the sample in liquid form.

Name: apci__ms_spectrum
Label: APCI- MS spectrum
Definition: A mass spectrum obtained from negative mode atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry.

Name: scanning_transmission_electron_microscope
Label: scanning transmission electron microscope
Definition: A transmission electron microscope where the electron beam is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Name: automated_thermal_desorption_gas_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
