Label: automated thermal desorption-gas chromatography mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first adsorbed onto packed tubes e.g. Tenax then each tube is automatically moved into a desorption oven and heated 100280 C for 520 min to promote thermal desorption of the mixture into the headspace of the tube. The headspace is sampled and used for gas chromatography and the eluent is then ionised and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: exorcycle
Label: exorcycle
Definition: A phase cycle technique used in FT NMR experiments whereby the sense of application or phase of the rf pulses is altered on repeating the experiment to eliminate spectral artefacts. Exorcycle takes its name from the fact that it is used to remove 'phantom' and 'ghost' peaks. For the technique see J. Magn. Reson. 1977 27 pg 511.

Name: electron_spin_resonance_oximetry
Label: electron spin resonance oximetry
Definition: A technique used to measure the levels of oxygen in a sample by measuring the enhancement of relaxation rates proportional to O2 concentration of paramagnetic species 'labels' or 'probes' e.g. nitroxides in solution with O2 using ESR spectroscopy.

Name: ultraviolet_detector
Label: ultraviolet detector
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a light source a phototelectric cell a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light which is used to detect the absorbance of ultraviolet 190400 nm light by molecules in a sample separated by chromatography.

Name: homoepitaxy
Label: homoepitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from liquid or gaseous precursors on a monocrystalline substrate of the same substance.

Name: solute_role
Label: solute role
Definition: solute role is a role played by a chemical entity which is dissolved by another chemical entity the solvent when creating a solution"en

Name: rayleigh_scattering_spectroscopy
Label: Rayleigh scattering spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of Rayleigh scattered visible light.

Name: ion_pair_chromatography
Label: ion-pair chromatography
Definition: A type of column chromatography in which ions in solution can be 'paired' or neutralised and separated as an ion pair on a reversed-phase column. Ion-pairing agents are usually ionic compounds that contain a hydrocarbon chain.

Name: programmed_temperature_vaporisation
Label: programmed temperature vaporisation
Definition: A sample preparation method for gas chromatography in which the sample is deposited into the inlet of the chromatograph at a low temperature then the inlet temperature is rapidly raised to vaporise the desired components and cause their transfer onto the column.

Name: magnetic_trapping
Label: magnetic trapping
Definition: The trapping of microscopic particles by a localised magnetic field.

Name: triple_axis_neutron_scattering
Label: triple-axis neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction energy and momentum of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample and suffer a loss of kinetic energy during collisions.

Name: electrospinning
Label: electrospinning
Definition: A process used to created very fine m or nm scale fibres from a liquid. A high voltage is applied to a droplet of the liquid sample which is drawn out into fibres and cooled in air.

Name: analyte_assay
Label: analyte assay
Definition: An assay with the objective to capture information about the presence concentration or amount of an analyte in an evaluant."en

Name: cyclic_electrical_field_flow_field_fractionation
Label: cyclic electrical field-flow field fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying an alternating electric field perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of electrophoretic mobility.

Name: liquid_phase_epitaxy
Label: liquid-phase epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from liquid or melt precursors on a monocrystalline substrate.

Name: data_transformation_objective
Label: data transformation objective
Definition: An objective specification to transformation input data into output data"en

Name: hncocaha
Label: HN(CO)CAHA
Definition: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a isotopically enriched protein. The chemical shift of the backbone amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and with the alpha-carbon and proton of the preceding residue. The experiment name describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Name: scanning_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: scanning transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Name: electrochemical_quartz_crystal_microbalance
Label: electrochemical quartz crystal microbalance
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of  a quartz crystal resonator  which is used to measure the current efficiency mass-to-charge ratio during an electrochemical reaction by measuring the change in resonance frequency of the crystal.

Name: gas_solid_chromatography
Label: gas-solid chromatography
Definition: Gas chromatography where the stationary phase is a solid.

Name: phosphorus_31_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: phosphorus-31 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for phosphorus-31 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: 109ag_cross_polarisation_magic_angle_spinning
Label: 109Ag cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field. Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 109Ag nuclei.

Name: import_ontology_module
Label: import ontology module
Definition: A subset ontology module that is intended to be imported from another ontology."en

Name: site_selection_spectroscopy
Label: site-selection spectroscopy
Definition: A type spectroscopy where a sub-ensemble of molecules within an inhomogeneously broadened absorption band is selectively excited by means of a narrow-band laser and the fluorescence and phosphorescence signal is detected with a monochromator or interferometer.

Name: membrane_inlet_mass_spectrometry
Label: membrane-inlet mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a thin membrane usually made of a silicone elastomer provides a selective means introducing low-molecular-weight volatile organic compounds into the ionisation source.

Name: visible_thermal_lens_spectroscopy
Label: visible thermal lens spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy generated by nonradiative thermal relaxation after visible laser light absorption is measured.

Name: granulometry
Label: granulometry
Definition: The measurement of the size distribution in a collection of grains.

Name: sensor
Label: sensor
Definition: A piece of apparatus that is used to measure a physical quantity.

Name: synchrotron_radiation_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: synchrotron radiation X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with synchrotron radiation radiation produced by the movement of charged particles in a magnetic field and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions known as 'X-ray fluorescence' are detected.

Name: cycling_stability
Label: cycling stability
Definition: A measure of how the discharge capacity of a battery is maintained over a given number of cycles.

Name: titration
Label: titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached.

Name: tris_buffer
Label: Tris buffer
Definition: A buffer where the pH is maintained by a TrisHTris equilibrium. Tris  trishydroxymethylaminomethane.

Name: material_combination
Label: material combination
Definition: is a material processing with the objective to combine two or more material entities as input into a single material entity as output."en

Name: metal_oxide_affinity_chromatography
Label: metal oxide affinity chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the separation is caused by differing analyte-ligand interactions. Phosphorylated proteins and peptides are retained by metal oxide particles because of their affinity for the phosphate group.

Name: angle_resolved_resonant_x_ray_scattering
Label: angle-resolved resonant X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the energy loss of X-rays scattered by a sample as a function of emission angle where the incident X-ray energy is chosen to coincide with an electronic transition in the sample.

Name: dna_metallisation
Label: DNA metallisation
Definition: The deposition of a layer of metal on DNA by chemically reducing DNA-complexed metal salts e.g. Ag Pd Pt and Cu.

Name: photolithography
Label: photolithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. The photoresist is then exposed to a pattern of intense typically UV light and a post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: 14n_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 14N magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 14N nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: ultracentrifugation
Label: ultracentrifugation
Definition: A method where components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in an ultracentrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. Samples are spun at speeds of up to 150000 rpm.

Name: graphitisation
Label: graphitisation
Definition: The conversion of an organic material in an inert atmosphere at temperatures in excess of 1800 C to produce a graphite crystal structure.

Name: liquid_stationary_phase
Label: liquid stationary phase
Definition: A liquid that plays the role of the stationary component in chromatography and may be chemically bonded or immobilized onto a solid.

Name: pulsed_gradient_non_linear_spin_echo_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: pulsed gradient non-linear spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment used to measure small diffusion coefficients via the attenuation of signals occurring due to molecular diffusion during the application of pulsed field gradients.

Name: resonance_enhanced_laser_microprobe_spectroscopy
Label: resonance-enhanced laser microprobe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more finely focused <10 m diameter resonant laser beams lasers which have been tuned to match an electronic transition within the sample and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured.

Name: metal_evaporation
Label: metal evaporation
Definition: A synthesis technique where the substrate is placed in a vacuum <10{-4} Pa and a metal electrode e.g. Au Cr Zn or Pt is melted and evaporated by passing a current through it. When the metal atoms hit the ch cooler substrate they condense into nanoscale particles forming a thin deposit on the surface.

Name: small_angle_x_ray_diffraction_data
Label: small-angle X-ray diffraction data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an X-ray diffraction experiment where the X-rays are incident on the sample at small angles 010 degrees.

Name: image
Label: image
Definition: An image is an affine projection to a two dimensional surface of measurements of some quality of an entity or entities repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range where the measurements are represented as color and luminosity on the projected on surface."en

Name: femosecond_stimulated_raman_spectroscopy
Label: femosecond stimulated Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a femtosecond laser pulse by a sample is detected. The laser pulse is generated by the mixing of two lasers 'pump' and 'probe'.

Name: rotating_field_mass_spectrometry
Label: rotating-field mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry that uses sinusoidal radio frequency fields in the x- and y- direction differing in phase by 90 during ion detection. The ions of a particular mass travel in a helix and impact an ion detector  generating a pattern consisting of a set of concentric circles.

Name: nanoelectrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: nanoelectrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of nL min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: polymeric_membrane_extraction
Label: polymeric membrane extraction
Definition: The transfer of a solute from one phase the 'donor' or 'feed' phase to another the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase across a nonporous sillicon rubber membrane.

Name: zimm_plot
Label: Zimm plot
Definition: A plot obtained from a scattering experiment on large particles which is used to determine the average molecular weight of the polymer sample. The plot typically consists of a grid.

Name: gas_electrode
Label: gas electrode
Definition: An electrode that participates in a redox couple where the other partner is a gas.

Name: working_range
Label: working range
Definition: The range of measures which can be quantified with reasonable certainty for a given analytical procedure.

Name: amplitude_atomic_force_micrograph
Label: amplitude atomic force micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by using a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the deflection of the tip as a function of position.

Name: laser_spectroscopy
Label: laser spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured.

Name: solvothermal_synthesis
Label: solvothermal synthesis
Definition: A synthesis method for growing single crystals from a non-aqueous solution in an autoclave a thick-walled steel vessel at high temperature 400 C and pressure.

Name: transformed_data_set
Label: transformed data set
Definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a data transformation.

Name: relational_quality
Label: relational quality
Definition: b is a relational quality  Def. for some independent continuants c d and for some time t: b quality_of c at t  b quality_of d at t. axiom label in BFO2 Reference: 057-001"en

Name: nucleic_acid
Label: nucleic acid
Definition: A macromolecule made up of nucleotide units and hydrolysable into certain pyrimidine or purine bases usually adenine cytosine guanine thymine uracil D-ribose or 2-deoxy-D-ribose and phosphoric acid.

Name: vacuum_deposition
Label: vacuum deposition
Definition: The process of the settling of particles atoms or molecules from a vapour at sub-atmospheric pressure onto a pre-existing surface resulting in the growth of a new phase.

Name: thermal_decomposition
Label: thermal decomposition
Definition: The separation of a chemical compound into elements or smaller compounds by heating it to a high temperature approx. 1000 C.

Name: normal_photoelectron_diffraction
Label: normal photoelectron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure during photoelectron spectroscopy. Photons are directed at a sample and diffraction patterns resulting from the emission of electrons at 90 from the surface are recorded.

Name: liquid_chromatography_mass_spectrum
Label: liquid chromatography mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment of a sample mixture separated by liquid chromatography.

Name: 1h1h_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: 1H–1H correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons which are J-coupled usually 3 bonds apart.

Name: inferential_statistical_data_analysis
Label: inferential statistical data analysis
Definition: A statistical data analysis that uses patterns in the sample data to draw inferences about the population represented accounting for randomness.

Name: constant_initial_state_spectroscopy
Label: constant-initial-state spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation X-rayultraviolet generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. The energy distribution of electrons which have been promoted from a specific valence band is measured.

Name: x_ray_spectrum
Label: X-ray spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. energy obtained by measuring the number and energy of X-rays absorbed or emitted by a sample.

Name: 1h13c_heteronuclear_multiple_quantum_coherence
Label: 1H–13C heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 13C nuclei to which they are covalently bound. The magnetisation of both the proton and the 13C nucleus is allowed to evolve over time.

Name: flip_flop_spectroscopy
Label: flip flop spectroscopy
Definition: A sequence of composite pulses designed to allow isotropic mixing of magnetisation between nuclei. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn.Reson. 1988 77 pg 274.

Name: micromoulding_in_capillaries
Label: micromoulding in capillaries
Definition: A process for shaping pliable polymer materials using a microsized rigid frame or model called a 'mould'. The mould is brought into contact with a rigid substrate forming microchannels. The polymer material in fluid form fills these microchannels by capillary action. The polymer material is then cooled or cross-linked.

Name: rapid_expansion_of_supercritical_solutions
Label: rapid expansion of supercritical solutions
Definition: A technique where a solid sample is dissolved in a supercritical fluid and this mixture is then expanded using a restrictor causing the solid to precipitate.

Name: epifluorescence_microscope
Label: epifluorescence microscope
Definition: A fluorescence microscope where the light source is mounted above epi the specimen and the excitation light passes through the microscope objective lens on its way toward the specimen.

Name: x_ray_excited_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where X-ray bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons which are detected as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Name: fourier_transform_electrochemical_induced_impedance_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform electrochemical-induced impedance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the change in impedance the resistance of alternating current of an electrochemical cell is measured. A Fourier transform is then applied to the spectrum.

Name: two_dimensional_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: two-dimensional nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule <6 angstrom apart.

Name: variable_angle_polarised_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: variable-angle polarised absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the absorption of linearly p- polarised UV-vis light by a poled thin film sample as it is rotated about the vertical axis is recorded at incremental angles of incidence.

Name: wollaston_wire
Label: Wollaston wire
Definition: A composite wire consisting of a fine platinum core with a silver coating.

Name: densiometry
Label: densiometry
Definition: The measurement of the density of a sample.

Name: multiple_collector_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: multiple collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. A series of collectors ised used to detect several ion beams simultaneously.

Name: distortionless_enhancement_with_polarization_transfer
Label: distortionless enhancement with polarization transfer
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 13C nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.The 13C NMR signals are enhanced by transferring 1H magnetisation to 13C nuclei and the phase of the signals reflects the multiplicity i.e. CH CH2 or CH3. Separate methyl methylene and methine spectra may be obtained.

Name: dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of polarised light by a sample.

Name: chiral_chromatography
Label: chiral chromatography
Definition: A separation method where the components in this case stereoisomers are distributed between two chiral phases one of which is stationary while the other moves in a definite direction.

Name: correlation_spectroscopy_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: correlation spectroscopy-nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear three-dimensional NMR experiment in which a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled usually leq 3 bonds apart. These signals are then correlated to nuclei that are spatially proximate within the molecule leq 6 AA apart.

Name: photothermal_infrared_microscopy
Label: photothermal infrared microscopy
Definition: The measurement of the photothermal response temperature fluctuations of a specimen exposed to the beam of a Fourier transform infrared spectrometer using an atomic force microscope tip as the thermal probe.

Name: time_lapse_fluorescence_microscopy
Label: time-lapse fluorescence microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light and the specimen is imaged at regular time intervals over several hours.

Name: only_para_hydrogen_spectroscopy_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: only para-hydrogen spectroscopy correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled usually < 3 bonds apart. Thermal signals in the resulting spectra are then removed whilst keeping the signals from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Name: 119sn_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 119Sn Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 119Sn nuclei is detected.

Name: laser_sintering
Label: laser sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample with a laser e.g. a CO2 laser below its melting point until its particles adhere to each other.

Name: scanning_fluorescence_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: scanning fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume which is moving with respect to the sample.

Name: heteronuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: heteronuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule 6  apart.

Name: distortionless_enhancement_with_polarization_transfer_spectrum
Label: distortionless enhancement with polarization transfer spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the where the nuclei of interest are carbon-13 nuclei the signals from which are enhanced by the transfer of magnetisation from 1H nuclei.

Name: polarisation_inversion_and_spin_exchange_at_the_magic_angle
Label: polarisation inversion and spin exchange at the magic angle
Definition: Magic angle spinning NMR experiments in which dipolar coupling is reintroduced to obtain information on the proximity of nuclei within the sample.

Name: positive_ion_laser_desorption_mass_spectrometry
Label: positive ion laser desorption mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry using positive ionisation where a high-energy pulsed laser is used for sample vaporisation.

Name: difference_gel_electrophoresis
Label: difference gel electrophoresis
Definition: A two dimensional gel electrophoresis method where protein analytes have been previously labelled with different fluorescent dyes and different analytes are compared.

Name: angle_resolved_x_ray_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: profilometry
Label: profilometry
Definition: The measurement of the profile of a surface in order to quantify its roughness.

Name: two_dimensional_j_spectroscopy_diffusion_ordered_spectroscopy
Label: two-dimensional J-spectroscopy-diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Definition: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D J-spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Name: thermal_desorption_gas_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: thermal desorption-gas chromatography mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first adsorbed onto packed tubes e.g. Tenax then moved into a desorption oven and heated 100280 C for 520 min to promote thermal desorption of the mixture into the headspace of the tube. The headspace is sampled and used for gas chromatography and the eluent is then ionised and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: x_ray_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays and the X-ray absorption coefficient of the sample is measured. When the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron in an atom there is a decrease in the intensity of transmitted X-rays resulting in an absorption edge.

Name: continuous_dynode_electron_multiplier
Label: continuous-dynode electron multiplier
Definition: An electron multiplier that consists of a single electrode in the form of a horn of plenty. The ions impinge on the wall of the horn at the open end producing a cascade of electrons which is multiplied on each interaction with the wall and focussed onto a preamplifier.

Name: kugelrohr_distillation
Label: Kugelrohr distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. As the sample mixture to be purified is heated its vapours rise a short distance into a vertical condenser called a 'Kugelrohr' where they are cooled by water. This technique is used for small amounts of samples with high boiling points usually >300 C under greatly reduced pressure.

Name: flow_injection_electrothermal_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: flow injection electrothermal atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where flow injection is used to carry a sample to an electrothermal atomiser where it is atomised using a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Name: reactive_sputter_deposition
Label: reactive sputter deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a solid target is bombarded with energetic ions e.g. Ar causing atoms to be ejected 'sputtering'. The ejected atoms then react with a gas that is introduced into the chamber and the products deposit as a thin-film on a substrate.

Name: bes_buffer
Label: BES buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 2-bis2-hydroxyethylaminoethanesulfonic acid

Name: 23na_triple_quantum_excitation_in_combination_with_magic_angle_spinning
Label: 23Na triple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment used for 23Na nuclei involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Name: magneto_optical_rotatory_dispersion
Label: magneto-optical rotatory dispersion
Definition: The measurement of magneto-optical activity by placing the sample in a strong magnetic field and observing a beam of plane-polarized light which is directed along the magnetic field axis.

Name: temperature_resolved_x_ray_diffraction
Label: temperature-resolved X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate as a function of temperature.

Name: isocratic_elution_chromatography
Label: isocratic-elution chromatography
Definition: A separation method where the components are distributed between two phases one of which is stationary while the other moves in a definite direction the 'mobile' phase. In isocratic elution chromatography the elution solvent strength of the mobile phase remains constant during the separation.

Name: extractive_distillation
Label: extractive distillation
Definition: A method of separating two components of very similar boiling point from a mixture. A third miscible and high-boiling-point solvent is added to the mixture which causes a change in the volatilities of the components. These components are then vaporised by the application of heat and cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser.

Name: reflectance_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: reflectance circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential reflectance of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by a sample.

Name: confocal_fluorescence_microscopy_assay
Label: confocal fluorescence microscopy assay
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by scanning a gas Ar or Kr laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface and using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus fluorescence.

Name: normalised_isothermal_capacitance_transient_spectroscopy
Label: normalised isothermal capacitance transient spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities grain boundaries interfaces etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the normalised capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at constant different temperatures spectra are generated that exhibit peaks the height of which are proportional to time constant for the emission rate.

Name: chrono_coulometry
Label: chrono-coulometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the time-dependence of the total Coulombs of electricity required to complete fully oxidise or fully reduce the sample in an electrochemical reaction is measured whilst the current is held at a constant value.

Name: data_transformation
Label: data transformation
Definition: A planned process that produces output data from input data."en

Name: curing
Label: curing
Definition: A chemical process in which a prepolymer or polymer is converted into a polymer of higher molar mass and then into a network.

Name: isostatic_pressing
Label: isostatic pressing
Definition: The process of pressing a powder under a gas or liquid so that pressure is transmitted equally in all directions.

Name: zz_filter
Label: ZZ-filter
Definition: A technique used in NMR experiments to remove unwanted signals from the spectrum by destroying the magnetisation giving rise to these signals using a pulsed filed gradient whilst the magnetisation of interest is maintained in a state which is unaffected by the pulsed field gradient ZZ-state.

Name: hnca
Label: HNCA
Definition: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used in to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a isotopically enriched protein. The chemical shift of the backbone amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the alpha carbons of the same and preceding residues.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_fluorescence_detection_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography fluorescence detection-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: high_resolution_scanning_electron_micrograph
Label: high-resolution scanning electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by scanning a finely  focused <10 nm diameter electron beam across the specimen under vacuum. The specimen is tilted such that a low-order zone axis is closely parallel to the incident beam and columns of atoms are viewed end-on by the beam.

Name: orthogonal_acceleration_mass_spectrometry
Label: orthogonal acceleration mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised and the ions are accelerated to very high kinetic energies by an ion source that works by sampling an ion beam travelling in a direction orthogonal to the axis of the flight path in the mass-to-charge analyser.

Name: single_isomorphous_replacement_with_anomalous_scattering
Label: single isomorphous replacement with anomalous scattering
Definition: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a crystal of the sample substituted with heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for both the original crystal and the isomorph. When the absorption edge of an atom in the crystals is close to the wavelength of the incident radiation the atom becomes an anomalous scatterer. Anomalous scattering can be used for phase determination and also for determining the absolute configuration.

Name: thermoplastic_nanoimprint_lithography
Label: thermoplastic nanoimprint lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses mechanical deformation to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of resist a thermoplastic polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. A mould containing the desired nanosized pattern on its surface is then pressed into the resist whilst both the substrate and mould are heated to the glass transition temperature of the polymer. The resist is then cooled and any residual resist in the cast area is removed by an anisotropic etching process such as reactive ion etching.

Name: spectroscopic_ellipsometer
Label: spectroscopic ellipsometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a light source a polariser a compensator which elliptically polarises the light and a detector which is used to measure the intensity and change in polarisation of light reflected by a sample as a function of wavelength. This information in turn can be used to determine refractive index and thin film thickness.

Name: selective_ion_monitoring
Label: selective ion monitoring
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the intensities of one or more specific ion beams are recorded rather than the entire mass spectrum.

Name: suction_filtration
Label: suction filtration
Definition: The separation of a solid phase from a liquid phase by passing the sample through a porous medium under pressure.

Name: localised_surface_plasmon_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: localised surface plasmon resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the resonant excitation of surface plasmons usually on a Au or Ag nanosized surface by ultraviolet or visible light is measured.

Name: chiral_stationary_phase_gas_chromatography
Label: chiral stationary phase gas chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas and the stationary phase is a chiral high-boiling-point thermally-stable liquid such as a chiral polysiloxane.

Name: fluorescent_labelling
Label: fluorescent labelling
Definition: The process of covalently attaching a chemically-reactive derivative of a fluorophore to another molecule such as a protein or nucleic acid.

Name: remote_plasma_enhanced_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: remote plasma-enhanced chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors which react or decompose in a plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and are then transferred to the surface to produce a deposit. The plasma enhances the rate of reaction.

Name: pressureless_sintering
Label: pressureless sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating the powder sample below its melting point without applied pressure until its particles adhere to each other.

Name: trisacetateedta_buffer
Label: Tris–acetate–EDTA buffer
Definition: An acetate buffer solution prepared from Tris acetic acid and EDTA.

Name: pulsed_field_gel_electrophoresis
Label: pulsed-field gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium consisting of gel across which a pulsed electric field is applied one in which the voltage direction is periodically switched among three directions one that runs through the central axis of the gel and two that run at an angle of 120 either side.

Name: processed_material
Label: processed material
Definition: Is a material entity that is created or changed during material processing."en

Name: realizable_entity
Label: realizable entity
Definition: A specifically dependent continuant  that inheres in continuant  entities and are not exhibited in full at every time in which it inheres in an entity or group of entities. The exhibition or actualization of a realizable entity is a particular manifestation functioning or process that occurs under certain circumstances."en

Name: 27al_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 27Al nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 27Al nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: polarising_light_micrograph
Label: polarising light micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by placing the specimen between two orthogonal polarising filters illuminating it with visible light and using a system of magnifying lenses.

Name: uv_assisted_capillary_force_lithography
Label: UV-assisted capillary force lithography
Definition: A process for shaping pliable thermoplastic polymers. An elastomeric polyurethane acrylate mould is placed on a UV-curable polymer that has been spin- or drop-coated onto a substrate and partially cured using UV light 200400 nm. The system is then further exposed to UV light and capillary force allows the polymer melt to fill up the void space between the polymer and the mould. After cooling to ambient temperature the mould is removed generating the negative replica of the mould pattern.

Name: high_resolution_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: high-resolution magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field and using a high-resolution magnetic susceptibility matching probe.

Name: injury_by_flying_debris
Label: injury by flying debris
Definition: An adverse laboratory event in which an organism comes into contact with the debris from an explosion at high speed.

Name: 33s_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 33S nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 33S nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: gas_chromatography_oven
Label: gas chromatography oven
Definition: A piece of heating apparatus used to convert the sample into a gaseous mobile phase.

Name: fluorescence_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume. Ultraviolet light is used to stimulate fluorescence.

Name: scanning_probe_microscope
Label: scanning probe microscope
Definition: A microscope which uses a probe to scan the surface of the specimen mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the probe-surface interaction as a function of position producing an image of the surface. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: infrared_emission_spectroscopy
Label: infrared emission spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated and the infrared radiation 0.781000 m emitted during cooling is detected.

Name: inductively_coupled_plasma_torch
Label: inductively coupled plasma torch
Definition: An ion source that consists of a torch that is surrounded by a radio frequency generator that ionises argon gas inside the torch to form a high-temperature up to 10 000 K plasma that can be used to ionise analytes.

Name: microscopy
Label: microscopy
Definition: Any technique where a microscope is used to view a small object or specimen by producing a magnified image.

Name: centrifugation
Label: centrifugation
Definition: centrifugation is a process separating molecules by size or density using centrifugal forces generated by a spinning rotor. G-forces of several hundred thousand times gravity are generated in ultracentrifugation"en

Name: electrophoresis_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrophoresis-mass spectrometry
Definition: Any method where the sample is first separated by electrophoresis before being analysed by mass spectrometry.

Name: paper_spray_mass_spectrometry
Label: paper spray mass spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the sample spotted onto paper then solvent is applied and an electrically charged solvent is generated upon application of a high voltage. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: quantitative_confidence_value
Label: quantitative confidence value
Definition: A data item which is used to indicate the degree of uncertainty about a measurement."en

Name: colloidal_dispersion
Label: colloidal dispersion
Definition: A sample preparation method where solid particles are dispersed in a liquid phase.

Name: carbon_13_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: carbon-13 magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are carbon-13 nuclei and in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: dielectric_drying
Label: dielectric drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample by the application of radio frequency 3 Hz to 300 GHz or microwave 11000 mm radiation.

Name: 15n_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 15N nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 15N nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: reflection_electron_microscopy
Label: reflection electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV under vacuum. The electrons elastically scattered by the specimen are detected.

Name: continuous_wave_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: continuous-wave electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to a perturbing magnetic field is measured as a function of the frequency of a periodic perturbation.

Name: liquid_liquid_liquid_micro_extraction
Label: liquid-liquid-liquid micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a microlitre amount of an ionisable substance from an aqueous phase to another aqueous phase via an organic phase by performing simultaneous extraction and back-extraction between the phases.

Name: negative_stained_transmission_electron_micrograph
Label: negative-stained transmission electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons. The specimen is stained with heavy metals salts e.g. uranyl acetate to improve contrast.

Name: competition_dialysis
Label: competition dialysis
Definition: The separation of molecules in solution by the difference in their rates of diffusion through a semipermeable membrane. In competition dialysis an array of nucleic acid structures and sequences is dialysed against a common test ligand solution. After equilibration the amount of ligand bound to each structure or sequence is determined by absorbance or fluorescence measurements. Since all structures and sequences are in equilibrium with the same free ligand concentration the amount bound is directly proportional to the ligand binding affinity.

Name: energy_supply_function
Label: energy supply function
Definition: An energy supply function is a function to supply or transfer energy from an energy source to a consumer of the energy"en

Name: c18_column
Label: C18 column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is an octadecyl-bonded silica.

Name: potentiostat
Label: potentiostat
Definition: A piece of apparatus that maintains the potential through an electrochemical cell at a preset value.

Name: ultraviolet_lithography
Label: ultraviolet lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. The photoresist is then exposed to a pattern of intense UV light and a post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: piezo_driven_micromanipulator
Label: piezo-driven micromanipulator
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to physically interact with a sample under a microscope and is driven by the application of an alternating current to a piezoelectric material.

Name: adsorptive_stripping_voltammetry
Label: adsorptive stripping voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is first adsorbed onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped'. During removal the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes.

Name: transfer_function
Label: transfer function
Definition: A transfer function is a function to displace a material from one location to another."en

Name: sector_field_mass_spectrometry
Label: sector field mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample ions are directed into magnetic field the orientation of which is perpendicular to the beam. The magnetic field forces the charged particles into different circular trajectories the radii of which depend on the strength of the magnetic field the accelerating voltage and the mass of the ion.

Name: single_pulse_pulsed_laser_polymerization_electron_spin_resonance
Label: single pulse-pulsed laser polymerization-electron spin resonance
Definition: A technique for measuring the time-resolved concentration of radicals during polymerisation reactions. The polymerisation is initiated by a single pulse of laser radiation and the radical concentration is monitored by measuring response of the unpaired electrons to short ns pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field.

Name: glass_refractive_index_measurement
Label: glass refractive index measurement
Definition: The measurement of the refractive index of small glass fragments as a function of temperature. The glass fragments are placed in silicone oil and observed as the temperature is raised. At the point where the glass fragment disappear the refractive index of the oil and glass are equal.

Name: ph_induced_gelation
Label: pH-induced gelation
Definition: The formation of a gel from a solution by altering the pH of the solution.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_gas_phase_electrophoretic_mobility_molecular_analysis_spectrum
Label: electrospray ionisation gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis spectrum
Definition: A plot of electrophoretic mobility diameter vs. particle count generated by separating singly-charged complexes in air under the influence of an electric field. The complexes are charged by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 1-10 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: strong_cation_exchange_reversed_phase_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: strong-cation-exchange reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography
Definition: A type of column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. An initial separation proceeds in a primary ion-exchange column the particles of which shows no loss or gain of charge with varying pH and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column where the stationary phase is significantly less polar than the mobile phase.

Name: total_ion_chromatogram
Label: total ion chromatogram
Definition: A plot of the total ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection.  selectivity in the data. The total ion current chromatogram monitors a very large window often of several hundred mass-to-charge units.

Name: orbitrap_mass_spectrometry
Label: Orbitrap mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured by their oscillations along the centre electrode in an Orbitrap mass analyzer.

Name: penetration_of_personal_protective_equipment
Label: penetration of personal protective equipment
Definition: An event where a poisonous substance penetrates personal protective equipment endangering the experimenter.

Name: 1h109ag_heteronuclear_multiple_quantum_coherence
Label: 1H–109Ag heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 109Ag nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Name: nanoflow_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_electrospray_ionisation_quadrupole_time_of_flight_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography electrospray-ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry where there is a nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography separation step and an electrospray-ionisation mass selection step.

Name: diffuse_reflectance_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: diffuse reflectance circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential diffuse reflectance of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by a sample.

Name: thermogravimetry_differential_thermal_analysis
Label: thermogravimetry-differential thermal analysis
Definition: The measurement of the temperature difference between the sample and a reference material during the measurement of the mass of the sample as a function of temperature.

Name: number_concentration
Label: number concentration
Definition: Experimental method output expressing a concentration in terms of the number of entities of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture.

Name: stimulated_raman_loss_spectroscopy
Label: stimulated Raman loss spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from two lasers 'pump' and 'probe' by a sample is detected. In stimulated Raman gain spectroscopy the pump laser has a lower frequency than the probe laser.

Name: energy_dispersive_x_ray_chemical_map
Label: energy-dispersive X-ray chemical map
Definition: A data set derived from energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents X-ray energy. The image is obtained by stacking one EDX spectrum per energy value sequentially. Energy values are characteristic of the elements in the sample thus giving a distribution of elements in the imaged area. EDX chemical maps are sometimes shown in false colour.

Name: layer_by_layer_assembly
Label: layer-by-layer assembly
Definition: A synthesis method in which thin films of oppositely charged layers are deposited in sequence. Positive or negative charged species are adsorbed onto the sample surface by dipping the substrate into solutions. The excess solution after each adsorption step is rinsed with solvent.

Name: micromanipulator
Label: micromanipulator
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to physically interact with a sample under a microscope.

Name: mid_infrared_microscopy
Label: mid-infrared microscopy
Definition: Microscopy that involves the collection of spatially resolved mid-infrared spectra 38 m.

Name: operational_ph_cell
Label: operational pH cell
Definition: An electrochemical cell which is used for practical pH measurements consisting of a hydrogen ion-responsive electrode and a reference electrode immersed in the test solution.

Name: microwave_oven
Label: microwave oven
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a high- voltage transformer a cavity magnetron a waveguide and a sample chamber that is used to heat samples by irradiation with microwave 2 GHz radiation.

Name: desorption_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: desorption electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by directing charged solvent droplets which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary into an electric field at the sample surface. The droplets form a thin film on the sample surface dissolving the analyte of interest.

Name: proton_decoupled_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: proton-decoupled nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where J/scalar coupling patterns between protons and heteronuclei have been removed.

Name: dosimetry
Label: dosimetry
Definition: Measurement of the dose of a substance taken up by an object.

Name: one_dimensional_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: one-dimensional nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where only one frequency dimension is employed based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule <6 angstrom apart.

Name: pulse_discharge_photoionisation_detection
Label: pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Definition: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through a carrier gas generating high-energy 13.517.5 eV photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Name: colloid_method
Label: colloid method
Definition: Any method for the synthesis or processing of colloids mixtures where one substance is dispersed evenly throughout another.

Name: atomic_spectrum
Label: atomic spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorption or emission radiation vs. frequency that reflects the internal degrees of freedom of an atom obtained in an experiment where the sample is vaporised and then atomised.

Name: electroluminescence_detection
Label: electroluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence emitted from a sample as a result of the application of an electric current or a strong electric field.

Name: atomic_force_spectrum
Label: atomic force spectrum
Definition: A plot of force vs. distance obtained by measuring the force experienced by a tip against position on a surface.

Name: jet_deposition
Label: jet deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where a flow of precursors is projected onto a surface resulting in a deposit.

Name: glow_discharge_ion_source
Label: glow discharge ion source
Definition: An ion source that produces ions by continuous sputtering of the sample by a glow discharge plasma which is produced by passing a current of several hundred volts through a low pressiure gas usually argon.

Name: absorption_detected_magnetic_resonance
Label: absorption detected magnetic resonance
Definition: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by light absorption. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Name: nuclear_magnetic_resonance_pulse_sequence
Label: nuclear magnetic resonance pulse sequence
Definition: A series of short microsecond bursts pulses of rf radiation separated by delays of defined duration designed to interact with and manipulate the magnetic moments of spin-active nuclei during NMR spectroscopy.

Name: imaging_assay
Label: imaging assay
Definition: An assay that produces a picture of an entity."en

Name: 1h_spin_diffusion_experiment
Label: 1H spin diffusion experiment
Definition: An NMR experiment which exploits the increased efficiency of energy magnetisation transfer between 1H nuclei via dipolar coupling in rigid or semi-rigid samples. The rate at which polarisation is transferred between spins is measured giving information on the proximity and orientation of the interacting spins within the sample.

Name: magnetic_tweezers
Label: magnetic tweezers
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an electromagnet containing a paramagnetic core material with a tip-shaped end that is used to trap and manipulate magnetic particles.

Name: gel_filtration_chromatogram
Label: gel filtration chromatogram
Definition: A plot of detector signal e.g. ion count or  absorbance vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment where the separation is caused by differences in molecular size.

Name: statistical_data_analysis
Label: statistical data analysis
Definition: A data transformation that has input of mulitple data and report overall trend of the data.

Name: nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.

Name: electron_multiplying_charge_coupled_device_camera
Label: electron-multiplying charge-coupled-device camera
Definition: A piece of apparatus that converts optical brightness into an electrical signal using a EMCCD and then reproduces an image of the specimen.

Name: 29si_cross_polarisation_magic_angle_spinning
Label: 29Si cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field. Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 29Si nuclei.

Name: transmission_electron_energy_loss_spectroscopy
Label: transmission electron energy loss spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known narrow range of kinetic energies is transmitted through a sample and the energy distribution of the transmitted electrons is measured.

Name: neutron_activation_analysis
Label: neutron activation analysis
Definition: A type of activation analysis where a sample is bombarded with neutrons the capture of which results in the generation of radioactive nuclei for most elements in the sample. These activated nuclei then decay according to their characteristic half-lives.

Name: 17o_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 17O magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes oxygen-17 nuclei.

Name: sorption_measurement
Label: sorption measurement
Definition: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an inert gaseous or liquid substance the 'sorbent' usually H2 or N2 which adsorbs onto the surface of interest the 'sorbate'. Regression analysis is then applied to the data resulting in an isotherm.

Name: denaturing_gradient_gel_electrophoresis
Label: denaturing gradient gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles consisting of polynucleotides move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of a gel that contains a denaturing agent that causes double-stranded DNA to unzip across which an electric field is applied.

Name: magnetic_sector_mass_spectrometer
Label: magnetic sector mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer that uses a wedge-shaped magnetic field to separate the total ion beam into discrete ion beams according to the mass-to-charge ratio of the ions.

Name: vapour_pressure_osmometry
Label: vapour pressure osmometry
Definition: A technique used to determine the concentration of osmotically active particles that reduce the vapor pressure of a solution. Vapour pressure osmometry is used to measure the average molecular weight of polymers.

Name: single_quantum_filter
Label: single quantum filter
Definition: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting only uncoupled spins singlets usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase direction of application of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver.

Name: inferential_statistical_data_analysis_objective
Label: inferential statistical data analysis objective
Definition: A statistical data analysis objective where the aim is to make inference using population sample data.

Name: electrophoresis
Label: electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium across which an electric field is applied.

Name: x_ray_microemission_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray microemission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with a finely focused <10 m diameter X-ray beam and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions known as 'X-ray fluorescence' are detected.

Name: auger_electron_partial_yield_spectroscopy
Label: Auger electron partial yield spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. Only the Auger electrons emitted at a particular photon energy are detected.

Name: stationary_phase
Label: stationary phase
Definition: A solid gel or liquid that plays the role of the stationary component in chromatography.

Name: aerosol_jet_deposition
Label: aerosol jet deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where an aerosol containing precursors is projected onto a surface resulting in a deposit.

Name: sample_deposition
Label: sample deposition
Definition: The process of the settling of particles atoms or molecules from a solution suspension or vapour onto a pre-existing surface resulting in the growth of a new phase.

Name: data_set
Label: data set
Definition: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets."en

Name: polyol_method
Label: polyol method
Definition: The synthesis of metal-containing compounds in polyethylene glycols. The ethylene glycol acts as both the solvent and reducing agent.

Name: low_coherence_interference_microscopy
Label: low coherence interference microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with short-coherence length visible light split into two beams which then interfere to produce fringes whose spacing is proportional to the height of the specimen.

Name: fast_atom_bombardment_mass_spectrum
Label: fast-atom bombardment mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the ions are generated from the sample which is held in a liquid matrix by bombarding it with a stream of primary noble gas atoms.

Name: experimental_plan_revision
Label: experimental plan revision
Definition: An experimental planning process in which a plan specification is modified resulting in a new plan specification.

Name: ultraviolet_bremsstrahlung_isochromat_spectroscopy
Label: ultraviolet bremsstrahlung isochromat spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation in the ultraviolet region.

Name: radio_frequency_sputter_deposition
Label: radio frequency sputter deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a solid target is bombarded with energetic ions e.g. Ar generated in a magnetron a device that uses electrical and magnetic fields to generate heat causing atoms to be ejected 'sputtering'. The ejected atoms then deposit as a thin-film on a substrate. The sign of the anode-cathode bias is varied at a high rate to avoid charge build-up on insulating targets.

Name: crystal_growth_method
Label: crystal growth method
Definition: Any synthesis method used to grow crystals.

Name: cryogenic_deep_reactive_ion_etching
Label: cryogenic deep reactive-ion etching
Definition: The process of creating deep holes and trenches in a sample surface cooled to -110 C using short pulses of a plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals alternating with the deposition of a chemically inert passivation layer.

Name: weak_anion_exchange_column
Label: weak anion-exchange column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a weak anion exchanger.

Name: coherent_anti_stokes_raman_spectroscopy
Label: coherent anti-Stokes Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. A Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and an anti-Stokes frequency beam is observed. multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Name: 65cu_pulsed_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 65Cu pulsed electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of a 65Cu atom to short ns pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured.

Name: coulometry
Label: coulometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the total Coulombs of electricity required to complete fully oxidise or fully reduce the sample in an electrochemical reaction is measured.

Name: magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample and involving magic angle spinning.

Name: thermal_lens_microscopy
Label: thermal lens microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an excitation laser and a probe laser are focused onto a specimen forming a refractive index distribution which results in a concave excitation beam. The strength of this lens is proportional to the sample concentration and is detected by a change in transmittance in the probe beam.

Name: laser_induced_breakdown_spectroscopy
Label: laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a high energy laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source.

Name: x_ray_reflectometry
Label: X-ray reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at an extremely flat surface and measuring the intensity of the reflected X-rays as a function of angle. X-ray reflectometry is used to determine the structure of thin films.

Name: mass_analyzer
Label: mass analyzer
Definition: A Mass analyzer is a device that separates ions according to their mass-to-charge ratio. All mass spectrometers are based on dynamics of charged particles in electric and magnetic fields in vacuum where the two laws of Lorentz force law and Newton's second law of motion apply."en

Name: laser_light_scattering
Label: laser light scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered visible light. Light from a laser source is scattered by the electrons surrounding the atomic nuclei in the sample.

Name: cold_vapour_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: cold vapour atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where no vaporisation step is required because the sample is a volatile heavy metal such as mercury which is a vapour at room temperature.

Name: positive_electrospray_ionisation_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: positive electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised to positive ions by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets and where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: 15n_separated_local_field_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 15N separated-local-field nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A two-dimensional NMR experiment which exploits the differential dipolar couplings which 15N nuclei exhibit to their neighboring protons within local magnetic fields. The experiment consist of two time intervals: during the first time period the dipolar couplings are encoded in the NMR signal while in the detection period the signals of different nuclei are separated on the basis of their differences in chemical shift.

Name: dynamic_reaction_cell
Label: dynamic reaction cell
Definition: A piece of apparatus that contains a reagent gas that reacts preferentially with certain species in order to allow only the analyte ions into the mass-to-charge analyser and the detector.

Name: laser_vaporisation_method
Label: laser vaporisation method
Definition: A method for the synthesis of carbon nanotubes where a laser beam typically a YAG laser is focused onto a graphitemetal target located in a quartz tube surrounded by a furnace. The target is vaporised in high temperature Ar gas producing single-walled and double-walled carbon nanotubes which are collected at a trap.

Name: alpha_particle_spectrum
Label: alpha-particle spectrum
Definition: A plot of alpha-particle count vs. energy obtained by measuring the number and kinetic energies of alpha-particles emitted by a sample.

Name: open_tubular_column
Label: open-tubular column
Definition: A chromatography column in which either the inner tube wall or a liquid or active solid held stationary on the tube wall acts as the stationary phase and there is an open unrestricted path for the mobile phase.

Name: 1h_only_para_hydrogen_spectroscopy
Label: 1H only para-hydrogen spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment where pulsed field gradients are used to filter thermal signals from 1H NMR spectra whilst leaving those derived from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Name: air_sensitive_vacuum_distillation
Label: air-sensitive vacuum distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a high-boiling-point sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat at low pressure and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser. The vacuum is replaced by an inert gas once the distillation is complete.

Name: laser_enhanced_atomic_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: laser-enhanced atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where a laser is used to excite the atoms in the sample.

Name: phase_alternated_rotation_of_magnetisation
Label: phase alternated rotation of magnetisation
Definition: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments.

Name: titration_curve
Label: titration curve
Definition: A plot of volume of titrant vs. an independent variable e.g. pH or enthalpy obtained from a titration experiment.

Name: electric_sector
Label: electric sector
Definition: A piece of apparatus which applies an electric field in order to select ions that have the same kinetic energy from an ion beam.

Name: unmixed_reforming
Label: unmixed reforming
Definition: The reaction of natural gas or syngas with steam at high temperature 7001000 C in the presence of a nickel catalyst in order to produce hydrogen. The nickel catalyst is then oxidised with air and finally reduced back to the metal using more hydrocarbon gas.

Name: walden_plot
Label: Walden plot
Definition: A loglog plot of molar conductivity vs. viscosity which indicates the degree of ionicity of an ionic liquid. Plots are compared to the 'ideal' case of 0.01M KCl which exists as dissociated ions.

Name: multiple_laser_beam_interference_lithography
Label: multiple-laser-beam interference lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. The photoresist is then exposed to a pattern of intense UV light generated by the interference of multiple coherent lasers. A post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: labelling
Label: labelling
Definition: The process of attaching a label onto a substance. Labels are molecular entities that facilitate the detection through fluorescence radioactivity etc. of the species to which they are attached.

Name: acidbase_titration
Label: acid–base titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample an acid or base by adding measured increments of a titrant a base or acid until the endpoint at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached.

Name: polymer_synthesis_method
Label: polymer synthesis method
Definition: Any method used to prepare a polymer sample.

Name: sample_quenching
Label: sample quenching
Definition: Material processing in which a sample is cooled by immersion in a fluid.

Name: differential_scanning_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: differential scanning fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of the  fluorescence emitted by molecules excited using ultraviolet light is detected as it changes upon interaction of the molecule with its environment.

Name: inverse_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: inverse photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons and the photons emitted are detected.

Name: hydride_generation_atomic_absorption_spectroscopy
