Definition: A two-dimensional NMR experiment which exploits the differential dipolar couplings which nuclei exhibit to their neighboring protons within local magnetic fields. The experiment consist of two time intervals: during the first time period the dipolar couplings are encoded in the NMR signal while in the detection period the signals of different nuclei are separated on the basis of their differences in chemical shift.

Name: pulsed_field_electrophoresis
Label: pulsed-field electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium across which a pulsed electric field is applied a field in which the voltage changes direction.

Name: thermal_field_flow_fractionation
Label: thermal field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating polymer particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and heating one end whilst cooling the other. The polymer particles migrate towards the cooler plate and are then removed with a carrier liquid.

Name: high_speed_centrifugation
Label: high-speed centrifugation
Definition: A separation method where components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. Samples are spun at >5000 rpm.

Name: purification
Label: purification
Definition: Any technique used to physically separate an analyte from byproducts reagents or contaminating substances.

Name: line_source_atomic_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: line-source atomic absorption spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry using a line source of radiation.

Name: liquid_assisted_grinding
Label: liquid-assisted grinding
Definition: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by attribution friction impact or cutting in the presence of a small amount of solvent.

Name: strong_cation_exchange_reversed_phase_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: strong-cation-exchange reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample is first subjected to two-dimensional high-performance liquid chromatography passed through two columns in sequence -a primary ion-exchange column where the particles show no loss or gain of charge with varying pH and a secondary column where the stationary phase is significantly less polar than the mobile phase. The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: thin_layer_chromatography
Label: thin-layer chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the stationary phase is a thin 0.10 to 0.25 mm layer of sorbent applied to a firm backing such as glass aluminium or plastic sheet. An eluent  single solvent or solvent mixture is allowed to flow by capillary action through the sorbent starting at a point just below the applied samples. As the eluent front migrates through the sorbent the components of the sample also migrate but at different rates resulting in separation.

Name: electrochemical_deposition
Label: electrochemical deposition
Definition: A synthesis method in which a film of solid metal is deposited from a solution of ions onto an electrically conducting surface an electrode. Three electrodes are required working counter and reference and when sufficient current is passed through the solution metal ions are reduced at the working electrode.

Name: 1h15n_heteronuclear_multiple_quantum_coherence
Label: 1H–15N heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 15N nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Name: tauc_plot
Label: Tauc plot
Definition: A plot of ehv vs hv where e is the molar extinction coefficient that is used to determine the optical gap or 'Tauc gap' in amorphous thin film materials.

Name: single_crystal_x_ray_diffraction_data
Label: single-crystal X-ray diffraction data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an X-ray diffraction experiment where the specimen is a single crystal.

Name: two_dimensional_liquid_chromatography_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: two-dimensional liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated sequentially using two different liquid chromatography columns commonly ion-exchange followed by reversed-phase before being analysed by two mass spectrometers in series.

Name: fluorescence_activated_droplet_sorting
Label: fluorescence-activated droplet sorting
Definition: A method for separating cells where each one is suspended in a single aqueous droplet. A fluorogenic substrate is embedded in each cell and any cellular enzymes present bind to it producing fluorescence. The droplets then flow over a microfluidic chip which sorts each one according to the intensity of the fluorescence.

Name: electron_micrograph
Label: electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage under vacuum and detecting the transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays emitted.

Name: nitrogen_sorption_measurement
Label: nitrogen sorption measurement
Definition: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of N2 that adsorbs onto the surface of interest the 'sorbate'. Regression analysis is then applied to the data resulting in an isotherm.

Name: 139la_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 139La nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 139La nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: phase_inversion_technique
Label: phase inversion technique
Definition: Any method for the synthesis of polymer membranes that involves the polymer transforming from the liquid phase of the cast solution to the solid phase.

Name: solubility_in_water
Label: solubility in water
Definition: The concentration of a solute in a saturated solution of water and the solute.

Name: individual_protein_immunoprecipitation
Label: individual protein immunoprecipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid material a 'precipitate' consisting of a specific proteinantibody complex from a solution containing many different proteins.

Name: voltammogram
Label: voltammogram
Definition: A plot of cell current vs. the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes obtained from a voltammetry experiment.

Name: heteronuclear_correlation_spectrum
Label: heteronuclear correlation spectrum
Definition: A spectrum obtained from a heteronuclear correlation experiment.

Name: ultraviolet_detection
Label: ultraviolet detection
Definition: A detection method which is sensitive to unsaturated organic compounds. As the sample passes through a cell it is illuminated with light in the region 190-350nm and any absorption is detected.

Name: environmental_control_device
Label: environmental control device
Definition: An environmental control device is a device which has the function to control some aspect of the environment such as temperature or humidity."en

Name: inhalation_of_poisonous_fumes
Label: inhalation of poisonous fumes
Definition: An adverse laboratory event where an experimenter inhales poisonous fumes.

Name: thermal_evaporation
Label: thermal evaporation
Definition: A synthesis technique where the material to be deposited is heated until evaporation in a vacuum <10{-4} Pa and eventually deposits as a thin film by condensing on a cold substrate.

Name: figure_of_merit
Label: figure of merit
Definition: A data item that describes a non-adjustable specification of a method.

Name: direct_analysis_in_real_time_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: direct analysis in real time time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a corona discharge within a He atmosphere. Sample ions with different masses are then accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: electronic_tongue
Label: electronic tongue
Definition: A piece of apparatus that measures and compares tastes using a number of discrete sensors usually one for each of the five taste categories sourness saltiness bitterness sweetness and umami.

Name: mass_spectrometry_assay
Label: mass spectrometry assay
Definition: An assay that identifies the amount and type of material entities present in a sample by fragmenting the sample and measuring the mass-to-charge ratio of the resulting particles."en

Name: electron_nuclear_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a nuclear resonance is detected though its effect on an electron spin resonance.

Name: chemical_vapour_transport
Label: chemical vapour transport
Definition: A crystal growth method for metal dichalcogenides in which the starting materials high purity metal and chalcogen are placed in a quartz ampoule together with a transport agent e.g. iodine and heated in a furnace under a temperature gradient.

Name: radioactive_labelling
Label: radioactive labelling
Definition: The substitution of an atom or an ion present in the form of its stable isotope by a radioactive isotope of the same element.

Name: specifically_dependent_continuant
Label: specifically dependent continuant
Definition: A continuant that inheres in or is borne by other entities. Every instance of A requires some specific instance of B which must always be the same."en

Name: delayed_emission_detected_magnetic_resonance
Label: delayed emission detected magnetic resonance
Definition: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by delayed light emission. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Name: 113cd_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 113Cd nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 113Cd nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: infrared_spectroscopic_ellipsometry
Label: infrared spectroscopic ellipsometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating a sample with a continuous infrared wavelength light source and measuring the intensity and change in polarisation of the reflected light as a function of wavelength.

Name: 79br_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 79Br nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 79Br nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: satellite_transition_magic_angle_spinning
Label: satellite transition magic angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment where the selective excitation of central and satellite transitions during magic angle spinning is used for recording high-resolution NMR spectra of quadrupolar nuclei in solids. Central transitions are detected first followed by satellite transitions.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorptionionisation_quadrupole_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: matrix-assisted laser desorption–ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix such as dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. In the first stage the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes a quadrupole. In the second stage the sample ions are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: inductively_coupled_plasma_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: inductively coupled plasma time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The sample ions with different masses are then accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured.

Name: phosphorescence_detection
Label: phosphorescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence emitted over a long timescale from a sample as a result of irradiation with light.

Name: 113cd113cd_double_quantum_filtered_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: 113Cd–113Cd double-quantum-filtered correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 113Cd nuclei which are J-coupled usually <3 bonds apart. The response is edited by selecting only two-spin coupled systems usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase direction of application of the pulses in the experiment.

Name: aluminium_metallisation
Label: aluminium metallisation
Definition: The deposition of a layer of aluminium on a substrate usually to provide electrical contacts in devices. A number of techniques may be used for metallisation including evaporation and sputter coating.

Name: macromolecule
Label: macromolecule
Definition: A macromolecule is a molecule of high relative molecular mass the structure of which essentially comprises the multiple repetition of units derived actually or conceptually from molecules of low relative molecular mass.

Name: laser_dissociation_spectroscopy
Label: laser dissociation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser and molecules in the sample dissociate following the absorption of one or more high-energy photons.

Name: chemiluminescence_detection
Label: chemiluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence emitted from a sample as a result of a chemical reaction.

Name: ion_microprobe_spectroscopy
Label: ion microprobe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectrocsopy where a finely focused <10 m diameter beam of ions is directed at a sample and the secondary ions emitted are detected.

Name: carrier_extraction_using_pulsed_voltage_method
Label: carrier extraction using pulsed voltage method
Definition: A method for measuring charge carrier mobilities and conductivities by applying two sequentional square-shaped voltage pulses and measuring the resulting current.

Name: spin_polarised_inverse_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: spin-polarised inverse photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a magnetised ferromagnetic sample is bombarded with electrons of a specific spin polarisation which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation.

Name: electron_transfer_detection
Label: electron transfer detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to peptides. Anions transfer electrons to multiply protonated peptides inducing fragmentation of the peptide backbone.

Name: spin_counting_experiment
Label: spin counting experiment
Definition: An NMR experiment which measures the variation in amplitude of signals from dipolar-coupled nuclei over time yielding information about the number of coupled nuclei in the system.

Name: raman_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: Raman circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: The observation of circular dichroism the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light in the Raman spectra of chiral molecules.

Name: laser_ablation_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised using a laser pulse then ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: electron_spin_resonance_spectrum
Label: electron spin resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to spin-state transitions of unpaired electrons against a perturbing magnetic field in the presence of fixed-frequency microwave radiation. EPR spectra are often represented without axes.

Name: states_acquisition
Label: States acquisition
Definition: A technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments to achieve frequency discrimination of the signals in the additional dimensions. For each value of the evolution time two FIDs are recorded and the signal is sine-modulated.

Name: atomic_absorption_glow_discharge_spectroscopy
Label: atomic absorption glow-discharge spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where a glow discharge a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas is used to atomise the sample before it absorbs ultra-violet or visible light atoms at characteristic wavelengths.

Name: slurry_nebulisation_electrothermal_vaporisation_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: slurry nebulisation electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a solid sample is ground to a fine powder and suspended in a diluent such as 0.1 HNO3 before being vaporised by a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it. The vaporised sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: acceleration_mass_spectrometry
Label: acceleration mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised and the ions are accelerated to very high kinetic energies.

Name: capillary_sieving_electrophoresis
Label: capillary sieving electrophoresis
Definition: An electrophoresis method that takes place in a capillary and where the separation medium contains a reticulated system for example an entangled polymer network that further separates the analytes according to their size and shape.

Name: sieving_electrophoresis
Label: sieving electrophoresis
Definition: An electrophoresis method where the separation medium contains a reticulated system for example an entangled polymer network that further separates the analytes according to their size and shape.

Name: gravimetric_analysis
Label: gravimetric analysis
Definition: A method used to determine an analyte on the basis of a mass of a sample.

Name: sample_sublimation
Label: sample sublimation
Definition: Any technique used to purify a sample by forcing it to pass from the solid to gas phase without passing through an intermediate liquid phase.

Name: solid_sampling_electrothermal_vaporisation_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: solid sampling electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a solid sample is vaporised by depositing it on a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it. The vaporised sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: vibrational_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: vibrational circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised infrared radiation during a vibrational transition.

Name: lithography
Label: lithography
Definition: Any synthesis technique involving the transfer of a pattern to a material a 'resist' by selective exposure to a radiation source e.g. light or X-rays or to a beam of charged particles. Upon irradiation the material experiences a change in its physical properties. Excess material is then removed by a liquid 'developer' or an etching process.

Name: resonant_soft_x_ray_reflectometry
Label: resonant soft X-ray reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at a surface e.g. a thin film and measuring the complex index of refraction as a function of incident X-ray energy near the absorption edge.

Name: hybrid_physicalchemical_vapour_deposition
Label: hybrid physical–chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method that involves both the chemical decomposition of a precursor gas and the vaporization of a solid source e.g. the growth of MgB2 involves both diborane gas and solid Mg.

Name: stimulated_raman_gain_spectroscopy
Label: stimulated Raman gain spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from two lasers 'pump' and 'probe' by a sample is detected. In stimulated Raman gain spectroscopy the probe laser has a lower frequency than the pump laser.

Name: drum_drying
Label: drum drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample by applying it as a thin layer to the surface of a heated drum.

Name: differential_pulse_anodic_stripping_voltammetry
Label: differential pulse anodic stripping voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is first electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped' by applying an oxidising potential as a series of voltage pulses of increasing amplitude. During removal the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The current is sampled before and after each voltage pulse.

Name: spin_echo_pulse_sequence
Label: spin echo pulse sequence
Definition: A pulse cluster used in NMR experiments which manipulates signals such that at the end of the sequence the effects of chemical shift differences have been compensated/removed. Used most simply to compensate for inhomogeneities in the magnetic field but delays in the sequence also permit various possible manipulations of the magnetisation. For the pulse sequence see Phys. Rev. 1950 80 pg 580.

Name: editors_ontology_module
Label: editors ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that is intended to be directly edited typically managed in source control and typically not intended for direct consumption by end-users."en

Name: surface_plasmon_resonance_spectrum
Label: surface plasmon resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of reflectance vs. incident frequency or angle obtained by measuring the resonant excitation of surface plasmons usually on a Au or Ag surface by ultraviolet or visible light.

Name: inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometer
Label: inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer that uses an inductively coupled plasma torch an ion source that consists of a torch that is surrounded by a radio frequency generator that ionises argon gas inside the torch to form a high-temperature up to 10 000 K plasma that can be used to ionise analytes.

Name: mass_spectrometer
Label: mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer is an instrument which is used to measure the mass to charge ratio of ions. All mass spectrometers consist of three basic parts: an ion source a mass analyzer and a detector system. The stages within the mass spectrometer are: 1. Production of ions from the sample 2. Separation of ions with different masses 3. Detection of the number of ions of each mass produced 4.Collection of data to generate the mass spectrum"en

Name: liquidsolid_chromatography
Label: liquid–solid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid and the stationary phase is a solid.

Name: comparison_light_microscopy
Label: comparison light microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where two specimens can be compared by illuminating them with visible light using two identical sets of microscope lenses which are linked by an optical bridge.

Name: optogalvanic_spectroscopy
Label: optogalvanic spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the current passing through a gas discharge is monitored as a laser light source is tuned through the frequencies of allowed transitions for excited atoms in the discharge.

Name: clustered_data_set
Label: clustered data set
Definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a class discovery data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned discovered class labels."en

Name: annular_dark_field_scanning_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: annular dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted before reaching the specimen and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample. An annular aperture is used to select electrons that have passed through given symmetric zones within the objective lens of the microscope.

Name: fluorescence_detection_assay
Label: fluorescence detection assay
Definition: An assay in which a material's fluorescence is determined."en

Name: directed_self_assembly
Label: directed self-assembly
Definition: A synthesis method in which the components of the sample spontaneously and reversibly associate by non-covalent interactions taking the form of an existing lithographically templated structure or pattern.

Name: supercritical_angle_fluorescence_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: supercritical angle fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample emitted at supercritical angles are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume. Ultra-violet light is used to stimulate fluorescence.

Name: thermoelectrically_cooled_angle_coating
Label: thermoelectrically cooled angle coating
Definition: A process for applying a thin cover to flat substrates by placing a drop of the coating solution on the substrate and then placing it inside a cooled box to control the speed of evaporation at an angle of 9 to initiate evaporation evaporation from the top of the substrate.

Name: 19f1h_heteronuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: 19F–1H heteronuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between 19F and 1H nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule <6 AA apart.

Name: gamma_ray_spectrum
Label: gamma-ray spectrum
Definition: A plot of gamma-ray count vs. energy spectrum obtained by measuring the number and energy of gamma-rays emitted or absorbed by a sample.

Name: differential_scanning_calorimetry_curve
Label: differential scanning calorimetry curve
Definition: A plot of enthalpy vs. temperature obtained by measuring the enthalpy required to increase the temperature of a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: catalytic_steam_reforming_of_ethanol
Label: catalytic steam reforming of ethanol
Definition: The reaction of ethanol with steam at high temperature 7001000 C in the presence of a nickel catalyst in order to produce hydrogen.

Name: anode
Label: anode
Definition: Electrode at which reduction takes place.

Name: anatomical_cluster
Label: anatomical cluster
Definition: Anatomical group whose component anatomical structures lie in close proximity to each other.

Name: low_temperature_electrothermal_vaporisation_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: low-temperature electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a solid sample is vaporised by depositing it on a probe which is rapidly heated to <1000 C by passing a current through it. The vaporised sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: high_pressure_carbon_monoxide_method
Label: high-pressure carbon monoxide method
Definition: A synthesis method for carbon nanotubes that involves mixing high pressure e.g. 30 atmospheres CO that has been preheated 1000 C and a catalyst precursor gas metal carbonyl or metallocene. Under these conditions the precursor decomposes forming metal particle clusters on which carbon nanotubes nucleate and grow. The carbon nanotubes are 99 single-walled carbon nanotubes with small diameters e.g. 55 tubes.

Name: isothermal_calorimetry
Label: isothermal calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy at constant temperature during a chemical or biochemical reaction.

Name: continuant
Label: continuant
Definition: An entity that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts."en

Name: environmental_scanning_electron_microscopy
Label: environmental scanning electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV is scanned across the specimen in a gaseous environment and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen is determined.

Name: b_cell_receptor_complex
Label: B cell receptor complex
Definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is present in the plasma membrane of B cells and that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains and a signaling subunit a heterodimer of the Ig-alpha and Ig-beta proteins.

Name: cyclic_voltammetry
Label: cyclic voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied linearly and inverts at the end point resulting in a cycle.

Name: micellar_electrokinetic_chromatography
Label: micellar electrokinetic chromatography
Definition: Electrokinetic chromatography where the secondary phase is a micellar dispersed phase.

Name: ragone_plot
Label: Ragone plot
Definition: A plot of specific energy of an electrochemical cell vs. its specific power.

Name: dynamic_surface_tensiometry
Label: dynamic-surface tensiometry
Definition: The measurement of the surface tension of a non-static liquid.

Name: ultraviolet_raman_spectroscopy
Label: ultraviolet Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from an ultraviolet laser by a sample is detected.

Name: obsolete_separation_method_detection_method
Label: obsolete: separation method-detection method
Definition: An experiment in which a separation method is coupled to a detection method in order to detect one or more different components of a sample.

Name: material_anatomical_entity
Label: material anatomical entity
Definition: Anatomical entity that has mass.

Name: linear_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: linear dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption parallel and perpendicular to the orientation axis of linearly polarised light by a sample.

Name: cell
Label: cell
Definition: A material entity of anatomical origin part of or deriving from an organism that has as its parts a maximally connected cell compartment surrounded by a plasma membrane.

Name: experimental_plan_creation
Label: experimental plan creation
Definition: An experimental planning process in which a plan specification is created de novo.

Name: dark_field_scanning_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted before reaching the specimen and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample.

Name: nuclear_magnetic_resonance_titration
Label: nuclear magnetic resonance titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is monitored by observing the changes in sucessive NMR spectra taken after each addition of titrant.

Name: powder_x_ray_diffraction_data
Label: powder X-ray diffraction data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an X-ray diffraction experiment where the specimen is a powder.

Name: cryogenic_scanning_electron_microscopy
Label: cryogenic scanning electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV is scanned across an electron transparent specimen under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured. Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV is scanned across the specimen which is cooled in liquid ethane to 180 C under vacuum and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen is determined.

Name: imnoaffinity_microextraction
Label: imμnoaffinity microextraction
Definition: Microextraction using an antibody where the specificity is related to the specificity of the antibody to the compound of interest.

Name: triple_quadrupole_mass_spectrometer
Label: triple quadrupole mass spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source a mass-to-charge analyser a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The detector is a linear sequence of three quadrupole mass-to-charge analysers which hold the ions in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Name: negative_mode_atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionization_mass_spectrometry
Label: negative mode atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry
Definition: Atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry where the sample is ionized by interaction with negative ions.

Name: open_chromatographic_bed
Label: open chromatographic bed
Definition: A piece of apparatus that is planar and is or hosts the stationary bed in chromatography.

Name: chemical_map
Label: chemical map
Definition: A data set derived from microspectroscopy consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents spectral wavelength. The image is obtained by stacking one image per spectral wavelength sequentially.

Name: infrared_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: infrared absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region 0.78 to 1000 micrometres.

Name: ion_cyclotron_resonance_cell
Label: ion cyclotron resonance cell
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of paired trapping plates receiver plates and transmitter plates which provides a magnetic field that coherently excites ions according to their cyclotron frequencies which depend on their mass-to-charge ratio.

Name: high_power_impulse_magnetron_sputter_deposition
Label: high power impulse magnetron sputter deposition
Definition: Magnetron sputter deposition where the ionisation process uses extremely high power densities of the order of kW cm-2 in short pulses.

Name: stripping_potentiometry
Label: stripping potentiometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped'. During removal the time-dependence of the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: polarising_light_microscopy
Label: polarising light microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen placed between two orthogonal polarising filters and illuminated with visible light.

Name: near_infrared_fluorescence_microscopy
Label: near-infrared fluorescence microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by illuminating it with radiation in the near infra-red region 0.82.5 x3bcm.

Name: laser_microprobe_mass_spectrometry
Label: laser microprobe mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised and ionised using a finely focused <10 um diameter high-energy pulsed laser.

Name: melt_cooling
Label: melt cooling
Definition: The process of allowing a sample a glass or polymer at its melting point to cool at a controlled rate in order to cause changes in morphology or properties.

Name: microwave_plasma_assisted_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: microwave plasma-assisted chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors in the presence of a microwave-induced plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit. The plasma enhances the rate of reaction on the substrate surface.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high.

Name: synchrotron
Label: synchrotron
Definition: A large-scale particle accelerator in which a magnetic field is used to create the particle orbits. Synchrotrons produce X-ray vacuum ultraviolet and broadband infrared radiation.

Name: micro_filtration
Label: micro-filtration
Definition: A pressure-driven membrane-based separation process in which particles and dissolved macromolecules larger than 0.1 micrometre are rejected.

Name: nanosecond_laser_flash_photolysis
Label: nanosecond laser flash photolysis
Definition: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong nanosecond pulse the 'pump' pulse of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Name: diode_array_detector
Label: diode array detector
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a two-dimensional pattern of diodes and a prism that is used to detect organic compounds. As the sample passes through a cell or cuvette it is illuminated with light in the region 1901100 nm and any light transmitted through the sample is dispersed by the prism so that light of different wavelengths falls on different diodes. The output from the array is used to construct an absorption spectrum that can be compared with standard spectra for identification purposes. Alternatively a single diode can be used to monitor a specific wavelength at which there is maxim absorption.

Name: polymer
Label: polymer
Definition: A polymer is a mixture which is composed of macromolecules of different kinds and which may be differentiated by composition length degree of branching etc..

Name: cell_permeabilization
Label: cell permeabilization
Definition: A protocol application to permeabilize cell membranes allowing molecules to more easily pass through the membrane than was possible prior to the protocol application"en

Name: differential_confocal_microscopy
Label: differential confocal microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where visible light coming from the specimen which is placed approximately half a confocal parameter from the focal plane along the optical axis of the microscope is collected and guided through a pinhole before it is detected. The pinhole allows only light from the focal point to pass to the detector reducing background interference.

Name: high_resolution_electron_microscopy
Label: high-resolution electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum. The specimen is tilted such that a low-order zone axis is closely parallel to the incident beam and columns of atoms are viewed end-on by the beam. The interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected. HREM imaging is used to explore crystal structures and imperfections on the atomic scale.

Name: thermodilatometry
Label: thermodilatometry
Definition: The measurement of a dimension of the sample under negligible load as a function of temperature.

Name: parallel_icp_ms_and_ei_ms_detection_after_gc_separation
Label: parallel ICP-MS and EI-MS detection after GC separation
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography before part of the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance. Another part of the sample is simultaneously ionised by electrons energy 70 eV which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: diffusion_ordered_spectrum
Label: diffusion-ordered spectrum
Definition: A two- or three-dimensional plot of one- or two-dimensional NMR spectra vs. the diffusion coefficients of the species involved.

Name: electron_paramagnetic_resonance_monitored_oxidationreduction_titration
Label: electron paramagnetic resonance monitored oxidation–reduction titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by monitoring a redox process until the endpoint at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. The titration is followed by monitoring the amplitude of an EPR signal the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to a perturbing magnetic field from one of the reactants.

Name: chemical_cytometry
Label: chemical cytometry
Definition: A method for analysing cells suspended in a stream of fluid. Cells are loaded with fluorescent substrates reporters followed by laser-based lysis of a single cell and loading of its contents into an overlying capillary where chemical separation is accomplished via capillary electrophoresis.

Name: slotted_disc
Label: slotted disc
Definition: A disc with a slot in it.

Name: calcination
Label: calcination
Definition: The heating of a sample to high temperatures in air or oxygen.

Name: isothermal_pyrolysis
Label: isothermal pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy during which the temperature is held constant.

Name: electricity_supply_function
Label: electricity supply function
Definition: An electricity supply function is an energy supply function to transfer electricity from one source to another typically a consumer of the electricity or as a stimulus during a neuroscience experiment."en

Name: inelastic_atom_scattering
Label: inelastic atom scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction and energy of scattered He atoms. The He atoms suffer energy loss upon scattering by colliding inelastically with surfaces leading to the absorption or emission of surface phonons.

Name: liquid_chromatography_refractive_index_detection
Label: liquid chromatography-refractive index detection
Definition: A liquid chromatography method where detection is based on the change in refractive index of a solution. Light passes through a hollow prism and is focused on a photocell. When the mobile phase is allowed to flow through the prism the light diverges from its original path and the change in intensity and angle of the transmitted light is measured.

Name: image_acquisition_function
Label: image acquisition function
Definition: An image acquisition function is a function to acquire an image of a material"en

Name: electron_spin_echo_envelope_modulation_spectrum
Label: electron spin-echo envelope modulation spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to electron spin-echo envelope modulation against the resonant frequency of the unpaired electrons.

Name: dynamic_secondary_ion_mass_spectrometry
Label: dynamic secondary ion mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a continuous focused beam of primary mass-selected ions which remove material from the surface of the sample by sputtering. The secondary ions ejected from the sample are then detected.

Name: liquid_polymer_infiltration
Label: liquid polymer infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with polymer precursors.

Name: liquid_scintillation_counting
Label: liquid scintillation counting
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous emission of a beta-particle produces a flash of light known as a 'scintillation' which is detected.

Name: presaturation
Label: presaturation
Definition: An NMR technique whereby particular resonances are saturated their spin-state populations are equalised. Commonly used to suppress solvent signals.

Name: frequency_modulation_spectroscopy
Label: frequency modulation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser which is tuned to match an absorption frequency of the molecules in the sample.

Name: confocal_micrograph
Label: confocal micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by illuminating the specimen with visible light and passing the light through pinhole before it reaches a system of magnifying lenses. The pinhole allows only light from the focal point to pass to the detector reducing background interference.

Name: x_ray_powder_diffractometer
Label: X-ray powder diffractometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus which illuminates a powder sample with X-rays electrons or neutrons and measures the diffraction pattern produced. It typically will contain at least one monochromator to ensure the incident radiation is of a specific energy a goniometer which allows the geometry of the sample and detector to be precisely specified and a detector.

Name: plasma_jet_deposition
Label: plasma jet deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where a plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons containing precursors is projected onto a surface resulting in a deposit.

Name: epifluorescence_microscopy
Label: epifluorescence microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by illuminating it with light of specific wavelengths. In epifluorescence microscopy light is transmitted through the objective lens onto the specimen eliminating the need to filter out unwanted light directly from the source.

Name: photoacoustic_spectrum
Label: photoacoustic spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the sound emitted when a gaseous sample is exposed to an intense laser beam which is rapidly interrupted by a rotating slotted disk.

Name: multiple_isomorphous_replacement
Label: multiple isomorphous replacement
Definition: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a number of crystals of the sample substituted with different heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for each crystal.

Name: electrothermal_vaporisation_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Plasma mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised by depositing it on a probe which is rapidly heated to >1000 deg C by passing a current through it.

Name: neutron_spectroscopy
Label: neutron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a beam of neutrons is used to probe atomic and magnetic dynamics.

Name: solgel_capillary_micro_extraction
Label: sol–gel capillary micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a small solgel-coated fused-silica capillary.

Name: pulsed_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: pulsed nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: fluorescence_titration_curve
Label: fluorescence titration curve
Definition: A plot of volume of titrant vs. fluorescence intensity obtained from a fluorescence titration experiment.

Name: immunoglobulin_complex
Label: immunoglobulin complex
Definition: A protein complex that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains held together by disulfide bonds and sometimes complexed with additional proteins. An immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space in mucosal areas or other tissues or circulating in the blood or lymph.

Name: high_frequency_conductometric_titration
Label: high-frequency conductometric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is monitored by measuring the conductance of the solution the current is provided by a high-frequency source.

Name: micro_dialysis
Label: micro-dialysis
Definition: The separation of molecules in solution by the difference in their rates of diffusion across a semipermeable membrane. The membrane is attached to a small probe <10 m diameter which is inserted into the sample.

Name: multi_layer_micromoulding
Label: multi-layer micromoulding
Definition: A process for shaping pliable polymer material using multiple microsized rigid frames or models called 'moulds'. The polymer material in liquid form is injected into a mould using a small diameter piston and then allowed to harden or set inside the mould adopting its shape.

Name: reversed_phase_nanoflow_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: reversed-phase nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry where the sample mixture is first separated by reversed-phase nanoflow high performance liquid chromatography.

Name: thermal_desorption_spectroscopy
Label: thermal desorption spectroscopy
Definition: A method of observing desorbed molecules from a surface when the surface temperature is increased. The sample is heated slowly in a vacuum and residual gas in the vacuum is detected as a change in pressure.

Name: phase_cycle
Label: phase cycle
Definition: A technique used in FT NMR experiments whereby the sense of application or phase of the rf pulses is altered on repeating the experiment such that addition of the resulting signals results in increased intensity for the signals of interest elimination of artefacts and more effective noise reduction.

Name: solid_phase_epitaxy
Label: solid-phase epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing an amorphous film on a monocrystalline substrate then heating the substrate to crystallise the film.

Name: equimolar_spectrophotometry
Label: equimolar spectrophotometry
Definition: A method where the absorption of radiation in the ultraviolet to near-infrared 0.1-2.5 x3bcm is used to calculate stability constants by equimolar dilution.

Name: glow_discharge_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: glow discharge atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a glow discharge a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas is used to excite the sample.

Name: spectroscopic_photoemission_and_low_energy_electron_microscope
Label: spectroscopic photoemission and low energy electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which combines a low energy electron microscope LEEM and an energy filtered x-ray photoemission electron microscope XPEEM.

Name: diffuse_reflectance_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: diffuse reflectance infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the diffuse reflection of infrared radiation by a sample is measured.

Name: stirring
Label: stirring
Definition: Mixing involving the agitation of a solution through circular motion.

Name: synchrotron_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: synchrotron circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised synchrotron radiation radiation produced by the movement of charged particles in a magnetic field.

Name: gel_filtration_chromatograph
Label: gel filtration chromatograph
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an eluent supply system an injection or sampling system a column containing a swollen gel a detector and a data acquisition/ processing system that is used to carry out chromatographic separations.

Name: size_exclusion_chromatography_flame_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: size-exclusion chromatography-flame atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by size-exclusion chromatography and then aspirated aerosolised and mixed with combustible gases such as acetylene and air or acetylene and nitrous oxide. The mixture is then ignited and atomised in a flame whose temperature ranges from 21002800 degC. During combustion atoms of the element of interest in the sample absorb light at characteristic wavelengths.

Name: incredible_natural_abundance_double_quantum_transfer_experiment
Label: incredible natural abundance double quantum transfer experiment
Definition: A 2D NMR technique which correlates commonly one-bond J-coupled homonuclei. In one dimension the signals appear at the chemical shift of a particular nucleus and in the other dimension at a position which is the sum of the frequencies of that nucleus and its J-coupled partner.

Name: power_supply
Label: power supply
Definition: A power supply is an device or part of a device that permits the required application of a defined electrical charge to an instrument. The power supply may permit the defined application of a given amount of current for a defined length of time."en

Name: scattered_molecular_aggregate
Label: scattered molecular aggregate
Definition: a material entity that consists of all the molecules of a specific type that are located in some bounded region and which is part of a more massive material entity that has parts that are other such aggregates"en

Name: atomic_absorption_spectrometer
Label: atomic absorption spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a light source that emits light at element-specific wavelengths a sample aspirator a flame or furnace apparatus for volatilising the sample and a photon detector that is used to measure the atomic absorption spectrum of a sample. Atoms in the sample of a specific wavelength will absorb light produced by the lamp before it reaches the detector and the amount of light absorbed depends on the quantity of the element present in the sample.

Name: contain_function
Label: contain function
Definition: A contain function is a function to constrain a material entities location in space"en

Name: inductively_coupled_plasma_atomic_fluorescence_spectrometry
Label: inductively coupled plasma atomic fluorescence spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where a plasma generated by electromagnetic induction is used to excite the atoms in the sample.

Name: conversion_spectrum
Label: conversion spectrum
Definition: A plot of a quantity related to the absorption for example absorbance or cross section multiplied by the quantum yield for the process considered against a measure of photon energy such as frequency wavenumber or wavelength.

Name: 63cu_pulsed_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 63Cu pulsed electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of a 63Cu atom to short ns pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured.

Name: cryogenic_electron_microscopy
Label: cryogenic electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen which is cooled in liquid ethane to 180 C is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected.

Name: reflection_extended_x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: reflection extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured 5001000 eV below the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy. Measurements are taken under total reflection conditions.

Name: thermospray_mass_spectrum
Label: thermospray mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the ions are obtained by forcing a pressurised solution of the sample through a heated metal capillary tip.

Name: temperature_gradient_chemical_vapour_infiltration
Label: temperature-gradient chemical vapour infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with or deposition from a vapour accelerated by a temperature gradient.

Name: 6li_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 6Li nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 6Li nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: eluent_function
Label: eluent function
Definition: A function which is realized as elution.

Name: particle_beamhollow_cathode_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: particle-beam/hollow-cathode atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a glow discharge a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas is used to excite the sample. A nebuliser is used to generate a finely dispersed aerosol containing the sample which is desolvated and a momentum separator is used to inject dry particles of the analyte the 'particle beam' into the plasma source which consists of a hollow cylindrical metal cathode containing the metal for excitation and an anode.

Name: incident_photon_conversion_efficiency_spectrum
Label: incident photon conversion efficiency spectrum
Definition: A plot of incident photon-to-current conversion efficiency IPCE vs. wavelength obtained from a solar or photovoltaic cell.

Name: x_filter
Label: X-filter
Definition: A technique used in NMR of isotopically enriched samples usually 13C/15N to select for or to remove signals of protons bound to a particular isotope.

Name: thin_film_deposition
Label: thin-film deposition
Definition: Any technique for depositing a thin film of material onto a substrate or onto previously deposited layers.

Name: electroluminescence_spectrum
Label: electroluminescence spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity against wavelength obtained by measuring the intensity of radiation emitted by a sample through electroluminescence emission of light as a result of the application of a current or an electric field against wavelength.

Name: bicine_buffer
Label: bicine buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving NN-bis2-hydroxyethylglycine.

Name: resonance_ion_dissociation_spectroscopy
Label: resonance ion dissociation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a sample in the form of ions is illuminated with a resonant laser a laser which is tuned to match a transition within the sample and molecules in the sample dissociate following the absorption of one or more high-energy photons.

Name: reforming
Label: reforming
Definition: Any process in which the molecular structure of a hydrocarbon is rearranged to alter its properties e.g. its combustion characteristics.

Name: biosensor
Label: biosensor
Definition: A sensor that recognises the analyte under study by interaction with a given biological system.

Name: argon_atmosphere
Label: argon atmosphere
Definition: A laboratory atmosphere consisting of argon.

Name: grazing_angle_x_ray_diffraction
Label: grazing-angle X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. The incident X-ray beam strikes the sample at a small angle <5 close to the critical angle of total external X-ray reflection.

Name: faraday_cup
Label: Faraday cup
Definition: An ion detector consisting of a collector electrode connected to a high-ohmic resistor and surrounded by a Faraday cage. The voltage drop across the resistor is a measure of the ion current.

Name: field_flow_fractionation
Label: field-flow fractionation
Definition: Any separation technique based on the application of a field perpendicular to a flow stream in a narrow channel.

Name: phosphorescent_labelling
Label: phosphorescent labelling
Definition: The process of covalently attaching a phosphorescent molecule to another molecule such as a protein or nucleic acid.

Name: liquid_chromatography_ion_trap_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography-ion trap mass spectrometry
Definition: Amethod where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised and the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric or magnetic field.

Name: tin_119_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: tin-119 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for tin-119 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: double_quantum_filter
Label: double quantum filter
Definition: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting only two-spin coupled systems usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase direction of application of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_source
Label: electrospray ionisation source
Definition: An ion source that consists of a syringe pump a needle a power source and a counter electrode or 'cone' that is used to ionise samples for mass spectrometry.

Name: reverse_osmosis
Label: reverse osmosis
Definition: A separation process which involves using pressure to force a solution through a membrane retaining the solute on one side and allowing the pure solvent to pass to the other side. This is the reverse of the normal osmosis process which is the natural movement of solvent from an area of low solute concentration through a membrane to an area of high solute concentration.

Name: longitudinally_detected_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: longitudinally detected electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the longitudinal response of an atom with an unpaired electron in a magnetic field to two transverse waves is detected.

Name: ultraviolet_thermal_lens_spectroscopy
Label: ultraviolet thermal lens spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy generated by nonradiative thermal relaxation after ultraviolet laser light absorption is measured.

Name: electrochemical_coulometer
Label: electrochemical coulometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an electrolytic cell that is used to determine electric charge by measuring the amount of an element deposited or released at the cathode during a specified time.

Name: isotope_ratio_mass_spectrometry
Label: isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the relative abundance of isotopes in a sample is determined.

Name: coherent_anti_stokes_resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: coherent anti-Stokes resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. A Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and an anti-Stokes frequency beam is observed and the difference between the pump and the anti-Stokes beams coincides with the frequency of an electronic transition within the molecule. multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Name: ball_milling
Label: ball milling
Definition: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by grinding with one or more inert balls ceramic flint or stainless steel 28 mm diameter rotating around a horizontal axis.

Name: direct_liquid_injection_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: direct liquid injection chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more liquid precursors which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: temperature_programmed_oxidation
Label: temperature-programmed oxidation
Definition: Thermal analysis of a system where the consumption of dioxygen in moles per second per gram of material is measured against temperature.

Name: collinear_fast_ion_beam_laser_spectroscopy
Label: collinear fast ion-beam laser spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of a high-speed accelerated beam of ions which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample and light absorption is measured.

Name: spin_coating
Label: spin coating
Definition: A coating method for applying a thin <1 m thickness cover to flat substrates where an excess amount of coating solution in a volatile solvent is placed on the substrate which is then rotated at high speed 8000 rpm for approximately 30 s in order to spread the solution by centripetal force. The solvent then evaporates leaving a thin film.

Name: figure_of_merit_determination
Label: figure-of-merit determination
Definition: An assay that determines a figure of merit for a given technique analyte and matrix. This will consist of multiple assays of a reference material.

Name: dry_etching
Label: dry etching
Definition: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by sputtering or dissolving using reactive ions or a vapour-phase etchant

Name: laser_trapping
Label: laser trapping
Definition: The trapping of microscopic particles by a focused laser beam. The beam is focused through a microscope objective producing a strong electric field gradient at its narrowest point which attracts dielectric particles.

Name: ion_exchange_column
Label: ion-exchange column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is an ion exchanger.

Name: scanning_electron_acoustic_microscopy
Label: scanning electron acoustic microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a pulsed electron beam is scanned over the surface of the specimen in order to generate elastic waves which are reflected and detected.

Name: infrared_scattering_near_field_optical_microscopy
Label: infrared scattering near-field optical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe consisting of an infrared laser transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to <10 nm from the surface of the specimen and focused to a diffraction-limited spot size. A vibrating metallic AFM cantilever tip periodically and locally modifies the electromagnetic field distribution of the excitation laser. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the scattered light from the tip as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: burum_linder_ernst_windowless_pulse_sequence
Label: Burum, Linder, Ernst windowless pulse sequence
Definition: A sequence of pulses used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effect of homonuclear dipolar couplings. A train/sequence of pulses is used to cyclically manipulate the signal whilst stroboscopic sampling ensures the effects of coupling are unobserved. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. 1981 44 pg 173.

Name: 95mo_electron_nuclear_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 95Mo electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 95Mo nuclei of a sample and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Name: 1h13c_heteronuclear_multiple_bond_coherence
Label: 1H–13C heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 13C nuclei which are 2 to 3 bonds removed.

Name: chromatography_column
Label: chromatography column
Definition: Chromatography column in chemistry is a tube and contents typically glass used to purify individual chemical compounds from mixtures of compounds. It is often used for preparative applications on scales from micrograms up to kilograms."en

Name: 19f_spin_counting_experiment
Label: 19F spin counting experiment
Definition: An NMR experiment which measures the variation in amplitude of signals from dipolar-coupled 19F nuclei over time yielding information about the number of coupled nuclei in the system.

Name: storage
Label: storage
Definition: A planned process with the objective to preserve and protect material entities by placing them in an identified location which may have a controlled environment."en

Name: amplifier
Label: amplifier
Definition: A piece of apparatus that can increase the power of a signal.

Name: lithographically_induced_self_assembly
Label: lithographically induced self-assembly
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses mechanical deformation to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of resist a thermoplastic polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. A mould containing the desired nanosized pattern on its surface is then held above the resist whilst both the substrate and mould are heated to the glass transition temperature of the polymer. The resist is then cooled and any residual resist in the cast area is removed by an anisotropic etching process such as reactive ion etching. During the heatcool cycle the initially flat polymer film self-assembles into periodic supramolecular pillar arrays.

Name: batch_injection_calorimetry
Label: batch injection calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of the enthalpy change during a chemical reaction in order to measure the amount of the imiting reagent.

Name: high_resolution_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrum
Label: high-resolution electrospray ionisation mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment  where the ions are obtained by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. When the ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios the exact mass is determined as opposed to the nominal mass the number of protons and neutrons.

Name: electron_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: electron ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by electrons energy 70 eV which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field.

Name: high_frequency_conductometry
Label: high-frequency conductometry
Definition: The measurement of the conductance of a solution as a function of concentration. Measurements are made indirectly across the resistance of the solution with high-frequency alternating current >0.1 MHz.

Name: 1h_electron_nuclear_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 1H electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 1H nuclei of a sample and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Name: x_ray_lithography
Label: X-ray lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique which uses X-rays to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a beam of X-rays is scanned across a patterned mask. The mask consists of an X-ray absorber e.g. Au on a membrane that is transparent to X-rays e.g. SiC. The X-rays induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'.

Name: peptisation
Label: peptisation
Definition: Reversal of coagulation or flocculation i.e. the dispersion of aggregates to form a colloidally stable suspension or emulsion

Name: small_angle_x_ray_scattering
Label: small-angle X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample at low angles 010.

Name: vapour_phase_growth
Label: vapour-phase growth
Definition: A synthesis method for carbon nanotubes where an organometallic precursor typically tungsten-based is vaporised then heated in an Ar and C2H2 atmosphere to 950 C.

Name: electrophoretic_light_scattering
Label: electrophoretic light scattering
Definition: A method for determining the electrophoretic mobility and zeta-potential of a sample of colloidal particles in solution by illuminating the sample with a light source usually a laser and measuring the time dependent fluctuations in the frequency of the scattered light caused by an oscillating electric field.

Name: forced_flow_chemical_vapour_infiltration
Label: forced-flow chemical vapour infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with or deposition from a vapour held at high pressure.

Name: electron_capture_negative_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: electron capture negative ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with thermal electrons electrons with energy 0.1 eV or less.

Name: buffer_solution
Label: buffer solution
Definition: A solution that contains a conjugate acidbase pair in equilibria and hence resists changes to its pH near the pK value of the acid.

Name: three_dimensional_1h1h_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: three-dimensional 1H–1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A three-dimensional plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for hydrogen-1 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field. Signals are defined in terms of three frequencies by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and in the other two by the chemical shifts of correlated nuclei.

Name: recorded_image
Label: recorded image
Definition: A data set consisting of a 2D representation obtained from a sample.

Name: electronic_sum_frequency_generation_spectroscopy
Label: electronic sum-frequency generation spectroscopy
Definition: A method for generating surface-specific electronic spectra by mixing two light beams at a surface and detecting the output beam which has frequency equal to the sum of the two input frequencies.

Name: gas_chromatograph_mass_spectrometer_transfer_line
Label: gas chromatograph-mass spectrometer transfer line
Definition: A piece of apparatus connecting a gas chromatograph to a mass spectrometer.

Name: stop_flow_lithography
Label: stop-flow lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. Shuttered pulses 30100 ms of mask-defined UV 365 nm light are flashed into a stationery layer of monomer which is sandwiched inside a microchannel before being flushed out. The process is then repeated in a cyclic manner.

Name: forster_resonance_energy_transfer
Label: Forster resonance energy transfer
Definition: A method for determining the distance between molecules using an energy transfer between two chromophores a donor and an acceptor in close proximity typically <10 nm via a nonradiative long-range dipole-dipole coupling mechanism.

Name: electron_induced_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: electron-induced photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured. The energy of the incident electrons is usually greater than the ionisation energy of the sample and the photoelectrons are emitted with the excess in the form of kinetic energy.

Name: microwave_spectrum
Label: microwave spectrum
Definition: A plot of emission vs. wavelength obtained through a Fourier transform of the time series of the radiation emitted by a sample of gas phase molecules that have been excited by a microwave-frequency pulse.

Name: process_boundary
Label: process boundary
Definition: p is a process boundary Def. p is a temporal part of a process  p has no proper temporal parts. axiom label in BFO2 Reference: 084-001"en

Name: heat_release_rate_curve
Label: heat-release-rate curve
Definition: A plot of heat release W/m2 vs. time obtained during a calorimetry experiment.

Name: square_wave_voltammogram
Label: square-wave voltammogram
Definition: A plot of cell current vs. the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes obtained from a square-wave voltammetry experiment.

Name: capacitively_coupled_plasma_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: capacitively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma generated by a potential difference between two electrodes one of which is grounded and one of which is live.

Name: 13c15n_edited_1h1h_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: 13C–15N edited 1H–1H nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A 4D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of carbon-bound protons with those of their associated 13C nuclei and with the chemical shift of spatially proximate amide protons <6A and the 15N nuclei to which these are bound.

Name: mid_infrared_emission_spectroscopy
