Label: mid-infrared emission spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated and the mid infrared radiation 0.781000 m emitted during cooling is detected.

Name: enzyme_dependent_fluorescence_recovery_after_photobleaching
Label: enzyme-dependent fluorescence recovery after photobleaching
Definition: A method for determining the distribution of enzyme activity in a sample by photobleaching a specific fluorescent metabolite during microscopy and monitoring its enzymatically-driven recovery.

Name: mossbauer_spectrum
Label: Mossbauer spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. velocity obtained by measuring the intensity and kinetic energy of a beam of gamma-rays transmitted through a solid sample.

Name: solid_phase_extraction_inductively_coupled_plasma_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: solid phase extraction inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample mixture is first separated by solid phase extraction and then excited using a plasma generated by electromagnetic inductance.

Name: steric_field_flow_fractionation
Label: steric field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating large  channel width particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel. Normally particles migrate towards the walls of the channel but large particles are unable to approach the walls and when a carrier liquid is passed through the channel these particles are removed first.

Name: capillary_force_lithography
Label: capillary force lithography
Definition: A process for shaping pliable thermoplastic polymers. An elastomeric mould is placed on a polymer that has been spin-coated onto a substrate. The system is then heated above the glass transition temperature of the polymer. Capillary force allows the polymer melt to fill up the void space between the polymer and the mould. After cooling to ambient temperature the mould is removed generating the negative replica of the mould pattern.

Name: nanoparticle_synthesis
Label: nanoparticle synthesis
Definition: A material processing process that is intended to produce nanoparticles.

Name: reciprocal_space_method
Label: reciprocal-space method
Definition: Any detection or measurement method for a set of points in reciprocal space.

Name: high_resolution_transmission_electron_micrograph
Label: high-resolution transmission electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with several finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beams under vacuum and using the phase contrast between transmitted interfering electron waves.

Name: graphitized_carbon_liquid_chromatography
Label: graphitized carbon liquid chromatography
Definition: A separation method where the components are distributed between two phases one of which is stationary and made from graphitized carbon and the other moves in a definite direction.

Name: analyte_role
Label: analyte role
Definition: The role inhering in that portion of a sample which is measured by an experiment.

Name: coulometer
Label: coulometer
Definition: Any piece of apparatus used to measure electric charge.

Name: multiphoton_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: multiphoton ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with an ultraviolet laser. The sample absorbs two or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Name: two_dimensional_heteronuclear_single_quantum_coherence_nuclear_overhauser_effect_spectroscopy
Label: two-dimensional heteronuclear single quantum coherence-nuclear Overhauser effect spectroscopy
Definition: A 2D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of spatially proximate protons with the chemical shifts of all of one type of their covalently bound heteronuclei.

Name: one_dimensional_proton_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: one-dimensional proton nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for hydrogen-1 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: optical_coherence_domain_reflectometry
Label: optical coherence-domain reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by illuminating an extremely flat surface with visible light and interfering the light reflected from the sample at the Brewster angle with light reflected from a reference mirror. Intereference only occurs when the difference in the optical path lengths between the two mirrors is within the coherence length of the optical source.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_gas_phase_electrophoretic_mobility_molecular_analysis
Label: electrospray ionisation gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis
Definition: A separation method where singly-charged complexes move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in air under the influence of an electric field. The sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 1-10 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: electron_cyclotron_resonance_mass_spectrometry
Label: electron cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
Definition: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by superimposing a static magnetic field and a high-frequency electromagnetic field at the electron cyclotron resonance frequency the frequency at which an electron precesses in a magnetic field.

Name: direct_recoil_spectroscopy
Label: direct recoil spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a focused beam of ions is directed at a sample causes binary collisions with surface molecules which result in molecular decomposition and the emission of atoms.

Name: discharge_mass_spectrometry
Label: discharge mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by an electrical discharge.

Name: fluorescence_resonance_energy_transfer
Label: fluorescence resonance energy transfer
Definition: A method for determining the distance between molecules using an energy transfer between two fluorescent chromophores a donor and an acceptor in close proximity typically <10 nm via a nonradiative long-range dipole-dipole coupling mechanism. Energy transfer usually occurs between a cyan fluorescent protein donor and a yellow fluorescent protein acceptor.

Name: sodium_cacodylate_buffer
Label: sodium cacodylate buffer
Definition: A buffer solution in which the pH 6.47.4 is maintained by an cacodylic acid sodium cacodylate NaCH32 AsO2 equilibrium.

Name: microwave_induced_plasma_atomic_emission_spectrometry
Label: microwave induced plasma atomic emission spectrometry
Definition: Atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma generated by microwave bombardment is used as the excitation source.

Name: supercritical_drying
Label: supercritical drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample without passing through the liquidgas boundary by immersion in a supercritical fluid and de-pressurisation.

Name: 45sc_triple_quantum_excitation_in_combination_with_magic_angle_spinning
Label: 45Sc triple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment used for 45Sc nuclei involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Name: infrared_fluorescence_microscopy
Label: infrared fluorescence microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by illuminating it with radiation in the infra-red region 2.516 x3bcm.

Name: flip_back_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: flip-back nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of heteronuclear two-dimensional NMR spectroscopy incorporating a water flip-back sequence based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule 6  apart.

Name: thermomagnetometry
Label: thermomagnetometry
Definition: The measurement of the magnetic susceptibility of a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: two_dimensional_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: two-dimensional high performance liquid chromatography
Definition: High performance liquid chromatography where initial separation proceeds in a primary column and parts of the eleuent from this column are into a secondary column.

Name: aluminium_27_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: aluminium-27 magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are aluminium-27 nuclei and in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: luminescence_spectroscopy
Label: luminescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of luminescence emitted by molecules excited is detected as a function of wavelength or time.

Name: 17o_electron_nuclear_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 17O electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 17O nuclei of a sample and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Name: equipment_specification_datum
Label: equipment specification datum
Definition: A data item that describes a non-adjustable specification of a piece of equipment.

Name: shake_flask_extraction
Label: shake-flask extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to an appropriate liquid phase during which the sample and solvent are kept in contact in a mechanical shaker.

Name: scanning_tunnelling_microscopy
Label: scanning tunnelling microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp conducting probe or 'tip' held very close 1 nm to the surface of the specimen. A bias voltage is applied between the tip and specimen which causes a tunnelling current to flow. An image is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the tunnelling current as a function of position.

Name: fourier_transform_raman_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of light produced by a single laser pulse by a sample is detected and the spectrum is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: headspace_extraction
Label: headspace extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a solid or liquid matrix to the vapour phase by heating.

Name: multi_metal_deposition
Label: multi-metal deposition
Definition: A development method where the substrate is first immersed in a colloidal gold solution containing negatively charged gold particles at low pH. Gold subsequently deposits on any organic molecules containing postively charged groups at this pH. In the second step the surface is treated with a solution containing silver acetate and hydroquinone which causes the reduction of silver ions producing a silver deposit on the exisiting gold layer. multi-metal deposition is used to enhance latent fingermarks.

Name: micropen_lithography
Label: micropen lithography
Definition: A synthesis method where a pattern or ink layer is deposited on a substrate using a liquid dispensed through a microsized conical nozzle. The movement of the 'micropen' is controlled by a computer program.

Name: catalytic_combustion_detection
Label: catalytic combustion detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds containing CH bonds. An electric current is passed through a tiny coil of platinum wire embedded in a catalytic ceramic bead heated to 500 C by the coil. A flow of air carries the sample to the bed and when a hydrogen or a hydrocarbon molecule impacts the hot coil it combusts on the surface raising the temperature and resistance of the platinum wire. The resistance change is then measured.

Name: isotachophoretic_focusing
Label: isotachophoretic focusing
Definition: An electrophoresis method where colloidal particles move at different speeds in a separation medium that has an electrophoretic mobility gradient so that the analytes move and stack in the order of their electrophoretic mobilities.

Name: electrophoretic_deposition
Label: electrophoretic deposition
Definition: Any synthesis process where colloidal particles suspended in a liquid medium migrate under the influence of an electric field and are deposited on an electrode.

Name: atomic_force_microscopy_cantilever
Label: atomic force microscopy cantilever
Definition: A cantilever used in atomic force microscopy to transmit force from the tip to a recording device.

Name: super_resolution_bright_field_microscopy
Label: super-resolution bright-field microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective and image resolution which is normally limited by diffraction is enhanced by processing the images with image restoration algorithms.

Name: sample_dispersion
Label: sample dispersion
Definition: The distribution of particles of one phase in a continuous phase of a different nature.

Name: positron_annihilation_lifetime_spectroscopy
Label: positron annihilation lifetime spectroscopy
Definition: A method for probing the free volume between polymer chains in which the anti-particle of an electron a positron is injected from a radioactive source into the sample. When the positron is annihilated a characteristic energy is emitted and the time from injection to energy emission is measured.

Name: diagram
Label: diagram
Definition: A figure that expresses one or more propositions"en

Name: nativenative_two_dimensional_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: native–native two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both native polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. In native polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis protein molecules move at different speeds in non-denaturing conditions according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied.

Name: lock_release_lithography
Label: lock-release lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. Shuttered pulses 30100 ms of mask-defined UV 365 nm light are flashed into a stationery layer of monomer inside microchannel. Objects generated by this process are 'locked' by relief structures in the channel before being flushed out. The process is then repeated in a cyclic manner.

Name: 1h15n_heteronuclear_single_quantum_coherence
Label: 1H–15N heteronuclear single quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 15N nuclei to which they are covalently bound. Only the magnetisation of the 15N nucleus is allowed to evolve.

Name: raman_microscope
Label: Raman microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a laser beam <10 m diameter a monochromator and a detector coupled to an optical microscope which is used to measure Raman spectra.

Name: 7li_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 7Li nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes 7Li nuclei.

Name: attenuated_total_reflectance_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: attenuated total reflectance infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where infrared light is introduced into a prism at an angle exceeding the critical angle for internal reflection. This produces an evanescent wave at the reflecting surface a surface which is transparent to infrared such as thallium bromide on which the sample is supported and the distortion of the evanescent wave by the sample is measured.

Name: scanning_tunnelling_spectroscopy
Label: scanning tunnelling spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a scanning tunnelling microscope is used to measure the I-V characteristics of the sample.

Name: 13c_incredible_natural_abundance_double_quantum_transfer_experiment
Label: 13C incredible natural abundance double quantum transfer experiment
Definition: A 2D NMR technique which correlates commonly one-bond J-coupled 13C nuclei. In one dimension the signals appear at the chemical shift of a particular nucleus and in the other dimension at a position which is the sum of the frequencies of that nucleus and its J-coupled partner.

Name: polymer_preparation_method
Label: polymer preparation method
Definition: Any experimental method used to prepare polymer samples.

Name: scanning_near_field_photolithography
Label: scanning near-field photolithography
Definition: A synthesis method which uses light and a self-assembled monolayer SAM to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of an alkanethiol is deposited on the substrate forming a SAM. UV light 244 nm from a scanning near-field optical microscope aperture size  50 nm is then used to oxidise the SAM in certain areas. Either the oxidised areas of the SAM or the gold corresponding to those areas is then removed by etching.

Name: co_precipitation
Label: co-precipitation
Definition: The simultaneous precipitation of a normally soluble component with a macro-component from the same solution by the formation of mixed crystals by adsorption occlusion or mechanical entrapment.

Name: weak_cation_exchange_chromatography
Label: weak-cation-exchange chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where cations are retained by functional groups that are  negatively charged at low pH for example aliphatic carboxylic acid groups in the stationary phase.

Name: sulfur_33_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: sulfur-33 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for sulfur-33 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: ion_assisted_deposition
Label: ion-assisted deposition
Definition: Sputter deposition where a secondary ion beam is then used to remove any partially bound atoms from the substrate surface.

Name: differential_pulse_polarography
Label: differential pulse polarography
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The working electrode is a dropping mercury or other liquid conductor electrode and unstirred solutions are used. The potential is varied using pulses of linearly increasing amplitude one pulse during each drop lifetime and the current is sampled before and after each voltage pulse.

Name: plasma_protein_fractionation
Label: plasma protein fractionation
Definition: A method for separating proteins from plasma by changing the conditions e.g. temperature or acidity of the plasma causing precipitation of the proteins which can then be removed by centrifugation.

Name: fragmentor_voltage
Label: fragmentor voltage
Definition: A setting datum that specifies the potential difference in a mass spectrometer where labile ions may dissociate.

Name: optical_tweezers
Label: optical tweezers
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a laser an optical microscope a condenser and a CCD camera that is used to manipulate microscopic particles.

Name: molecular_beam_fourier_transform_microwave_spectroscopy
Label: molecular beam Fourier transform microwave spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample in the form of a molecular beam is irradiated with a single pulse of radiation in the microwave region 11000 mm and the spectrum is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: time_resolved_fluorescence_anisotropy
Label: time-resolved fluorescence anisotropy
Definition: A method for measuring the binding interaction between two labelled molecules. The sample is excited with vertically polarised light and the decay time and polarization of the fluorescence is measured.

Name: ultra_violet_thermal_lens_microscopy
Label: ultra-violet thermal lens microscopy
Definition: Thermal lens microscopy where the excitation laser is an ultraviolet laser.

Name: multiple_quantum_filter
Label: multiple quantum filter
Definition: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting particular spin systems of interest according to the number of nuclei present within them. Usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase direction of application of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver.

Name: goods_buffer
Label: Good's buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an acidbase equilibrium involving one of Good's buffer substances CHEBI:39011.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_time_of_flight_mass_spectrum
Label: matrix assisted laser desorption-ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the mass-to-charge ratio is determined from the time they take to reach a detector. The sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser whilst being held in a matrix such as dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Name: continuous_wave_electronelectron_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: continuous wave electron–electron double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is irradiated by two microwave frequencies which match electron resonance transitions. The effect of the higher power frequency 'pump' transition on the lower power 'observed' transitionsis measured.

Name: x_band_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: X-band electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to short ns pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured. The microwave radiation used has an approximate frequency of 9 GHz known as the 'X-band'.

Name: spectrometer
Label: spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus used to measure a spectrum.

Name: orthogonal_acceleration_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometer
Label: orthogonal-acceleration time-of-flight mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer which uses a time-of-flight mass-to-charge analyser to separate ions. Ions introduced into the mass analyzer are accelerated along the axis perpendicular to their initial direction of motion.

Name: laser_ablation_inductively_coupled_plasma_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: laser ablation inductively-coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: Inductively coupled atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is vaporised by laser ablation.

Name: catalysed_chemiluminescence_detection
Label: catalysed chemiluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence resulting from a thermal electron-transfer reaction.

Name: ion_chromatogram
Label: ion chromatogram
Definition: A plot of ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection.

Name: x_half_filter
Label: X half filter
Definition: A technique used in 2D NMR of isotopically enriched samples usually 13C/15N to remove signals of protons which are not bound to a particular isotope from one of the two domains of the experiment. For the technique see J. Magn. Reson. 1986 70 pg 500.

Name: data_item
Label: data item
Definition: An information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something modulo e.g. measurement precision or other systematic errors and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce approximately truthful statements."en

Name: isopycnic_gradient_ultracentrifugation
Label: isopycnic gradient ultracentrifugation
Definition: A method where the components of a sample e.g. plasma lipoproteins are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. A density gradient is established via equilibrium sedimentation e.g. using caesium ions and then analyte molecules concentrate as bands where the molecule density matches that of the surrounding solution. Samples are spun at speeds of up to 150000 rpm.

Name: 23na_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 23Na solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states 23Na nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: volumetry
Label: volumetry
Definition: A method for determining the exact amount of an analyte by adding an equivalent amount of a reagent of exactly known concentration to the sample.

Name: collision_induced_dissociation_mass_spectrometry
Label: collision-induced dissociation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised and selected ions are allowed to collide with neutral gas molecules resulting in fragmentation.

Name: plasma_atomic_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: plasma atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where a plasma is used to excite the atoms in the sample.

Name: time_resolved_ultrasonic_speckle_velocimetry
Label: time-resolved ultrasonic speckle velocimetry
Definition: A method for measuring the velocity of a sample by detecting and analysing successive ultrasonic speckle signals that result from the interference of backscattered echoes of successive incident pulses of ultrasonic radiation 36 MHz as a function of time.

Name: resonant_inelastic_x_ray_scattering
Label: resonant inelastic X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the energy loss of X-rays scattered by a sample where the incident X-ray energy is chosen to coincide with an electronic transition in the sample.

Name: magnetic_field_flow_fractionation
Label: magnetic field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying a magnetic electric field perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of magnetic susceptibility.

Name: field_ion_microscopy
Label: field ion microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where atoms of an inert gas in the vicinty of the specimen which is in the form of a very sharp tip <10 m diameter are ionised by the application of a strong electric field to the tip and an image is produced by the projection of the ions onto a fluorescent screen. The image consists of a pattern of spots of light which correspond to individual atoms on the specimen surface.

Name: environmental_scanning_electron_microscope
Label: environmental scanning electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of a specimen by scanning a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50150 kV across the specimen in a gaseous environment and measuring interaction of the electrons with the specimen.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: electron_ionisation_mass_spectrometer
Label: electron ionisation mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer that uses an electron ionisation source which consists of a thin strip of metal that is heated electrically to incandescence or a temperature at which it emits free electrons that are accelerated through a potential to an energy where they ionise the sample.

Name: in_situ_micro_x_ray_diffraction
Label: in situ micro-X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by detecting the positions and intensities of X-rays that have been generated in microstructural domain as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Name: anomalous_x_ray_scattering
Label: anomalous X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in phase of X-rays scattered by a sample. Normally incident X-rays continue in the same phase after encountering the scatterer. However if the energy of the incident X-rays is at or above the absorption edge of the scatterer a phase shift occurs.

Name: attenuated_total_reflectance_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: attenuated total reflectance Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where infrared light is introduced into a prism at an angle exceeding the critical angle for internal reflection. This produces an evanescent wave at the reflecting surface a surface which is transparent to infrared such as thallium bromide on which the sample is supported. The distortion of the evanescent wave by the sample is measured producing a spectrum which is then subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: multiple_quantum_excitation_in_combination_with_magic_angle_spinning
Label: multiple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment used for half-integer quadrupolar nuclei involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Name: vibrating_sample_magnetometry
Label: vibrating-sample magnetometry
Definition: The measurement of the change in magnetic field caused by the vibration of a sample.

Name: nanoflow_liquid_chromatography_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: nanoflow liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by nanoflow liquid chromatography flow rate of nL min-1 before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance by two mass spectrometers in series.

Name: circular_dichroism_spectrum
Label: circular dichroism spectrum
Definition: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised photon radiation as a function of wavelength.

Name: optical_quality
Label: optical quality
Definition: An EM radiation quality in which the EM radiation is within the fiat range of the spectrum visible deemed to be light.

Name: gel_filtration_chromatography
Label: gel filtration chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the separation is caused by exclusion effects within the stationary phase and where the stationary phase is a swollen gel.

Name: service_provider_role
Label: service provider role
Definition: is a role which inheres in a person or organization and is realized in in a planned process which provides access to training materials or execution of protocols for an organization or person"en

Name: drop_coating
Label: drop coating
Definition: The application of a thin cover to a sample by depositing consecutive drops of a solution on its surface and allowing the solvent to evaporate.

Name: degassing
Label: degassing
Definition: A preparative step involving the removal of dissolved gases from a sample.

Name: chemical_vapor_deposition_synthesis_of_carbon_nanotubes
Label: chemical vapor deposition synthesis of carbon nanotubes
Definition: A synthesis method for carbon nanotubes where a hydrocarbon vapor such as methane is thermally decomposed in a tube furnace in the presence of a metal catalyst. Carbon nanotubes grow over the catalyst and are collected upon cooling. Low temperatures yield multi-walled carbon nanotubes whereas high temperatures favour single-walled carbon nanotubes.

Name: 51v_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 51V nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 51V nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: synchrotron_x_ray_scattering
Label: synchrotron X-ray scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample. X-Rays are generated in a synchrotron.

Name: multiple_isomorphous_replacement_with_anomalous_scattering
Label: multiple isomorphous replacement with anomalous scattering
Definition: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a number of crystals of the sample substituted with different heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for each crystal. When the absorption edge of an atom in the crystals is close to the wavelength of the incident radiation the atom becomes an anomalous scatterer. Anomalous scattering can be used for phase determination and also for determining the absolute configuration.

Name: low_pressure_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: low-pressure chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors at less than atmospheric pressure which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: direct_drying
Label: direct drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample by the application of heated air.

Name: transmission_spectroscopy
Label: transmission spectroscopy
Definition: The study of radiation as a function of wavelength that has been transmitted through a sample.

Name: thermal_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: thermal chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where a substrate is placed in a heated atmosphere 600800 C and exposed to one or more volatile precursors which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: sodium_23_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: sodium-23 magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are sodium-23 nuclei and in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: ion_source
Label: ion source
Definition: An ion source is a device that is part of a mass spectrometer that ionizes the material under analysis. The ions are then transported by magnetic or electric fields to the mass analyzer.  Techniques for ionization have been key to determining what types of samples can be analyzed by mass spectrometry. Electron ionization and chemical ionization are used for gases and vapors. In chemical ionization sources the material is ionized by chemical ion-molecule reactions during collisions in the source. Two techniques often used with liquid and solid biological samples include electrospray ionization due to John Fenn PMID 2675315. and matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization MALDI due to M. Karas and F. Hillenkamp Measuring Mass: From Positive Rays to Proteins by Michael A. Grayson Editor ISBN 0-941901-31-9."en

Name: reflectron_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometer
Label: reflectron time-of-flight mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer which uses a time-of-flight mass-to-charge analyser and a reflectron to separate ions. The reflectron uses a constant electrostatic field to reflect the ion beam toward the detector. The more energetic ions penetrate deeper into the reflectron and take a slightly longer path to the detector. Less energetic ions of the same charge-to-mass ratio penetrate a shorter distance into the reflectron and correspondingly take a shorter path to the detector.

Name: spectroscopy
Label: spectroscopy
Definition: The study of the interaction of a sample with radiation or particles for measurement or detection.

Name: single_molecule_surface_enhanced_raman_spectroscopy
Label: single molecule surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a visible laser by a single molecule sample adsorbed onto a metal Au Ag or Cu surface is detected.

Name: centrifugal_evaporation
Label: centrifugal evaporation
Definition: The evaporation of solvent from a sample by placing it a centrifuge and spinning it rapidly.

Name: nanoflow_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography flow rate nL min-1 before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: x_ray_photon_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray photon correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the size distribution of a sample of small particles in solution by bombarding the sample with coherent X-rays and measuring the time-dependent fluctuations in the intensity of the scattered X-rays caused by Brownian motion.

Name: electrochemical_cell
Label: electrochemical cell
Definition: A piece of apparatus in which a current causes chemical reactions or chemical reactions cause a current to flow.

Name: 1h13c_heteronuclear_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: 1H–13C heteronuclear correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 13C nuclei.

Name: scanning_near_field_microscopy
Label: scanning near-field microscopy
Definition: Any type of microscopy where a probe is positioned very close to the surface of the specimen in the near-field. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the probe-surface interaction as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: fourier_transform_photoacoustic_spectrum
Label: Fourier transform photoacoustic spectrum
Definition: The Fourier transform of a plot of intensity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the sound emitted when a gaseous sample is exposed to an intense laser beam which is rapidly interrupted by a rotating slotted disk.

Name: mass_spectrometry_of_recoiled_ions
Label: mass spectrometry of recoiled ions
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a stream of primary mass-selected particles and the secondary elemental ions usually H D or He ejected from the sample are detected.

Name: generalised_polarisation_spectroscopy
Label: generalised polarisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a spectral shift in fluorescence spectrum which depends on the phase of lipid membranes is measured.

Name: high_resolution_electron_micrograph
Label: high-resolution electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage under vacuum and detecting the transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays emitted. The specimen is tilted such that a low-order zone axis is closely parallel to the incident beam and columns of atoms are viewed end-on by the beam.

Name: resonance_rayleigh_scattering_spectroscopy
Label: resonance Rayleigh scattering spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of Rayleigh scattered visible light where the wavelength of the incident light corresponds to an absorption band in the scattering molecules.

Name: two_dimensional_separation_method
Label: two-dimensional separation method
Definition: A method that results in the separation of two components along two physical axes.

Name: atomic_layer_deposition
Label: atomic layer deposition
Definition: A thin film deposition technique based on the sequential reaction of gaseous precursors at a surface to produce a monolayer

Name: electron_appearance_potential_fine_structure_analysis
Label: electron appearance potential fine structure analysis
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by a sudden change in the electron beam current. The fine structure close to the threshold is analysed by measuring the change in electron beam current.

Name: cocrystallisation
Label: cocrystallisation
Definition: The simultaneous crystallisation of two different substances or two different structural elements of the same substance.

Name: thermospray_mass_spectrometry
Label: thermospray mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a pressurised solution of the sample is forced through a heated metal capillary tip. Ions are formed when the solvent evaporates and the statistically unbalanced charge distribution on the droplets leads to a net charge.

Name: heteronuclear_single_quantum_coherence_spectrum
Label: heteronuclear single quantum coherence spectrum
Definition: A two-dimensional NMR spectrum in which peaks appear at the chemical shift of usually protons in one dimension and at the chemical shift of their covalently-bound heteroatoms in the other dimension.

Name: chemical_vapour_infiltration
Label: chemical vapour infiltration
Definition: The process of filling in the pores of a material e.g. a ceramic by reaction with or deposition from a vapour.

Name: solvent_casting
Label: solvent casting
Definition: A process for forming thermoplastic polymer samples by dipping a mould into a solution of the polymer and drawing off the solvent to leave a polymer film adhering to the mould.

Name: atomic_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Atomic spectroscopy where an atom absorbs then spontaneously emits a photon.

Name: homodyne_detection
Label: homodyne detection
Definition: The measurement of the intensity of the light resulting from the interference of two lasers of the same wavelength.

Name: hollow_cathode_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: hollow-cathode atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a glow discharge a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas is used to excite the sample. The plasma source contains a hollow cylindrical metal cathode containing the metal for excitation and an anode.

Name: 15n_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 15N rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 15N nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: photoluminescence_spectroscopy
Label: photoluminescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where luminesence the emission of visible light from molecules irradiated with light is detected as a function of wavelength.

Name: sieverts_apparatus
Label: Sievert's apparatus
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a gas manifold with a series of tubes and valves connecting the sample chamber to one or more pressure reservoirs of known volume used for measuring the thermodynamics of hydrogen sorption onto metal samples.

Name: magnetic_contrast_neutron_reflectometry
Label: magnetic contrast neutron reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing two beams of polarised neutrons one spin 'up' and one spin 'down' onto the sample which contains a ferromagnetic reference layer and measuring the intensity of the reflected neutrons in the presence of an applied magnetic field.

Name: oximetry
Label: oximetry
Definition: A technique used to measure the levels of oxygen in a sample.

Name: fourier_transform_infrared_emission_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform infrared emission spectroscopy
Definition: IR emission spectroscopy where the spectrum is obtained by a single pulse of UV radiation and is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: reactant_role
Label: reactant role
Definition: A role borne by a biological or chemical entity that participates or has molecular components that participate in a chemical reaction."en

Name: energy_dispersive_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: energy-dispersive X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the energy spectrum of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions is measured using a semiconductor detector.

Name: blue_native_two_dimensional_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: blue native two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both blue native polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. In native polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis protein molecules move at different speeds in non-denaturing conditions according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied. The dye Coomassie blue is used to transfer charge to the protein.

Name: gaseous_mobile_phase
Label: gaseous mobile phase
Definition: A gas that percolates through the stationary bed in chromatography.

Name: particle_beam_mass_spectrometry
Label: particle beam mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a liquid sample passes through a desolvation chamber producing a beam of microscopic solid particles.

Name: magnetic_resonance_force_microscopy
Label: magnetic resonance force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a cantilever tipped with a ferromagnetic iron cobalt particle to directly detect a modulated spin gradient force between sample spins and the tip to scan the surface of a magnetic specimen. As the ferromagnetic tip moves close to the sample the nuclear spins become attracted to it and generate a small force on the cantilever. The spins are then repeatedly flipped causing the cantilever to gently sway back and forth in a synchronous motion. That displacement is measured with an interferometer to create a series of 2D images of the sample.

Name: quality_of_interaction_of_a_substance_with_electromagnetic_radiation
Label: quality of interaction of a substance with electromagnetic radiation
Definition: A quality of a substance on which or through which electromagnetic radiation impinges or traverses with respect to radiation. This substance quality changes the quality of the incident radiation with respect to any of: intensity direction scatter and wavelength.

Name: quasi_elastic_neutron_scattering
Label: quasi-elastic neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in a liquid sample which is in thermal motion. Phase is not conserved and although the neutrons retain all of their kinetic energy during collisions the thermal motion of the sample causes a broadening of the energy range of the scattered neutrons.

Name: synthesizing_function
Label: synthesizing function
Definition: A synthesizing function is a function to assemble new output materials from distinct input materials.  The output materials typically consist of chemically distinct monomeric objects or object aggregate polymers."en

Name: thermogravimetric_analyser
Label: thermogravimetric analyser
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a quartz or alumina chamber a balance a sample pan and a heating mechanism which is used to record the mass of a sample as a function of increasing temperature.

Name: borate_buffer
Label: borate buffer
Definition: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by a boric acidborate anion equilibrium.

Name: angle_resolved_photoelectron_extended_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved photoelectron extended fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of emission angle. The spectrum is recorded over an extended energy range from the photon absorption edge onset to several hundred eV above it.

Name: bioluminescence_resonance_energy_transfer
Label: bioluminescence resonance energy transfer
Definition: Forster resonance energy transfer in a bioluminescent system usually between a luciferase donor and a green fluorescent protein acceptor.

Name: polarised_neutron_reflectometry
Label: polarised neutron reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing polarised neutrons onto an extremely flat surface and measuring the intensity of the reflected neutrons as a function of angle and neutron wavelength.

Name: blow_moulding
Label: blow moulding
Definition: A process for shaping pliable thermoplastic or thermosetting plastics using a rigid frame or model called a 'mould'. The plastic is heated and shaped into a tube then a pressurized gas usually air is used to expand the plastic and press it against the mould.

Name: low_speed_centrifugation
Label: low-speed centrifugation
Definition: A separation method where the components of a sample  are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. Samples are spun at <5000 rpm.

Name: tandem_scanning_microscope
Label: tandem-scanning microscope
Definition: An optical microscope that works by using a spinning Nipkow disc a wheel pierced by a spiral of pinholes to illuminate small areas of the sample.

Name: inelastic_neutron_scattering
Label: inelastic neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample and suffer a loss of kinetic energy during collisions.

Name: emission_spectrum
Label: emission spectrum
Definition: A plot of emission against wavelength obtained by measuring the emitted spectral radiant power against a quantity related to photon energy such as frequency wavenumber or wavelength.

Name: charge_coupled_device_camera
Label: charge-coupled-device camera
Definition: A piece of apparatus that converts optical brightness into an electrical signal using a CCD a semiconductor chip which converts the intensity of light falling onto its surface at different points into a charge and then reproduces an image of the specimen.

Name: microscope
Label: microscope
Definition: A microscope is an instrument which magnifies the view on objects too small to be viewed by the naked eye under increased resolution. A microscope can be an optical instrument but also and electronic instrument. There are various kind of optical microscopes e.g confocal microscope epifluoresence microscope"en

Name: selected_ion_chromatogram
Label: selected ion chromatogram
Definition: A plot of ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection. A small mass window is monitored such that the mass chromatogram represents detection of a very specific mass-to-charge ratio.

Name: emission_titration
Label: emission titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the intensity/wavelength of radiation emitted by the sample.

Name: metal_ion_deposition
Label: metal-ion deposition
Definition: The process of the settling of metal ions from a solution or suspension onto a pre-existing surface.

Name: vacuum_metal_deposition
Label: vacuum metal deposition
Definition: A development technique where the substrate is placed in a vacuum 10{-4} Pa and two metal electrodes are melted and evaporated sequentionally by passing a current through them. When the metal atoms hit the ch cooler substrate they condense into nanoscale particles forming a thin deposit on the surface. When vacuum metal deposition is used to enhance latent fingermarks on polymer surfaces a Au layer is applied first followed by a ch thicker Zn layer which does not deposit on the fingermark ridges.

Name: phosphorescence_detected_magnetic_resonance
Label: phosphorescence detected magnetic resonance
Definition: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by phosphorescence. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Name: electronic_circular_dichroism_spectrum
Label: electronic circular dichroism spectrum
Definition: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised visible or near-ultraviolet radiation as a function of wavelength. ECD spectra can also be derived computationally.

Name: quadrupole_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometer
Label: quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometer
Definition: A time-of-flight mass spectrometer that uses an orthogonal-acceleration ion source. The detector is a quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser which holds the ions in a stable orbit using an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Name: chrono_amperometry
Label: chrono-amperometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the time dependence of the cell current is measured whilst the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is controlled.

Name: light_induced_gelation
Label: light-induced gelation
Definition: The formation of a gel from a solution by irradiation with light from the visible region 400800 nm.

Name: surface_enhanced_non_resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: surface-enhanced non-resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a visible laser by a sample adsorbed onto a metal Au Ag or Cu surface is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light does not coincide with an electronic transition within the sample.

Name: spin_polarised_angle_resolved_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: spin-polarised angle-resolved Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of emission angle and a magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the emitting surface.

Name: 17o_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 17O nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes oxygen-17 nuclei.

Name: chromatography_temperature_program
Label: chromatography temperature program
Definition: The plan specification for the temperatures in different places and times in a chromatography experiment.

Name: epitaxy
Label: epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from liquid or gaseous precursors on a monocrystalline substrate.

Name: alternating_current_impedance_spectroscopy
Label: alternating current impedance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the change in impedance the resistance of alternating current of a sample during excitation with an alternating-current voltage is measured.

Name: monochromator
Label: monochromator
Definition: A piece of apparatus that transmits a narrow band of wavelengths of light or other radiation e.g. X-rays chosen from a wider range of wavelengths available at the input.

Name: dynamic_range
Label: dynamic range
Definition: The working range over which an incremental change in concentration or mass flow rate produces an incremental change in response.

Name: laser_pyrolysis
Label: laser pyrolysis
Definition: A technique used to synthesize ultrafine powders by heating a mixture of reactant vapour and inert gas with a laser.

Name: transmission_low_energy_electron_diffraction
Label: transmission low energy electron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of high energy <500 eV electrons at the sample and recording the resulting diffraction pattern produced by any electrons transmitted through the sample.

Name: ion_amperometry
Label: ion amperometry
Definition: The measurement of cell current whilst the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is controlled associated with the ion transfer across the interface between two immiscible electrolyte solutions ITIES.

Name: total_reflection_x_ray_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: total reflection X-ray fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays and the energies of totally reflected X-rays are measured.

Name: creating_a_mixture_of_molecules_in_solution
Label: creating a mixture of molecules in solution
Definition: is a process with the objective to prepare a liquid solution of one or more chemicals at desired concentrations."en

Name: delayed_fluorescence_detected_magnetic_resonance
Label: delayed fluorescence detected magnetic resonance
Definition: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by delayed fluorescence. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Name: material_component_separation
Label: material component separation
Definition: a material processing in which components of an input material become segregated in space"en

Name: hot_isostatic_pressing
Label: hot isostatic pressing
Definition: The process of pressing a powder under a gas or liquid at elevated temperatures so that pressure is transmitted equally in all directions.

Name: emergency_response_equipment
Label: emergency response equipment
Definition: Equipment that is used in a laboratory context to mitigate adverse laboratory events.

Name: bright_field_scanning_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: bright-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons passes directly through an aperture before reaching the specimen. The image results from a weakening of the direct beam by its interaction with the sample.

Name: glow_discharge_synthesis
Label: glow discharge synthesis
Definition: A synthesis method where an electrical discharge is passed under reduced pressure between two electrodes.

Name: quartz_crystal_microgravimetry
Label: quartz crystal microgravimetry
Definition: A method used to measure the mass micrograms per unit area of a sample using a quartz crystal microbalance a piece of apparatus that measures the change in frequency of a quartz crystal sandwiched between a pair of electrodes as a function of the mass of the sample.

Name: aberration_corrected_high_resolution_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: aberration-corrected high-resolution transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum and the phase contrast between transmitted electron waves is used to produce an image. The beam is focused using a set of magnetic lenses which removes spherical aberration an effect where the electron beam is deflected too strongly resulting in a blurred image.

Name: chemical_substance
Label: chemical substance
Definition: A chemical substance is a portion of matter of constant composition composed of molecular entities of the same type or of different types.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_photodiode_array_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography photodiode array-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography with photodiode array detection before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: hydrodynamic_voltammogram
Label: hydrodynamic voltammogram
Definition: A plot of cell current vs. the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes obtained from a voltammetry experiment during which convective mass transfer the movement of material by the action of a fluid occurs.

Name: 1h_continuous_wave_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: 1H continuous-wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of the absorption of radio frequency radiation vs. frequency for hydrogen-1 nuclei.

Name: silanisation
Label: silanisation
Definition: The deposition of a layer of silane-like molecules on a surface e.g. glass or mica through self-assembly.

Name: acoustic_emission_spectrometry
Label: acoustic emission spectrometry
Definition: Spectrometry where the noise generated by the movement of bubbles or particles is detected.

Name: two_colour_four_wave_mixing_spectroscopy
Label: two-colour four-wave mixing spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where three incident laser beams are mixed two 'pump' beams of the same frequency and one 'probe' beam of a different frequency.

Name: liquid_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: autoclave
Label: autoclave
Definition: A thick-walled steel vessel used during synthesis methods that require both high pressures and high temperatures.

Name: temperature_dependent_rheometry
Label: temperature-dependent rheometry
Definition: The study of the temperature dependence of the relationship between deformation and stress for fluids which cannot be defined by a single value of viscosity.

Name: small_angle_x_ray_scattering_data
Label: small-angle X-ray scattering data
Definition: Data which is obtained from an X-ray scattering experiment where the X-rays are scattered by the sample at low angles 010.

Name: electron_ionisation_source
Label: electron ionisation source
Definition: An ion source that consists of an ionisation chamber and a thin strip of metal that is heated electrically to incandescence or a temperature at which it emits free electrons that are accelerated through a potential to an energy where they ionise the sample.

Name: energy_dispersive_x_ray_spectrum
Label: energy-dispersive X-ray spectrum
Definition: A plot of energy keV vs. intensity for X-rays emitted by a sample due to core-to-core transitions following bombardment with electrons. The energies of the emitted X-rays are characteristic of the elements in the sample therefore peaks are usually labelled with the corresponding element symbol.

Name: 31p13c_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 31P–13C rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P and 13C nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: electrochemical_surface_plasmon_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: electrochemical surface plasmon resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the resonant excitation of surface plasmons on a surface which is the working electrode in an electrochemical experiment by ultraviolet or visible light is measured.

Name: daly_detector
Label: Daly detector
Definition: An ion detector that consists of an aluminised cathode or Daly knob held at a very large negative potential that attracts ions and produces secondary electrons which impact a scintillator producing photons that are detected by a photomultiplier.

Name: x_ray_microscopy
Label: X-ray microscopy
Definition: An imaging technique where soft X-rays 1001000 eV are directed at the specimen and the difference in absorption of the X-rays by different elements mainly O and C produces an image.

Name: karlfischer_volumetric_titration
Label: Karl–Fischer volumetric titration
Definition: The process of determining trace amounts of water in a sample by the titration of sulphur dioxide in water using iodine. In this method the titrant is added directly to the sample using a burette.

Name: nanoimprint_lithography
Label: nanoimprint lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses mechanical deformation to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of resist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. A mould containing the desired nanosized pattern on its surface is then pressed into the resist and any residual resist in the cast area is removed by an anisotropic etching process such as reactive ion etching.

Name: pulse_voltammetry
Label: pulse voltammetry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The potential is varied using pulses of increasing amplitude.

Name: field_emission_transmission_electron_microscope
Label: field-emission transmission electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of an electron transparent specimen using a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam produced by thermionic emission heating with an acceleration voltage of 50150 kV under vacuum. The energies and intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Name: surface_plasmon_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: surface plasmon resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the resonant excitation of surface plasmons usually on a noble metal e.g. Au or Ag surface by ultraviolet or visible light is measured. The light source is incident on the noble metal surface through a prism at a range of angles that are above the critical angle where total internal reflection occurs. At a certain angle excitation of the surface plasmons occurs leading to a minim in the reflected light. The resonance angle shifts whenever the optical density of the sample in contact with the noble metal undergoes a change and thus it allows detection of the adsorption or desorption of molecules.

Name: collision_induced_dissociation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: collision-induced dissociation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps where the sample ions are allowed to collide with neutral gas molecules resulting in fragmentation between each mass-selection stage.

Name: schlenk_tube
Label: Schlenk tube
Definition: A piece of apparatus used as a reaction vessel in air-sensitive chemistry. It is made of glass and has a side arm fitted with a PTFE or ground glass stopcock which allows the vessel to be evacuated or filled with gas e.g. nitrogen or argon.

Name: collinear_laser_ion_beam_spectroscopy
Label: collinear laser ion-beam spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of an accelerated beam of ions which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample and light absorption is measured.

Name: bioelectrochemical_analysis
Label: bioelectrochemical analysis
Definition: The use of an electrochemical cell to measure a qualitative or quantitative response for a biological system.

Name: 29si_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 29Si rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 29Si nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: electrothermal_atomic_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: electrothermal atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: Atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where the sample is atomised using a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Name: paramagnetic_signals_enhancement
Label: paramagnetic signals enhancement
Definition: A method for NMR spectra acquisition of paramagnetic proteins based on the use of homonuclear broadband decoupling of the diamagnetic region.

Name: capillary_column
Label: capillary column
Definition: A piece of apparatus that has the form of a tube with a diameter of less than a millimetre and hosts the stationary bed in chromatography.

Name: ion_beam_lithography
Label: ion-beam lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses ions to transfer a pattern to a substrate. The substrate is coated with a film or 'resist and a focused ion beam 75 keV He ions is scanned across it in a patterned fashion. The ions induce chemical reactions in the resist and the desired pattern is obtained by selectively removing either exposed or non-exposed regions of the resist 'developing'.

Name: thermolysis
Label: thermolysis
Definition: The uncatalysed cleavage of one or more covalent bonds resulting from exposure of a compound to a raised temperature or a process in which such cleavage is an essential part.

Name: tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage.

Name: high_target_utilization_sputter_deposition
Label: high-target-utilization sputter deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a solid target is bombarded with energetic ions e.g. Ar causing atoms to be ejected 'sputtering'. The ejected atoms then deposit as a thin-film on a substrate. Ionisation of the neutral gas atoms requires an external plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons source which generates an ion beam.

Name: measurement_unit_label
Label: measurement unit label
Definition: A measurement unit label is as a label that is part of a scalar measurement datum and denotes a unit of measure."en

Name: rapid_thermal_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: rapid thermal chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where a rapidly heated substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: direct_analysis_in_real_time_mass_spectrometry
Label: direct analysis in real time mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a corona discharge within a He atmosphere.

Name: surface_initiated_polymerisation
Label: surface-initiated polymerisation
Definition: An experimental method used to prepare polymer samples e.g. polymer brushes using a surface-imobilised monomer.

Name: gas_chromatography_flame_ionisation_detection
Label: gas chromatography-flame ionisation detection
Definition: Flame ionisation detection that is sensitive to compounds containing C-H bonds. The eluent is mixed with H2 and air and ignited. Any positively-charged radicals resulting from this process are collected at a cathode allowing the current to be measured.

Name: water_elimination_fourier_transform
Label: water elimination Fourier transform
Definition: A pulse cluster used to suppress solvent water signals exploiting the differing relaxation properties of solvent and sample. Resonances are inverted and the subsequent recovery period is chosen such that the solvent signal is at a null point when the signal is detected. For the pulse sequence see J. Chem. Phys. 1972 56 pg 3182.

Name: dark_field_transmission_electron_micrograph
Label: dark-field transmission electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the scattered transmitted electrons.

Name: ellipsometric_porosimetry
Label: ellipsometric porosimetry
Definition: The measurement of the pore diameter pore-size distribution and total pore volume of a thin porous film sample by measuring the changes in intensity and polarisation of  reflected light during vapour adsorption and desorption.

Name: alpha_particle_spectroscopy
Label: alpha-particle spectroscopy
Definition: Spectrometry where the alpha-particles or 4He nuclei spontaneously emitted from radioisotopes are detected.

Name: regulatory_agency
Label: regulatory agency
Definition: A regulatory agency is a organization that has responsibility over or for  the legislation acts and regulations for a given sector of the government."en

Name: valence_shell_photoionisation_spectroscopy
Label: valence-shell photoionisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation of the valence shell and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: physical_vapour_deposition
Label: physical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where vaporized molecules or atoms condense on a surface forming a thin layer. The process is purely physical no chemical reaction occurs at the surface.

Name: orthogonal_acceleration_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: orthogonal acceleration time of flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised and the ions are accelerated to the same known very high kinetic energies by an ion source that works by sampling an ion beam travelling in a direction orthogonal to the axis of the flight path in the mass-to-charge analyser. The time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: freeze_distillation
Label: freeze distillation
Definition: The process of enriching a solution by partially freezing it and removing frozen material that contains less of the dissolved material than the remaining solution.

Name: physical_blending
Label: physical blending
Definition: The process of making a polymer blend by mechanically mixing different polymers together in the melt.

Name: amount_concentration
Label: amount concentration
Definition: Experimental method output expressing a concentration in terms of the amount of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture.

Name: class_discovery_objective
Label: class discovery objective
Definition: A class discovery objective sometimes called unsupervised classification is a data transformation objective where the aim is to organize input data  typically vectors of attributes into classes where the number of classes and their specifications are not known a priori. Depending on usage the class assignment can be definite or probabilistic."en

Name: pyrolysis_gas_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: pyrolysis gas chromatography-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first chemically degraded by heating then separated by gas chromatography then ionised and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: magnetron_sputter_deposition
Label: magnetron sputter deposition
Definition: Sputter deposition where the ion source is a magnetron. The ejected atoms then deposit as a thin-film on a substrate.

Name: electrostatic_force_microscopy
Label: electrostatic force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. A bias voltage is applied between the tip and sample forming a capacitor with the sample surface over which it is scanned laterally at a constant separation. The electrostatic force measured as the change in resonant frequency of the cantilever is probed as a function of position by changing the applied voltage.

Name: constant_current_chronopotentiometric_stripping
Label: constant-current chronopotentiometric stripping
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped'. During removal the time-dependence of the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is constant and sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: ionspray_mass_spectrometry
Label: ionspray mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing an aqueous solution of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 1-10 L min1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: pyrolysis_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: pyrolysis infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is first chemically degraded by heating then its absorption of radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m is measured.

Name: protein_containing_complex
Label: protein-containing complex
Definition: A stable assembly of two or more macromolecules i.e. proteins nucleic acids carbohydrates or lipids in which at least one component is a protein and the constituent parts function together.

Name: pulse_radiolysis_time_resolved_microwave_conductivity
Label: pulse radiolysis time-resolved microwave conductivity
Definition: A technique allowing the quantitative and qualitative detection of radiation-induced charge separation by time-resolved measurement of the changes in microwave absorption resulting from the production and decay of charged and dipolar molecular entities. In a typical pulse-radiolysis TRMC experiment separated charge carriers which are generated by a nanosecond pulse of 3-MeV electrons lead to a perturbation of the initial microwave absorbance. The temporal decay of the conductivity signal i.e. microwave absorbance reflects the lifetime of the electrogenerated carriers.

Name: photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured. The energy of the incident photons is usually greater than the ionisation energy of the sample and the photoelectrons are emitted with the excess in the form of kinetic energy.

Name: time_of_flight_mass_spectrum
Label: time-of-flight mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the mass-to-charge ratio is determined from the time they take to reach a detector.

Name: transformed_data_matrix
Label: transformed data matrix
Definition: A data item that consists of two or more data sets that are produced as the output of a data transformation.

Name: dispersion_polymerisation
Label: dispersion polymerisation
Definition: A polymer preparation technique in which an insoluble polymer is dispersed in a continuous organic phase.

Name: triple_quantum_filter
Label: triple quantum filter
