Definition: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting only three-spin coupled systems usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase direction of application of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver

Name: miniemulsion_polymerisation
Label: miniemulsion polymerisation
Definition: A polymer preparation technique in which monomer usually acrylic 50500 nm droplets are dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase and are kept colloidally stable through the use of a surfactant and are stablised against Ostwald ripening using a costabiliser such as hexadecane.

Name: field_emission_scanning_electron_micrograph
Label: field-emission scanning electron micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by scanning a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam produced by thermionic emission heating field emission across the specimen under vacuum.

Name: size_exclusion_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: size-exclusion chromatography-inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by size-exclusion chromatography and then excited using a plasma generated by electromagnetic induction and the emission of electromagnetic radiation from the sample at characteristic wavelengths is detected.

Name: zero_field_optically_detected_magnetic_resonance
Label: zero-field optically detected magnetic resonance
Definition: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels at zero applied magnetic field are detected by optical means i.e. the polarisation or the intensity of light emitted or absorbed by the sample depends on the population distribution in the spin levels. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Name: temperature_programmed_surface_reaction_spectroscopy
Label: temperature-programmed surface reaction spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy that uses thermal analysis to probe the surface chemistry of heterogeneous catalysts.

Name: sum_frequency_generation_spectrum
Label: sum-frequency generation spectrum
Definition: A plot of sum-frequency intensity vs. wavelength or wavenumber obtained by mixing two light beams at a surface and detecting the output beam which has frequency equal to the sum of the two input frequencies.

Name: optical_feedback_cavity_enhanced_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: optical feedback cavity enhanced absorption spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside a v-shaped optical cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected. The laser light is allowed to feed back to the laser diode.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_column
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography column
Definition: A chromatography column that contains very small particles and is capable of taking a high inlet pressure.

Name: derivatisation
Label: derivatisation
Definition: The transformation of a chemical compound the 'educt' into another similar compound the 'derivative' by altering one or more of its functional groups. Derivatisation is generally perfomed to alter reactivity or change a physical property such as solubility boiling point melting point thermal stability etc.

Name: 13c_solid_state_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 13C solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states 13C nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: super_continuum_cavity_enhanced_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: super continuum cavity enhanced absorption spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside a highly reflective laser cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of a supercontinuum light source is detected. The light source is tuned to match the frequency of the cavity bandwidth.

Name: two_dimensional_gel_electrophoresis
Label: two dimensional gel electrophoresis
Definition: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both gel electrophoresis.

Name: auger_electron_appearance_potential_spectroscopy
Label: Auger electron appearance potential spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by a sudden increase in secondary electron current.

Name: scanning_probe_microscopy
Label: scanning probe microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a probe to scan the surface of the specimen and measure some form of interaction between surface and probe. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the probe-surface interaction as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: quadrupole_carr_purcell_meiboom_gill_using_magic_angle_spinning
Label: quadrupole Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill using magic-angle spinning
Definition: An NMR experiment used to enhance the sensitivity of low gyromagnetic ratio nuclei by collapsing the intensity of the 'full' spectrum into discrete 'spikelets'/peaks. The intensities of the peaks vary according to the spin-spin relaxation rate T2 and the envelope described by these peaks represents the full static spectrum. The solid sample is spun rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field to reduce line broadening.

Name: pulsed_electron_nuclear_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: pulsed electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in a sample and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Name: 123sb_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 123Sb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 123Sb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: laser_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: laser absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and the absorption of light by the sample is measured.

Name: pulsed_electrochemical_detection
Label: pulsed electrochemical detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds which can be either reduced or oxidised. A liquid containing the sample passes directly over the working electrode which is subject to a periodic potential. The current produced is then measured.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Name: deuterium_labelling
Label: deuterium labelling
Definition: The substitution of one or more hydrogen atoms in a molecule with deuterium atoms.

Name: sintering
Label: sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample below its melting point until its particles adhere to each other.

Name: velocimetry
Label: velocimetry
Definition: The measurement of the velocity of a moving object or medium.

Name: low_temperature_photoluminescence_spectrum
Label: low-temperature photoluminescence spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation emitted by a sample through photoluminescence emission of visible light against the frequency of the incident radiation at low temperature.

Name: sensitivity_disposition
Label: sensitivity disposition
Definition: A disposition that inheres in a population of continuant and is realized in a test process e.g. disease diagnosis.

Name: lateral_force_microscopy
Label: lateral force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the frictional force experienced by the tip as a function of position the 'twist' of the tip. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: heterodyne_detection
Label: heterodyne detection
Definition: The measurement of the intensity of the light resulting from the interference of two lasers of different wavelength.

Name: liquid_state_sintering
Label: liquid-state sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample consisting of a powder and a liquid below the melting point of the solid until its particles adhere to each other.

Name: photon_cross_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: photon cross correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the size distribution of a sample of small particles in concentrated or opaque solutions by illuminating the sample with two laser beams and cross-correlating the time-dependent fluctuations in the intensity of the scattered light caused by Brownian motion.

Name: ion_trap_mass_spectrometry
Label: ion trap mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric or magnetic field.

Name: desorption_atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionisation
Label: desorption atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method in which a corona discharge is used to direct a liquid spray composed of an inert high velocity gas and solvent ions onto the sample surface.

Name: double_quantum_filtered_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: double-quantum-filtered correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled usually <3 bonds apart. The response is edited by selecting only two-spin coupled systems usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase direction of application of the pulses in the experiment.

Name: 125te_mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: 125Te Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 125Te nuclei is detected.

Name: electrospray_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrospray-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where neutral molecules are desorbed from the sample usually biological using a nitrogen laser and then ionised by collision with charged solvent droplets which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary into an electric field.

Name: microwave_synthesis_system
Label: microwave synthesis system
Definition: A device that is used to apply microwave irradiation to chemical reactions."en

Name: quadrupole_carr_purcell_meiboom_gill_experiment
Label: quadrupole Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill experiment
Definition: An NMR experiment used to measure spin-spin T2 relaxation times of quadropolar nucei by acquiring multiple spin echos with the intensity decay of the echos proportional to T2. In the solid state this is also used to enhance sensitivity of low gyromagnetic ratio nuclei by collapsing the intensity of the 'full' spectrum into discrete 'spikelets'/peaks. The intensities of the peaks vary according to T2 and the envelope described by these peaks represents the full static spectrum.

Name: fourier_transform_far_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform far-infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Far-infrared spectroscopy where the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: capillary_electrophoresis
Label: capillary electrophoresis
Definition: An electrophoresis method which takes place in a capillary.

Name: ionothermal_synthesis
Label: ionothermal synthesis
Definition: A synthesis method for growing single crystals from an ionic liquid in an autoclave a thick-walled steel vessel at high temperature 400 C and pressure.

Name: column_eluent
Label: column eluent
Definition: The liquid or gas entering a chromatographic column and used to effect a separation by elution.

Name: thermal_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: thermal ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where ionisation is achieved by loading the sample onto a heated filament.

Name: spectrophotometric_titration
Label: spectrophotometric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the absorbance of radiation in the range ultraviolet to near-infrared 0.12.5 m by the sample.

Name: chemiluminescence_spectroscopy
Label: chemiluminescence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where luminesence the emission of visible light from molecules as a result of a chemical reaction is detected as a function of wavelength.

Name: fluorescence_laser_scanning_microscopy
Label: fluorescence laser scanning microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce emit energy as visible light by scanning a laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface.

Name: deep_ultraviolet_lithography
Label: deep-ultraviolet lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. The photoresist is then exposed to a pattern of intense UV 240 nm light and a post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: transmission_electron_microscope_with_an_energy_dispersive_x_ray_analyser
Label: transmission electron microscope with an energy dispersive X-ray analyser
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of an electron- transparent specimen using a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50-150 kV under vacuum. X-rays emerging from the sample as a result of electron bombardment pass through a slit then a grating disperses them by diffraction according to their wavelength. Finally X-ray energy which is characteristic of atomic number is converted to voltage pulses or 'counts' by a detector.

Name: hyperfine_sublevel_correlation_spectrum
Label: hyperfine sublevel correlation spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to spin-state transitions of unpaired electrons against a perturbing magnetic field in the presence of fixed-frequency microwave radiation. A two-dimensional spectrum which plots the resonance frequency of electrons in the same magnetic environment obtained from spectroscopy ased on the electron spin-echo envelope modulation ESEEM effect where a sequence of four microwave pulses is applied to the sample and the stimulated spin-echo produced is measured.

Name: reflectance_ultraviolet_visible_spectrophotometry
Label: reflectance ultraviolet-visible spectrophotometry
Definition: Ultravioletvisible spectroscopy where the reflection or scattering of radiation from the sample surface is detected.

Name: fast_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: fast Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m and the spectrum obtained is subject to a fast Fourier transform.

Name: second_harmonic_generation_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: second harmonic generation circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by a sample. Laser light of frequency nu is converted to light of frequency 2nu by a non-linear interaction with the sample and the polarisation of this light the 'second harmonic' is determined.

Name: micro_dissection
Label: micro-dissection
Definition: The disassembly of a small part of an object <10 m diameter to determine its internal structure.

Name: single_isomorphous_replacement
Label: single isomorphous replacement
Definition: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a crystal of the sample substituted with heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for both the original crystal and the isomorph.

Name: adiabatic_scanning_calorimetry
Label: adiabatic scanning calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction by the known variation step-wise or linear of the temperature whilst the pressure is kept constant. Scanning rates on the order of a few mK min-1 are used and a constant power is continuously applied to or extracted from the sample.

Name: controlled_current_potentiometry
Label: controlled-current potentiometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium and held at a constant non-zero value.

Name: ph_sensor
Label: pH sensor
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to measure pH.

Name: regulator_role
Label: regulator role
Definition: a regulatory role involved with making and/or enforcing relevant legislation and governmental orders"en

Name: non_dispersive_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: non-dispersive infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the difference in infrared radiation 0.781000 m bsorption of a sample cell against a reference cell is measured.

Name: ultraviolet_curing
Label: ultraviolet curing
Definition: A chemical process in which a prepolymer is converted into a polymer and then into a network upon irradiation with light in the range 190400 nm.

Name: heteronuclear_hartmann_hahn_pulse_sequence
Label: heteronuclear Hartmann Hahn pulse sequence
Definition: An NMR pulse sequence used to transfer magnetisation between protons and covalently bound spin active heteronuclei via isotropic mixing of their magnetisation. Used to e.g. enhance the NMR signal of heteronuclei or to correlate chemical shifts of protons with heteronuclei. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. 1991 91 pg 444.

Name: packed_column
Label: packed column
Definition: A chromatography column that contains a solid packing.

Name: device
Label: device
Definition: A material entity that is designed to perform a function in a scientific investigation but is not a reagent."en

Name: magnetic_resonance_method
Label: magnetic resonance method
Definition: Any technique which detects the response of spins to a perturbing magnetic field.

Name: x_ray_magnetic_circular_dichroism_spectroscopy
Label: X-ray magnetic circular dichroism spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised X-ray radiation in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: base_ontology_module
Label: base ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that comprises only of asserted axioms local to the ontology excludes import directives and excludes axioms or declarations from external ontologies."en

Name: stepwise_pyrolysis
Label: stepwise pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy where the temperature is raised in a stepwise manner and the pyrolysates are recorded between each step.

Name: syringe_pump
Label: syringe pump
Definition: A syringe which has the function of pumping material into an experiment.

Name: diffusing_wave_spectroscopy
Label: diffusing wave spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining molecular motion by measuring the time it takes for a particle in a highly-scattering suspension e.g. a colloid to move a distance comparable to the wavelength of light.

Name: mes_buffer
Label: MES buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 2-N-morpholinoethanesulfonic acid.

Name: 207pb_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 207Pb magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 207Pb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: zeta_potential_measurement
Label: zeta-potential measurement
Definition: The measurement of the overall charge a particle acquires in a specific medium. A number of different experimental methods can be used including electrophoretic light scattering and laser Doppler velocimetry.

Name: fourier_transform_ion_cyclotron_resonance_mass_spectrometer
Label: Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer that uses an ion cyclotron resonance cell a piece of apparatus that measures the frequency at which ions precesses in a fixed magnetic field and subjects the frequency output to a Fourier transform as a mass-to-charge analyser and detector.

Name: synchrotron_radiation_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: synchrotron radiation photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation X-rayultraviolet generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons the energies of which are measured.

Name: blow_drying
Label: blow drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample by the application of an inert gas or air.

Name: electrophoresis_cathode_buffer
Label: electrophoresis cathode buffer
Definition: A buffer that serves as a cathode in an electrophoresis experiment.

Name: vanadium_51_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: vanadium-51 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of the resonance frequency of vanadium-51 nuclei in the same magnetic environment on a scale relative to their resonance frequency and with intensities proportional to the populations of nuclei in those environments.

Name: ultrasonic_dispersion
Label: ultrasonic dispersion
Definition: The distribution of particles of one phase in a continuous phase of a different nature assisted by sound waves >20 KHz in frequency.

Name: 15n15n_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: 15N–15N correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 15N nuclei which are J-coupled usually 3 bonds apart.

Name: aces_buffer
Label: ACES buffer
Definition: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an N-2-acetamido-2-aminoethanesulfonic acid2-2-amino-2-oxoethylammonioethanesulfonate anion equilibrium.

Name: reference_electrode
Label: reference electrode
Definition: An electrode through which no appreciable current is allowed to flow and is used to observe or control the potential at a working electrode.

Name: species_subset_ontology_module
Label: species subset ontology module
Definition: A subset ontology that is crafted to either include or exclude a taxonomic grouping of species."en

Name: quadrupole_mass_to_charge_analyser
Label: quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser
Definition: A mass-to-charge analyser that uses a quadrupolar potential generated by four parallel electrodes to constrain the trajectories of ions according to their mass-to-charge ratio.

Name: molecular_beam_epitaxy
Label: molecular beam epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from a molecular beam on a monocrystalline substrate under high vacuum <10{-8} Pa. Molecular beam epitaxy is very slow with a deposition rate of <1000 nm per hour.

Name: atom
Label: atom
Definition: A chemical entity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element.

Name: slurry_electrothermal_vaporisation_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: slurry electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: ETV-ICP-MS where the solid sample is prepared by grinding into a fine powder and suspension in a diluent such as 0.1 HNO3.

Name: total_reflection_x_ray_absorption_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: total-reflection X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient around the absorption edge the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron are measured as a function of incident X-ray energy. Measurements are taken under total reflection conditions.

Name: hadamard_encoded_total_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: Hadamard-encoded total correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system. All of the resonances in the spin system are excited by selecting only one line for excitation and the final spectrum consists of a series of 1D sub-spectra each representing one spin system.

Name: ultra_rapid_scan_infrared_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: ultra-rapid-scan infrared absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region  0.781000 m. Spectra are collected at a rate of approx. 0.001 s per spectrum.

Name: optically_heterodyned_raman_induced_kerr_effect_spectroscopy
Label: optically-heterodyned Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where two polarized laser beams pump and probe with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained. The polarizing filters are rotated slightly giving rise to a heterodyne at the detector improving the signal-to-noise ratio compared to Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy.

Name: polarisation_optical_time_domain_reflectometry
Label: polarisation optical time-domain reflectometry
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing an optical pulse through an optical fibre and measuring the polarisation state of light reflected at the Brewster angle as a function of time.

Name: high_resolution_electrospray_ionisation_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-resolution electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets and where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion and the 'exact' mass of the molecular ions in the sample is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass the number of protons and neutrons.

Name: continuant_fiat_boundary
Label: continuant fiat boundary
Definition: b is a continuant fiat boundary  Def. b is an immaterial entity that is of zero one or two dimensions and does not include a spatial region as part. axiom label in BFO2 Reference: 029-001"en

Name: concentration
Label: concentration
Definition: Experimental method output expressing the contribution of one constituent to the composition of a mixture.

Name: electrochemical_quartz_crystal_microgravimetry
Label: electrochemical quartz crystal microgravimetry
Definition: A method used to determine the ratio of the mass deposited at the electrode surface during an electrochemical reaction to the total charge passed through the electrode the 'current efficiency'. The electrode surface is deposited on a piezoelectric quartz crystal and the change in resonance frequency of the crystal is measured.

Name: sedimentation_field_flow_fractionation
Label: sedimentation field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel within a centrifuge such that the centripetal force is applied perpendicular to the flow stream driving the particles towards the walls of the channel. A carrier liquid is then passed through the channel removing the smallest particles first.

Name: electrochemical_analysis
Label: electrochemical analysis
Definition: The use of an electrochemical cell to measure a qualitative or quantitative response.

Name: surface_extended_electron_energy_loss_fine_structure_spectroscopy
Label: surface extended electron energy loss fine structure spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known extended range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and the Auger emission is measured. Measurements are taken from the absorption edge onset to several hundred eV above it.

Name: photoelectron_diffraction
Label: photoelectron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure during photoelectron spectroscopy. Photons are directed at the sample and diffraction patterns resulting from the emission of electrons are recorded.

Name: atmospheric_pressure_glow_discharge_ionisation
Label: atmospheric pressure glow discharge ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method when the sample is ionised at atmospheric pressure in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes.

Name: obsolete_fluorescence_detection_for_separation_methods
Label: obsolete: fluorescence detection for separation methods
Definition: A detection method which is sensitive to naturally fluorescent or tagged compounds. As the sample passes through a small cell it is excited by ultraviolet light and any fluorescence is detected.

Name: atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction electron or proton transfer with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation with electrons from a radioactive beta-source or a corona discharge.

Name: silica_gel
Label: silica gel
Definition: Vitreous silica in granular form for experimental purposes.

Name: oxygen_plasma_etching
Label: oxygen plasma etching
Definition: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface using short pulses of an oxygen plasma a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals e.g. O O and O2.

Name: certified_reference_material
Label: certified reference material
Definition: A reference material that has been certified by an appropriate authority.

Name: oxygen_17_atom
Label: oxygen-17 atom
Definition: The stable isotope of oxygen with relative atomic mass 16.999131. The least abundant 0.038 atom percent isotope of naturally occurring oxygen.

Name: spatially_offset_raman_spectroscopy
Label: spatially-offset Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a laser by a sample is detected. Scattered light is collected from regions laterally offset from the excitation laser spot.

Name: electronelectron_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: electron–electron double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where one electron spin resonance is detected though its effect on another.

Name: scanning_near_field_acoustic_microscopy
Label: scanning near-field acoustic microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe vibrating at its resonant frequency is positioned very close to the surface of the specimen in the near-field. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the resonant frequency or amplitude of vibration of the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: pole_figure_measurement
Label: pole figure measurement
Definition: A method for determining crystal orientation using X-ray diffraction which involves systematically rotating the sample about well defined angles until all possible lattice planes are reflected and measuring the reflection intensity as a function of angle. The results are plotted as a pole figure.

Name: single_metal_deposition
Label: single-metal deposition
Definition: A development method where the substrate is first immersed in a colloidal gold solution containing negatively charged gold particles at low pH. Gold subsequently deposits on any organic molecules containing postively charged groups at this pH. In the second step the surface is treated with another solution containing gold chloride and hydroxylamine which causes the reduction of gold ion producing a further gold deposit on the exisiting gold layer. Single-metal deposition is used to enhance latent fingermarks.

Name: variable_angle_spinning
Label: variable angle spinning
Definition: A technique used in solid-state NMR experiments to achieve the controlled reintroduction of dipolar couplings by varying the angle at which the sample is spun relative to the applied magnetic field.

Name: electron_multiplying_charge_coupled_device
Label: electron-multiplying charge-coupled device
Definition: A piece of apparatus based on a semiconductor chip which converts the intensity of light falling onto its surface at different points into a potential difference. The device contains a gain register that amplifies the electrical signal by impact ionisation.

Name: alpha_particle_scattering
Label: alpha-particle scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered alpha-particles.

Name: fluorescence_anisotropy_decay_curve
Label: fluorescence anisotropy decay curve
Definition: A plot of fluorescence anisotropy the difference in polarisation between incident and fluorescent light vs. time.

Name: dynamic_light_scattering
Label: dynamic light scattering
Definition: A method for determining the size distribution of a sample of small particles in solution by illuminating the sample with a light source usually a laser and measuring the time-dependent fluctuations in the intensity of the scattered light caused by Brownian motion.

Name: ageing
Label: ageing
Definition: Any time-dependent change of the properties of a precipitate e.g. loss of water or growth of crystals as a result of prolonged heat treatment.

Name: helium_discharge_ionisation_detection
Label: helium discharge ionisation detection
Definition: A detection method where metastable helium ions generated by an electric arc ionise the molecules in the sample held in He carrier gas. The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Name: polarised_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: polarised Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of polarised radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: ion_microscopy
Label: ion microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where ions are used to produce an image.

Name: solution_x_ray_diffraction
Label: solution X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at a sample solution and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Name: determination_of_copper
Label: determination of copper
Definition: A quantitative determination method where the analyte is copper.

Name: electrolytic_conductivity_detection
Label: electrolytic conductivity detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds containing Br or Cl. The pyrolysed sample is dissolved in water forming aqueous solutions of HBr or HCl. The change in electrical conductivity of the solution is then measured.

Name: transmission_spectrum
Label: transmission spectrum
Definition: A plot of transmittance vs. wavelength.

Name: planar_chromatography
Label: planar chromatography
Definition: A chromatography method where the stationary phase is present as or on a plane.

Name: electrospray_ionisation_fourier_transform_ion_cyclotron_resonance_mass_spectrometry
Label: electrospray ionisation Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 microlitre min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The mass-to-charge ratio of the ions is then determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field and subjecting it to a Fourier transform.

Name: processed_specimen
Label: processed specimen
Definition: A specimen that has been intentionally physically modified."en

Name: ion_beam_patterning
Label: ion beam patterning
Definition: A patterning process which involves using a focused Ga beam to cut trenches into substrates.

Name: direct_current_plasma_atomic_emission_spectroscopy
Label: direct current plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes is used as the excitation source.

Name: limit_of_linearity
Label: limit of linearity
Definition: The largest measure at which the sensitivity of the detector is constant to within a specified variation.

Name: he_excited_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: He+-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with He ions results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons which are detected as a function of incident He ion energy.

Name: fractional_crystallisation
Label: fractional crystallisation
Definition: The stepwise crystallisation of two or more different substances induced by changes in concentration or temperature. The sample is mixed with a solvent heated and then gradually cooled so that as each of its constituent components crystallises it can be removed in its pure form from the solution.

Name: solid_sampling_graphite_furnace_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: solid sampling graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where a solid sample is atomised by placing it in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Name: microemulsion_polymerisation
Label: microemulsion polymerisation
Definition: A polymer preparation technique in which monomer usually acrylic <100 nm droplets are dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase and are kept colloidally stable through the use of a surfactant and a cosurfactant e.g. hexanol.

Name: saturated_mercury_sulfate_electrode
Label: saturated mercury sulfate electrode
Definition: A reference electrode where the electrochemical reaction is between mercury metal and mercuryII sulfate.

Name: diffractometer
Label: diffractometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus which illuminates a sample with X-rays electrons or neutrons and measures the diffraction pattern produced. It typically will contain at least one monochromator to ensure the incident radiation is of a specific energy a goniometer which allows the geometry of the sample and detector to be precisely specified and a detector.

Name: droplet_dispensing
Label: droplet dispensing
Definition: The controlled dropwise release of a liquid.

Name: aerosol_assisted_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: aerosol-assisted chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where the substrate is exposed to one or more involatile precursors suspended in a liquidgas aerosol generated ultrasonically which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: inductively_coupled_plasma_three_dimensional_quadrupole_mass_spectrometry
Label: inductively coupled plasma three dimensional quadrupole mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is then measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by three electrodes.

Name: atomic_force_micrograph
Label: atomic force micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by using a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position.

Name: reaction_yield_detected_magnetic_resonance
Label: reaction yield detected magnetic resonance
Definition: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by means of reaction yield. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Name: picosecond_laser_flash_photolysis
Label: picosecond laser flash photolysis
Definition: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong picosecond pulse the 'pump' pulse of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Name: soft_lithography
Label: soft lithography
Definition: Any synthesis technique which uses elastomeric stamps moulds and conformable photomasks prepared from liquid polymer precursors.

Name: hydride_vapour_phase_epitaxy
Label: hydride vapour-phase epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from vapour-phase precursors in hydrogen or ammonia carrier gases on a monocrystalline substrate.

Name: confocal_raman_microscopy
Label: confocal Raman microscopy
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved Raman spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. An aperture is used to discriminate between Raman signal coming from the laser spot and that coming from the out-of-focus region of the sample.

Name: gradient_selected_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: gradient-selected correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei that are J-coupled usually <3 bonds apart. A spatially inhomogeneous magnetic field is applied with a defined gradient and used to either select a particular signal or to render unwanted signals undetectable.

Name: experimental_sample_function
Label: experimental sample function
Definition: The function inhering in a portion of material that is the subject of an experiment.

Name: dissolved_material_entity
Label: dissolved material entity
Definition: A material entity that has been going through a process of being put into solution"en

Name: anion_exchange_column
Label: anion-exchange column
Definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is an anion exchanger.

Name: tandem_mass_spectrometry_assay
Label: tandem mass spectrometry assay
Definition: A mass spectrometry assay that uses two or more analyzers separated by a region in which ions can be induced to fragment by transfer of energy frequently by collision with other molecules."en

Name: material_separation_device
Label: material separation device
Definition: A device with a separation function realized in a planed process"en

Name: cathodoluminescence_detection
Label: cathodoluminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence emitted from a sample as a result of the impact of high-energy electrons.

Name: laser_desorption_electrospray_ionisation
Label: laser desorption electrospray ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where neutral molecules are desorbed from the sample usually biological using a nitrogen laser and then ionised by collision with charged solvent droplets which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field.

Name: dynamic_scanning_calorimetry
Label: dynamic scanning calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction as a function of temperature.

Name: distillation
Label: distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser.

Name: liquid_chromatography_photodiode_array_detection
Label: liquid chromatography-photodiode array detection
Definition: Photodiode array detection where input is the mobile phase from a liquid chromatography separation.

Name: liquid_chromatography_at_the_critical_condition
Label: liquid chromatography at the critical condition
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid held at or near its critical point. Liquid chromatography at the critical condition is used to determine functionality distributions in polymers.

Name: radiolysis
Label: radiolysis
Definition: The cleavage of one or more bonds resulting from exposure to high-energy radiation.

Name: image_creation
Label: image creation
Definition: A planned process that captures an image of an object."en

Name: field_emission_electron_spin_polarization_spectroscopy
Label: field-emission electron spin-polarization spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of electron spectroscopy where electrons are emitted from a cathode by application of an intense electric field and a magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the sample surface.

Name: purification_objective
Label: purification objective
Definition: The objective to separate a material entity into different compositions of which one or more have are purified fractions that contain higher concentration of a desired component while others contain impurities and are not of interest"en

Name: total_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: total correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy which reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system.

Name: chemical_solution
Label: chemical solution
Definition: A material entity  that is made up of at least 2 scattered molecular aggregates one playing the role of solvent and the other one playing the role of solute."en

Name: charge_coupled_device_diffractometer
Label: charge-coupled device diffractometer
Definition: A diffractometer in which the detector is a charge-coupled device.

Name: analyte_measurement_objective
Label: analyte measurement objective
Definition: an assay objective to determine the presence or concentration of an analyte in the evaluant"en

Name: pervaporation
Label: pervaporation
Definition: A method for the separation of liquid mixtures based on diffusion rate and membrane affinity. The sample mixture is placed in contact with one side of a non-porous polymeric membrane while a vacuum is applied to the other side. The components in the liquid stream permeate through the membrane evaporate and are then condensed.

Name: pump_function
Label: pump function
Definition: a transfer unction where the transfer requires work to move the entity often against a gradient."en

Name: laser_ablation_electrospray_ionisation
Label: laser ablation electrospray ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample is vaporised using a high-energy pulsed laser and then ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of it through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: laser_chemical_vapour_deposition
Label: laser chemical vapour deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where a laser-heated substrate is exposed to one or more volatile precursors which react or decompose on the surface to produce a deposit.

Name: double_quantum_transitions_for_finding_unresolved_lines
Label: double quantum transitions for finding unresolved lines
Definition: A pulse sequence used to selectively resolve the signals from two coupled nuclei see J. Am. Chem. Soc. 1982 104 pg 4286.

Name: single_particle_energy_dispersive_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: single-particle energy-dispersive X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the energy spectrum of the X-rays emitted by a single particle due to core-to-core transitions is measured using a semiconductor detector.

Name: osmometry
Label: osmometry
Definition: The measurement of the osmotic strength of a substance which often used to determine its molecular weight.

Name: neutron_scattering
Label: neutron scattering
Definition: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered neutrons. Neutrons are scattered by the atomic nuclei in the sample and the intensity of the scattering is given by the scattering vector Q  4/sinpi/2.

Name: replica_moulding
Label: replica moulding
Definition: A process for shaping pliable polymer materials using a microsized rigid frame or model called a 'mould'. A mould is cast from the object to be replicated. This mould is then filled with a prepolymer which is cross-linked and the resulting polymer is peeled off the mould. Using a mould rather than the object itself allows multiple copies to be made without damaging the original.

Name: ongoing_process_adjustment
Label: ongoing process adjustment
Definition: A planned process adjustment that takes place while at least one subprocess is taking place.

Name: substoichiometric_extraction
Label: substoichiometric extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to another where the amount of reagent used is lower than that dictated by stoichiometry.

Name: aluminium_k_alpha_source
Label: aluminium K-alpha source
Definition: An X-ray source where aluminium atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Name: dry_spinning
Label: dry spinning
Definition: A process used to create polymer fibers. Polymer dissolved in a solvent is forced through a spinneret a multi-pored device similar to a shower head and the solvent is removed from the polymer fibres by evaporation.

Name: ultra_filtration
Label: ultra-filtration
Definition: A separation process whereby a solution containing a solute of molecular size significantly greater than that of the solvent molecule is removed from the solvent by the application of hydraulic pressure which forces only the solvent to flow through a suitable membrane usually having a pore size in the range 0.0010.1 m.

Name: hydride_generation_atomic_fluorescence_spectroscopy
Label: hydride generation atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy of metal samples such as As Sb and Se which are vaporised by converting them into volatile hydrides.

Name: gas_chromatography_nitrogen_phosphorus_detection
Label: gas chromatography-nitrogen-phosphorus detection
Definition: Nitrogen-phosphorus detection where the input is from a gas chromatography separation.

Name: spin_trap_electron_paramagnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: spin-trap electron paramagnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of an unstable free radical to short ns pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured by first  forming a more stable radical adduct e.g. a nitroxide radical with a nitrone or nitroso compound the 'spin trap'.

Name: fluorescence_speckle_microscopy
Label: fluorescence speckle microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a very low concentration of fluorescent subunits in a polymer or peptide reveals the assembly dynamics movement and turnover of assemblies throughout the image.

Name: suspension_polymerisation
Label: suspension polymerisation
Definition: Any experimental method used to prepare polymer samples where the monomer is suspended as liquid droplets in a continuous water phase by means of strong agitation and the presence of a suspending agent.

Name: ultraviolet_visible_near_infrared_spectrophotometry
Label: ultraviolet-visible-near infrared spectrophotometry
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the range ultraviolet to near-infrared 1902000 nm resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Name: furnace_atomisation_plasma_emission_spectroscopy
Label: furnace atomisation plasma emission spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a furnace is used to atomise the sample and a plasma is used as the excitation source.

Name: dip_coating
Label: dip coating
Definition: The application of a thin cover to sample by immersing it in a tank containing coating material allowing it to remain there for a certain 'dwell time' removing the piece from the tank 'withdrawal' and allowing it to drain.

Name: refractive_index_detector
Label: refractive index detector
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a light source a hollow prism and a photoelectric cell that is used to detect non-ultraviolet-absorbing molecules in a sample separated by chromatography. Light from the sample passes through a flow cell with two channels towards the photoelectric cell. One channel holds the eluent from the column whereas the other holds a control sample solvent that has not passed through the column.  Detection occurs when the light is bent due to molecules eluting from the column and this is read as a disparity between the two channels.

Name: sample_throughput
Label: sample throughput
Definition: The quantity of gas in pressure-volume units at a specified temperature flowing per unit time across a specified open cross section.

Name: electrochemical_catalytic_reforming
Label: electrochemical catalytic reforming
Definition: Any process in which the molecular structure of a hydrocarbon is rearranged to alter its properties e.g. its combustion characteristics in the presence of a metal catalyst and under a high pressure of H2 gas. An electric current is used to heat the catalyst.

Name: 2h_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 2H nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 2H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: composite_pulse_decoupling_sequence
Label: composite pulse decoupling sequence
Definition: An NMR pulse sequence employing composite pulses which decouples nuclei i.e. removes the effects of usually J-coupling line splitting from the spectrum.

Name: colorimetry
Label: colorimetry
Definition: The determination of the spectral absorbance of a solution. This method is often used to determine the concentration of a chemical in a solution.

Name: off_line_pyrolysis
Label: off-line pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy in which the products of a reaction are trapped before analysis.

Name: steady_state_nuclear_overhauser_enhancement_spectroscopy
Label: steady-state nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule <6 AA apart. In this technique the saturation of a particular proton resonance signal perturbs the intensities of signals from spatially proximate nuclei.

Name: quadrupole_mass_spectrometry
Label: quadrupole mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Name: dispersive_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: dispersive infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m. The infrared beam is passed through a diffraction grating which separates or disperses the wavelength of the light and directs each wavelength individually through a slit to a detector.

Name: dark_field_optical_micrograph
Label: dark-field optical micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by illuminating the specimen with visible light that is not collected by the objective lens. Only the light scattered by the specimen is collected by the lens producing an image of a light specimen on a black background.

Name: heteronuclear_multiple_quantum_coherence_diffusion_ordered_spectroscopy
Label: heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence-diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Definition: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D HMQC spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Name: wideband_uniform_rate_and_smooth_truncation_pulse
Label: wideband, uniform rate and smooth truncation pulse
Definition: An adiabatic shaped pulse incorporating a linear sweep through a frequency range used for selective inversion of spin state populations over wide ranges. For the pulse see J. Magn. Reson. Ser. A 1995 115 pg 273.

Name: immunoglobulin_complex_circulating
Label: immunoglobulin complex, circulating
Definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is secreted into extracellular space and found in mucosal areas or other tissues or circulating in the blood or lymph. In its canonical form a circulating immunoglobulin complex is composed of two identical heavy chains and two identical light chains held together by disulfide bonds. Some forms of are polymers of the basic structure and contain additional components such as J-chain and the secretory component.

Name: two_dimensional_gas_chromatography
Label: two-dimensional gas chromatography
Definition: Chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas initial separation proceeds in a primary column and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column.

Name: hydrogen_arc_discharge_method
Label: hydrogen arc-discharge method
Definition: A method for the synthesis of carbon nanotubes where a direct-current arc voltage is applied across two graphite electrodes immersed in H2 gas. When pure graphite rods are used fullerenes are deposited as soot inside the chamber and multi-walled carbon nanotubes are deposited on the cathode. When a graphite anode containing a metal catalyst Fe or Co is used with a pure graphite cathode single-walled carbon nanotubes are generated in the form of soot.

Name: 1h13c_heteronuclear_multiple_bond_coherence_spectrum
Label: 1H–13C heteronuclear multiple bond coherence spectrum
Definition: A heteronuclear NMR spectrum where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 1H and 13C nuclei which are 23 bonds removed.

Name: linear_quadrupole_ion_trap_fourier_transform_ion_cyclotron_resonance_mass_spectrometer
Label: linear quadrupole ion trap Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source a mass-to-charge analyser a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The analyser consists of a linear quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser which holds the ions in a stable orbit using an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes and an ion cyclotron resonance cell a piece of apparatus that measures the frequency at which ions precesses in a fixed magnetic field and subjects the frequency output to a Fourier transform.

Name: photovoltage_spectroscopy
Label: photovoltage spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where light energy absorbed by the sample results in the production of a potential difference the 'photovoltage' which is measured at different spectral intervals.

Name: particle_tracking_velocimetry
Label: particle-tracking velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by tracking the diffracted or fluorescent light emitted from individual particles in successive digital camera images.

Name: particles_from_gas_saturated_solutions
Label: particles from gas-saturated solutions
Definition: A solid sample is heated above its melting point and combining the molten material with a supercritical fluid. The solution is then expanded through a nozzle causing the precipitation of the solid as a fine powder.

Name: gelation
Label: gelation
Definition: The formation of a gel or solidification of a gelatin solution caused by a change in conditions such as temperature or pH.

Name: fourier_transform_infrared_spectrometer
Label: Fourier transform infrared spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an infrared laser an interferometer and a detector which is used to measure spectra in the infrared range. The spectrometer measures the amount of infrared radiation not absorbed by the sample and the application of a Fourier transform converts the resulting time domain digital signal into a frequency domain digital signal.

Name: femtosecond_optically_heterodyned_raman_induced_kerr_effect_spectroscopy
Label: femtosecond optically-heterodyned Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where femtosecond pulses of two polarized laser beams pump and probe with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained. The polarizing filters are rotated slightly giving rise to a heterodyne at the detector improving the signal-to-noise ratio compared to Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy.

Name: block_copolymer_micelle_nanolithography
Label: block copolymer micelle nanolithography
Definition: A synthesis technique involving the transfer of a nanosized pattern to a material using a micelle solution of a block copolymer. A glass or silicon substrate is dipped into the solution retrieved and the solvent is allowed to evaporate in air. A plasma treatment O2 H2 or Ar is performed to remove the polymer shell leaving a pattern.

Name: height_atomic_force_micrograph
Label: height atomic force micrograph
Definition: An image obtained by using a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the height moved by the tip as a function of position.

Name: polarisation_spectroscopy
Label: polarisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is irradiated with an initial pulse of polarised laser light the 'pump' and the change in polarisation of a second laser pulse the 'probe' is determined.

Name: electron_transfer_dissociation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: electron transfer dissociation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps where anions transfer electrons to multiply protonated peptides resulting in fragmentation between each mass-selection stage.

Name: synchrotron_radiation_x_ray_diffraction
Label: synchrotron radiation X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. The X-rays are generated by the acceleration of charged particles through magnetic fields.

Name: two_dimensional_column_chromatography
Label: two-dimensional column chromatography
Definition: A type of chromatography where an initial separation proceeds in a primary column and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column.

Name: scanning_auger_microscopy
Label: scanning Auger microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a focused electron beam of small diameter is used to produce Auger electrons which are detected.

Name: pyrolysis
Label: pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy. The term pyrolysis generally refers to heating in an inert environment.

Name: liquidliquid_chromatography
Label: liquid–liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where both the mobile phase and the stationary phase are liquids. The stationary phase st be immiscible and insoluble in the mobile phase and is usually supported on a suitable material such as a diatomaceous earth.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorptionionisation_tandem_time_of_flight_detection
Label: matrix-assisted laser desorption–ionisation tandem time-of-flight detection
Definition: A mass detection method where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. The ions are then characterised by two time-of-flight mass-to-charge analysers where the ions are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured in sequence. The first isolates precursor ions of choice using a velocity filter and the second detects the fragment ions.

Name: superconducting_quantum_interference_device
Label: superconducting quantum interference device
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of superconducting loops containing Josephson junctions which is used to measure the strength and/or direction of an extremely weak magnetic field 10-18 T.

Name: optical_profilometry
Label: optical profilometry
Definition: A method where the profile of a surface is determined by illuminating the sample with a beam of light which has been split into two paths one of which is directed at the sample and the other at a reference mirror. When the reflections are recombined any interference contains information about the contours of the surface.

Name: steam_methane_reforming
Label: steam methane reforming
Definition: The reaction of natural gas with steam at high temperature 7001000 C in the presence of a nickel catalyst in order to produce hydrogen.

Name: electrostatic_detection_apparatus
Label: electrostatic detection apparatus
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to detect footwear marks and indented impressions of handwriting in paper. The sample sheet of paper is placed on a sintered copper plate a vacuum is applied and a thin mylar plastic film is rolled over the sample. An electrostatic charge is then applied to the plastic by means of a corona discharge and the subsequent pattern of charging is then visualised using photocopier toner. The toner adheres to those areas corresponding to indentations.

Name: continuous_flow_calorimetry
Label: continuous-flow calorimetry
Definition: A term used to describe methods wherein a reagent is continuously fed into a flowing analyte stream and the temperature difference is measured before and after a reactor mixing chamber. Alternatively the temperature may be measured in a differential manner between a reference and a reactor chamber. The analyte concentration is directly proportional to the measured temperature difference.

Name: activation_analysis
Label: activation analysis
Definition: A kind of elemental or isotopic analysis based on the measurement of characteristic radiation from nuclides formed directly or indirectly by activation of the test portion.

Name: aqueous_phase_reforming
Label: aqueous-phase reforming
Definition: The reaction of biomass-derived oxygenated compounds e.g. glycerol in aqueous solution at low temperature in the presence of a platinum catalyst to produce hydrogen.

Name: low_frequency_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: low-frequency electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to short ns pulses of low-frequency microwave L-band cm wavelength or radio frequency m wavelength radiation in a magnetic field is measured.

Name: optically_heterodyned_kerr_effect_spectroscopy
Label: optically-heterodyned Kerr effect spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the refractive index change of the sample induced by two polarized laser beams pump and probe under the influence of an electric field the 'optical Kerr effect' is measured. The polarizing filters are rotated slightly giving rise to a heterodyne at the detector improving the signal-to-noise ratio compared to optical Kerr effect spectroscopy.

Name: dark_field_microscopy
Label: dark-field microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the sample is illuminated with visible light that is not collected by the objective lens. Only the light scattered by the specimen is collected by the lens producing an image of a light specimen on a black background.

Name: two_dimensional_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: two-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A two-dimensional plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for spin-active nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field. Signals are defined in terms of two frequencies by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and in the other by the chemical shift of a correlated nucleus.

Name: nuclear_activation_analysis
Label: nuclear activation analysis
Definition: A type of activation analysis where atomic nuclei are excited by a heavy ion beam or by collision with another nucleus and their decaying gamma-ray emissions are measured and compared to reference spectra.

Name: mass_detection
Label: mass detection
Definition: A detection method where the sample is converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: affinity_chromatography
Label: affinity chromatography
Definition: Chromatography where the separation is caused by differing biological specificity of the analyte-ligand interactions.

Name: karlfischer_coulometer
Label: Karl–Fischer coulometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of an electrolytic cell with an anodic compartment containing sulfur dioxide SO2 iodide I and a cathodic compartment containing the sample which is used to determine trace amounts of water in a sample by measuring the time and current flow required to reach the titration end-point.

Name: proton_transfer_reaction_mass_spectrometry
Label: proton transfer reaction mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by introducing it into a tube containing fast flowing He gas and H3O ions.

Name: x_ray_photoelectron_spectrum
Label: X-ray photoelectron spectrum
Definition: A plot of photoelectron count vs. kinetic energy following illumination of the sample with X-rays.

Name: bremsstrahlung_isochromat_spectroscopy
Label: bremsstrahlung isochromat spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation.

Name: time_resolved_polarised_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: time-resolved polarised Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of polarised radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m and the spectrum obtained recorded as a function of time is subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: 19f_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 19F rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 19F nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: two_dimensional_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: two-dimensional chromatography-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method in which a two-dimensional chromatography method is coupled to mass spectrometry.

Name: constant_time_method
Label: constant time method
Definition: A technique used in 2D NMR whereby the chemical shift frequency modulation of the FIDs necessary to interrogate the second dimension is achieved by moving the position of a rf pulse within a fixed time period on subsequent repeats of the experiment.

Name: femtosecond_two_colour_four_wave_mixing_spectroscopy
Label: femtosecond two-colour four-wave mixing spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where three femtosecond pulse incident laser beams are mixed two 'pump' beams of the same frequency and one 'probe' beam of a different frequency.

Name: watermethanolchloroform_131_extraction
Label: water:methanol:chloroform 1:3:1 extraction
Definition: Extraction of plant metabolites using a 1:3:1 v/v mixture of water methanol and chloroform.

Name: chromatography_paper
Label: chromatography paper
Definition: An open chromatographic bed that consists of a sheet of paper often filter paper.

Name: solid_stationary_phase
Label: solid stationary phase
Definition: A solid that plays the role of the stationary component in chromatography.

Name: momentum_resolved_bremsstrahlung_spectroscopy
Label: momentum-resolved bremsstrahlung spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation which is detected as a function of photon momentum.

Name: supercritical_fluid_extraction_fourier_transform_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: supercritical fluid extraction-Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy where the sample is initially transferred from a matrix to a liquid phase using a supercritical fluid.

Name: ultrasonic_gas_jet_deposition
Label: ultrasonic gas jet deposition
Definition: A synthesis method where a flow of carrier gas moving faster than the speed of sound containing vaporised precursors is projected onto a surface resulting in a deposit.

Name: resonance_ionisation_spectroscopy
Label: resonance-ionisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with metastable atoms resulting in the emission of an electron by resonant ionisation and an Auger electron.

Name: direct_current_amperometry
Label: direct current amperometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the cell direct current is measured whilst the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is controlled.

Name: specimen_collection_process
Label: specimen collection process
Definition: A planned process with the objective to obtain a material entity for potential use as an input upon which measurements or observations are performed."en

Name: near_field_phase_shift_lithography
Label: near-field phase shift lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. A transparent PDMS mask with the desired pattern in relief on its surface is placed in contact with the photoresist layer. UV light 300460 nm is then used to cross-link the polymer. Light passing through the stamp is modulated in the near-field by the relief of the mask such that the edges of the relief structures correspond to nulls in the intensity of the light. The polymer is cross-linked in the remaining areas.

Name: capacitively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: capacitively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by a potential difference between two electrodes one of which is grounded and one of which is live.

Name: electron_energy_loss_spectrum
Label: electron energy-loss spectrum
Definition: A plot of intensity vs. energy loss obtained by measuring the energy lost by electrons on interacting with a surface.

Name: confocal_microscope
Label: confocal microscope
Definition: An optical microscope that works by scanning one or more focussed beams of light across the specimen.

Name: non_resonant_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: non-resonant X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with incident X-rays of a wavelength which does not correspond to a specific electronic transition within the atoms of the sample and the energies and intensities of the emitted X-rays are measured.

Name: confocal_fluorescence_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: confocal fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume. The light emitted during fluorescence is collected and guided through a pinhole before it is detected reducing background interference.

Name: distillation_precipitation_copolymerisation
Label: distillation precipitation copolymerisation
Definition: A polymer preparation technique in which two different types of monomer are dissolved in an organic solvent and distilled until a precipitate of the corresponding copolymer is formed.

Name: auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a high energy photon ionises a core electron and an electron from a higher energy level descends to take its place releasing sufficient energy to eject a second so-called 'Auger' electron and the energy of the Auger electron is detected as a function of incident photon energy.

Name: high_performance_liquid_chromatography_electrospray_ionisation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-performance liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
