The sample molecular ions are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: transfer_moulding
Label: transfer moulding
Definition: A process for shaping pliable polymer materials using a rigid frame or model called a 'mould'. The mould is filled with a prepolymer then the whole assembly is transferred to a flat substrate where the prepolymer is cross-linked and the mould removed.

Name: luminescence_detection
Label: luminescence detection
Definition: The detection of luminescence from a sample.

Name: acoustic_emission_spectrum
Label: acoustic emission spectrum
Definition: A plot of decibels  vs. frequency obtained by measuring the amount of noise generated by a sample as a function of frequency of incident radiation.

Name: photoionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: photoionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with an ultraviolet laser. The sample absorbs one or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Name: chromatographic_phase
Label: chromatographic phase
Definition: One of the portions of material between which the components to be separated are distributed in chromatography.

Name: laser_multiphoton_ionisation_spectroscopy
Label: laser multiphoton ionisation spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a sample is illuminated with a laser and photoexcitation by the absorption of two or more photons is used to promote an atom or molecule above its ionisation potential to create an ion.

Name: fourier_transform_infrared_spectrum
Label: Fourier transform infrared spectrum
Definition: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained through a Fourier transform of the times series of the absorption of a sample that has been excited by an infrared-frequency pulse.

Name: high_resolution_fast_atom_bombardment_mass_spectrometry
Label: high resolution fast-atom bombardment mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample which is held in a liquid matrix is bombarded with a stream of primary noble gas atoms and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected. The 'exact' mass of these secondary is then determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass the number of protons and neutrons.

Name: spectrum
Label: spectrum
Definition: A plot of a measured quantity against some experimental parameter.

Name: ion_selective_potentiometry
Label: ion-selective potentiometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the potential difference between an ion-selective indicator electrode and the reference electrode is measured under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: atomic_force_microscopy_height_profile
Label: atomic force microscopy height profile
Definition: A plot of vertical displacement vs. distance obtained by using a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position.

Name: immunoprecipitation
Label: immunoprecipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid material a 'precipitate' consisting of an antigenspecific antibody complex from solution.

Name: chromatography_column_length
Label: chromatography column length
Definition: The length specified for a chromatography column.

Name: fermentation
Label: fermentation
Definition: The process in which cells microorganisms plant or animal cells are cultured in a bioreactor in a liquid or solid medium to convert organic substances into biomass growth or into products.

Name: adsorption_desorption_isotherm
Label: adsorption-desorption isotherm
Definition: A plot of relative pressure vs. volume adsorbed obtained by measuring the amount of an inert gasesous or liquid substance the 'sorbent' usually H2 or N2 which adsorbs onto the surface of interest the 'sorbate' and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature.

Name: atom_probe_field_ion_microscopy
Label: atom probe field ion microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where atoms in the vicinty of the specimen which is in the form of a very sharp tip <10 m diameter are ionised by the application of a strong electric field to the tip and an image is produced by the projection of the ions onto a fluorescent screen. The image consists of a pattern of spots of light which correspond to individual atoms on the specimen surface. When a sudden voltage pulse is applied to the tip atoms from the surface of the specimen itself are be ejected and travel down a drift tube where their arrival time a measure of the mass of the atom can be determined. This allows the atomic composition of the specimen to be determined.

Name: ultra_soft_x_ray_emission_spectroscopy
Label: ultra soft X-ray emission spectroscopy
Definition: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with ultra-low energy <1 keV X-rays and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to valence-to-core transitions are detected.

Name: oxidative_pyrolysis
Label: oxidative pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy in the presence of an oxidative atmosphere.

Name: laser_induced_fluorescence_detection
Label: laser-induced fluorescence detection
Definition: A detection method which is sensitive to naturally fluorescent or tagged compounds. As the sample passes through a small cell it is excited by a focused ultraviolet laser and any fluorescence is detected.

Name: high_resolution_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: high-resolution transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Transmission electron microscopy where the phase contrast between the transmitted interfering electron waves is used to produce an image.

Name: capillary_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: capillary high-performance liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small particles held in a tube of diameter less than a millimetre and the inlet pressure is relatively high.

Name: orbitrap
Label: Orbitrap
Definition: A mass-to-charge analyser that consists of two coaxial axially symmetric electrodes the outer one in the shape of a barrel the inner one in the shape of a spindle that traps ions in oscillating trajectories along the z-axis according to their mass-to-charge ratio.

Name: chiral_supercritical_fluid_chromatography
Label: chiral supercritical-fluid chromatography
Definition: A separation method where the components in this case stereoisomers are distributed between two chiral phases one of which is stationary while the other moves in a definite direction the 'mobile phase'. In this method the mobile phase is a fluid above and relatively close to its critical temperature and pressure.

Name: molecular_distillation
Label: molecular distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a high-boiling-point sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat at low pressure < 0.01 Torr and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser.

Name: mass_spectrometer
Label: mass spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of at least an ion source a mass-to-charge analyser a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra.

Name: solution_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: solution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture a solution in dilute HNO3 is ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Name: high_resolution_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: high-resolution electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. When the ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios the exact mass is determined as opposed to the nominal mass the number of protons and neutrons.

Name: molybdenum_k_alpha_source
Label: molybdenum K-alpha source
Definition: An X-ray source where molybdenum atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Name: potentiometry
Label: potentiometry
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Name: in_situ_synchrotron_xrd
Label: in situ synchrotron XRD
Definition: A method for determining structure by detecting the positions and intensities of X-rays that have been generated within a synchrotron as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Name: non_resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: non-resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light usually from a laser in the visible near infrared or near ultraviolet range by a sample is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light does not coincide with an electronic transition in the sample.

Name: microscopic_particle_image_velocimetry
Label: microscopic particle-image velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by pulsing a planar laser light sheet twice and recording images of microscopic particles lying in the light sheet using a video camera or a photograph.

Name: interferometry
Label: interferometry
Definition: The measurement of the properties of two or more lasers or waves by studying the pattern of interference created by their superposition.

Name: wet_grinding
Label: wet grinding
Definition: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by attribution friction impact or cutting in the presence of a small amount of liquid which is not a solvent for the solid.

Name: positive_ion_matrix_assisted_laser_desorptionionisation_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: positive ion matrix-assisted laser desorption–ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. The positive sample ions are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: heat_function
Label: heat function
Definition: A heat function is a function that increases the internal kinetic energy of a material"en

Name: pressure_perturbation_calorimetry
Label: pressure perturbation calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction by the known variation step-wise or linear of the temperature whilst the pressure 10-100 atm is kept constant.

Name: matrix
Label: matrix
Definition: Those components of a sample that are not measured by an experiment.

Name: surface_enhanced_laser_desorptionionisation
Label: surface-enhanced laser desorption–ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is mixed with a matrix compound such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid and deposited on a surface with some chemical functionality to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Name: transmission_electron_microscope_grid
Label: transmission electron microscope grid
Definition: A thin film of micrometre thickness which is used as a support for specimens during transmission electron microscopy.

Name: force_spectroscopy
Label: force spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where an atomic force microscope is used to measure the force experienced by a sample usually by taking forcedistance curves.

Name: electron_spin_echo_envelope_modulation
Label: electron spin-echo envelope modulation
Definition: A type of pulsed EPR spectroscopy which is used to observe the electron spin echo in a paramagnetic system as a function of the time that separates the pulses causing the echo. This technique is a powerful probe of the radial distribution of magnetic nuclear spins in the environment of the electron spins producing the echo.

Name: photo_nanoimprint_lithography
Label: photo nanoimprint lithography
Definition: A synthesis technique that uses mechanical deformation and cross-linking to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photosensitive resist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. A transparent stamp e.g. fused silica containing the desired nanosized pattern on its surface is then pressed into the resist which is exposed to UV light. Any unexposed areas of polymer are removed by reactive ion etching.

Name: microwave_velocimetry
Label: microwave velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of a sample by measuring the Doppler shift experienced by microwave radiation. This is the method used by police to measure the speed of a vehicle using a radar gun.

Name: laser_electric_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: laser electric resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where a fixed-wavelength infrared  or ultraviolet laser is used to excite the sample which is placed in an electric field. By varying the strength of the applied electric field some vibrationalrotational transitions can be made to coincide with the laser wavelength and the absorption of the laser light is measured.

Name: furnace_ionisation_nonthermal_excitation_spectrometry
Label: furnace ionisation nonthermal excitation spectrometry
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is atomised by placing it in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it then ionised and excited using a glow discharge a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas.

Name: diastereomeric_excess
Label: diastereomeric excess
Definition: The absolute value of the mole fraction for one diastereomer in a mixture minus the mole fraction for the other.

Name: reflectionabsorption_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: reflection–absorption infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the absorption and reflection of low incident angle infrared light by the surface molecules of a highly reflective or polished sample is measured.

Name: subset_ontology_module
Label: subset ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that is extracted from a main ontology module and includes only a subset of entities or axioms."en

Name: displacement_chromatography
Label: displacement chromatography
Definition: Chromatography where the mobile phase contains a compound the displacer more strongly retained than the components of the sample under examination. The sample is fed into the system as a finite slug.

Name: carbo_reduction
Label: carbo-reduction
Definition: A process in which a metal oxide is reduced in the presence of carbon or a carbon-containing compound.

Name: weak_beam_dark_field_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: weak-beam dark-field transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured. A diffracted beam harmonic a 'weak beam' is used rather than the diffracted beam itself allowing ch higher resolution to be obtained.

Name: field_emission_scanning_electron_microscopy
Label: field-emission scanning electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam produced by thermionic emission heating field emission and with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV is scanned across the specimen under vacuum and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen is determined.

Name: barrel_sputter_deposition
Label: barrel sputter deposition
Definition: Sputter deposition where the substrate is held in a barrel which is swung from side-to-side to ensure even deposition.

Name: electron_ion_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: electron-ion coincidence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of an ion and an electron which are detected as a function of energy.

Name: microelectrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: microelectrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution usually in an organic solvent of the sample through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 1 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: plasmon_resonance_energy_transfer
Label: plasmon resonance energy transfer
Definition: Spectroscopy where by intentionally matching the plasmon resonance frequency of a gold nanoparticle with the frequency of the electronic transition energy of a biomolecule energy transfer occurs which gives rise to resonant quenching dips in the Rayleigh scattering spectrum of the particle.

Name: diffusion_ordered_spectroscopy
Label: diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy using pulsed-field gradients where the rate of decay of NMR signals in each component of a sample mixture is measured across a series of experiments. The rate of signal decay is proportional to the diffusion coefficient for each component.

Name: polymer_co_precipitation
Label: polymer co-precipitation
Definition: The simultaneous precipitation of a normally soluble component with a polymer component from the same solution by the formation of a composite by adsorption occlusion or mechanical entrapment.

Name: fluorine_19_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: fluorine-19 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for fluorine-19 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: metastable_quenched_electron_spectroscopy
Label: metastable-quenched electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with metastable atoms resulting in the emission of two or more particles electrons photons or ions which are detected as a function of energy.

Name: magnetic_bead_extraction
Label: magnetic bead extraction
Definition: A method for extracting biological molecules from a biological sample by functionalising a magnetic bead 0.001200 m diameter with a molecule specific to the target molecule e.g. complementary DNA or a specific antibody and placing it in the sample solution. The bead is removed from the solution using a magnetized source.

Name: ultra_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: ultra high performance liquid chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small < 2 microm particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high.

Name: datum_label
Label: datum label
Definition: A label is a symbol that is part of some other datum and is used to either partially define  the denotation of that datum or to provide a means for identifying the datum as a member of the set of data with the same label"en

Name: low_temperature_gas_chromatography_inductively_coupled_plasma_mass_spectrometry
Label: low-temperature gas chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by low-temperature gas chromatography -78C before being ionised in a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: cone_calorimeter
Label: cone calorimeter
Definition: A piece of apparatus consisting of a cone-shaped heater a hood to collect evolving gases and a laser beam that is used to measure thermodynamic parameters such as heat release rate heat of combustion ignitability and the evolution of toxic gases smoke and soot for flame retarding materials.

Name: coherent_stokes_resonance_raman_spectroscopy
Label: coherent Stokes resonance Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. An anti-Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and a Stokes frequency beam is observed and the difference between the pump and the Stokes beams coincides with the frequency of an electronic transition within the molecule. multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Name: field_emission_scanning_electron_microscope
Label: field-emission scanning electron microscope
Definition: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of a specimen by scanning a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam produced by thermionic emission heating field emission with an acceleration voltage of 50150 kV across the specimen under vacuum and measuring interaction of the electrons with the specimen.

Name: liquid_solid_extraction
Label: liquid-solid extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a stationary phase e.g. silica particles.

Name: thermogravimetry_curve
Label: thermogravimetry curve
Definition: A plot of weight vs. temperature usually consisting of a series of steps obtained by measuring the mass of a sample during heating.

Name: carr_purcell_meiboom_gill_spectrum
Label: Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill spectrum
Definition: A plot of the nuclear magnetic resonance frequency vs. intensity composed of a series of peaks separated by the reciprocal of a user-defined time delay in a CPMG pulse sequence which describe the envelope of the full static spectrum.

Name: nitrogen_atmosphere
Label: nitrogen atmosphere
Definition: A laboratory atmosphere consisting of gaseous diatomic nitrogen.

Name: liposome_electrokinetic_chromatography
Label: liposome electrokinetic chromatography
Definition: Electrokinetic chromatography where the secondary phase has liposomes suspended in it.

Name: static_liquid_phase_micro_extraction
Label: static liquid-phase micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase or vice versa by suspending a microlitre-sized drop of the organic phase in a large volume of the aqueous phase.

Name: nmr_sample_preparation
Label: NMR sample preparation
Definition: A sample preparation for assay process that includes a series of operations applied to a starting material to prepare an NMR sample for an NMR assay.

Name: liquid_chromatography_at_the_critical_condition_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography at the critical condition-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography where the liquid is held at or near its critical point before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: deuterated_triglycine_sulfate_detector
Label: deuterated triglycine sulfate detector
Definition: A very sensitive room-temperature detector for mid-infrared range measurements that employs temperature-sensitive ferroelectric crystals of deuterated triglycine sulfate. As the temperature and hence polarisability of the crystals changes due to the absorption of infrared radiation a charge is generated which is detected by two parallel electrodes. The deuterated form of the crystals are used because they have a higher Curie point.

Name: low_energy_radioactive_ion_beam_spectroscopy
Label: low-energy radioactive ion-beam spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a focused beam of proton is directed at a uranium sample and the secondary ions emitted are detected.

Name: gradient_13c13c_1h1h_nuclear_overhauser_spectroscopy
Label: gradient 13C–13C 1H–1H nuclear Overhauser spectroscopy
Definition: A 4D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of carbon-bound protons with those of their bonded 13C nuclei and with the chemical shifts of spatially proximate carbon-bound protons <6A and their associated 13C nuclei. Pulsed field gradients are employed to improve the appearance of the spectrum.

Name: algorithm
Label: algorithm
Definition: A plan specification which describes the inputs and output of mathematical functions as well as workflow of execution for achieving an predefined objective. Algorithms are realized usually by means of implementation as computer programs for execution by automata."en

Name: chromatography_device
Label: chromatography device
Definition: A device that facilitates the separation of mixtures. The function of a chromatography device involves passing a mixture dissolved in a "mobile phase" through a stationary phase which separates the analyte to be measured from other molecules in the mixture and allows it to be isolated."en

Name: optical_extinction_spectroscopy
Label: optical extinction spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the amount of light transmitted through a sample is measured.

Name: elastic_low_energy_electron_diffraction
Label: elastic low energy electron diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of low energy <500 eV electrons at the sample and recording the resulting diffraction pattern produced by any elastically scattered scattering where kinetic energy is conserved electrons.

Name: light_emission_function
Label: light emission function
Definition: A light emission function is an excitation function to excite a material to a specific excitation state that it emits light."en

Name: time_proportional_phase_incrementation
Label: time proportional phase incrementation
Definition: A technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments to achieve frequency discrimination of the signals in the additional dimensions. For each value of the evolution time a single FID is recorded and the phase of the preparation pulse is changed.

Name: raman_induced_kerr_effect_spectroscopy
Label: Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where two polarized laser beams pump and probe with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained.

Name: plasma_assisted_desorption_ionisation
Label: plasma-assisted desorption ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where a plasma a partially ionised gas-such as Ar-containing free electrons is directed onto the sample surface causing desorption of sample molecules from the surface and subsequent ionisation.

Name: microwave_detected_photoinduced_current_transient_spectroscopy
Label: microwave-detected photoinduced current transient spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities grain boundaries interfaces etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the current produced by applying a microwave pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures spectra are generated which exhibit peaks the height of which are proportional to the defect density and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.

Name: time_of_flight_method
Label: time-of-flight method
Definition: A method for measuring charge transport by sandwhiching the sample between two parallel electrodes one of which has to be semitransparent. A short light pulse is applied to the sample giving rise to charge carriers which traverse through the sample generating a current which is then measured.

Name: 77se_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 77Se nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 77Se nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: measurement_of_solubility_in_water
Label: measurement of solubility in water
Definition: Measurement of concentration of a solute in water.

Name: excitation_laser
Label: excitation laser
Definition: A laser that has the function of exciting some internal state of a sample.

Name: chromatin_immunoprecipitation
Label: chromatin immunoprecipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid material a 'precipitate' consisting of a proteinspecific antibody complex where the protein is attached to a proteinDNA complex from solution. This method is used to determine the location of DNA binding sites on the genome for particular proteins of interest.

Name: ionisation_method
Label: ionisation method
Definition: The physical process of converting an atom or molecule into an ion by removing electrons.

Name: acidimetric_titration
Label: acidimetric titration
Definition: Acid-base titration where the sample is a base and the titrant is an acid.

Name: supercritical_fluid_extraction_gas_chromatography
Label: supercritical-fluid extraction-gas chromatography
Definition: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid then depressurised collected and subjected to gas chromatography.

Name: percentage_diastereomeric_excess
Label: percentage diastereomeric excess
Definition: The absolute value of the mole fraction for one diastereomer in a mixture minus the mole fraction for the other multiplied by 100.

Name: kalousek_polarography
Label: Kalousek polarography
Definition: An electrochemical technique where the ac component of the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the ac potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The working electrode is a dropping mercury or other liquid conductor electrode and unstirred solutions are used. The cell current is sampled on alternate half cycles and the potential is applied as a small amplitude square wave superimposed on a linear sweep.

Name: quantitative_preparative_native_continuous_polyacrylamide_gel_electrophoresis
Label: quantitative preparative native continuous polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Definition: A separation method where metalloprotein molecules move at different speeds in a buffer with pH 10 according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel across which an electric field is applied. This method does not use a dye to transfer charge to the protein molecules and the concentration of metal atoms from the metallproteins is determined by ICP-MS.

Name: liquid_chromatography_at_the_critical_condition_electrospray_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: liquid chromatography at the critical condition-electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography where the liquid is held at or near its critical point before being ionised by forcing the solution usually in an organic solvent through a small heated capillary at a flow rate of 110 L min-1 into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Name: microemulsion_method
Label: microemulsion method
Definition: A method for dispersing two or more immiscible liquids as micrometre-sized droplets by shaking stirring or homogenising the mixture.

Name: differential_scanning_calorimetry
Label: differential scanning calorimetry
Definition: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters e.g. enthalpy during a chemical or biochemical reaction of both a sample and a reference by the known variation step-wise or linear of one variable whilst a second is kept constant.

Name: 57fe_electron_nuclear_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 57Fe electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 57Fe nuclei of a sample and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Name: electrokinetic_patterning
Label: electrokinetic patterning
Definition: Any patterning technique that utlilises the movement of particles under the influence of an electric field e.g. electroosmosis or electrophoresis.

Name: organization
Label: organization
Definition: An entity that can bear roles has members and has a set of organization rules. Members of organizations are either organizations themselves or individual people. Members can bear specific organization member roles that are determined in the organization rules. The organization rules also determine how decisions are made on behalf of the organization by the organization members."en

Name: charge_coupled_device_detector
Label: charge-coupled-device detector
Definition: A detector that uses a silicon chip to convert light into electrical signal. When a photon is absorbed by the Si chip a single electron is released. Electrodes covering the chip surface hold these electrons in place in an array of wells or pixels so that during exposure of the chip to light a pattern of charge builds up that corresponds to the pattern of light.

Name: microwave_assisted_hydrothermal_synthesis
Label: microwave-assisted hydrothermal synthesis
Definition: Hydrothermal synthesis that makes use of microwave radiation to affect the course of reaction.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorption_ionisation_plate
Label: matrix assisted laser desorption-ionisation plate
Definition: A extremely flat surface that holds the sample during a mass spectrometry experiment where the sample is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser whilst being held in a matrix to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. The surface of the plate may be chemically functionalised for a specific sample.

Name: steam_distillation
Label: steam distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a sample mixture are vaporised by bubbling steam through it and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser.

Name: chromatography_column
Label: chromatography column
Definition: A piece of apparatus that has the form of a tube with a diameter between 5 to 50 mm and hosts the stationary bed in chromatography.

Name: time_of_flight_mass_spectrometer
Label: time-of-flight mass spectrometer
Definition: A mass spectrometer which uses a time-of-flight mass-to-charge analyser to separate ions.

Name: angle_resolved_photoelectron_spectroscopy
Label: angle-resolved photoelectron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Name: thermophotometry
Label: thermophotometry
Definition: The measurement of the total light or the light of a specific wavelength emitted by a sample as a function of temperature.

Name: planned_process_setup
Label: planned process setup
Definition: A planned process involving setting up the equipment for another planned process.

Name: cold_field_emission_scanning_electron_microscopy
Label: cold-field-emission scanning electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam produced by applying a high voltage to a tungsten crystal cold-field emission and with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV is scanned across the specimen under vacuum and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen is determined.

Name: convective_self_assembly
Label: convective self-assembly
Definition: A synthesis method in which colloidal particle suspensions in thin evaporating films spontaneously and reversibly associate by non-covalent interactions.

Name: magnetic_circular_dichroism_spectrum
Label: magnetic circular dichroism spectrum
Definition: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised photon radiation as a function of wavelength in the presence of a magnetic field.

Name: everhartthornley_detector
Label: Everhart–Thornley detector
Definition: A detector used in scanning electron microscopy experiments to detect secondary electrons. The detector consists of a scintillator inside a Faraday cage inside the specimen chamber of the microscope. A low positive voltage is applied to the Faraday cage to attract the relatively low-energy <50 eV secondary electrons.

Name: direct_laser_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: direct laser absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and light absorption is measured.

Name: sonication
Label: sonication
Definition: The irradiation of a liquid sample with sound 20 Hz-20 kHz waves resulting in agitation. Sound waves propagate into the liquid media result in alternating high-pressure compression and low-pressure rarefaction cycles. During rarefaction high-intensity sonic waves create small vacuum bubbles or voids in the liquid which then collapse violently cavitation during compression creating very high local temperatures.

Name: ion_beam_sputter_deposition
Label: ion-beam sputter deposition
Definition: Sputter deposition where the energetic ions come from an external ion source which generates a focused ion beam.

Name: supercritical_carbon_dioxide_drying
Label: supercritical carbon dioxide drying
Definition: The removal of solvent from a sample without passing through the liquidgas boundary by immersion in supercritical CO2 and de-pressurisation.

Name: bilinear_rotation_decoupling_pulse_sequence
Label: bilinear rotation decoupling pulse sequence
Definition: A pulse cluster a spin echo on 1H with inversion of 13C in the centre used to achieve selective inversion of 12C-bound protons thus achieving the removal of signals due to 12C-bound nuclei. For the pulse sequence see Chem. Phys. Lett. 1982 93 pg 504

Name: stable_isotope_ratio_mass_spectrometry
Label: stable isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the relative abundance of non-radioactive isotopes in a sample is determined.

Name: field_emission_electron_microscopy
Label: field-emission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam produced by field emission with an acceleration voltage 50-150 kV under vacuum. The interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected.

Name: separation_method
Label: separation method
Definition: A method that results in the separation of two or more components according to some property.

Name: scanning_electrochemical_microscopy
Label: scanning electrochemical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electrode probe is positioned very close to the surface of the specimen in the near-field. The surface is mechanically scanned by the electrode in a raster scan and the height required by a feedback loop in order to maintain a constant electrical conductance between the electrode and the specimen is recorded as a function of position.

Name: laplace_deep_level_transient_spectroscopy
Label: Laplace deep-level transient spectroscopy
Definition: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities grain boundaries interfaces etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the average capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at a fixed temperatures spectra are generated which exhibit a peak for each 'deep level' each energy level near the center of the band gap. The height of the peak is proportional to the defect density and the emission rate is characteristic for each type of defect.

Name: fractional_distillation
Label: fractional distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. As the sample mixture to be purified is heated its vapours rise into a condenser where they are cooled by water. The vapours stick to the inside surface of the condenser where they continue to be heated until they vaporise again.

Name: stir_bar_solid_phase_extraction
Label: stir-bar solid-phase extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by attaching a stationary phase to a stir bar which moves throughout the liquid sample.

Name: laser_emission_spectroscopy
Label: laser emission spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a thermally-excited vapour sample is illuminated with an ultraviolet or visible laser and the photon emission spectrum of the sample is observed.

Name: spray_pyrolysis
Label: spray pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample caused by spraying it as a liquid mixture onto a heated substrate.

Name: ultrasonic_velocimetry
Label: ultrasonic velocimetry
Definition: A method for determining the velocity of a sample by measuring the Doppler shift experienced by ultrasound radiation.

Name: confocal_raman_spectroscopy
Label: confocal Raman spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light is detected. An aperture is used to discriminate between Raman signal coming from the focused laser spot and Raman signal coming from the out-of-focus region of the sample.

Name: photodiode_array_detection
Label: photodiode array detection
Definition: A detection method that is sensitive to organic compounds. As the sample passes through a cell it is illuminated with light in the region 1901100 nm and any absorption is detected by a photodiode array.

Name: piezoresponse_force_microscopy
Label: piezoresponse force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electric field is applied to a sharp spike known as a 'tip' which is mounted on the end of a cantilever. The tip scans the surface of a piezoelectric specimen and the distortion of the electric field by the specimen is measured as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: collinear_fast_atom_beam_spectroscopy
Label: collinear fast atom-beam spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of a high-speed accelerated beam of atoms which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample and light absorption is measured.

Name: czochralski_process
Label: Czochralski process
Definition: A method of producing large single crystals of semiconductors or metals by inserting a small seed crystal into a crucible filled with similar molten material then slowly pulling the seed up from the melt while rotating it.

Name: solvent_extraction
Label: solvent extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to an appropriate liquid phase.

Name: diffusion_ordered_spectroscopy_correlation_spectroscopy
Label: diffusion-ordered spectroscopy-correlation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D COSY spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Name: single_pulsepulsed_laser_polymerizationnear_infrared_technique
Label: single pulse–pulsed laser polymerization–near-infrared technique
Definition: A technique for measuring the time-resolved concentration of monomers during polymerisation reactions. The polymerisation is initiated by a single pulse of laser radiation and the monomer concentration is monitored by measuring absorbance in the near-infrared 0.82 m region.

Name: headspace_liquid_phase_micro_extraction
Label: headspace liquid-phase micro-extraction
Definition: The process of transferring a substance from an organic phase to an aqueous phase or vice versa by heating the organic sample within a confined space in the presence of an aqueous acceptor droplet suspended on the tip of a microsyringe.

Name: radio_frequency_spectroscopy
Label: radio frequency spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy using short pulses of radiation from the radio frequency MHz range. Radio frequency spectroscopy is used to probe cold gas atoms and single ions.

Name: pool_of_specimens
Label: pool of specimens
Definition: A pool of specimens is a mixture of a population of samples which have been gathered from one or more sample populations obtained by the physical process of mixing individual specimens e.g.  mixing the DNA collected from the individual fish."en

Name: size_exclusion_chromatography_high_performance_liquid_chromatography
Label: size-exclusion chromatography-high performance liquid chromatography
Definition: A type of column chromatography where a sample mixture is first separated according to molecular size then subjected to chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high

Name: electrical_field_flow_fractionation
Label: electrical field-flow fractionation
Definition: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying an electric field perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of electrophoretic mobility.

Name: 19f_pulsed_field_gradient_spin_echo_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 19F pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 19F nuclei resonances. Additionally attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Name: ultraviolet_melting_curve
Label: ultraviolet melting curve
Definition: A plot of absorbance vs. temperature for a sample that is heated by irradiation with a specific wavelength of ultraviolet light range 190400 nm to cause the solidliquid phase change.

Name: electron_beam_sputter_deposition
Label: electron-beam sputter deposition
Definition: A synthesis technique where a solid target is bombarded with electrons causing atoms to be ejected 'sputtering'. The ejected atoms then deposit as a thin-film on a substrate.

Name: centrifuge
Label: centrifuge
Definition: A device with a rapidly rotating container that applies centrifugal force to its contents"en

Name: scanning_near_field_optical_microscopy
Label: scanning near-field optical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe consisting of a laser transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to <10 nm from the surface of the specimen. The tip is coated with metal to prevent light from escaping from the sides and near-field or evanescent field light is emitted through a small opening or 'aperture' 50100 nm in diameter at the apex of the probe. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the disturbance of the near-field as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: electrodialysis
Label: electrodialysis
Definition: The selective separation of molecules in solution by the difference in their rates of diffusion across a semipermeable membrane under the influence of an electric field.

Name: protein_complex_immunoprecipitation
Label: protein complex immunoprecipitation
Definition: The sedimentation of a solid material a 'precipitate' consisting of a proteinspecific antibody complex where the protein is attached to a arger protein complex from solution.

Name: scanning_probe_x_ray_diffraction
Label: scanning probe X-ray diffraction
Definition: A method for determining structure by scanning a finely focused <10 m2 beam of X-rays over the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Name: gas_chromatograph_mass_spectrometer_transfer_line_temperature_setting
Label: gas chromatograph-mass spectrometer transfer line temperature setting
Definition: The specified temperature for a gas chromatograph-mass spectrometer transfer line.

Name: scattering_near_field_optical_microscopy
Label: scattering near-field optical microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe consisting of a laser transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to <10 nm from the surface of the specimen and focused to a diffraction-limited spot size. A vibrating metallic AFM cantilever tip periodically and locally modifies the electromagnetic field distribution of the excitation laser. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the scattered light from the tip as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: tristricine_buffer
Label: Tris–tricine buffer
Definition: A buffer where the pH is maintained by TrisHtris where Tris  trishydroxymethylaminomethane and N-trishydroxymethylmethyl-2-aminoethanesulfonic acidN-trishydroxymethylmethyl-2-ammonioethanesulfonate equilibria.

Name: 23na_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 23Na nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 23Na nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: spin_decoupling_employing_ultra_broadband_inversion_sequences_generated_via_silated_annealing
Label: spin decoupling employing ultra-broadband-inversion sequences generated via siμlated annealing
Definition: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. A 1994 106 pg 241.

Name: tandem_dual_column_high_performance_liquid_chromatography_atmospheric_pressure_chemical_ionisation_tandem_mass_spectrometry
Label: tandem dual-column high-performance liquid chromatography atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where the sample is first subjected to column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. The sample passes through two columns anion and cation exchange in series. The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised by interaction electron or proton transfer with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure and then analysed by two mass spectrometers in series.

Name: holography
Label: holography
Definition: The recording of an interference pattern on a photographic film. Coherent light from a laser is reflected from an object and combined at the film with light from a reference beam. Both the phase and amplitude of the light scattered by the object is recorded.

Name: heteronuclear_single_quantum_coherence
Label: heteronuclear single quantum coherence
Definition: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the nuclei to which they are covalently bound. In HSQC only the magnetisation of one nucleus is allowed to evolve over time.

Name: nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: Any spectrum that shows the response of spin-active nuclei to radio frequency radiation in an applied magnetic field.

Name: postprecipitation
Label: postprecipitation
Definition: The subsequent precipitation of a chemically different species upon the surface of an initial precipitate usually but not necessarily including a common ion.

Name: 87rb_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 87Rb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 87Rb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: bright_field_transmission_electron_microscopy
Label: bright-field transmission electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV. under vacuum. The beam of electrons passes directly through an aperture before reaching the specimen. The image results from a weakening of the direct beam by its interaction with the sample.

Name: chemosensor
Label: chemosensor
Definition: A sensor that recognises the analyte under study by interaction with a given chemical motif.

Name: heteronuclear_three_dimensional_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: heteronuclear three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which three independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals. Each signal is described by three frequencies arising from a combination of protons and heteronuclei thus effecting the distribution of signals within a cube.

Name: mass_to_charge_analyser
Label: mass-to-charge analyser
Definition: A piece of apparatus which separates ions according to their mass-to-charge ratio.

Name: 13c_rotational_echo_double_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 13C rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 13C nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and thus yielding distance information.

Name: 73ge_magic_angle_spinning_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 73Ge magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 73Ge nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field.

Name: indicator_electrode
Label: indicator electrode
Definition: An electrode at which the potential is measured.

Name: kelvin_force_spectroscopy
Label: Kelvin force spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where an atomic force microscope is used to measure the force experienced by a sample. A probe which is made of a material with a known work function commonly tungsten or platinum is arranged close to the sample surface as a parallel-plate capacitor with a small spacing. The probe is vibrated causing a change in the capacitance between the electrodes. A voltage is then applied between the probe and sample until the electric field between them vanishes. The force gradient is proportional to the change in amplitude of the vibration. The distance between the probe and sample is kept constant during the measurement using a feedback loop.

Name: three_pulse_electron_spin_echo_envelope_modulation
Label: three-pulse electron spin-echo envelope modulation
Definition: A type of pulsed EPR spectroscopy which is used to observe the electron spin echo in a paramagnetic system as a function of the time that separates the three pulses causing the echo. This technique is a powerful probe of the radial distribution of magnetic nuclear spins in the environment of the electron spins producing the echo.

Name: verneuil_process
Label: Verneuil process
Definition: A method for preparing synthetic gemstones. A finely powdered sample is melted in an hydrogen-oxygen flame 2000 C and crystallising the melted droplets on a boule a single crystal.

Name: x_ray_source
Label: X-ray source
Definition: A device that is used to generate X-rays."en

Name: triple_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: triple-resonance spectroscopy
Definition: A type of NMR experiment in which excitation of the spin states of three different types of nuclei usually 1H 13C and 15N is employed. The name of the experiment describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Name: negative_stain_electron_microscopy
Label: negative-stain electron microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where the specimen is stained with heavy metals salts to improve contrast before being bombarded with a finely focused <10 nm diameter electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50150 kV under vacuum. The interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted secondary backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected.

Name: microwave_scanning_near_field_microscopy
Label: microwave scanning near-field microscopy
Definition: Microscopy where a probe consisting of a microwave radiation source transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to <10 nm from the surface of the specimen. The tip is coated with metal to prevent light from escaping from the sides and near-field or evanescent field microwave radiation is emitted through a small opening or 'aperture' 50-100 nm in diameter at the apex of the probe. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the disturbance of the microwave near-field as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Name: null_ellipsometry
Label: null ellipsometry
Definition: A method for determining structure where the sample is illuminated with light and the ellipsometric angles of the reflected light are measured from the configuration of the analyzer and the compensator for which no reflected light is detected.

Name: water_suppression_through_gradient_tailored_excitation
Label: water suppression through gradient tailored excitation
Definition: A pulse cluster used for solvent water suppression. The solvent resonances are selectively excited and pulsed field gradients used to destroy the signal. For the pulse sequence see J. Biomol. NMR 1992 2 pg 661.

Name: colorimetric_test
Label: colorimetric test
Definition: A test which produces colour change in the sample.

Name: electron_excited_auger_electron_spectroscopy
Label: electron-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where electron bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electron and the energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of incident electron energy.

Name: hydrostatic_extrusion
Label: hydrostatic extrusion
Definition: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die in the presence of a pressurised fluid.

Name: frequency_modulation_atomic_force_microscopy
Label: frequency-modulation atomic force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The tip oscillates intermittently touching or tapping the surface. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the resonant frequency of the tip and the surface during scanning which is performed under ultra-high vacuum conditions.

Name: simple_distillation
Label: simple distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat and then immediately cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser. This method can only be used to separate mixtures where the components differ widely in boiling point by approx. 25.

Name: time_lapse_microscopy
Label: time-lapse microscopy
Definition: Microscopy in which the same object e.g. a cell is imaged at regular time intervals over several hours.

Name: interrogating_electrode
Label: interrogating electrode
Definition: An electrode whose response indicates the change of some analytical variable.

Name: photothermal_spectroscopy
Label: photothermal spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where light energy absorbed by the sample results in heating and the subsequent change in temperature pressure or density is measured.

Name: microtransfer_moulding
Label: microtransfer moulding
Definition: A process for shaping pliable polymer materials using a microsized rigid frame or model called a 'mould'. The mould is filled with a prepolymer then the whole assembly is transferred to a flat substrate where the prepolymer is cross-linked and the mould removed.

Name: chemical_ionisation_mass_spectrum
Label: chemical ionisation mass spectrum
Definition: A plot of relative abundance  vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the ions are obtained by the sample interacting with reagent N2 O2 H2O gaseous ions at low pressure.

Name: pump_probe_spectroscopy
Label: pump-probe spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse the 'pump' followed by a second laser pulse the 'probe' after a short delay. The pump pulse creates excitations in the sample which are sensed by the probe pulse.

Name: fourier_transform_infrared_photoacoustic_spectroscopy
Label: Fourier transform infrared photoacoustic spectroscopy
Definition: Infrared photoacoustic spectroscopy where the spectrum is then subject to a Fourier transform.

Name: gas_chromatography_infrared_spectroscopy
Label: gas chromatography-infrared spectroscopy
Definition: Any method where a sample mixture is first separated by column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas then the absorption of radiation from the infrared region by the sample is measured.

Name: acid_digestion
Label: acid digestion
Definition: The decomposition of a sample in strong acids such as nitric sulfuric or perchloric acid in order to obtain the sample in liquid form.

Name: electric_field_induced_second_harmonic_generation_spectroscopy
Label: electric-field-induced second harmonic generation spectroscopy
Definition: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser of frequency  whilst a direct-current electric field is applied allowing the production of the second harmonic 2. This technique is used to induce an asymmetry in an otherwise symmetric material as a probe of the molecular hyperpolarisability.

Name: tandem_quadrupole_mass_spectrometry
Label: tandem quadrupole mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage. The mass-to-charge ratios of the sample ions are measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Name: matrix_assisted_laser_desorptionionisation
Label: matrix-assisted laser desorption–ionisation
Definition: An ionisation method where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Name: chloroform
Label: chloroform
Definition: A one-carbon compound that is methane in which three of the hydrogens are replaced by chlorines.

Name: electron_electron_ion_coincidence_spectroscopy
Label: electron-electron-ion coincidence spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of an ion and a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of energy.

Name: coulometric_titration
Label: coulometric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point at which essentially all of the sample has reacted is reached. In a coulometric titration the titrant is generated electrochemically by passing a constant current through an electrolyte.

Name: steam_pyrolysis
Label: steam pyrolysis
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample caused by heating it as a vapour with steam.

Name: capillary_electrophoresis_electrothermal_atomic_absorption_spectrometry
Label: capillary electrophoresis-electrothermal atomic absorption spectrometry
Definition: A method where a liquid sample is first separated by capillary electrophoresis then vaporised and atomised using a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it. The sample is then analysed by illuminating it with ultraviolet or visible light which is absorbed by the non-excited atoms at characteristic wavelengths.

Name: mossbauer_spectroscopy
Label: Mossbauer spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample is detected.

Name: batch_distillation
Label: batch distillation
Definition: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser. Distillation is completed before more sample mixture is added.

Name: peptide
Label: peptide
Definition: Amide derived from two or more amino carboxylic acid molecules the same or different by formation of a covalent bond from the carbonyl carbon of one to the nitrogen atom of another with formal loss of water. The term is usually applied to structures formed from alpha-amino acids but it includes those derived from any amino carboxylic acid. X  OH OR NH2 NHR etc.

Name: four_wave_mixing_spectroscopy
Label: four-wave mixing spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where three incident laser beams are mixed.

Name: enantiomeric_ratio
Label: enantiomeric ratio
Definition: The ratio of the percentage of one enantiomer in a mixture to that of the other.

Name: kelvin_probe_force_microscopy
Label: Kelvin probe force microscopy
Definition: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The conducting tip forms a capacitor with the surface over which it is scanned laterally at a constant separation in order to map the change in work function of the surface. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: terahertz_four_wave_mixing_spectroscopy
Label: terahertz four-wave mixing spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where three incident terahertz laser beams are mixed.

Name: infrared_map
Label: infrared map
Definition: A data set derived from infrared microscopy consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents the infrared wavelength. The image is obtained by stacking one image per infrared wavelength sequentially.

Name: ontology_module_subsetted_by_owl_profile
Label: ontology module subsetted by OWL profile

Name: ion_mobility_spectroscopy
Label: ion mobility spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the velocity of gas phase ions in an electric field is measured.

Name: pyrolysis_gas_chromatography
Label: pyrolysis gas chromatography
Definition: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy where the volatile pyrolysates are then separated by column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas.

Name: nyquist_plot
Label: Nyquist plot
Definition: A plot of complex impedance vs. frequency that reflects the change in impedance the resistance of alternating current of an electrochemical cell.

Name: angle_of_optical_rotation_in_chloroform
Label: angle of optical rotation in chloroform
Definition: Angle of optical rotation of a substance that has been obtained with it dissolved in chloroform.

Name: fluorescence_detection
Label: fluorescence detection
Definition: The measurement or detection of luminescence which results from the molecular absorption of a photon which triggers the emission of a photon with a longer wavelength.

Name: electrochemical_gelation
Label: electrochemical gelation
Definition: The formation of a gel from a solution by electrochemical oxidation.

Name: single_photon_infrared_emission_spectroscopy
Label: single-photon infrared emission spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated using ultraviolet excitation single photon and the infrared radiation 0.781000 m emitted during cooling is detected.

Name: generated_ontology_module
Label: generated ontology module
Definition: An ontology module that is automatically generated for example via a SPARQL query or via template and a CSV."en

Name: ultra_high_field_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: ultra-high-field nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static >900 MHz magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Name: 13c_pulsed_field_gradient_spin_echo_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: 13C pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Definition: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 13C nuclei resonances. Additionally attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Name: 13c_cross_polarisation_magic_angle_spinning
Label: 13C cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
Definition: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle 54.74 with respect to the direction of the magnetic field. Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 13C nuclei.

Name: hydrothermal_synthesis
Label: hydrothermal synthesis
Definition: A synthesis method for growing single crystals from an aqueous solution in an autoclave a thick-walled steel vessel at high temperature 400 C and pressure.

Name: rapid_scan_infrared_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: rapid-scan infrared absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region 0.781000 m. Spectra are collected at a rate of approx. 0.05 s per spectrum.

Name: extreme_ultraviolet_lithography
Label: extreme ultraviolet lithography
Definition: A synthesis method that uses light to transfer a pattern to a substrate. A solution of photoresist a polymer is deposited on the substrate by spin coating. The photoresist-coated substrate is then heated to drive off excess solvent 'soft-baked' 'prebaked' 'post-application baked' PAB typically at 90100 C. The photoresist is then exposed to a pattern of intense EUV 13.5 nm light in a vacuum. A post-exposure bake PEB at 120180 C is performed before immersing the substrate in a 'developer' which removes excess photoresist. Positive photoresist becomes soluble in the developer when exposed negative photoresist becomes insoluble in the developer. Finally the substrate is baked again 'hard-baked' to solidify the remaining photoresist.

Name: polarimeter
Label: polarimeter
Definition: A device that measures the angle of optical rotation of a sample.

Name: near_infrared_microscopy
Label: near-infrared microscopy
Definition: The collection of spatially resolved near-infrared spectra 0.8 to 2 micrometres of a sample during microscopy.

Name: femtosecond_raman_induced_kerr_effect_spectroscopy
Label: femtosecond Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where femtosecond pulses of two polarized laser beams pump and probe with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained.Information is obtained regarding ultrafast solvent dynamics by measuring the time response of a transient birefringence that is induced in the sample by a polarized femtosecond optical pulse.

Name: surface_enhanced_laser_desorptionionisation_time_of_flight_mass_spectrometry
Label: surface-enhanced laser desorption–ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is mixed with a matrix compound such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid and deposited on a surface with some chemical functionality to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. The sample molecular ions are accelerated to the same known kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Name: ultraviolet_visible_near_infrared_spectrometer
Label: ultraviolet-visible-near infrared spectrometer
Definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source a holder for the sample a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light a detector and is used to measure spectra in the range ultraviolet to near-infrared 190-2000 nm resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Name: metalorganic_molecular_beam_epitaxy
Label: metal–organic molecular beam epitaxy
Definition: A synthesis method which consists of depositing a monocrystalline film from a molecular beam of organometallic precursors on a monocrystalline substrate under high vacuum <10{-8} Pa.

Name: ion_exclusion_chromatography
Label: ion-exclusion chromatography
Definition: Column chromatography where the separation is caused by differences in charge the mobile phase is aqueous and the analyte is ionic.

Name: appearance_potential_spectroscopy
Label: appearance potential spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the appearance of relaxation products Auger electrons or X-rays or by a change in the electron beam current.

Name: ultra_performance_liquid_chromatography_mass_spectrometry
Label: ultra-performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by ultra-performance liquid chromatography before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Name: gas_chromatography_isotope_ratio_mass_spectrometry
Label: gas chromatography-isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography before being characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance of isotopes.

Name: scatter_plot
Label: scatter plot
Definition: A scatterplot is a graph which uses Cartesian coordinates to display values for two variables for a set of data. The data is displayed as a collection of points each having the value of one variable determining the position on the horizontal axis and the value of the other variable determining the position on the vertical axis."en

Name: optically_detected_magnetic_resonance
Label: optically detected magnetic resonance
Definition: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by optical means i.e. the polarisation or the intensity of light emitted or absorbed by the sample depends on the population distribution in the spin levels. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Name: first_derivative_nuclear_magnetic_resonance_spectrum
Label: first derivative nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Definition: A plot of the change in intensity of absorption vs. the change in frequency as a function of the frequency of radiation applied for spin-active nuclei.

Name: solid_state_sintering
Label: solid-state sintering
Definition: The fusing together of small particles by heating a powder sample below its melting point until its particles adhere to each other.

Name: positive_ion_chemical_ionisation_mass_spectrometry
Label: positive ion chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Definition: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with reagent gaseous cations at low pressure.

Name: catalymetric_titration
Label: catalymetric titration
Definition: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration involves a catalyst and the end-point is detected by the sudden increase or decrease in the rate of a reaction.

Name: photoelectron_yield_spectroscopy
Label: photoelectron yield spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation X-rayultraviolet generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. All photoelectrons emitted at a particular photon energy are detected.

Name: laser_transient_absorption_spectroscopy
Label: laser transient absorption spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where transient species such as radicals ions or reactive intermediates are studied using laser pulses. The absorbance of the sample before and after an excitation laser pulse is measured.

Name: pulsed_electron_spin_resonance_spectroscopy
Label: pulsed electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to short ns pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured.

Name: femtosecond_laser_induced_breakdown_spectroscopy
Label: femtosecond laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy
Definition: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a high energy femtosecond laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source.

Name: post_column_derivatisation
Label: post-column derivatisation
Definition: The transformation of a chemical compound the 'educt' following column chromatography into another similar compound the 'derivative' by altering one or more of its functional groups. Derviatisation is generally perfomed to alter reactivity or change a physical property such as solubility boiling point melting point thermal stability etc.

Name: galvanic_etching
Label: Galvanic etching
Definition: The process of removing the unprotected areas of a silicon surface by placing it inside an electrochemical etching solution KOH HF or TMAH in the presence of an electric current. When the silicon substrate is in contact with a noble metal Au or Cr a Galvanic cell is formed and the silicon is oxidized.

Name: thermal_gelation
Label: thermal gelation
Definition: The formation of a gel from a solution by heating.

Name: atomic_force_microscope
Label: atomic force microscope
Definition: A microscope which uses a sharp spike known as a 'tip' mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen line by line and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Name: dark_field_optical_microscopy_and_spectroscopy
Label: dark-field optical microscopy and spectroscopy
Definition: Spectroscopy where a dark-field optical microscope is used to image the sample and locate a small area for spectral analysis with radiation in the ultraviolet to near infrared range.

Name: polarimetry_of_sample_dissolved_in_dimethyl_sulfoxide
Label: polarimetry of sample dissolved in dimethyl sulfoxide
Definition: Polarimetry of a sample that has been dissolved in dimethyl sulfoxide.
